Name: Ralphs Fresh Fare
Address: 5225 Canyon Crest Dr, Riverside, CA 92507, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Saturday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Address Components: 5225 (street_number); Canyon Crest Drive (route); Canyon Crest (neighborhood); Riverside (locality); Riverside County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92507 (postal_code)
Reviews: Ralph's is a great place to shop. The store is very clean and well-organized, and the staff is nice. They have a bakery section with delicious cupcakes and cakes, and their fresh produce is top-notch. Everything here looked really nice. Highly recommended!; Store is clean. Beautiful flowers. Great produce, bakery. Paul has the best customer service out of everyone.; I moved to Canyon Crest 14 years ago and Ralph's was my go to store because of the convenience and for friendly employees but because of what they have done with their checkout service I will drive 5 miles away to Stater Bros because who actually have friendly employees working their checkout lanes. They have ZERO SELF CHECKOUTS! Last night 09/19/2024 I went in Ralph's just to grab some lettuce and beer. They had closed down one side of their self checkouts, 6 in total. They only had 2 employees that had their checkout lanes opened and the other 6 self checkouts opened. Customers were standing in lines going halfway down their food aisles which was causing a huge mess with other customers trying to walk around the store to grab items and whatnot. After realizing it was going to about 20 minutes of standing in line I just put what I had down in the aisle and walked out. What a joke! All of this inconvenienced because some big wig thought it would be better to have less employees for customer service by letting their own customers check themselves out just hoping to save money. That is insulting to your customers. I will now drive the extra 5 miles to stand in line to interact with the friendly employees of Stater Brothers. They usually have at least 7 to 8 checkout lanes opened at any given time. I give Ralph's a Big Fat 0 for Customer Service.; I love Canyon Crest Town Center and for many years have enjoyed shopping at Ralph’s until recently. I love the location, the variety, the prices, but the thing that I don’t like is the fact that whenever I go there, there is usually just one check stand open. I don’t like using self check out so this has caused me to go to Stater Brothers, which is further away from my home but where I know I can get a clerk to check me out without a problem. That being said, I want to give a shout out to cashier Natalie C. I ended up having to go to Ralph’s yesterday because I was in a hurry and didn’t want to drive further away to Stater Brothers. As usual, there was only one check stand open and it was hers. There was a long line and when I finally got up to her, she was pleasant and  accommodating, despite the fact that I could tell she was frustrated that there were no other checkers working. This woman deserves a raise. And let me know when you have more checkers working and I will gladly go to Ralph’s on a more regular basis.; This Ralph’s is amazing. Sounds funny, I know, but I am a big fan of this particular location. It is always well organized, clean, and has the friendliest staff. Great selection and a cleverly planned floor plan that prevents long lines and keep things moving. The V-day balloon displays yesterday were so gorgeous I had to take a picture.

Name: Fry's Marketplace
Address: 3246 E Bell Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85032, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 3246 (street_number); East Bell Road (route); Paradise Valley Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85032 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Had to update my 5 stars to 1 i normally go here for all my shopping and today some older lady with blue eyes treated me like a shop lifter- i knew the manager she reported me to and the security gaurd seen me shopping before and where just doing their job however i was dehumanized when being treated as a shop lifter. Once i shown my receipt they all looked at the ground feeling bad besides the older lady. Please do better and focus on the real shop lifters and not your day to day customers. There was a man who ran out with the alarm ringing and all and somehow their main focus was me :(; Recently while in the parking lot if fry’s.  One of the cart boys named mason, wasn’t paying attention to what he was doing and Plowed a stack of carts into my car, putting 3 nice sized dents into my passenger side door.   I reported it to the stores manager.     They came out and looked at the car.    Saw the damage.    But now the store is saying they aren’t responsible  for the damage to my car.    The dents are deep and cannot be rubbed out.    Whole door needs replaced.   I hope it’s worth the loss of business.  I will never shop at fry’s again.; This Fry's has clothes and a larger non-food section than most. The bakery, deli, and produce departments are fairly standard for Fry's but seem to have a bit better management than most stores. The men's room was exceptionally clean this morning which, frankly was better than expectation. I always like to stop by the "clearance" section in the back to search for treasures.; If you don’t mind being harassed by persistently annoying cell phone salesmen, zoned out delivery pickers cutting you off, and the occasional disgruntled cashier, the prices are good and most of the peeps that work there are very nice.

Produce, when stocked, is reasonably fresh and solid on quality/consistency.

Center aisles are inconsistently stocked and maintenance/cleanliness seem to be a secondary priority.

No reason to buy meat products here.  They’re very mediocre.  Quality and price gap way too wide not to make the separate trip to Costco.

Deli is disappointing.  Food quality is iffy and every other staffer is surely or indifferent.

I do like the pleasant familiarity and friendliness of most of the checkers and baggers.  The prices are definitely good, but the trajectory has definitely been downward over the years.   I can only imagine when Kroger/Albertson’s merge.; On July 11th, around 5 PM, I went to the store to purchase an Amazon gift card. I waited about 2 minutes at the customer service counter, as there was no one there. Eventually, a woman named Kristine came out. She greeted me in a very unfriendly and impatient manner, not even saying hello, and just asked what I needed.

I told her I needed an Amazon gift card, and she asked how much I wanted. Since I'm not fully comfortable with English, I asked her to repeat the question, and she responded by raising her voice and sounding annoyed, asking again how much of the gift card I wanted. I was really upset by her rude and unprofessional attitude. As a customer service representative, I cannot believe she would treat a customer, especially one with limited English skills, in such a dismissive and irritated way.

I wonder if Kristine treats all customers this way, or if she was discriminating against me because I am Asian. After I placed the money on the counter instead of handing it to her directly, she sighed heavily and gave me a disapproving look.

I had purchased an Amazon gift card, but I told the employee Kristine that I did not want to earn rewards points on that purchase. However, despite my request, Kristine went ahead and used her own shopper's card to earn the rewards points on your gift card purchase. This action by the employee seems inappropriate. Typically, store employees should only apply rewards points to a customer's card if the customer explicitly requests it. By using her own card without my consent, Kristine appears to be trying to personally benefit, rather than respecting the customer's wishes.

This kind of behavior by the employee may go against the store's policies. Customers should have the right to decide whether or not to earn rewards on their purchases, and the employee should not override that without the customer's approval.

This kind of poor customer service and potential discrimination is unacceptable. The store and the Fry's company as a whole should take action to address Kristine's behavior and ensure all customers are treated with respect, regardless of their language skills or background.

Reviews:
I love fresh food here but froze  area please double check, hope manager of 168 can see this picture and stop putting this kind of Mochi icecream to the rack, it completely bad, when I open 2 pcs with hollow it means it was melted completly but market put it back, the mochi skin dry and hard like eating raw rubber, trash completely waste my money almost $6; The supermarket is located in a convenience location with restaurants and shops, quick access to the freeway. It has most of the Asian produce and products with some amazing weekly discounts/deals. The store is organized but has sales items all throughout the store, making it feels and looks messy. Food court also includes a bakery and many different food options. I didn’t eat there, but they were busy. Weekly specials are great buys, items were new and fresh, unlike some stores has the almost expired items on sale! Staff are friendly and remind customers of super deals. During my visits, I saw people buying by the dozen on the sale items. It can keep the place cleaner to attract customers.; Very nice people! Very clean store looking for something you're only going to find in an Asian market this is the place to go; It's your typical Asian Supermarket.
They do have lots of live seafood. The price are usually good value.; Has a lot of groceries, fresh meats, veggies, spices and sauces. Good selection of asian snacks and instant noodles too. There are a couple small stall/shops inside as well, one selling electrodomestics and the other selling fried snacks (I think it's currently closed due to covid). Theres also a cooked food/deli and a small bakery section. Never had an issue here.

No comment no judgment, please see pictures below and be careful with their fruits.; They have ample variety of Asian goods. Price is reasonable. The store as a whole is clean. The staff are good -some friendlier than others but overall good. I love their hotfood area and bakery. Bought their cakes several times for birthday celebrations. The cakes are reasonably priced and taste very good and light. Bought the mango cake with fresh fruits on top.; One stop of a grocery shopping  place , 168 super market provides me with conveniences and affordability . It has a variety of Asian products as well as daily necessities .  I love to shop in its vegetable sections that are full of fresh Asian  fruits and vegetables . It also has a unique food court that offers Chinese breakfast and a lunch menu  . It has a bakery department that provides cakes , sweet treats and bread . Compared with other super markets ,  I enjoy its reasonable product prices . 168 Super market is my favorite super market .; The market is a bit dingy and underlit. And the food is decent at best.; The BOGO deals are a great catch and the fruit is really fresh.
The only downside is that some of the meat for hotpot doesn't look as fresh as it seems.

Name: Fry's Marketplace
Address: 1455 N Higley Rd, Gilbert, AZ 85234, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 1455 (street_number); North Higley Road (route); Gilbert (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85234 (postal_code)
Reviews:
While out running errands I drove by this Fry’s and decided to stop in as I needed to get done Diet Coke. Of course I ended up shopping far longer than I intended to as I need to check out this store lol.

I really don’t understand the negative reviews as this store has everything and so many specialty sections. They even sell clothes and shoes! I didn’t browse those sections as I’m sure I’m not going to find clothes that suit my taste in a grocery store, but still kinda impressive.

I loved they had an olives and anti pasta bar for $9.99/pound. Ended up buying for some hubby!

One cool thing that I have never seen is their cooler section with all kinds of different drinks. It has pictures and prices of all the drinks inside. How creative and cool is that!!

They also have a sushi bar with lots of rolls for $6. I have tried their sushi and really don’t have any desire to try again but it’s convenient. The cheese section is vast and if you’re a cheese lover, you’ll be in heaven! They also have a huge kitchen section with gadgets, dishes, bowls, and appliances. Again, a very convenient one stop store.

I was puzzled why the store was so crowded until another shopper told me it was senior citizens day. If you’re over 55 years of age, you get an additional 10 percent off your groceries! I was told it’s on the first Wednesday of each month. Great info as it applies to any sale items too.

If I’m in the area, I’d definitely stop in again.; Not my favorite store considering most of what they sell is from all of the horrible corporations that produce unhealthy foods laced with drug science which gets us addicted & sick.  Not a conspiracy anymore, now it’s becoming more of our collective common knowledge.  The people who work here are great people.  Don’t get me wrong.  They have great customer service and some decent prices.; Poor customer service, we bagged our groceries while employees just stood around. The cashier didn’t even say hello as we unloaded our groceries. I hope Publix comes to the valley.; Great Management and staff. I do online orders both for Fry's and instacart so I'm in the store daily , I'm impressed w/how clean this location always is and how much the employees and managers are always offering me help when I need it. SO appreciated !; This is my neighborhood fry’s. I’ve been shopping here since they opened a few years ago. I spend $1k on groceries here each month & i will no longer be shopping here.

This store has terrible management & the absolute worst customer service I have ever experienced anywhere! The employees are rude & sometimes mean. The only people working here who have ever been friendly to me are the deli and cheese counter. While I could spend way too much time elaborating on each negative experience I’ve had on every occasion in this store, I’ll spare you & make a couple suggestions.

1) do not work here!!! You can tell the employees are miserable & mistreated.

2) do not shop here. There’s a fry’s on power/ baseline, recker/williams field, & a new location opening at Elliot/power, as well as a Safeway & sprouts across the street. Avoid this store!!!! It’s really the worst & it is a shame.

Name: Mercado El Rey Lake Forest
Address: 23532 El Toro Rd #7, Lake Forest, CA 92630, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 5:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 7 (subpremise); 23532 (street_number); El Toro Road (route); Lake Forest (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92630 (postal_code); 4703 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Very good Mercado, very clean and organized. They have a large selection of vegetable, fruit, dairy, meat and canned food. They have an ice cream and juice bar plus they have churro. Their churro is very delicious and they have a special 2 for $1 deal. Their prices are very reasonable compare to other Mercado. I will definitely go back.; Cool little Mexican Market, well… not so little lol. They have just about everything you’ll need. From different types of meat, to detergent, to Mexican candies, and fruits.

The shop looks clean and well organized. The staff was nice, at least the cashiers were.

We came here just to check the place out. It was recommended by a friend of ours. No complaints, it was a cool find here in Lake Forest.

Bought a watermelon, and some Mexican candies lol.; So here is the deal.   I am half afraid to share this because this place is a gem 💎!    I can buy wonder marinated meats.. ceviche.. dairy.. chicharron.. and a bunch of produce and hit only $80.   Sometimes $70 and sometimes $50.    They have a smoothie bar that’s probably the best one around…. As the produce is right there,   The fresh produce looks better and is ripe and great looking and better than Bristol farms or whole paycheck.   It’s a fast shopping store with a fresh hot food to go as well - and it’s aaaahmazing!!   do not expect big grocery carts here.   It’s fresh ripe food that you eat this week or in the next few days.   I truly love this shop as it’s perfect for me by myself and even better when there were more of us.   Just for reference they had beautifully RIPE RED SWEET SMELLING strawberries for under $3 a pack,  like RIPE RED strawberries- not those white topped unripe hard bland berries like at a regular store.  Really.   Even the butcher shop is really really awesome.  It is not the same as a big grocery store chain but everything has been fantastic.   I don’t speak Spanish but every single person there has been great and it’s nice to shop in a place without having to listen to the obnoxious thinly veiled racism from other customers directed at others.   Bravo to this store.   You could in fact get all your weekly groceries here just fine.   I mostly do -  ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️; Love the meat market and vegetables etc lots of stuff from my country.; They really need to work on keeping their floors clean, couldn’t push the store cart with out getting stuck with what was on the floor. Trip hazard, customers can slip or trip over boxes they leave on the floor! Terrible!

Reviews:
The is a great place for quick things you left off your list at the grocery store. Careful with the cakes slices in the case though. I bought 2 of them at $6 each and they were stale and hard. Had to throw them out. Went back with my receipt and they wouldn't refund or replace unless I brought the cake back. Lesson learned.

Update:  That was a great owner reaction.  I just moved here and am not used to having someone from the business actually care about making it a better experience.  Thank you.  I don't need anything to make it better but fresh cake for next time.    It looked  incredible.  I look forward to trying it again.

Also, you are the only store around here that I've found so far who carries my favorite coffee.  Community breakfast blend.  Everyone should try it so you keep it in stock.; The staff at the Market in Laughlin are always helpful and friendly. I am very thankful to have such a nice store close to home.; Nice clean store. The staff is friendly. Glad it’s so close to home; this town became an absolute food desert without a viable local market so I'm willing to pay more to support the market; I can't complain about this place even if I wanted to. The staff is always friendly, the store is always clean and there's plenty of parking. Some items are a little bit pricey, but that is to be expected from a neighborhood grocery store. I'm happy that they reopened the store and I hope they stay forever.

Address: PR-110 Km. 32.6, Bo, Maleza Alta, Aguadilla 00603, Puerto Rico

Reviews:
I recently visited the Econo Cash and Carry near Ramey Base in Aguadilla, and I have to say, it was a frustrating experience. The prices here are *unrealistically high* compared to other nearby stores like Selectos, Sam's Club, Walmart, and even smaller local grocery stores. For a store that’s supposed to provide competitive pricing, it feels like they’re taking advantage of the local community with their overpriced products.

In addition to the steep prices, the *parking lot is a complete mess*. Navigating the area is chaotic, and pushing your cart to the car is an unnecessary struggle due to the poor layout and uneven pavement. It’s incredibly inconvenient and adds to the overall frustrating experience.

With so many other, better-priced grocery stores around, I *highly encourage customers to look elsewhere* for their grocery shopping needs. Between the prices and the parking hassle, it’s just not worth it.; Huge breakfast sandwiches served in the bakery area,  enough for two people, the cafe con leche and cheese flan is great too; They only have two cashiers they want you to use the automatic cashier machine. I won't shop there anymore I'll shop somewhere else also and most importantly over the past 25 years I have purchased a ton of bad meat from the store. One good one that comes to mind is a 10 lb bag of chicken wings that were rotten.. whenever I purchase meat in this store I slit the plastic and smell the meat because I'm not going to get burned again. Do I trust this store not really; Sorry, prices keep going up and up... They could find cheaper substitutions. No change on my 3rd visit.; They had a great variety of products. The employees were very friendly, helpful, and courteous.

Address: 114 Avenida José de Diego, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

Address Components: 114 (street_number); Avenida José de Diego (route); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Bayola (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00907 (postal_code)
Reviews:
SuperMax is a grocery store located in Puerto Rico 🇵🇷! 5 🌟 ➕️ 5 more! It's super because you not only find what you are shopping for but it's a place where you can meet up for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  Meals served hot and tasty Puerto Rico style.  If you travel here for a weeks stay, this is the place to go to stock up. You will love ❤️ 😍! Refrigerators in most island hotels are generally small, so you'll not have enough space.  Stock up on fruits and water, nightly snacks 😋 to hold you over. There are plenty of good places to eat otherwise. 😋 Okay, I've got to join the planning for our next trip. Who knows, our paths may cross. So be sure to smile as you go. I'll be one of those who smiles 😊back! Safe travels. Thank you for reading my review ❤️.  We've started planning for our returned trip. 😀 Be cool, love life, and give God the Praise! Pass it on, be strong, and be sure to follow me. Until my next adventure, see you soon.  Ciao 😎!; This is the Whole Foods of PR. Clean , fresh, the prepared food line can stretch very far during breakfast and lunch because it’s cheap AND good. The liquor selection is vast and they have sushi and a bakery. And open 24 hours for people like me.; I love this store! It’s amazing! Visiting from the states, I find this chain clean and up to par with meeting expectations. The hot food line is to die for! Food plates last all day! Definitely meets my shopping needs.; They have a great variety of spirits, liquor and beers; I was surprised to find a wide selection of cooked food inside this supermarket, a few tables to sit down and eat inside and a mini coffee bar. The food was great and for very reasonable pricing. I had the chicken with rice, beans and maduros (fried plantains) everything cooked to perfection, I also had a slice of pizza from the same place, also really good.
Followed that with some coffee, yum . The whole supermarket was immaculate and I constantly saw the cleaning crew walking around and clean some more sweep up any paper on the floor. The bathrooms on the second floor also very clean. On the second floor is also where you will find the liquor store section of the supermarket. You can't go wrong by going here to do your grocery shopping and also for a quick bite..

Name: Walmart Supercenter
Address: 5250 W Indian School Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85031, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 5250 (street_number); West Indian School Road (route); Maryvale Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85031 (postal_code)
Reviews:
UPDATE : 2/24/24 (The family who owns walmart, donates millions to republicans for lower taxes for the filthy rich.) They are only face-lifting their stores themselves, not actual quality of their food, better selections etc, just stores and landscaping lift. This walmart has made the whole store self check (While I literally see at least 5 employees walking around just cleaning the scanners on the self check outs at 6am) outs besides maybe 3 or 4 very small registers while complaining about thefts and locking everything up aka will take more time to shop instead of hiring security. I'm assuming they will with all walmarts eventually so get ready to check out your own groceries after working 10+ hour days the rest of your life. Beyond ridiculous. I wonder how the multi billionaire family owners, presidents and CEOs of these companies, meals look like..  walmart made 153 billion in profit this year (Ending in 2023). They are putting 9 billion in store face-lifts. Not because walmart has the worst selections and quality in food and furniture. Flower, vitamin etc selection is a joke. They lock up eye drops, make you press a button, wait for an employee and then they walk you to a register to pay for them etc.... 😳🤦🏼 The frozen bags of chicken nuggets etc is a good idea but in true walmart fashion, has the smallest openings possible to pour the food out. You can tell instantly the difference in quality from "great value" foods from other great known brand foods. Employees don't say one word to you when ringing you up aka pretty awkward for me and or just rude etc. I don't expect anything less from a kid nowadays working at walmart. The amount of employees just walking around compared to the empty registers is mind blowing on a daily basis. Store opens at 6am, no one on registers until 8 or 9am 👌🏻. We live in Maryvale so its another hassle for us paycheck to paycheck peeps. 👏🏻 Stores are always messy, dirty with milk stains on cartons/ refrigerator doors. You can tell in any walmart, they only care about profit, period. Especially the "Grab your attention" useless garbage you buy on an impulse and the beyond extra security measures now. 👌🏻; I love how they have the checkout area,  I've never had to wait long for a kiosk. Since I use the scan and go it's even faster for me, all I have to do is scan the QR code on the register and bounce!; Really bad experience front and supervisor stated she was short of staff but her employees walking around playing around singing and doing all the type of other things they sure were not working but yet money center had a line wrapped around the store with one employee; First thing is it was extremely packed. You pretty much had to stand in lines just to get to get anywhere in the store. The staff is really to busy to help you and they were out of alot of stuff. Make sure to check all product expiration dates because they do not.; A Delightful Shopping Experience at Supermercados Econo in Cabo Rojo

I recently had the opportunity to visit the Supermercados Econo in Cabo Rojo, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations. This fantastic supermarket offers an impressive variety of products and a convenient location, making it an ideal choice for grocery shopping in the area.

Upon entering the store, I was immediately struck by the bright and welcoming atmosphere. The store is well-organized and clean, with clear signage to help you navigate the various sections. The wide aisles make it easy to browse and find the items you're looking for without feeling cramped.

The selection at Supermercados Econo in Cabo Rojo is truly remarkable. From fresh produce and meats to household items and pantry essentials, this supermarket has it all. I was particularly impressed with the quality and diversity of their fresh produce section, which offered a wide range of fruits and vegetables, including many locally-sourced options.

Another standout feature of this supermarket is the friendly and helpful staff. They were always on hand to assist with any questions I had or help me locate items I was struggling to find. It's evident that customer service is a top priority at Supermercados Econo in Cabo Rojo.

The location of the supermarket is also a significant advantage. Situated in the Cabo Rojo Shopping Plaza, it's easily accessible and provides ample parking for customers. The supermarket's proximity to other shops and services makes it even more convenient, allowing you to take care of multiple errands in one trip.

In summary, Supermercados Econo in Cabo Rojo offers an excellent shopping experience for anyone in the area. With its wide selection, friendly staff, and convenient location, it's easy to see why this supermarket is a popular choice for locals and visitors alike. Don't miss the opportunity to shop at this outstanding market – you won't be disappointed!

They have their own farm and the meat is always fresh and their prices are much better than other stores I shop at. Customer service is top notch.; A Convenient Stop at Cabo Rojo Shopping Plaza

I recently had the pleasure of visiting the Cabo Rojo Shopping Plaza, a charming shopping center located in the heart of Cabo Rojo. This delightful plaza offers a variety of shops and services, catering to the diverse needs of locals and tourists alike. With an Econo grocery store, a couple of banks, All Ways 99, Bargain City, and more, this plaza has become my go-to spot for everyday essentials and last-minute shopping.

One of the standout features of the Cabo Rojo Shopping Plaza is its convenience. The Econo grocery store, in particular, offers a wide selection of fresh produce, household items, and pantry staples, making it easy to pick up everything you need in one trip. The All Ways 99 and Bargain City stores are perfect for finding affordable and quality items for home, clothing, and various knick-knacks.

The plaza's layout is user-friendly, with ample parking spaces and easy navigation between stores. The banks located within the shopping center provide added convenience for those needing to take care of financial transactions or access ATMs.

However, the one minor drawback I experienced at the Cabo Rojo Shopping Plaza was the occasional delay in exiting the plaza due to the red light traffic. While it can be a bit frustrating to wait for the light to change during peak hours, I find that the convenience and variety of stores available within the plaza far outweigh this minor inconvenience.

Overall, the Cabo Rojo Shopping Plaza is a fantastic shopping destination for anyone in the area. With its array of shops and services, it's easy to see why it's a favorite among locals and visitors alike. Just remember to be patient when exiting during busy times, and you'll find that the Cabo Rojo Shopping Plaza is well worth the visit.

I think they still continued to serve the chicken tinders  even after I brought the issue to them. I will never buy food from them again!; This El Super has helpful employees.  I did a review of the El Super down the street and it sounded like all El Supers  were bad, but this El Super I would definitely return to.  Even though there was a bit of a language barrier, all the employees that I encountered did their best to help me.; Service was great.  Store is Awesome. Clean and great prices.

Name: El Super
Address: 3405 E Cesar E Chavez Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90063, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Vicinity: 3405 East Cesar E Chavez Avenue, Los Angeles
Address Components: 3405 (street_number); East Cesar E Chavez Avenue (route); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90063 (postal_code)
Reviews:
First time coming to this El Super location and it was not what I expected. Terrible service from Daniela who is the one “in charge”. Claiming the store was closed at 10:30 when it was actually 11. She has a nasty attitude and kept yelling back in forth inside the store. El super needs to do better with who they select as leaders. Please train your employee properly or do not hire them at all. Not a good look. Disappointed is the least I could say.; This is the supermarket we go to every week to buy fruits and vegetables. Their fruits and vegetables are very fresh. The shrimps are also of good quality.
They also have Midengao ice cream. The taste and texture of childhood.
This is a very good lifestyle supermarket.; DANIELA IS HORRIBLE!!!!! I wish I could leave zero stars. I walked into the store 15 minutes before they closed. My sister and I were looking at the cakes for my moms birthday and one of the vey nice workers there saw us and he said that if we wanted a cake , we ask the cashier and she'll get it for us. We proceeded to buy some candles and Hilda the cashier checked us out on Lane 9. She was very kind . When we asked for a cake, she called the manager Daniela on the speaker. Daniela yells from all the way across 8 registers to say in Spanish "At this time no, it's too late, we can't give them a cake". She was very rude, dismissive, disrespectful and unprofessional. I don't understand why they have someone like that working there. I'm calling corporate, this is unacceptable. They are obligated to help us out even if we are there 5 minutes before they close. Terrible!!!!!; I usually go to this Market once per week with my mother-in-law and my wife. The market is always very crowded, but we still go there. There is an old guy who sweeps the floor and for three times on different visits he bumps his broom into my foot even though there's no trash around me and I told him, in Spanish, what's going on? why do you keep following me through the whole store? My wife and her mom are Mexican and I am a white guy. I am starting to feel unwelcome in this store and that the older sweeper man is a RACIST toward me and that's why he keeps trying to sweep my feet even with no trash near my feet And just for this reason I'm never going back to that store. I didn't get the name of the sweeper guy, but he is an older Latino guy that always works on Wednesday afternoons when I go there.; My wife and I have been shopping at  El Super when looking for good deals on produces,meats and house hold items.  It's  a great place for Mexican products from Mexico.

Name: Col. Mendoza
Address: 7RX8+6Q8, PR-402, Añasco, 00610, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 7RX8+6Q8 (plus_code); Puerto Rico 402 (route); Añasco (locality); Hatillo (administrative_area_level_2); Añasco (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00610 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Celebrating our honeymoon in PR and trying to get around this beautiful island, I stumbled upon this beautiful place!!! At first (and I'm going to be honest) I was hesitant to go in but my wife and I did not regret it. The owner welcomed us, attended to us and treated us as if we were regulars. She is tremendous LOVE and I don't have enough expression to explain to her how I feel.

The place itself is easy to find but upon entering it is a little dark and hot (because it is PR), but the food and service are worth it.

We went in to drink and get out of the sun and ended up discovering one of the best rabbit dumplings (or pastries depending on the island) we have ever tasted. I RECOMMEND THEM TO EVERYONE!!

I finish this short and give it 4 out of 5 because the owner truly deserves it. I recommend this place!; I make it clear that they are one of the best businesses in Añasco (BO Hatillo). The beers are always super cold and delicious. The atmosphere is great for you and yours because we are family there and also friends from upbringings. Everyone who arrives doesn't want to leave. It has a billiards, bathrooms, monchiiies, fried foods, juice and soda for children, as well as a diabetic diet🤘😜 the tough ones are always loved
Att Zuly & Oscalito 🙏❣️😘; My favorite, always excellent attention!!! And cozy atmosphere.; I didn't like it very much, it's more for other types of culture; Brutal treatment. The truth is that a very quiet place.

Name: Walmart Supercenter
Address: Carr #2 Km 56.6, Barceloneta, 00617, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: Barceloneta (locality); Florida Afuera (administrative_area_level_2); Barceloneta (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00617 (postal_code)
Reviews: We come here often, including today, which is the day before a tropical storm is due to arrive. The management and staff deserve the highest praise. Plenty of water still available, at the regular inexpensive price. Employees were all over the place, filling displays, eliminating empty cartons, and helping customers. And the store was immaculate. No wait at the self checkouts, all of which were working fine. A pleasure to ship here. ♿️; I ordered dog food through the app to be picked up, when i arrived to my store in Barceloneta it was very easy to check in, the delivery girl was very polite and didn’t accept any help to pick up the 44 pounds bag, everything was good and perfect except that she wasn’t allowed to accept any tip, it’s our way to appreciate her effort and very good customer service, if i can give more stars i certainly will; Store is big and had a nice selection of clothes and shoes. The fitting room was open and kept very clean. The lines went quickly and social distancing and mask wearing were a priority.; This Walmart is cleaner and better organized than the ones I have seen in the states. The liquor selection is actually pretty good. I really love the express lane which allowed me to get in and out quickly every time I visited.; Love it can find everything you need in one place!

Name: Fry's Marketplace
Address: 2727 W Bell Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85053, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 2727 (street_number); West Bell Road (route); Deer Valley (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85053 (postal_code)
Reviews:
First time to the store.
Very nice layout.  Everything seemed stocked  and neatly placed.
Like to give a shout out to Annie in the meat department for providing over the top customer service, by being right there,  being extremely friendly, and taking great care of us.; What happened to this Fry's? First, the trash under the shopping cart area by the front door was awful.  Then a lady not paying attention to her kids in the way of my cart yelled at me after I kindly said excuse me twice to get past and then wouldn't apologize after.  Then the cashier barely said hi after I said good morning.  Then there was no one bagging in my lane so the cashier had to do it.  I
thought I should help but I pay more for a store like this to not have to bag my own groceries.  I did thank him and wished him a good day and he did not reply.  Definitely will not be back.; I like the size of this location and the convenience of it being down the street from my home. HOWEVER, I'm seriously considering going to a different location or business altogether because of the AT&T sales people. When people are grocery shopping, esp. post-pandemic, they don't want to be approached and harassed about a new cell phone plan. As a woman shopping alone or coming after a long day at work, it feels uncomfortable and inappropriate to be stared down and approached by a salesman and have to hear the whole spiel. It completely ruins the shopping experience. Based on other reviews, it doesn't look like this will be addressed.; Worst Fry's in Phoenix!! Every time I go to this store it's trashy & the employees are lazy, I had a gift card tried scanning it like it said but that didn't work so I asked cashier for help...she did what I did & scanned it but something wasn't right & instead of trying to figure it out for me she tossed her hands up like whatever and said she didn't know maybe the system's messed up & walked away. Lol, people are so lazy and do not want to do their job. So I paid with my debit card and left it at that still have the gift card that I will be using when I go to a correct store that knows how to operate.; I saw a gentleman checking out at self checkout and as he was checking out I noticed another gentleman who appeared to be a manager interrupted the man who was checking out and asked him about a bottle of pills. Saying to him, where are the pills you had in your cart. The man who was checking out answered, "I put them back on the shelf." The manager repeatedly asked the gentleman to tell him or show him where the bottle of pills were put back and completely harass this man that was checking out. The man told the manager feel free to look in my bags. I also noticed there was a Phoenix police officer there who I believed the store had called on the gentleman checking out. I don't understand why they(manager of Fry's or associate) would accuse someone of stealing presumably on how the gentleman looked that was checking out. He had a beard long hair tattoos and wearing all black. However, I can not assume why the accused that man, but it would appear that way. It really made me uncomfortable as a custimer because I don't want to shop at a store of any kind where they feel that they need to have police presence nor do I want to possibly be accused of stealing something based off of my appearance. The gentleman finished checking out and left without the police officer making any contact with the man that the manager accused of shoplifting. I will no longer return to that location.

Parking is disappointing, as it is dark and under a low ceiling. Store is immaculate, with shelves packed with merchandise. Employees are busy, but helpful. Nice liquor section. Lots of cashiers. Good parking and handicap ramp; Big and huge Supermarket. It's no way you can't find what you need. Their meat section is awesome they have some of everything. They had frozen whole pig or half pig ready to buy and grill up. The alcohol section was bigger then the liquor store itself. Bakery section well let's just say I was going to go crazy trying to buy all the pastries that day. The cashiers don't know much english so make sure your up on your español. I would shop here all the time if I could. The bathrooms are clean and well lite. Security is all around the store so please pay for all your items. Unless you want a bad vacation. Name: Freshmart Condado
Address: 1310 Ashford Ave, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 1310 (street_number); Ashford Avenue (route); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Condado (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00907 (postal_code)
Reviews:
For years, I've gone here. For years, I've been disappointed. Don't even consider the high prices. Produce is often over ripe, dairy is past its sell-by date, and staff consistently opens later and closes earlier than posted hours. No one cares; The only reason I am giving this review four stars instead of five is because the downstairs mart is very expensive ($7 for gluten free loaf as opposed to maybe $5 in the States), and the upstairs cafe service time can be a little slow (but that’s because everything is made to-order).

Besides those notes, the food is very tasty given the price tags (surprisingly low!). A meal for me and my wife was about $15 to share delicious oatmeal, have a scramble sandwich for her, and gluten free pancakes for me. They have fruit and nutella options to top the pancakes and french bread, and they have multi-grain and sourdough options for the sandwich type bread and french bread.

They also have pizzas, smoothies, and salads—but I didn’t try any of them.

Love this place, and I will be back if I come to San Juan again!; Parking is always available, a bit on the pricier end, but they have gluten-free and allergen free options that can't be found elsewhere.; Excellent customer service.The store has parking. They have everything you need when it comes to healthy products that are hard to find in regular supermarkets. Store is clean, modern and fully stocked. They also have fresh cooked food and ice creams. Great experience, highly recommended. The only con will be the prices, but you need to have in mind that this are high quality products.; What can I say about this grocery store??

It’s fantastic!! Awesome selections, great staff and the restaurant upstairs has such good food. This gem was located near our hotel and we found ourselves every single day.

Now we just need one of these in Chicago!

Reviews: I went there several times over the weekend. Charming little island market with friendly staff.; Well stocked. Great selections. Lots of specialty and curiosity items. Nice selection of single beers. They even had a waffle maker.; Prices seem in line with most in PR.  Lots of take away options like sandwiches and salads.  Had some of their octopus salad (ensalada de pulpo) and it was quite flavorful. The Mallorca sandwiches were tasty and bread was soft.  Lots of drink options available.  Great stop for lunch and eating out in the Plaza des Les Armas under the shaded benches.; This is a great store, and a great environment to be in. Formerly used to be employeed here and be a great connection with my coworkerss and team. It gets packed really quick and very busy. I remember being there the 4 days of San Sebastián. The only a thing I would say about this place is that there are people from the mainland United States, that come here who do not speak even a little bit of Spanish, and feel as if they are entitled to something. For my experience, it’s mainly the people mostly from New York who have a bit of arrogance, but other than that this is a great place to shop, and a great place to visit.; Fair prices (especially for the area), clean premises, friendly and helpful employees, and convenient location. Store is well lit and well organized and has great hours. Perfect place to get groceries, alcohol, and essentials in Old San Juan. Easy walking distance of many hotels in the area, so we just carried our purchases to our hotel easily. This is our go-to stop for necessities!

Reviews: They have those fancy fridges that instead of glass to see the options they have digital screens on the outside front and a button for responding to voiced questions.; Andre and the other female worker went above and beyond with my drink order. He helped me figure out what I wanted to drink then helped me get it just sweet enough. They were so nice and helpful. What true service should be.; I love this store. It reminds me of Fred Meyer which I miss. The selection is awesome for food, home and baby. They have clothes, outdoor furniture, & kids toys. I do think that they could use more staff, but I am giving them (and everyone else) a pass right now on that. Seems to be an issue everywhere. I have a smaller Fry’s closer to me but I come here when I have the time.; I love picking up from this location! Every time I am greeted with a smile and today I had a fantastic conversation with one of the ladies working!! Even with being a hard worker she made sure to make the time to ask us about our day!; People who say this store is clean and well stocked, most likely normally do their shopping at Walmart. This store always smells bad and the floors are always dirty. It seems to be understaffed. There is no signal in this Fry’s and if you want to use the app, you have to use their Wi-Fi. I started going to the Other location on Higley and it’s a night and day difference and I can use my phone in there. Only come here out of convenience.

Name: La Superior Mercados
Address: 5731 Hillsdale Blvd, Sacramento, CA 95842, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 5731 (street_number); Hillsdale Boulevard (route); Sacramento (locality); Sacramento County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 95842 (postal_code); 3003 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
4/06/24- I found it on accident and I had a great experience. Like many stores some prices are high, but I go in knowing this and focus on customer service.

Mia was working at the salsa and salad counter. She greeted me right away, and answered all my questions. She offered me samples as they have a big variety.

I asked if they added sour cream to the guacamole as I do not like it. They don't. I bought cactus salad, and a few salsas. The only salsa that went bad fast is the Tatemada but the other's were fine. Mia got busy but not for long as Juan saw this and came over to help.

My next stop was the meat deli. I asked for a pound of carnitas. They are cheaper than the other two Mexican stores I've been to. The lady pointed out the sales. I appreciated it her doing so. All the meat looked fresh.

Next I headed to the bakery and noticed all the choices of breads, pastries and cakes. Lots of choices but not if you're a diabetic 😁

I walked the rest of store. If I lived here it would be my weekend store. Like any other store I would shop the sales and go to the next store.

A shout out to Mia and Juan for working as a team to take care of the customers. I saw how every customer that came to the counter got the same service I did.; Food is absolutely Overpriced & not tasty.. Their 'Super Burrito ' is more like a regular burrito. Carne asada is not seasoned well - salsa is also an extra charge . 'Super Tacos' are $5 Each on a regular white tortilla and not worth it to say the least.; Been here many times since moving to the area. From now on I'll go anywhere else but here. In all the years coming here it's always very inconsistent in quality and service. First, I've gotten produce that was rotten multiple times. I should have stopped going then. I have bought ready made food and gotten sick.    I stopped buying anything to eat here. I have bought tortillas with moldy ones in the middle. The last straw was today. Went to buy meat for a BBQ. Asked for marinated beef. I noticed the meat at bottom was in the marinade. I asked if he could give from bottom. He said the top is the same and anyway its way easier for me. The store was not busy and many of the guys in the meat area were standing around doing nothing. I would rather go somewhere else for everything and anything We need.; Very clean and organized with very nice staff. They have a great selection of items, although they can be a bit more pricey. The meat section and bakery have a variety of items. The cakes are a bit dry though.  I don't recommend the guacamole. It is the WORST thing you can eat! 2nd time in a row that we get Guacamole and it tasted spoiled. The agua fresca is okay.; Just come back from store. All my churros raw . Disappointed

Reviews:
Still trying to wrap my head around the rudeness at this store and why it's so excessive. Two cashiers were chatting at a register and told me "this one's closed, go to aisle 2!" I went to aisle 2 and there was no one working any register. Or any register for that matter. When the woman finally returned to register 2 after minutes of waiting I told her I didn't want a bag and she began bagging my 4 items anyway. I repeated I did not want a bag (I have my reusable own bags in my car––not that it's anyone's concern), and she got angry with me!! (???) She told me it was "inappropriate for me to not take a plastic bag." She then proceeded to say stuff under her breath and be extremely condescending. There is no reason for this kind of treatment when I am spending my money at your job. Will not be returning to this overpriced store.; Dont recommend

Minus a star for staff having a local skip over a line instead of taking the next customer. I felt this was very poor service and makes me consider simply buying my food elsewhere before making the trip to Longville. Minus another star for unnecessarily using such an extensive amount of environmentally unfriendly packaging (foam and cellophane).; Great selection and the produce was always great! Came from out of state and wasn't sure what we'd find in town. Had great produce and all of the brands we hoped for and more.; I love Tabaka's.  A great store for such a small community.  Deli cheeses are my favorite here, but produce and meat counters are also satisfactory.  Expect the commensurate rural price inflation that comes with living in such a beautiful area.  Lastly the onion buns are awesome!  Only gripe is the lack of chocolate malt'o'meal.; All the Employees that works in this Store are very nice and friendly; Prices are fair and they have a good selection in comparison with other stores in the area. I have noticed at times the cashiers tend to talk to people a little much instead of taking care of a waiting customer but I guess that's part of a small town atmosphere

Name: Narenj Mediterranean Grocery
Address: 7700 Sunrise Blvd #1300, Citrus Heights, CA 95610, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 1300 (subpremise); 7700 (street_number); Sunrise Boulevard (route); Citrus Heights (locality); Sacramento County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 95610 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Narenj Mediterranean Grocery is a fantastic addition to the Citrus Heights community. They offer an incredible selection of fresh vegetables, dates, and olives at unbeatable prices. The quality of their produce is outstanding, and it's clear that the owners take great care in selecting only the best products for their customers.

But what really sets Narenj Mediterranean Grocery apart is the level of customer service they provide. The owners are incredibly helpful and knowledgeable, and they go out of their way to make sure you find everything you're looking for. They're always willing to answer questions and offer suggestions, which makes shopping there a truly enjoyable experience.

I'm so grateful to have Narenj Mediterranean Grocery in my community. It's so convenient to have such a great selection of Mediterranean groceries available right here in Citrus Heights. I highly recommend this store to anyone looking for high-quality produce and excellent customer service. If you haven't checked them out yet, you're missing out!; I recently explored Narenj Mediterranean grocery, and it's a hidden treasure for anyone with a taste for Mediterranean and Arabic cuisine. This place has it all—a diverse array of food products that transform your shopping trip into a culinary adventure. What sets Narenj apart is its commitment to top-notch quality. The staff not only is friendly but also makes you feel like family, always ready to assist you in finding exactly what you need, whether you're a seasoned chef or just dipping your toes into Mediterranean flavors.

For those who savor the richness of Mediterranean and Arabic tastes, I highly recommend this spot. It's not just a store; it's a haven where you can not only restock your kitchen but also stumble upon new ingredients and brands that elevate your cooking game. I am so grateful to have this store in my neighborhood.; Collection is good, mostly fresh, prices are fair, customer service is nice.; I recently had the pleasure of visiting Narenj Mediterranean grocery, and I must say, it's a true gem for anyone who loves Mediterranean and Arabic cuisine. This store offers a wide range of food products, making it a one-stop-shop for all your culinary needs.

The selection of Arabic food items is impressive, and they have everything you need to create authentic dishes, from spices to specialty ingredients. The variety of oils, rice, and other essential staples is outstanding, and what's even better is the choice of different brands, so you can pick your favorites.

What truly sets this grocery store apart is the dedication to providing quality products. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly, always ready to help you find exactly what you're looking for. Whether you're a seasoned cook or just starting to explore Mediterranean cuisine.

I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys Mediterranean and Arabic flavors. It's a place where you can not only find what you need but also discover new ingredients and brands to enhance your cooking experience.

Additionally, Narenj Mediterranean grocery offers a delightful selection of sweets that is truly a feast for the senses. The range of authentic, delicious confections is a sweet tooth's dream come true. From baklava to Turkish delight, and various traditional pastries, you'll find a wide array of sweet treats to satisfy your cravings. These sweets are not only delicious but also make for perfect gifts or additions to your dessert table when hosting guests.

You truly have to visit Narenj Mediterranean grocery store to fully grasp what I'm talking about. The in-person experience is a sensory delight, with the aroma of spices, the vibrant colors of fresh produce, and the tantalizing display of sweets. So, if you're a food enthusiast or simply curious to explore, a visit to this store is a must. You won't be disappointed!; Owner is a very respectable , hardworking man ! Recommend this place , strongly

Reviews: I really enjoy shopping at Dillard's in Baton Rouge. The staff at every station were very helpful and engaging, which made my day and shopping experience even better!!!; We're staying near Natchez for about 10 days and, of course, needed groceries. We googled grocery stores, and Natchez Market had the highest ratings. The store was very well stocked, and shelves faced, for an attractive appearance. What really stood out was the wide aisles. I've been to bigger and more trendy stores, but for a small city store, this was nice. The prices seemed fair, and the staff that we interacted with were pleasant.; I enjoy shopping at this store The staff is always extremely friendly prices may be a dime or to higher than Walmart but the customer service is well worth it and the fact that the store is clean and you can get around and it makes a very nice; For months now I have been asking the meat dept guys about salmon. Salmon is healthy and good food. That meat dept guys are very nice and helpful but their management and the owners absolutely REFUSE to provide salmon! Why I do not understand other than that they must not care about what customers want because I know if they tried they could obtain salmon at a reasonable price. The Natchez Walmart has it, you can travel to Brookhaven, McComb, Baton Rouge or Vicksburg and find salmon. I would love to be able to shop local and find a good assortment of healthy food. I have called to enquire but no reasonable explanation is offered other than the vendors available do not provide salmon which I find to be very hard to believe, why lie about this?. I have no alternative but to shop else where; I'm from Louisiana and had never been here before. I didn't even know it existed until I was visiting in Natchez and someone mentioned that pork tenderloins were on sale for $1.79/lb! I had to take advantage of the sale and in the process found a very nice, locally owned grocery store. It had everything that I would expect national grocery store chains would have. And very nice employees and you don't have to park a mile away from the door! Love this store and will remember it the next time that I am in Natchez.

Reviews:
Please get College Inn Chicken Broth and Beef Broth! Your store used to have it. Staple in my house. Nothing compares. Too many Swanson on shelf taking up too much room! Not good. Also, Tony Packo Hot Dog Sauce is amazing. Please look into carrying this. 10/10!; Fred Meyer is becoming increasingly "Kroger-ized", replacing many other brands with some version of Kroger brand (Kroger, Private Selection, Simple Truth).  They are also clearly selling massive areas of shelf space to reduce competition and selection.  Just try to buy something other than grape or strawberry jelly.  Welches is the dominant brand, and Smuckers non-grape and non-strawberry are absent.  I expect eventually even these brands will be Krogerized as well.
I'm no longer loyal to what used to be Fred Meyer but is now increasingly Kroger.  The more this happens the more likely I will do ALL of my shopping somewhere else.  I already source many food brands no longer carried at Kroger/Fred Meyer from Albertson's, Safeway, Winco and Walmart.
Sad to see this happening as I used to love Fred Meyer.; Friendly service tonight even tho it was almost closing time.  One set of sliding entry doors was locked at 9pm, and I wanted to purchase an item right outside the locked doors.  so an employee went and got it for me, so I didn't have to carry the heavy items outside all the way to the next set of doors late at night.  Thank you! I was happy with my experience tonight.  Great job to the folks working at checkout; Freddys has changed in the last few years. I've seen sell items not showing sale at checkout.  Thought it was just someone's mistake but my last experience may stop me from shopping there again. Every item didn't show sell. Clerk was rude about it. The sell item tag was for another item but placed in front of wrong item. Seems like Freddys is trying to scam their customers. Now to top things off, security checks me at the door going out. Treating paying customers like criminals and letting the criminals walk out while the security beeper is going and not doing anything.  I'm going to shop at another store and maybe try Freddys again someday.; Not only are the lines longer due to reduced staff, but now you have to wait in another line to get out the door so the security guy can check your receipt (also due to reduced staff). I'd pay more for groceries to not have to deal with this.

Name: Olive Grove
Address: 720 Main St, Mendota Heights, MN 55118, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 720 (street_number); Main Street (route); Mendota Heights (locality); Dakota County (administrative_area_level_2); Minnesota (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 55118 (postal_code); 3758 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
This lovely store has the absolute best olive oils and vinegars. I especially love their 18-year old balsamic, but also keep on hand their Pear-cranberry balsamic, Sicilian lemon balsamic and white balsamic. They have so many more options, too, as well as the makings for some wonderful meals.; Great service, helpful staff, they let you taste things, and the selection is wonderful.  Don't skip the cabinets of jams and jellies because there is so much more to buy.  (Bacon pepper jam....  mmmm); I walked in The Olive Grove store to propose a mural. I heard about the store from a friend and I was curious. Natalie was so kind and she knows all about olives. I am from Turkey and I still spend summers at Eagen Sea facing Greek Islands. In other words, one of the best olive reagens in the world. I also lived in Italy for 4 years and in Spain for 2 years. I have to admit that I got surprised when I started tasting the oils at The Olive Grove. I had to buy The Tuscan Herb Evoo. I make myself a Mediterranean breakfast salad every morning; tomatoes, cilantro, parsley, olives, feta cheese and lots of olive oil. When I tried my salad with my new Olive oil from The Olive Grove I was amazed! I feel so lucky to have this store in Mn.
Thank you Natalie🌸; Just made my first purchase a few days ago based on Anne's recommendations (she is amazing!) and extremely helpful flavor and pairing descriptions on the site.  I can't express enough how impressed I am with the quality of the oils and balsamic vinegars.  I cannot pick one favorite because all the flavors I purchased are divine!   I'll definitely be back!; I started using The Olive Grove's olive oils and balsamic vinegars last summer. What a difference they have made in our families meals!  Previously, I had thought I was buying "the good stuff" from the grocery store, but this has opened a whole new world of freshness and flavor! I LOVE that you can taste everything before buying it, so you'll never go home wondering if you're going to like something or not. The staff are very welcoming, friendly, and knowledgeable. They have lots of great suggestions for how to use the products. I've made many of the recipes found on their website, and they have all been delicious! Their products make wonderful gifts as well. Last Christmas I gave a gift bag to each of my children's teachers, which included a balsamic, an oil, a seasoning, and a recipe using the products. The teachers loved them! I would highly recommend The Olive Grove!

Name: Vidalia Market
Address: 1645 Carter St, Vidalia, LA 71373, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews:
I go through Vidalia often and enjoy stopping at this store.  It is always clean and items are easy to find.  The cashiers are friendly and usually greet customers at check out.; I don't like their new way of doing coupons! They are treated like rebates, which mean you pay the full price then the amount of the coupon is supposed to show "in a few DAYS" in your "wallet" section in their app. I have been waiting a week and my $3.00 rebate for buying a roast never came through!!! I hate this new system! I liked it when we just entered in our phone numbers and coupons actually saved money. HATE this "rebate" system. Feels scammy.; Store in Vidalia is ridiculous,  they do not honor the sale paper adds, for example, the sale paper has 3 dollars off one pack of hamburger meat. I was told that if it is not in the digital coupons then it is no good. I tried to talk to the manager but all she would tell me is that "I just work here". So be aware,  just because it is in the sale paper doesn't mean that it is on sale. Glad we have a Walmart!!

Had to change my review,  I messaged Vidalia Market about the sale paper and they corrected the problem.  The Digital Coupons has been updated and the correct 3 dollars off coupon for Ground beef now available but still kinda aggravating because the manager at the store had a I don't want to deal with you attitude and could have corrected this herself but someone did take care of the problem.; Great store. Well stocked and very clean. The employees were very friendly and helpful; I like this store when I'm visiting family because it's very clean and I can usually find what I'm looking for, some of the staff however, leave a lot to be desired with their customer service skills.

Reviews: Great market for essential groceries and hard to find asian snacks at really good prices. Has a great variety of hispanic and asian groceries. Ready made food is really good too they have Taiwanese Bento boxes and Sushi. Cool place to shop.; This supermarket has issues with honest business practices. The prices labeled on the shelves do not match the prices charged at checkout. This is clearly a dishonest form of theft. What’s even more bizarre is that when you go back to point out the discrepancy, a lady who claims to be the manager, supervisor, and owner all in one insists that she personally placed the price tags, so there is no problem. Her blatant lying leaves you speechless. We hope that all customers in this community carefully check their receipts when shopping at this store.; This Asian supermarket is tucked in a plaza which is mostly a Hispanic sort of community. There are shelves that display  Taiwanese products. As you walk to a different area there are shelves that focus on hispanic products. The rest of the store is focused on Asian products. The store looks dated but inside seems clean and organized. As you enter there is a little heated lamp area near the cashier with Taiwanese bento and other ready to eat food. If the Taiwanese bento does appeal to your liking, you can walk towards the far left corner where you can ask the staff to make a Taiwanese bento that is made to order. The live seafood section seems limited, the seafood area seems sub par as the fishy smell is quite strong.; Sad. The popcorn chicken stand has very limited items at 2pm Friday afternoon. The staff doesn’t bother to explain if the popular taro related sold out or discontinued. He just returned the order sheet to me without any explanation or apology. I missed those friendly staffs who are more welcoming.; Customer service is good, but their prices is wait over price compared to supermarket near by not only that the produces , mango I have to take it back to my money back , and today I bout some fruit few of them $30 worth of fruit I get home try them all almost most of it not even right, I was think about take it back ( no waist of time ) all I can said it no QI . Reviews:
We were sold rancid meat. Cooked it as soon as we came home, well done until crispy. My entire family has been sick for days. Completely disgusted. First time coming in, now I’m never shopping here again.; This is probably the best store ever it's quick convenient and is delicious! Thank you guys for being so kind every single time I'll see you guys next time; I have craving menudo for quite some time.. I finally was able to get to this place to try  it out.. there meat selection is awesome.( just looked didn't buy) I did get some bfast chorizo and some tortillas will let you know how that is.. back to the Menudo I don't know how but it was kinda greasy not sure if the pigs feet made it that way.. but it was still very tasty, good flavor!! Will go back..; Pan dulce is super fresh and tasty! Ordered a cake and customer service in the bakery section was outstanding. Happy to say that I was satisfied and pleased with my visit.

I returned four days later to pick up the cake and was surprised and highly disappointed with the outcome of my cake. Firstly, the writing on the cake was smeared, smudged, and illegible. The cake toppers were placed on top of the HB writing! I'm still scratching my head how the baker/cake decorator had no sense in doing this or was simply careless. Seems silly that the the cake toppers were not accounted for prior to writing on the cake. Secondly, the cake was not fresh (made the day before). Apparently, the customer is supposed to be informed at the time ordering that the baker only works on select days...that which was not mentioned.

It's a huge bummer that this happened, but on the upside, I was glad that the cashier and the manager/owner accepted accountability for their error and did what they could to rectify the problem.

All in all, I will have to find another bakery for cakes, but may return for pan dulce if I'm ever in the neighborhood.; Great place for Fajitas de pollo!!! Can't be beat. Also grabbed some salsa roja and guacamole....good prices as well...never disappointa!

Name: Jacobo's Grocery
Address: 4621 S 24th St, Omaha, NE 68107, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Address Components: 4621 (street_number); South 24th Street (route); South Omaha (neighborhood); Omaha (locality); Douglas County (administrative_area_level_2); Nebraska (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 68107 (postal_code); 1819 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: This was my first time going to Jacobos and might be my last. They have a decent selection of Mexican goods, but that's probably the only reason I'd return. If you aren't a Spanish speaker, the deli counter is a bit intimidating. I heard many good things about their salsa, but it's just okay in my opinion. It also looked like they had four varieties behind the counter, but there were only two choices on the menu they have posted. I didn't receive what I thought I was ordering. There were some communication issues between me and the person helping me, who was also very softspoken, so it was confusing for me to order, even after asking for clarification. There is also the added pressure that so many people are in line, so I didn't want to take up too much time ordering. I was very disappointed in the pork as well. I took it straight home to refrigerate for later, still all wrapped up. When I opened it (same day), most of the pieces are completely dry with no flavor! For $8.99/lb, I couldn't believe the lack of quality. It seems as though lack of quality are what some others have posted in their reviews in the last year as well. I'm going to have to throw it away because I'm not sure it can be salvaged. I also purchased a bag of their tortilla chips, but they are stale. The package states they are packaged at Jacobos, but there are no dates, so not sure how fresh they are. I don't know if I just went on an off day or something, but I probably won't go here again aside from getting some of the Mexican candies/drinks. They have a huge selection of Jarritos and a nice (decently priced) selection of Mexican candies. They also have a good sized parking lot, so that was nice. The employees were friendly. As others stated, the store is cash only. At the time of writing, they have an ATM in store.; Jacobo's might be the perfect, South Omaha, large-scale Bodega.  It has a wide variety of products and a reasonable supply on-hand of each.  The piñatas and Mexican imports definitely lend it a certain Latin authenticity, but it's the deli at the back that is the cherry on this fried ice cream sundae.    We were on the hunt for some variety packs of bottled soda, but the steady stream of patrons for the quart-sized salsa containers told us we will need to make return trip!; All the Food and bakery items are Delicious my favorite place to buy. The cost of item's are very affordable and is only cash only sales  no credit cards or checks.; Best chips and salsa, hands down. Always a line, goes decently quick. Bring cash. No cards accepted; Yes my name is paul I go to Jacob's because they make the best authentic Mexican food there chips and salsa is the best 👌 the employees are very very nice and workers are very good I'm very impressed 👌 I recommend Jacob's market to everyone I been in omaha sense 1997 and ever sense they open Jacob's great service great food overall great employees
