Address Components: 3003 (street_number); North 108th Street (route); North Central Omaha (neighborhood); Omaha (locality); Douglas County (administrative_area_level_2); Nebraska (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 68164 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Very good weekly sales!

The first sentence was my original review but I'm updating it after my experience this past weekend. FF had a wonderful 3-day sale on catfish nuggets that started on May 23, and ended on May 25. On May 24th, after work I stopped by this store but wasn't surprised when I saw that they were out. I asked a person from the meat department if they expected to have more and I was told yes, but I should come back on Saturday morning. The store opened at 6am so I stopped in at 6:45am. There were still no catfish nuggets on display but a person from the deli told me that the meat department personnel usually won't come in until 7am or so. I left to go grab coffee and then returned at about 7:30am. The nuggets were still not out so I asked a female from the meat department when they would be put out. She did say that they were indeed in the store but they probably won't be put out until the manager comes in later. According to her, he would need to dig them out and that will take some time. She could not give me a timeframe but said I should be okay if I came back in the afternoon. She asked for my name and how many pounds I would like then said she would set some aside for me. It wasn't until I went to the FF on 144th and W Center St then learned of an experience that my best friend had earlier the same morning at the FF on Saddle Creek, that I realized how poor and lazy the service I was given at the 108th St FF. First at the 144th FF, same thing, there were no nuggets on display when I arrived HOWEVER, I asked an extremely nice man from the meat department when they would be put out and he said, well I can get some for you now. He asked me to wait for about 5 minutes while he go to the back to get them. He asked how many pounds I want then asked if it were ok if he put them in one package. It couldn't have been a better shopping experience. While there, I decided to get a couple of steaks, some brats, five loaves of bread, and couple of other things. I spoke to my best friend who visited the Saddle Creek store on the same morning and he said when he arrived the nuggets hadn't yet been brought out but he asked a young kid where they were and the young clerk said to him, let me go and package some for you. Contrast those experiences to the lazy meat department clerk at 108th St who tried to make me think that the nuggets would need to be dug out by the manager as if they were brought to the store in a dumpster. Nevertheless, I did not go back and likely won't. The 144th St store appears to value customers more and from this point will get my business.; Best fried chicken in Omaha, don't believe me, go there and wait an hour in line, ridiculous, but so worth it. When they say they are not taking orders until a week out, there is a reason. I wish it wasn't so well known, selfishly. Freakin amazing, and great staff at the deli.; This Family Fare carries a few brands that I can't find at other grocery stores. Great deli, great produce. Everybody is always professional, helpful and friendly.
It's the only grocery/hardware store combo I've ever seen but it's pretty handy when you need furnace filters or something like that.; Went inside searching for a solution to a yard issue. Headed to the ACE area and everyone was busy. However, I found the Inventory team very busy. One young lady asked if I needed any help? She pointed me in the direction to get someone who could answer my question. I waited for a few minutes as the sales staff was busy with some keys. Waited a little while longer and turned to go to another store. I was stopped by a second female on the inventory team who was determined in a professional way to solve my issue. I explained to her that I really appreciated her assistance, but I'll try another store. To the two "Ladies" who were very helpful "Thank You". To the Inventory Team, collectively, your team was focused and professional. Keep up The Good Work !; Nice clean store, quiet. Lots of good stuff, will definitely go back. Check out was fast and easy.

Love this store, I hope it never closes.; They have delicious hot food. Name: Nichols Supermarkets Inc
Address: 327 1st St, Liverpool, NY 13088, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 327 (street_number); 1st Street (route); Liverpool (neighborhood); Salina (locality); Onondaga County (administrative_area_level_2); New York (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 13088 (postal_code); 5111 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: I went to Nichols last week and as usual had a great experience!  I’m always impressed with the employees and how friendly they are.  I ordered something from the butcher and he had it cut up and back to me in about 5 minutes.  I noticed the owner who was greeting employees and customers alike with a friendly good morning.  He was all over the store, helping wherever needed.  When I took out my groceries, he was outside retrieving carts.  I told him how much I liked the store and how it was nice to see a store that was adequately staffed with happy employees.  I feel like Nichols really cares about customer service. 😊; If you want quality produce, it is all here! I personally enjoy shopping to locale stores. I will definitely keep coming back even thought it’s quite a drive, it’s worth it.; Just leaving the store, I’m sad to say after 43 years of business, I won’t be returning. Mike Hennigan, the worst thing you could have done was install self checkouts. That made your staff lazy and your customer service poor. The last time I was sick with RSV and had to get emergency groceries. I was told to cash my full cart of groceries out myself, while your cashiers stood around and talked. Today, I went to the “CUSTOMER SERVICE” desk at 8pm and was told she was closed and I’d have to cash myself out. I handed her my items and will take my business elsewhere from now on. My father is 97 years old and I can’t imagine him cashing himself out with a cart full of groceries. I quit working there when I was 17 and I don’t need to play cashier again. How unfortunate!; I live in SE Onondaga County but always travel to Nichols for meats, deli items, seafood, and other needs. Their meats are far & away better than Tops, Wegmans, Price Chopper, etc. the employees are always friendly & courteous. Mr. Hennigan operates a great store!; Very good meat, watch for the 3-day specials, T, F, S, always good buys. polite cashiers.

Name: Super Y Grocery
Address: 7635 LA-26, Sugartown, LA 70662, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 5:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 5:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 5:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 5:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 5:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 7635 (street_number); Louisiana 26 (route); Sugartown (locality); Beauregard Parish (administrative_area_level_2); Louisiana (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 70662 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The cashier is always rude. Dont look like a deer in head lights because i come back in and call you out. I've ordered pizza there twice and twice it has been wrong. Same cashier. I don't know if the cook was aggravate with me or her at first but when I went back to pick up corrected pizza she was very nice. The first time I order pizza there, got there it was not correct, waited for remake, wait for it...that one also was messed up. Just kept that one.; It's I just a quick corner grocery gas station out in the country and they had link sandwiches ,chopped beef, hamburgers seemed clean; There are good and bad things going on at this store. You hardly ever see the same person helping you. They go through so many people. It was bad before the owner retired and gave it to his grandson, but now it is worse. There is a cook that sweats profusely that occasionally now works the front register. Who wants to see a cook come out of the kitchen dripping sweat.

You still can't get chicken fried for supper unless you have it fried before around 2:30 pm. or so. Who wants chicken that has been fried for around 3 hours before you eat it.

The workers used to know what customers wanted before they even walked through the door, but now they go through the employees so fast that no one gets to know the customers' wants or needs. The only good thing that I can tell that has happened is there is no hollering and cussing going on from old employees and guests .

The quality of the pizzas has  gone down also. We ordered several pepperoni pizzas, and NONE of them had more than 15 out of the 25 pieces of pepperoni that they should have on them. The "Lots of Meat" pizzas have anything but lots of meat. They are almost bare like the pepperoni pizzas are. The store charges more than the recommended price but gives you way less than what you pay for.

I hope things settle down and get somewhat back to being a place where I can bring my family to eat and not have to worry about if they are  sweating in/on my food; Great place to work with great co-workers. Employers treat you like family and really care about their employees.  As in alot of businesses these days, there has been alot of changes in employees, but you have to weed out the bad to get to the good. Staff is friendly and will go the extra mile to make sure customers are happy. Breakfast is now served all day along with the regular menu. You can call in orders now as early as 5am (Mon-Sat) and 7am on Sundays.; Gas is a little higher but it is available  has a nice staff and some good snack food to keep you going lots of free parking

Reviews:
pretty much everything is available in this store.  It's not a supermarket so the prices may be little higher. It has basic Indian pulses, cereals too; Edit: I appreciate the response and am understanding when businesses need to shorten their hours for a period of time, but indicated winter break hours on Google and front door of your store. Both places state till 12am. That's the most frustrating part.

I just recently moved on to campus and excited to have a convience store a minute walk from me. I was craving cereal and milk, well my boyfriend finished the milk so I needed to run to the store. I checked the closing time and was happy to see you guys close at 12am. It was 11:15pm when I left my apartment. Well you guys were not open. There was clearly still time for me and other customers to shop. I would have been more understanding if school wasn't in session.; If you’re on the SU campus and you need anything this is the place to go!; Clean and tidy. This is certainly not a supermarket, so it is a bit expensive. But when you want to eat ice cream and find that it's not in your refrigerator, and don't want to drive to the supermarket, then it becomes a good choice. In addition, if the opposite Chase Bank runs out of coins, I will come here to exchange quarters.; Great store! Excellent selection of beers and the owner is very nice and helpful. FAVORITE SPOT ON CAMPUS!

Reviews: One of my favorite grocery stores in Sioux City. I will make any and every excuse to get something from here if I know they have it, rather than stop at some of the grocery chains in-town. There is so much here and I always love trying new things! My favorite is their stock of interesting fruits that you can't find anywhere else. I don't think I walk out of this place without getting some new and interesting food or ingredient that I am excited to try out.; Staff and enviornment is so Respectful! Guy who helped me was so polite and helpful gave me tips on how to make sticky rice for the first time and get everything I needed for it. Thank you so much!; Best fresh produce ,sweet peas, Japanese sweet potatos are  My favorita  ! Great down town location.; This is an awesome little store. So many unique items to find. If you are making an Asian style recipe, this store will have your ingredients. They also have some house wares sort of stuff and I swear they have the largest selection of raw sea food to take home and cook. I love this place.; They have SO many things and very good prices! I was looking for two VERY specific brands of soy and fish sauces (a special type of a main brand), and not only did they have both in stock (and quite a few of them), but they were very helpful in helping me locate them on the shelves (they seriously have a wide variety of products!). I’ve been in many, many Asian markets all over the country before, and this market definitely rates up in the top five. :) I will most certainly be back!

Reviews:
I was looking for manti (Turkish ravioli) since my trip to Turkey last year.  I simply love it! but it had been difficult to find it.  Last week I was driving and suddenly saw this store!  I went into and found it!  I was so happy.  I was in a hurry, but I am planning come back and get more stuff, mainly cheese!; Update: it is still a delightful place to shop. It is fun to peruse the different types of teas and coffees and sweet treats and savory snacks.
It's always a treat to travel here and explore. I have given the mixed nuts in a can, Castania brand, and people love them!
Friendly  proprietor and staff. I will return!; We love Sheep Cheese( not FETA) and this is the place we are going, and yes we are driving 30 miles from Plattsmouth to get the delicious sheep cheese and other international grocery.; This is the only place I know that sells Barhi Dates when they are in season. If I lived closer, I would shop here often, but I live more than 20 minutes away.; Fun neighborhood grocery store perfect for small farms with in season produce (small scale). Awesome for those that cook Middle Eastern cuisine & easy grab and go for dinner and snacks. Helpful and kind! Thank you!!

Name: Baiz Fresh Foods
Address: 1858 W Baseline Rd, Mesa, AZ 85202, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews:
Baiz is a great middle eastern market in the East Valley. Its the size of a Basha’s and has a butcher
section, produce, small restaurant and lots of groceries. They have a lot of produce that is seasonal and not sold commonly in stores. Love getting the fresh bread and meat from the deal. My family loves the ground lamb and the Apple Barbican(alcohol free beer). We really like also getting a few dishes and have breakfast or lunch in the food area. It always is really good!; Good Mediterranean food, falafel, hummus, garlic sauce was good but not creamy. lots of dessert variety.; NO RETURNS AT ALL NO MATTER WHAT
I have changed my mind on the place. Shopping there has always been an experience, but now I am done with this place.
Baiz, you have lost a good customer.
I spent easily between $50 and $100 there every time I went shopping at Baiz.
No more. For a $5 purchase, due to NO RETURN. The jar of pickled turnips had lost its seal. This store does not stand behind its products.
I say, no thanks. I can buy these products elsewhere.
BAIZ takes no returns even with a receipt, I do not return, ever.
I’m only out $5, other customers lost a lot more money. 💰; I like their meat (especially the lamb meat) and I shop some of my cultural food from here. Different varieties!
It is also worth mentioning what happened to me few months ago, I dropped my wallet with ID card and credit cards at their parking lot. Someone (not sure who that person is, could be customer or employee) hand it over to the manager.
That parking lot looks sketchy but thankfully I got my wallet after driving home and coming back several hours later. Great people! Appreciate them- this comment is for Phoenix location; Today I was shopping at the store and I wanted some pomegranates and I picked up a couple pieces and I came back home and I was like let me try one of them. It was black and burned. It was broken. I don’t know what to say and it was too expensive for a couple of pieces I wish they could please make sure everything comes fresh because this is not fresh. This is basically for trash and I am mad that I wasted eight bucks on just three pieces of Pomegranatesoverall, I give the store a 10 out of 10 because he has every supplies you need in the country, but still a lot of stuff it’s expired.

Very unprofessional staff working in the kitchen, food is too salty [carne asada flour quesadilla], so much oils and grease and I literally can not believe it was $40 for a plate of carne asada quesadillas, el pastor burrito plate and a single tamale. Restrooms leaking, yes it's raining but seriously no signage to tell you their is wet floors in the restroom, or roof leakings...; 😃 quite expensive but good customer service wouldn’t recommend every day shopping but definitely a treat; This location is awesome it's clean smells good and is a awesome place to shop at I would recommend it to anyone I just was in this location and I love it every thing is easy to find and the employees are very friendly and the store is clean the isles are very open and plenty of room to move around I recommend their location to everyone !!!; Do not go there it’s full of rats. 🐀 big rats  running through the vegetables and fruits. Also they have everything over priced double check your recits because they have things on sale and you think you got it on sale and you got it at regular prices and they don’t give you the sales discount that they have it at. So make sure you double check  because you will over spend  here; We like going here because the bread is good however their service to pay is very slow.. only one person charges everyone who has to get anything from the bakery.. they also charge for the box to carry the bread, never had that happen in any store before..

I love this place. The selection of their noodles alone is worth a trip here. Everything from seafood, pre packaged food and all the fruits that you’ll be hard pressed to find in AZ. I always enjoy going here and getting some fun/delicious food and treats.; So many things you dont see anywhere else!
very organized and well stocked.
some areas have dirty floors and aisles can be too narrow.; Good southeastern Asian market in the desert.  Find most of the products here but not a complete list.  The fish and meat section are the stars of the market.  Great selection of fishes and meat that are mostly fresh.

There is plenty of parking, and there are different stores close by that a person can check out.; It has every Asian food possible. Fish selection is insane. Produce is more varied than regular market. I feel it could be a little cleaner. So much stuff it can be overwhelming but staff was very helpful.; Great place.  I purchased a Bonsai Tree and a Money Tree. Amazing items. Great Prices❤️

Name: El Super
Address: 3130 E Thomas Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85016, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Reviews:
Admittedly I'm not your biggest customer but I probably would have| bought something from the bakery had this experience gone differently.

I walked up to an employee near the entrance. "Do you share the restroom code or do you need to open the door yourself?" I despise having to inconvenience them.

He apparently couldn't understand so he deferred to his colleague nearby. So I repeated the question.

She said "There's a code on the door. You need to talk to a cashier." No duh.

I'm not jumping through the twelve hoops to get into the restroom. I refuse to be treated like an idiot. You lost me as a customer permanently at all locations.; Yes, I completely agree, the fruits and veggies are at a great price. However, the staff needs to either get some customer service training,and learn how to atleast smile. We never shop there and we decided to go and check it out. Spent a little over $100.00, but I can tell you that this business does not deserve my money, first and last time. But enter at your own risk.; The quality of the vegetables and fruits is outstanding at a reasonable price. I buy veggies for a week for less than $80. Plus they also have some of the Mexican soap and other Mexican item that you cannot find anywhere else. I never have a bad surprise when I am at the cash register. 👌; This lady at the carnicería was grabbing chicken and meat with the same gloves
the whole 25 minutes I was waiting I witnessed how bad she was doing
cross contamination all the way but it what’s worse, it’s that I think the manager was here also and didn’t say anything
and when I was my turn I was ready to ask her to change her gloves and maybe she saw me looking at her and finally changed gloves
Please don’t make people sick; Good prices but it's so slow.  15 people at one cashier at 650am. Then somebody finally comes to help and they take people from the END of the line!!! Some of us had been waiting 15 minutes because of a customer paying in $1s and doing several separate transactions for 2 full shopping carts. Tell the cashiers who open a new line to take from the next in line,  not the people who haven't even waited.  You had a lot of upset people and then you had an employee cut in line to buy themselves a drink.

Name: El Rancho Market IGA - Chandler AZ
Address: 1076 N Arizona Ave, Chandler, AZ 85225, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 1076 (street_number); North Arizona Avenue (route); Chandler (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85225 (postal_code); 6600 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
I wish that I could leave a rating of 3.5 stars instead of 3 stars.

This market is in an older shopping center/strip mall in Chandler. There are a lot of little stores and a couple of restaurants. The parking lot is on the smaller side and is usually busy, especially in front of this store.

They have a really good Mexican bakery and deli area. When you walk into the store, the bakery will be on your left and the sweet rolls/pan dulces will be straight ahead. If you follow around in that direction, you will see the deli and where they make their tortillas. It can get busy, especially on the weekends so you need to pay attention to your place in line. You usually have to pay for everything separately in each area, so if you buy something in the bakery, you will pay there. If you buy something in the deli area you will pay at their register. If you buy groceries, meat, and packaged goods, you will need to pay at one of the main cashiers on your way out.

It is a small grocery store that carries mostly Hispanic products. You can get some good deals on tortillas, meat, and produce. You can see their weekly ad online or sign-up for their ad to be sent to your email.

I usually go for their deli items like carnitas, roasted/grilled chicken, and for their fresh tortillas. They are open from 6am-9pm every day except some major holidays.; This review is of my recent visit to their deli and bakery (last Saturday).  It was a late afternoon visit and their hot foods in the kitchen looked fresh and there was plenty to choose from.  I ordered the red menudo and it was flavorful, savory, and a little spicy. 👍👍The bakery also had a good variety of fresh goodies.; I don't know why I keep going back to this place. Today was my last visit as I will not put up with their rude conduct.
I visited the food counter and ordered some Menudo for take out. As the girl at the register is handling my order, I asked if I could have bread instead of tortillas and she said no, those are for the restaurant. I jokingly said, well that's not fair and she responded with, if you don't like it go somewhere else.
I was pretty disappointed with her response. I did not say another word as she just handed me my receipt and ignored me, not even a thank you.

I don't expect any special treatment but at least the courtesy of saying thank you come again would be nice, needless to say I will not return again. This is not the first bad experience I've had at this store.; The prices are too high. Quality is great. Portion is small and extremely overpriced. When visiting expect to spend no less than $50. Bakery appears fresh, meat is fresh and clean.; We made a preorder birthday cake for our Daughter and it came out so cute. They added details and made the cake Girly. We will order from them again.

Name: Ricomini Bakery Rincon
Address: Carr. 115 km 12 4, Aguada, Rincón 00602, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: km 12 4 (subpremise); Carretera 115 (route); Aguada (locality); Pueblo (administrative_area_level_2); Rincón (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00602 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I stopped by at lunch to try their sandwiches. The place was empty and the service was excellent and fast. The food, though, was just average, hence the 3 stars.

I got the midnight sandwich and the pastrami with cabbage. The pork on the midnight was clearly leftover and reheated, which I'm fine with, when reheated properly. They should put it in a pan with either cooking juices or mojo and make the pork juicy again. Instead it was very dry and not at all tender. Really a disappointment.

The pastrami was much better, but also very dry. It had cabbage and cheese and I think tomato, but no sauce. I'm glad they used cabbage instead of coleslaw but they needed to replace the sauce of the coleslaw with something else. Thousand island dressing would've been perfect, taking it from a 5 to an 8.

I must say their bakery goods looked fantastic. So keep in mind this review is only for the two sandwiches I ordered. Perhaps I didn't order well, but I did ask for everything on the sandwiches.

Nothing was bad, just nothing was great either. My experience, very average.; The Best  coffee & pastries on this side of the Island, Rincon!! Love the almound cookies ❤️; Around noon on a Wednesday, we tried about 5 other places that said they were open in the area but were not when we arrived. But, we were very happy to end up here! Excellent sandwiches, perfect fresh French bread. We had the ricomni special & the Cuban. Highly recommend both. Before we got our sandwiches we had a cinnamon roll that was warmed up for us, one of the best we've ever had. Staff was friendly, helpful, and spoke some English.; Best fresh bread, awesome coffee and friendly staff all make this place worth visiting. Not to mention, the tasty variety of pasties to choose from. I had a cinnamon roll. Swing by if you can.; My wife and I went two different times on our trip to PR. The staff were all very helpful, kind and patient. The food was absolutely phenomenal, very fresh and flavorful too. If I was able I would rate this place a 6/5 for the experience, service, and great food!

Keep it up guys!

Reviews: This place has the best deli meats and deli service to match, in my opinion. They are the one's who take care of the active military,and veterans and our elders the right way at anytime,You can be overseas or in any 50 states and still place orders and know your groceries will be delivered in the most proper manner. And best of all their workers take the groceries inside your home so clients won't have to worry about having a hassle. Very much APPRECIATED.; We found everything we wanted. The prices seemed fair & many different brands to choose from. Store was clean & people were friendly & polite. Glad I went here instead of Walmart.; So far, Super Max of Puerto Rico has all of the boars Head  products if anyone is interested in this type of cold cut. Just go to the dely department and place your order and they also make sandwiches and serve foods that are the special of the day. Parking is for everyone. There are wheelchair ramps, parking and wheelchair accessible entrance, and bathrooms for both males and females. This establishment is Parr of a shopping center that includes other stores and restaurants; I love that superMax is close to my mom's house because when I visit I can still find products I get at my home. Reviews: Big and clean. Meat is inexpensive and fresh. I like shopping here and just noticed that there is a small post office here. How convenient!; I go here all the time.  They are close to the freeway and have a good seafood selection.  I have to give them 1 star for a bad experience.  After paying at the register and just 10 feet away from the counter and nowhere near the exit door, I heard a "Hey you! I need to check your receipt."  Turns out, it was the security guard yelling at me from 20-30 feet away.  He checked my receipt, and everything was good and let me go.  I felt the security guard was very rude for yelling out from that far away to check my receipt.  And he only checked my receipt and no one else.  Other grocery stores have a receipt checker at the door that checks everybody's purchase, and that's OK.  Shun Fat Westminster managers need to figure out better ways to make their customers feel valued and not treat them like thieves for simply buying seafood.; This market is huge! Really great selection of Asian groceries and produce. The store is very clean and also has a sushi stall as well as boba stand. Prices are fair and parking is very easy. I much prefer coming here as it’s less crowded than many of the other Asian grocery stores.; Very beautiful interior design, the seafood sections is large and they have a a large selection of fish to choose from! I highly recommend!; I kept spotting ads for salted egg noodles, which I’m obsessed with but can’t always find at restaurants. Turns out, Vifon sells the instant ones here, I didn’t even know about this store, but I ended up doing a full-on grocery run because it’s so well-stocked and pretty affordable, definitely worth checking out

Reviews:
Don’t go this place because they would charge more than you should pay if you didn’t pay attention to how their cashier is doing. I caught their cashier charged $19.99 for something I didn’t have in my cart today. After I pointed out, she had her manager to void the charge of $19.99. If I didn’t pay attention who would know how much she would have over charged me. This was a fraud and not sure if they have been doing this to other customers as well or not.; This is a truly beautiful sore! The produce area is amazing and has many different items from all over the world in addition to things like lettuces and tomatoes. The aisles have items you expect and very special choices for many different places. Everything is clean and well cared for and they have some very good sale prices; Be careful when you shop here. I bought 2 packs of LoMein and Chow Mein fresh noodles and a box of rambutans.
The noodles didn't have expiration dates on them. I thought they should be ok but within 2 days when I wanted to use them, they were moldy. I opened one and smelled mold and quickly checked the other pack and found the same thing.
The box of rambutans was $30. The top layer was filled with red fresh rambutans.  Upon opening the saran wrap, I found the bottom layers were black, moldy and rotten. I only ate about 7 good ones on the top. What a scam!
Upon calling the store and asking for a refund they said that fresh food doesn't come with guarantees. So they can continue to sell rotting food to unsuspecting customers and it's perfectly fine!!! What BS!!; Dont come here even if its for one item. Everything is expired or going bad. Place is dirty and stinks. Rude ass cashiers need to learn some manners and not slam my stuff or have an attitude problem.; We're so lucky to have such a great Asian food store! Always friendly, lots of great produce and frogs and such. Go in for the noodles, stay for the ong choy. *****

Reviews:
Just a little gallery. It's a bit of a craft shop. Actually it's more of a craft shop than a gallery. I have art on the wall at my house also.
And no you're not invited at my house; Such a cute store. I love the T’shirts and came home with artist (Brian) made desert glass earrings that are always complimented and a cool photograph that I love. Rich was very helpful in getting the earrings in when I was in town.; Absolutely phenomenal store. If you are a local, or a visitor- there is something here for you! From tshirts, to books, to guitar pedals that are all things desert - Very Very is the place to be! We love it here. Check it out!; Such a delight to have a new space open up in town that isn’t catering exclusively to spendy tourists. Artful postcards, stickers, local art, and I hear more community events are in the works for the patio space out back. This whole plaza is shaping up to be a great meeting place for locals (& still has excellent gifts for tourist who like spending less than $300 on a planter!) Such a great spot y’all!; Eclectic collection of great gifts and helpful team. I went in to get gifts for Xmas but ended up buying for myself as well. A shopping oasis in the desert!

Definitely worth the visit.; This is a great spot for anyone who's into vinyl. They have a wide variety of records, all reasonably priced and in solid condition. Steven was also super friendly and nice to chat with. I highly suggest making the trip if you're in the area.; This low key, record shop is a serious hidden gem of Twentynine Palms. Very knowledgeable about all genres and generations of vinal and accessories. Stop in and take a peek, just don't forget to wipe your feet! 🤘🏼; We stopped by to grab some vinyl to play at the airBnb and take home. Cool spot. Cool staff and live music in the back.

Name: SuperMex El Pueblo Market
Address: 720 N 20th Ave, Pasco, WA 99301, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:30 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
Speaking for white Americans, go here!! You’ll find something fun and new and all the staff treated us kindly even with our lack of Spanish familiarity.
Breads (pan) were excellent and cheap
Limes were 9 for $1!!!
So many good things for good prices!; It was a great place to buy all kinds of assorted foods, they have a small area where you can eat as well! I recommend if you need to buy something quick.; Every time I go to this place I have a very bad experience. My last visit I purchased a gallon of mill that had good expiration day but when I used it, it was bad, I was making jello and waist 4 package of it. When I try to get reimbursed they told me that they couldn't help me or reimburse my money. They're not very good with costumer service.; The music is sooo loud!!  The only reason I shop here,  is because my mom likes the fruit. Why the 2 stars....the cashiers are friendly.; I love this grocery store.  It's no frills with fantastic quality and prices on produce and is a great source for a variety of Mexican ingredients (cheeses, meats, crema, dried peppers, ect.)  The red and green sauces they sell here are DELICIOUS (if you like heat I should mention) and I always have at least one in my refrigerator because I use them so often and they pair well with so much.  They also have a great inexpensive eatery and fresh fruit/ juice stand, but be prepared for long lines because every time I come here they seem very  popular.

Name: Hannam Chain Super Market
Address: Los Coyotes Shopping Center, 5301 Beach Blvd, Buena Park, CA 90621, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:30 AM – 9:00 PM

Address Components: Los Coyotes Shopping Center (premise); 5301 (street_number); Beach Boulevard (route); Buena Park (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90621 (postal_code); 1231 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Purchased Apples but it's all rotten.
Complained to store manager and they said next time bring the knife check before purchase.... This place is joke.; Love the freshness and verity of produce . The prices are reasonable. I also love the ready prepared hot food. I am not korean, and i don't know how to cook Korea food. The ready prepared food gives me a chance to explore and try new delicious korean dishes.
I love the food samples that they give out. Also, the sample ladies are usually very kind. They help me in getting to know the products.  They give me recommendations on what to buy and what ingredients are needed to make some simple dishes.
I also appreciate the kitchen tools and utensils section.  It always have good quality reasonably prices products.
Also the little restaurants and shops inside the supermarket building.  This is a good place to grab a quick launch.  Or even grab prepared food and take it home to enjoy it.; Standard Korean market in Buena Park. Has just about everything you might be looking for when it comes to Korean food. Fruits and vegetables are good and fresh. There's a fish market with two or three Korean guys who seem to hate being there but are good about cleaning fish when asked. There's also a bakery and food court inside,  but I've never visited those areas. Not as modern looking as the HMart across the street, but it's a little bit cheaper for the same products. Some of the aisles are too narrow. Also, this place can get really busy on the weekends in the afternoon. There are a lot of parking spots.; I often bought mackerel from H Mart because it was good and cheap…

After purchasing 4, the price difference is almost double…

4 mackerels and a pair of sardines for $18.55. At the H Mart next door, 5 mackerels (free cleaning) for $12… .

The cost of cleaning fish should also be realistically very cheap... Is this how the service at large marts should be?

Why is the cost of fish preparation so expensive? Then customers will stop coming.

Isn't that too much?!

Everything else here is good, but the seafood section is too expensive.

It's convenient because there are all Korean food and ingredients, and it seems that a lot of foreign friends are coming these days.All sales prices have risen, so even if you buy a little, $100-2/300 is the basic. Koreans who go here should keep their conscience. Even though there is a cart gathering place, they should leave it anywhere and protect their national dignity.; Their CS is a total disappointment. Bought a box of cookie 2 days ago (imported from Korea, expire Dec 2024) and tasted totally stale and texture also off. I had this cookie 쿠크다스 since childhood and even bought few months ago without a problem, so I know how it tastes. Lady at CS claims no refund for an open item (I had one opened, tasted one out of 30 in the box). She said refund ok for food gone bad but this is not an applicable item lol. I do not know their definition of 'bad food' but clearly she was blaiming on my change in taste. I suggested they do QA for the current batch and the lady denied it since I was the first to bring up the issue with this item.  Poor reasoning overall and humiliating experience. They just lost their loyal customer of 4 years over a small box of cookies.

Name: Ralphs
Address: 1500 N Moorpark Rd, Thousand Oaks, CA 91360, USA

Reviews:
The service deli now compared to last year is absolutely amazing. Everything is fresh and ready to go. Before I would never find any fresh items, hardly sandwiches, never a choice of potato salads. Now when I go there’s always so many choices of potato salads, sandwiches, guacamole etc. I love it! The previous manager never took pride in his work or department. Every time I had a question I always felt pushed away. Now I don’t mind asking the new service deli manager questions. She’s nice and very customer friendly. Thank you management for picking the right one!; Organized and great service and was my 1st job at  16 exactly 20 years ago to the day; Clean and well stocked.  A little pricier than Albertsons.   A lot more than Wal-Mart.; Beyond terrible. Absolutely WORST customer service. If always having one cashier open to  force you to scan and bag your own groceries wasn't enough, they now hide the bags and you have to be chasing the employees to beg for one!!! And heavens forbid you catch one of their teenage "managers" at a bad time, and they spew rudeness at you.
I'm out!!!
After many years buying at Ralphs, I'll now commit to making 100% of all my purchases at Vons next door.; Decent grocery store just do not take cash back out there, they charge for it.  Never seen that at any other grocery store.

Name: El Super
Address: 3700 W McFadden Ave, Santa Ana, CA 92704, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 3700 (street_number); West McFadden Avenue (route); Riverview West (neighborhood); Santa Ana (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92704 (postal_code)
Reviews:
If you have a WIC card then go to El Super, items are tagged so you won’t guess and look at the app several times. Check out is brilliant so far the only store I could modify and return items without any problems.
Highly recommend 👍🏾; Two weeks ago I bought chicken and it came out smelly and my daughter bought beef and it was packaged and under the meat there was fly and it is not the first time that the chicken comes out smelly. They have very bad service.; I went to check the pineapples they all had mold why would have have that on the shelf to sell . I asked the produce guy he said that's all they have. Not happy every time I go the fruit is bad . All the cashiers don't greet you at all; Always very crowded, outside in the parking lot AND inside the store. Most times I've been there the lines are super long (especially on Wednesdays) and they usually only have like 2 cashiers, one being an express lane. The cashiers are sometimes rude - YOU greet them and they either ignore you or respond all dry.

I was also harassed by their on-site "security " guard, JR, he followed me to my vehicle and proceeded to offer me outings that were not requested. In another occasion, I saw this same security guard (JR) and an older gentleman who was the cart attendant- being racist and aggressive. A woman who may have been Vietnamese asked the cart attendant if he could help her with her groceries and he said "no because you no pay " meaning she wasn't going to tip him (I assume). A bystander instead took it upon himself to help the woman load her groceries and when the cart attendant and JR the security saw the man (Hispanic) doing that they started talking bad to him to the point where JR implied he wanted to fight.

This store is all over the place with these outside and inside employees. I don't even think management does anything about it either since it's not the 1st time employees have been reported.; This grocery store was so clean and tidy. Fresh produce with great price.

Name: Northgate Market
Address: 831 N Hacienda Blvd, La Puente, CA 91744, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 831 (street_number); North Hacienda Boulevard (route); La Puente (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91744 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I purchased a chicken combo plate and was very disappointed. The chicken looked good but was raw in the middle I was trying to get my money back but they wouldn't let me. I am very displeased.; I was in the furthest lane to the right looking out into the parking lot, two people were in front of me. A lady and a man with his daughter.  The cashier spoke to both in Spanish and also asked  them if they wanted a bag, she also helped them both bagging  thier items. I was next, she looked me over and soke in English and later asked if I wanted a bag, I said yes, she pointed at a group  of bags at the end of the counter, I looked back at her with a bit of shock, she then reached for a bundle of bags as I was about to bag my own items, pulled one out, stuck one of my items in it handed me the receipt and began to ring someone else before I could finish.
I felt like asking her " am I  too white for you?" Never have I  been treated  like that in a Spanish store in my life. To answer  your question,  yes I'm Hispanic this happened at Northgate 06  08.08.24. 14:04:02; My go to Latin grocery store has to be Northgate Market. I’ve been shopping here for over a decade. You can find great prices, quality produce and meats. They have aguas frescas, a guacamole station, bakery and more. They go all out for the holidays and offer specialty meats, dried fruits, tamale husks, etc! Everyone there is always very friendly and helpful.; Met the Store Manager very nice person. Informed her that she had a Very Clean Store  that was stocked well.
Great Customer Service.; Found everything I needed.  Plenty of parking, prices are very competitive. Found items other stores didn't have.

Very clean store and the cashier has a very welcoming attitude we love coming here and get greeted by staff like Rickey; Man they have everything here. Carfull if you come during rush hour this place is no joke. I would say between 630and 8pm this place is pretty packed and half of the register people are great and half are not. So that means if you choose the wrong line your going to be mad. Once your a regular you will understand who knows what they are doing vs the slow pokes. I still really love this market. They should probably beef up the staff. But the store has everything you need. Let me round them off like a revolver.

This market has a lot going on and the produce options are pretty great I come here for fruit mostly and I will keep coming back as long as they keep them deals coming. The meat selection today was pretty great. If your buying a meat or something that was on the add I would recommend calling in advance. Always calm in advance if you trying to get alot of something. The price here is usually better then most places. Bulk food items are available here. I recommend stocking up on can food prices here . I think they are hiring right now too. They really just need to work on keeping the lines down or at least making sure they got the best on register.; The bakery! I was SOOOO impressed. This looked like a high end stand alone bakery... but located in a grocery store?! They put all other grocery store bakeries to shame!
The produce was incredibly fresh. This is a nice store.; Elma, Elmo, Alma whatever her name was in hot foods! Ridiculous customer service, doesn’t know any manners. The meat said it was not expired which makes me think their product expires and they repackage the food so customers think it is still good.; Good grocery store. Budget pricing. Has a Wells Fargo Bank inside. Plus a loan office, Oportun. Super long lines for the customer service section, 99¢ money orders. And bank line super long too... But overall a good place to shop and get multiple things done. Also have a Coinstar machine, Rugdoctor rental, Lottery tickets, Redbox Movie Rental.; Great selection of ready-to-heat meals, stuffed chiles, enchiladas and much more.; This Superior is bigger and better equipped than the one on Cesar Chavez.; Was looking for Wells Fargo Bank and it is inside Superior Market,  they should have a Wells Fargo sign outside, for we can actually know that it's in there. I went inside to make a purchase and get cash back since I couldn't find the bank 😁. And there it was as soon as we entered 😅.

Reviews: Superior grocers feels more like a Mexican/Hispanic store. The interior is a little dirty and some items aren’t very well stocked. I also got the feeling that the workers there are grumpy and not willing to help. I guess the only thing superior about this market are the prices, otherewise I don’t think I’ll come back.; You can buy the freshest vegetables here. I love the bakery department. The staff are always friendly. The store is always orderly the floor is always clean and there's always a fast check out. Don't forget to download the superior app to get discounts and loyalty points!; Pretty much a grocery store but with a lot of different mexican bakery goods.; I'm impressed by how far along some of these stores have come.  I'm glad I've given them another chance.  A few years back, the whole experience was usually negative, but I must say they are definitely being managed much better now in days. A couple more cashiers open during peek hrs would be great. (Around the time the kids are leaving school); I find that Superior Grocers are far more friendly and helpful than their competitors, right across the street El Super. Thank you for the great products and customer service.

Name: Walmart Neighborhood Market
Address: 1425 N Hacienda Blvd, La Puente, CA 91744, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 1425 (street_number); North Hacienda Boulevard (route); La Puente (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91744 (postal_code)
Reviews:
It was okay this has to be the smallest Walmart I have ever been into there was a good selection of fruits and vegetables but a lot of the shelves were empty I was able to find everything that I went in there for so I didn't really have a problem. I'm probably not going to ever go back to this Walmart again it was just a one-time thing cuz I needed a few things and it was the closest Walmart near by. but it's not a bad store.; This specific Walmart neighborhood market in La Puente is very close to me and that’s what makes it convenient for me and my family. Always has what we need and the employees on the floor and standing by the self-checkout are always helpful and nice. I’m not going to stop going here. But tell me why every time I’m by the vitamins/medicine isle, I can hear employees cussing and being super loud, by where I assume is their break room? It’s usually young guys. It’s super uncomfortable especially when I’m with my kids. I was going to complain to a woman employee once but I was embarrassed to sound like a Karen or just an older person complaining about kids; but also I was embarrassed for her like these are her co- workers. I love this convenient place to go and get last minute dinner items but I just wish it was a more comfortable experience.; I had an exceptional experience at Walmart thanks to Cid! I was looking for a chicken tenderizer hammer, but couldn't find any on the shelves. Cid stepped in and went above and beyond to help me out. He checked his device and discovered that there was a shipment of the product. Without hesitation, he went to the back, unboxed the item, and brought it out for me. His willingness to assist and dedication to customer satisfaction truly impressed me. I'm grateful for his outstanding service and couldn't be happier with my shopping experience. Thank you, Cid, for your exceptional service!; I always come here because its convenient and is small enough to find the items I need unlike the large super centers. Quick in and out. Good selection; MADI is always a bright spot during my La Puente store visits. Even when things are stressful in the store, you can count on her to not show it.

Always located at the front entrance where she can easily be seen; Madi can be found front and center, easily accessible to answer any questions or just to keep the flow of pedestrian traffic moving and the bad guys away.

She's exceptionally good at what she does and she knows the store like the back of her hand. Pleasant and welcoming, yet forthright in taking care of the necessary business.

She's a true example of what it looks like to do a job well and treat people with decency and respect while doing it.

Way to go Walmart for having her as part of your team!!!

Good customer & always well stocked.; If you need very basic groceries, this might be the place for you. It's not a supermarket by any stretch of the imagination. In reality, it's more of a mini mart. They have as much variety as you can have in a place this size. Think: Pueblito.
Update: They are renovating by increasing the space by probably 50%. Let's see what happens.; Loved this supermarket, I wish we had one like this in Moca. I couldn't believe they had Boar's Head deli products. Reminded me of the delis in nyc . Great assortment of everything.; Too cramped. Isles are too small. Selection is smaller than regular pueblo.; Honestly speaking, I did find some products I was looking for and good prices, but Pueblo also lack on some other products that I was not able to find there. It really needs a variety of certain things that way one can do their whole groceries in one place and not have to go elsewhere. I also want to point out that there was another customer complaining about the same issue. Overall I am pleased with what I was able to get. Thank you for your services.

Name: Supermercados Agranel Aguada
Address: PR-115, Aguada, 00602, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: Puerto Rico 115 (route); Aguada (locality); Guayabo (administrative_area_level_2); Aguada (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00602 (postal_code)
Reviews: The worst of all the Econo locations! The manager frequently closes the store 2-3 hours before the posted time. Very inconvenient not to mention that parking is a nightmare. It’s difficult even just to drive by the store because of all the shoppers out in the middle of the road. It’s very small and not very well maintained.; Terrible management. I Arrived at 8:20 pm and at 8:40 pm they were turning the lights off and waiting for me at the cash register.  Closing time is at 9:00 pm.  In any normal supermarket they wait for you until you are finished purchasing your groceries.  Since it was dark, I stop collecting things and went straight for the cash register.  At the cash register I paid for everything I got.  I paid for the food with the food assistance money (food stamps).  Then I paid 6.35 for beer with a debit card.  The lady at the cash register tried to charge me for the beer again, because they are not supposed to put beer and food on the same purchase ticket.  The cash register terminal separates food, from anything else that is not food automatically.  I asked the lady why was she charging me for the beer twice? She answered me, that I had not paid for it it yet.  I asked her, then why did I pay you 6.35 right now?  She very unfriendly told me, that she did not know, that I have to look it up in the ticket that she gave me.  I looked it up, and in fact she had already charge me for the beer when I payed with the debit card.  Even showing her, she denied doing that and wanted to charge me for the beer separately in another ticket, thus making me pay for it twice.  Another employee had to come and confirm that in fact she charged me for the beer.  To finish with the story, the employees were very unfriendly, except for the man that show me to the rest room, everybody else were unprofessional.  They rounded up around me like if I was a thief, and they were just in a rush to get out of there.  They did close exactly at 9:00pm after chasing me out the door, not having the least consideration for doing business with me.  If you have a choice, do not go there.  Econo Aguada is probably the last supermarket that you want to go.  Any other supermarket, Selectos for example, will give you better customer service.; A lot of supermarket options to buy at a nice price. Is very clean and very well organized.; This place is cool got majority of things I needed for a smaller place. But parking is tough. Park on the side streets. It’s quicker.; Small place but they are nice and there meat selection is small but fresh and there vegetables.

Reviews:
After hitting the Survivor Beach hike close by (amazing hike by the way), I was dying for some lunch and coffee. Luckily this place had exactly what I needed. I went with the Ramey Special sandwich and my girlfriend got the All Star. We split them and they both were insanely good. The bread was maybe one of the highlights… so fresh and flavorful. Coffee was great too!; The food was very good, the area was very clean but the atendant was not  friendly. This was around 3: 00 pm... close to closing time.  Overall i recommend this place and i think you should raise your employees salary.; The guy that attended us at Ramey Bakery is straight to the point, but a smile is helpful. Coffee & Quesito bakery item was good. We had a Tripleta sandwich- the meat was fresh sandwich was good. If you are ever at CESCO or this plaza this would be an ideal place to eat. They have good prices, the place is 🧼 clean.; Visited by today.  Servers give you an annoying look and ignore you.  Have been to many bakerys in the area, that have much much better service.; Situated only few minutes away from hotel that I stayed.

Had breakfast for two days there because wanted to support local business during this difficult time due Covid-19.

Very reasonably priced meals with friendly local owner. As a picture shown, really nice place to feel the local Puerto Rican atmosphere with good meals !

I will surly come back again for “Big Breakfast”.

Gracious !!

Reviews:
Really liked this store for sure. It has something for everyone with their little individual shops. They have from handicraft articles to a food restaurant.
Prices on these little shops were ok, customer service was good too. Only thing was that there is not a complete grocery store, this area was pretty small.One thing that we experienced was that when we asked for help about finding an item the young lady ignored us and kept walking away, I walked behind her for mostly a whole aisle calling for her attention and she never turned around.  I just hope their customer service gets better.; I absolutely "LOVE" this "GEM" of a market! It is like visiting a little Mexican town at my beloved Mexico! You will find all sorts of authentic breads, gello, fruits, and other goodies! The authentic Mexican dishes are so tasty! They have live music every Sunday as well. Bring the whole family, and you will enjoy every minute. I wish we had a market such as this one closer to home. The drive it definitely worth it! Huntington Beach is only a few minutes away.💗; I was visiting relatives and they decided to take me here, foodie that I am. Lol.  This place was phenomenal!! The food the fresh vegetables and fruits. Fresh guacamole! To die for!! Don't even get me started on the Pastries they have. If I lived here, I would do my grocery shopping here at least once a week and be showing up for lunch or dinner more often than that. Great atmosphere and friendly staff.; Absolutely stunning and authentic Mexican-American market in the heart of Costa Mesa! You can find absolutely anything here, especially your favorite Mexican staples and any ingredient you can imagine to make your favorite Mexican cuisine. The restaurants are incredible and the staff unbelievably accommodating. Not to be missed!; This is our first time at this market. A couple of golf buddies were raving about it, and now I see why. It's amazing—so many places to eat, drink, and shop, plus a great Mexican restaurant. We'll definitely be back often.

Address: 2600 W Victory Blvd, Burbank, CA 91505, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Saturday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Address Components: 2600 (street_number); West Victory Boulevard (route); Burbank (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91505 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Ralph's, Sunday I came here to Ralph's to buy my daddy some flowers 💐 for his 🪦 gravesite at Pierce Brothers Valhalla as I have done plenty times before & the employee's they are always so helpful & the store is always so clean! Thank You & ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐'s; 2600 Victory...Frustration personified. 10:30 am on a Saturday 8/17/24 and only two checkouts open. Had to wait at least ten minutes in line...couldn't use self-checkout since I needed change. Was over-charged on a sale item and when I asked for a manager to correct it she had just come in and told me to wait while she clocked in. Imagine...no manager until 10:45am. Then she told me that I had to go to a cashier for as refund...I was not going to go through that ordeal again. Fortunately one of the baggers was standing close by and opened a register for me. His name is Eddie and he was the only one that showed any concerns. He was bagging, explaining things and helping a person in front of me who was a tourist, showed me where the  manager should be, and, as said, opened a register to correct the price, applying a credit on my card.
Someone from corporate should come up on a Saturday and make sure there is a manager on duty, have enough checkouts open, and find out why they wait until busy times to start re-stocking shelves, thereby blocking the aisles.; Edit: This store is no longer listed here correctly, maybe because it gets so many bad reviews (?). It's called home and the address is not correct. The Ralph's is at 2500 W. Victory Blvd. It's not at the current listed address. I'm not sure why this particular Ralph's attracts so many homeless and transient people. But it does. Seems much worse since Covid. Yesterday, while I was scanning my items at self-checkout, a very homeless looking woman at the next scanner asked me for money. Ralph's, why is this store so completely messed up? Do you want to respond to this review and explain that to us?

Older review: The prices on many items are out of control. They want $4.50 for 6 Kaiser rolls that used to cost $3. A small sour dough bolle is $6. I could go on and on with what I saw today. It’s now cheaper to shop at Whole Foods. The Kroger corporation is pillaging the public. It’s a disgrace, really. We customers, who made this company a success, are being thanked this way. On top of that, they are getting rid of more workers. They have just added these fancy new check out systems with conveyors. You scan your item, put them on the belt and they go to the bagging end. You pay and then you move down to bag your items. While you’re doing so, the person behind you begins to scan theirs and their items come and mix with yours while you’re trying to bag them. It’s the dumbest invention I’ve ever seen. The US airlines managed to make flying a really horrible annoying experience. I didn’t think a supermarket could pull that off. I guess I was wrong. It’s really sad because I’ve shopped at this supermarket for many many years. Not anymore.; In my 60 years of living I've seen grocery stores give deals for customers just for walking in their door. It used to be that stores thought All customers that take the time to drive to their store and walk in the door should be considered a valued customer.  Then stores decided to make us give them our addresses and emails to get those deals. We now had to start using their card to receive deals, no more valued customers unless you give up your mailing addresses. Fine, we did that. NOW you can't just show your Ralph's card or just be a customer walking in the door. Ralph's now advertises deals stating...digital CARD. The word digital is much smaller than the word CARD giving customers that didn't bring their glasses and/or didn't see the smaller word "digital" the impression they can use their Ralph's card for the deal. I mean, it's not even a Card so why is it advertised as a digital CARD?!?! To Trick Us! Why can't I get these deals with my Ralph's card like we used to? This just makes the CARD obsolete. Probably why they don't have them any more. This type of advertising affects mainly the elderly who need glasses to see that tiny lettering, it's hard to see on purpose, just rushing though the store can cause one to not notice the word digital. it's such a crappy trick that billion dollar corporations pull all the time on everyone especially the elderly! The elderly don't always have the transportation to return those items. Not everyone has space on their phone or even has a phone to download apps. Not everyone has a computer or iPhone and are able to easily go online to join Ralph's website and scroll through coupons. Even if Ralph's advertising was readable why are these grocery stores making their customers waste OUR valuable time by making US download an app? Or making us sign up online then making us scroll through coupons that we then have to download or something something in order to receive a savings while I'm already there shopping?! It's a complete waste of MY time. Aldi's, Trader Joes and Costco are so much better. I get the deals and I'm considered valued just for walking in the door. No jumping though hoops just for a simple deal. Trader Joe's, Aldi's and Costcos produce tastes so much better than Ralphs any way. So Ralphs, Stop tricking customers into paying 200% more for a product. Stop tricking them into paying that jacked up price. I'm returning my produce that should have cost me $10.00 but instead you charged me $30 dollars all because I didn't download a digital coupon of which I had no clue what that meant until I got home and had to research it. Because I have to waste my time returning this over priced produce I will never be returning to Ralphs. It's disgusting and should be criminal when big billion dollar corporations use deceitful advertising to get those billions. Especially when it's on the backs or should I say from the banks of the elderly and it affects them the most. If I could give negative stars I would. There's no reason but greed for the pillaging.; Burbank is having three Ralph..... I think this is the best in terms of huge stocks.....
Very nice and clean, well maintained.... stuffs are very friendly.....

Huge parking outside.... Star bucks and US bank counter is inside....

Plenty of stocks on Dairy , Meats, Bakery, Fruits,  Frozen sections, Vegetables,  liquors everything..

Most importantly wine section is excellent 😊😊

Very small store won't be going back terrible experience.; Great store, has everything you need, reasonably priced & friendly service!; This store is actually good for there pruces the reason 4 the one someone took a basket from there abonded in a alley and no one wont pick it up; So I came here to buy a few things, sandwich cheese, R.C. cola, and turkey breast slices.. and knew I had enough.. but when the cashier paisa lady rang me up, I seen that she was charging me 1.79 when the sign clearly said .99 , when I told her that to do please do a price check, she stood quite and said nothing so then I talked to her in Spanish and still no response so then I told her why is she charging me 1.79 .. she said cause of taxes lol.. .99 + .10 crv and tax soda should be 1.29 not 1.79.. and when I told her that she still would say anything so then another cashier came and gave her a barcode not to fix the price but to take off the item.. I told her no did you not hear what I requested.. I want the item still and you need to fix the price.. she never acknowledged us and never tried to make things right .. the name on the receipt says A. PRADO. the only thing she did tell us is have a nice day and I hope you like the security help. Once I talked to the manager.  He was backing her up .  Didn't want to listen to what we said, cutting us off when we were talking and tried to tell us that they have specials when you buy 3 of them.. well sign the sign did not say that and I showed it to him and said oh we made a mistake.. you damn sure you did.. I'll never go back here again and hope weights and measures does their job.. they like to rob people with there false advertisements.. shame on them .. their customer service sux!! I rather go to the one on 1st and bandini... never had issues there..; 3:12 pm Sun 22 Oct. It was a "Superior Grocers" and the $2 Rockstar beverage was a good price.

Address: 5V33+52Q, PR-343, Hormigueros, 00660, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 5V33+52Q (plus_code); Puerto Rico 343 (route); Hormigueros (locality); Guanajibo (administrative_area_level_2); Hormigueros (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00660 (postal_code)
Reviews: Been our go to for the last year.  Today, the young man who has been bagging groceries for my Wife, put the one Dozen Eggs...$3.99 not cheap, on top of Cart and upon exiting the Store, they fell and all broke.  Seen by Security Guard saw it...but after unpacking the Cart and returning to ask for a Replacement dozen, it all went bad.  Wife is from Hormigueros and NYC so she expected some customer service.  Nope, the Bagger boy took   eggs and receipt to MGR ON DUTY who said because it happened outside, she needs the Owners approval.  Mr. Velez...about 90 yrs old came to handle the situation.  He said something like nothing I can do because it happened outside store.  Wife said I know it happened outside store, but your Employee packed the Cart.  He was Adamant, not my problemo.  Wife explained, I just spent $173 plus and spend $800 a month here.  And he said something like...how do I know that you didn't drop them. I.e. my fault.  Wife asked...R u calling me a Liar?  Sir, don't you know I am the Customer and the Customer is always right? Owner says.. It's not like the Eggs are 5 cents, who is going to pay for them?  I have to Fire the kid now. Sir, I am on Social security and worked very hard for my money.  Now you are calling me a liar and a thief. I am a Child of God. Don't you have a damaged goods margin.  He said I don't need your business and you are no longer welcome here...So, after like 20 minutes wait, the gal came and gave a Dozen eggs.  I was very unpleasant and unprofessional, although we like the Grandkids who normally assist us, the old man is not in touch with reality.  They are losing about 9-10k in Sales a year over a bad customer service interaction.  Really sad... especially if he fires the bag boy.  Shop at your own Risk .. Caveat Emptor!!; Every shopping trip here is a great experience.  I am able to find what I need and the prices are really great. The kindness of the cashiers at checkout really make it 5 stars for me.; Best fresh meats. Fresh Churrascos...Good prices and variety.  Hope it had a little more space, but it has been nice to be in  and out quickly with most of the stuff I wanted at good or the best prices around.; Excellent cuts on beef and pork. Has a butcher shop for you to order. Good prices compare to other outlets. Good service. Good parking.; Rearranged store ailses. Store seems bigger, cleaner, and products better placed. Their meat department for the most part has fresh products. They need to bring in more fresh vegetable varities.

Reviews:
One of the best places to go in all of Santurce , el Capitolio de madre soltera , the best store in the world. The food is cheap and good and the line is long. The sell liquor and they have a Gaby’s donut and a Panda Express; Stop by to grab some sandwiches and Pedro who took our order was wonderful. You find everything here. Plenty of parking. Highly recommended.; The Walmart  of Kennedy avenue near Parada 18 is at a great point near San Juan Bay, Dock " Los Muelles".  Store offers a free parking lot in multiple levels. The first two floors are the stores and cafeteria zone. As a great department store, you may find anything looking for. My favorite days to lunch are Sundays after church with friend.
Elevator service available. Suggestion: should be an excellent idea store to keep the stair open to folks who love fitness and can walk up to parking.; On a visit to Puerto Rico.. Needed a few things fast and figured Walmart was the best option.. I had never seen a Walmart that looked like this in the states.. No huge building and parking lot that takes up 20 acres!  There was a parking garage and elevators.. as the store had several floors you had to wait in line with shopping carts to get on the elevator to go back to parking garage.. It was kinda cool, honestly.. No loading car in pouring rain or in parking lot where the concrete is 200 degrees.. good job San Juan Walmart!  Bring this design back to Florida!; Carts sliding, too long of a line to get into an elevator just insane, Walmart can do way better in Puerto Rico especially for all us tourists.

Reviews: Been shopping here for 9 years. They have everything. Wonderful family run market. If there’s something you need and they don’t carry it, just tell them. They’ll get jt. So thankful to have this on my corner!; This is the best place to go to on Ashford Ave for their amazing prices. Don’t bother going to Walgreens or CVS first unless this place doesn’t have what you need. I bought a couple drinks and 3-4 snack and my total was $5!!! I was shocked as I was paying so much in this tourist area on foods and needs. I wish I walked in to this lovely store on my first day of my vacation; Not a bad little shop to grab a few things you need for dinner.; We stopped here just to check it out. Was surprised at the variety of fresh food and daily necessities they had. We picked up some cat food for the many cats we see, conditioner and drinks. Inexpensive.; I bypassed the expensive fresh market and came here daily while staying nearby. The thick sliced fresh watermelon and mangoes were staples in my mini fridge in the condo. Wonderful store with everything you'd need to supplement condado restaurants.

Name: La Hacienda de Altamira
Address: 1905 Av. Jesús T. Piñero, San Juan, 00920, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Vicinity: 1905 Avenida Jesús T. Piñero, San Juan
Address Components: 1905 (street_number); Avenida Jesús T. Piñero (route); Gobernador Piñero (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Gobernador Piñero (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00920 (postal_code)
Reviews:
La Hacienda de Altamira isn't just a culinary destination for dining—it’s also a haven for food enthusiasts looking to bring gourmet flavors into their own kitchens. The fine food store offers an impressive selection of high-quality products that reflect the same commitment to excellence found in their restaurant.

From expertly aged prime cuts of beef to artisanal cheeses, every product at La Hacienda de Altamira’s store is carefully curated. Their selection of meats is particularly noteworthy, offering the same top-tier cuts that diners enjoy, but for you to prepare and savor at home. The staff is knowledgeable and eager to assist, offering cooking tips and helping you choose the best ingredients for your meal.

The store's layout is inviting and easy to navigate, with everything beautifully displayed. It's clear that La Hacienda de Altamira takes great pride in offering only the best to its customers, making every visit a delightful experience for food lovers.

For those who appreciate fine ingredients and gourmet products, La Hacienda de Altamira’s fine food store is a must-visit. Whether you're preparing for a special occasion or just looking for something extraordinary to bring home, this store has everything you need to create a memorable meal.; Wow, it was a super clean store and very professional staff. First time here, and I am so glad to have discovered this store here in PR.; So good, food, service and 3 leches and others goodies.; I bought a hot chai late first the guy didn't even stir the milk,it didn't even tested like chai .WILL NOT GO BACK; The place is elegant, yet surprisingly smaller than what it looks from the outside. It's nice if you're looking for gourmet stuff; but it's gonna hurt where you don't like it to hurt. I may have found the birthday cake I was looking for; but overall, I thought it would've had more variety. It may be great for the Real Housewives of Guaynabo City, but the rest of us, normal people who live and breathe in the real world, should stick with the supermarket across the street.
