Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: 7730 (street_number); Hazard Center Drive (route); Mission Valley (neighborhood); San Diego (locality); San Diego County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92108 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I like shopping here. Prices are great here compared to the other major grocers we have here in town. Great selections of both produce and meats. Almost never have to wait in line. The staff I have encountered have always been friendly. A plus here is to keep your receipts when you leave. There's always a great coupon on the back. It's for Jack in the Box. Purchase a large drink and get a free Jumbo Jack. The location this is for is the one in the parking lot. So it's a win win. Get great shopping at Food 4 Less, then go to Jack in the Box and have a great lunch before going home.; Convenient location with reasonable affordability for the Fashion/Mission Valley area. Early open hours. Easy access restrooms near the front. Neat. Friendly staff. Well planned self check out system.; The store is very organized. I enjoyed my shopping here. They have the quality stuffs at a very low price. Plus, the staffs are very friendly and helpful.; You can walk around the store for 20 minutes looking for a certain product and not find an employee who can help you. The security guard won't let you go inside with your backpack and asks you to leave it at the front door. Is it okay to consider every visitor with a backpack a criminal?; It's a quick place to shop closes enough to do you're 1to3daya
Shopping.

Name: Ensenada Markets
Address: 1827 W La Palma Ave, Anaheim, CA 92801, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 1827 (street_number); West La Palma Avenue (route); Northwest Anaheim (neighborhood); Anaheim (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92801 (postal_code); 3533 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
I LOVE bringing my family to eat here. We've been doing so for about 5yrs and the food is always great! Well portioned, perfectly seasoned and the nopales so delicious. The staff is always busy doing something and it's hard to have a conversation with them but it is understandable because they have to remember many orders and concentrate so they don't mess up anyone's order. When I do get to have a conversation,  they are very fun and friendly!
You can either get an horchata or jamaica premade cup at the register or on the left side of the store, you can choose the fruit you like and have a fresh water made right there while you wait for your food. It usually takes 30 mins for each order to be made since most are/have HANDMADE tortillas, sopes, huaraches, etc
If you are in a hurry for pick up, I suggest you order at least 20 mins ahead of time BUT don't take 30mins-1 hr to get there and expect to have hot food waiting for you
This is an AUTHENTIC MEXICAN FOOD restaurant so come in with patience and enough time to wait for your food
You won't be disappointed if you come in with a positive attitude 😁; Food is always amazing it really helps if you calling your order if you're taking takeout The staff is always so nice and very respectful food does not disappoint always gives you that homemade feeling; Other times they put avocado on my quesadilla this time not very good only like a 🍒 of avocado; Wouldn't go there at all, I ordered a plate of chicken enchiladas and it took them like 40 minutes. The worst thing is there was no wait 🤦🏾; The chicken is so good from here! I highly recommend the chicken Huaraches or tacos. Very filling and the price isn't too bad. When they're busy it could seem like the workers are rude, but they're just trying to be efficient. Highly recommend.

Reviews: Has a wide variety of products. A perfect go to place for last minute grocery shopping.; This little super market has a few food, drink, and snack options. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were able to grab a few lunchables before heading out on the water for our tour of the mangroves and bio bay. This is a small market in a small town and some of the items were very close to their best by dates. I would recommend double checking the best by date on any items you pick up.; I've been an M&M customer, both the supermarket and bakery, for more than 15 years. It is the perfect small supermarket for Parguera. You can probably find everything you need from food, drinks (including libations), snacks, paper products, and even some plumbing and automotive supplies. Great staff also.; Decent option right in the middle of town for some groceries and basics. Not a crazy selection, but they normally have what you need for this area. They carry a small selection of craft beer, have a wine "cellar", and have some basic liquors.; Delicious bakery and local Puerto Rican breakfast and food. They are very friendly and super clean.

Reviews:
We were so relieved to have found this market after experiencing such disappointment in the quality of the fruits and vegetables at the supermarket. The prices were reasonable and the variety was impressive. Not everything was local, but most was.

The meat shop had some local meats but the fish is imported from India.; Love this place. I get my medicine from here. Ginger, cucumbers, beets, and coconut candies. Yummmm.; Authentic market, takes card, ATH, and cash. I speak limited Spanish but vendors know english. I always come here before I go do my grocery store run- it’s cheaper and of the same quality as the store. Consistently have the same types of fruits and vegetables. Also has some interesting fruits that the grocery store doesn’t usually have.; Always find something to your like.; Fresh fruits, vegetables, refreshments, carnicería (meat market), and a pollera (fresh chickens) all in one place. If your looking for candles, incense, handmade soaps, or any type of religious items there are 2 bodegas above the plaza. Very friendly and helpful owners & employees.

This is definitely a very popular place to shop.  Plenty of selection with good prices.  This place is packed on the weekends, too.  The parking lot always seems to be full, so you might want to consider shopping here during the rest of the week to avoid the crowds.; Walmart is Walmart and I may be crazy but I think this may be the biggest one yet. Probably encompasses two zip codes. I’m talking HUGE and endless. But surprisingly neat and well organized. Whoever manages this location deserves a promotion. Place is veritably spotless, even though there are a couple thousand shoppers wreaking havoc at any given time. Also, bathrooms in front and back. Muy bueno!; To start I regularly order pick up from Walmart and everything is normally done but today drew that line for me when I got meat that was packed in June! And expired in July this is beyond disgusting and I will not be buying meat from here again and don’t encourage people to either, your staff clearly doesn’t care if people get sick from it not being properly rotated and more then likely I will not be back either , I also called to see if I could be refunded and they said to bring it back that’s ridiculous that I have to do that and waste more gas for something they couldn’t get right the first time.; This store its full of wild Birds inside the Store... Yes  BIRDS...
the bad thing its, their employees does not care, the feces are all over the floor, in some food items, everywhere. I tell the employees about it,  their awnser was, -"We tell management but they don't care. It's much worse in the morning. We try to clean up as much as we can. But when he saw that the management did not pay attention to remove the animals. We stopped cleaning up the feces, we were afraid of getting sick."
dont buy food here they fecal matter its on everything even on produce.; Very big Walmart, feels like the Walmarts in Florida. They have many options here and even have a cafe and cooked Spanish food.

As stores go I used to find safeway with better prices but Fred's with bigger varieties & inventory ....and better produce a d excellent meats. I tendrd to stick to Safeway until the COVID experience changes the world. It's so different now.  What gets me is I feel like the Russians must.l of when the cold ear ended, all of our new buddies got to buy government industry for pennys.... lsttr become oligarchs. And a dictatorship. If Fred.myers is dny indication they are still deleting to make good on their promises over the years... Quality over anything anfbyhey lol ve where we live.  Except then hit the greedy hungry to joonle up Safeway after time prune competitor fade when they bought them. Not sure what's next but in the name of us citizens... Stop trying to capture the entire market and end the American way. It only weakens us. Without competition we lose jobs too. We pay more for less variety.

Now this is a review of Fred's. At the current level and size they enjoy some power in the market. A healthy competitor. Stop. No more growth by acquisition. Good old-fashioned you must earn it.; Courtney of customer service. Thank you for excellent service. I mean the whole staff of Fred Meyer summer at good but the customer service ladies Michelle and Courtney did an amazing job above and beyond service. Thanks for helping me fix my receipt problems and change and being informative about the items and discounts; When I worked at Amazon a few years ago. I frequented shopping 🛒 here as it was on the way home. Now, I shop here probably once a month or once in two months.

The produce is always fresh. The store is always cleanly. It’s a lovely experience shopping here. It is a comfortable environment. The shelves are well stocked. This is a one stop shopping. They sell miscellaneous nice good, durable furniture and pretty decors. This store suffices all my needs.

They are nice and helpful when you call for assistance.; We Just moved to Sumner and it’s the closest store to us. I haven’t had any issues until yesterday when the lady employee (older looking) at self checkout started harassing me and my daughter (4 year old) I was buying groceries that included wine and help was need for age verification,my daughter had a dollar in her hand and the lady looked at her and rudely said, I hope you’re not the one paying .. I don’t want to get into trouble,went ahead and said the same thing to me,At this point my daughter is scared.I wouldn’t ask a 4 year old to pay for my groceries and she only had a  dollar and wouldn’t know how to do it anyway.Experiencing racism in a new neighborhood was not something we were looking forward to.; Today a lady accused my mom of stealing we are regular customers here but now we are rethinking even coming again we live in sumner but its starting to be more worth it to drive to bonney lake or puyallup this lady was older gray hair and very rude to my mom took the stuff out of her cart and bent the hell out of the gift bag she was buying causing her to go back already being late for her party and grab a new gift bag. When we called a manager he went to get her side of the story and she lied to him told him she was helping my mom and "folded the bag up nicely" if it was nice why did my mom have to get a new one once told this lie the manager basically told me he wasn't able to do anything and hung up after telling me that. no retial "bye" or "have a good day!" Shity service all around

Reviews:
Paid $7 for one pineapple.; For a tourist town I was surprised shops were closed on a Monday afternoon. Hoping to buy some food and souvenirs but that was not the case.

I'll give two stars because the people we met  (locals) were wonderful. I love the hospitality here. The people make the town a must come to place.; The only reason a give 2 stars is because the attention and service of the place I was looking for was excellent. The building where the establishment I visited is located is deteriorated (Plaza del Mercado) and with poor higiene. In fact it looks abandoned.; Bad work attitude on the part of the clerk at the "Tu municipio verde" Office.  Her cell phone was more important than helping the customer.  Her excuse when asked to update an email address was: can't be done here.  Has to be done online.  But, when she handed the invoice, which by the way looks like she printed the screen in front of her, you could read the key button to edit the customer's profile.  And, the online website doesn't provide a link to update your personal info.  It was evident she didn't want to be working there, didn't want to help others.  She was just there to pretend to work while collecting government money doing the less possible & counting the hours to finish the day.  What a waste of public funds.  Hiring an incompetent employee while other capable and willing people can't work.  Such an inept!; Great place to purchase produce and goods. You can find the best bread you have ever tasted at the Bakery located here! I highly recommend buy bread there.

Name: El Super
Address: 1251 E Southern Ave, Mesa, AZ 85204, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 1251 (street_number); East Southern Avenue (route); Mesa (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85204 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I bought cut beef meat for tacos for my son's birthday party. The meat was horrible, it looked like they gave me all the waste they took off the good meat. It was mostly fat and hard waste. It took me a few hours to separate the good meat from the bad. I called the store they denied me speaking to a manager. I was told that there was nothing they could do for me since the meat was already tampered with. She was very rude and asked me why I didn't check the meat before leaving the store. I said I did not know I had to check the meat, why would I? I am sorry but I paid good money for that meat, it was not given to me for free. I shouldn't have to check it to make sure it isn't trash.  I did not notice how bad the meat was until I was ready to cook it, I did not have time to drive back to the store.  I had to use it, serving my family and friends what I was able to clean from it.  I felt horrible and embarrassed to feed them waste, I don’t think that is fair.  The store caters to the Latino community and the Latino community deserves better than that, we work hard for our money and expect more from our grocery stores.  You need to hire staff that is less rude and that takes pride in the products they serve.  I will never buy from your store again and I will make sure to let all my friends and family know how horrible your meat is.; This is one of my favorite places to shop, especially when I’m making carne asada or ceviche. They have everything I need plus many other ingredients that are hard to find. The place is very clean and wide-open. Interestingly, knowing that they cater to a Hispanic audience, their prices are substantially more than almost all other supermarkets. The reason I don’t give them five stars is because of their customer service. The staff in the aisles are friendly and will help you, but the staff at the registers frequently are rude. The last four visits have been especially awful, given how I am treated at the register. The girls seem irritated with customers and do not smile. They are typically visiting with each other, so a customer interruption rocks their world.; My family and I like to shop here because of the selection. We are from out of town but might come here one or two times a month. While looking at some of the reviews I notice other people had issues with customer service too. We went to the meat counter early on a Saturday morning and they were not busy like they usually are, about four people ahead of us, six standing around the whole thing. We took a number and waited about five minutes. My wife asked for three pounds of the same cut of meat but wanted it separated into three separate bags of one pound each, not an unreasonable request, because we were going to give the other two pounds to two other people and keep one for ourselves. Well, the young guy and this woman, both are new since the last time we were there, both immediately started having fits and making visible childish pouting faces with my wife's request.

My wife didn't act rude and was nice to them while asking but they didn't want to do the extra work and had a counter request of, well can we just do two bags instead of three? No we want three. "Well they get mad at us for taking to long"....Who is they and to long for what??? There was no crowd and usually we get one person helping not two so it should go even quicker right? So    they did what we requested while making faces at each other like children not wanting to do something they are told to do, and they asked if there was anything else we needed? My wife replied, in a rude way this time, No! It'll will be to much work for you...
I suggested we complain to the manager but she said, "no why..next time we come here they won't be here".; I stopped here to get donuts for my son's club meeting.  They DO NOT have donuts.  But what they do have was very unique and well received by the team.  I took pictures of many of the pastries and what I think of as Mexican style cookies.  The baked goods are not as sweet as you would find in USA grocery stores so this is great for those looking to cut down on their sugar intake.  The pastries with the cream cheese topping are DEVINE!  I was so tickled as how much the kids loved them.

This is a great cultural experience.  The produce is huge and fresh.  There are sections of Mexican candies and everyday kitchen items that are unique from Mexico.

The meat counter is enormous! I've never seen such a large variety of meat to choose from.  The sea food looks so fresh you could swear they were just caught.

At the entrance inside are a lot of Crain games to occupy bored children.  A very teensy tine florist area is right by there and they offer some very decent flower bouquet.

There is a restaurant here that offers sit down tables.  All in all this was a very fun place to shop.  There is also a very large handicap parking that takes up the center of the parking lot. The doors are automatics so this place is very handicap friendly.; Went today for the first time here in Arizona. I grabbed a pre-packaged chicken and it smell rotten.  Obviously I walked.out the door and never coming back. I should of never turned my back on walmart.  I give 1 star because I have to rate otherwise I would give -stars......

Name: Vallarta Supermarkets
Address: 3425 Whittier Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90023, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 3425 (street_number); Whittier Boulevard (route); Central LA (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90023 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Are you looking for a market that has an extensive variety of Latino produce,meat,poultry, fish, and groceries????? DON'T HESITATE TO GO TO VALLARTA SUPERMARKETS because it has ALL  you need to make delicious meals. Don't forget to stop by LA COCINA, and enjoy all the hot and ready delicious dishes .😋😋😋; their staff is incredibly unfriendly- on my last visit, 3 of their staff including the security guard stood right by the door and although they made eye contact with everyone coming in, none of them greeted anyone. I also noticed they have installed a cashier-less checkout area and when I was ready to check and the SECURITY GUARD  came close to me but never addressed me and simply stood close by which was a bit creepy.
I've been to other Vallarta's that provide amazing produce and variety of Mexican grocery options, this is not one of those stores which is such a disappointment; For me, not Hispanic, I love to experience other cultures' food & this place has variety, hot food, pan de dulce, tamales, etc. Decent prices, cashier was friendly; I wish there was an option to rate this place at the lowest possible score "0" staff is not customer centred and behave like the customer is the problem. The store manager is a joke to hire staff that is so careless and rude. And why does every cashier assume you don't speak English and just come out and speak Spanish? Cashier's have given my wife a bad attitude because she does not speak Spanish but because of her appearance it's automatically assumed by all you low level employees. This location needs a complete revamp and honestly it starts from management. The bakery make wait while there right in front you casually carrying on with a personal conversation and when interrupted immediately resort to let you know you're a bother. Also have issues in the meat department and that was enough for me to completely eliminate your business for good. I post this to warn other customers of what to expect when you visit Vallarta Markets It's very disappointing.; I love the butcher department "carniceria" is great. Fresh meats and seafood.  Good variety of fresh vegetables. I like that they have choices of  loose dry chiles to make a variety of sauces for mexican dishes.
Staff is very helpful. I appreciate this because it's not my regular grocery store.

Name: Smart & Final Extra!
Address: 845 S Figueroa St #100, Los Angeles, CA 90017, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: #100 (subpremise); 845 (street_number); South Figueroa Street (route); Downtown Los Angeles (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90017 (postal_code)
Reviews:
First time here and have already been a couple times now, great location, the parking lot is very busy, there is a structure and very limited spaces outside. Large store once inside service at the register was slow but friendly staff. Large selection, very clean store, surprisingly no homeless outside. Would recommend this location and will return.; A grocery store with typical and bulk products at good prices. I enjoyed browsing the aisles as everything was very neat and the store looks well maintained. There is free 90 minute parking for customers out front. It’s within walking distance to the shopping centre.; #OMGawd...
A few days passed when the realization popped in that pre-paid products were left at the cashier stand as the employees switched cash boxes in the middle of a customer's purchase.
Jonathan helped, but stated due 2 store #policy charge card was physically needed.
Next attempt on the next day the sun was such a #scorcher my mind had immediately erased where I had placed the store receipt with Jonathan's circled items and signature to validate the paid and forgotten items at the cashier stand.
Store Manager #Benji was amazing to find the duplicate receipt inside the side office.
It took him no more than 5 minutes & his cashier #Claudia processed the cash refund.
I was impressed, reminded, & grateful how  important building rapport is.
I truly believed the odds were stacked against a resolution, but Faith led the way... #ThankYou @Smart&FinalExtra for a very pleasant and friendly customer service experience. 🇺🇲💯👍; I been shopping here for over 1 year now and it's getting worse every time it seem's like. When I first started shopping here everything was fine but now the fruit is horrible. The strawberries are alway's molded and dried up and the grapes are always brownish looking. I work with Smart and Final DC and I'm really trying to support my company by shopping with them but man i can only take so much. There's always only 1 cashier/ line open smh. Out of like 5 different line's only 1 be open. This location need's to get it together.; WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE - SMART & FINAL Downtown LA
Manager: TEO GOMEZ
Manager admitted there were confusing signs for parking which cost me $17, but refused to do anything about it. He said it was because they had old parking spots there.
He was very determined to not help, pretty much laughing me out of the store.
Why don't you (Smart & Final) do something about the signs?  I must not be the only one that thinks the parking lot in this picture is for Smart & Final.

I wrote Corporate an email too, but obviously they don't care.
Other people MUST have issues with their customer service.

Name: Whole Foods Market
Address: 788 S Grand Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90017, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 788 (street_number); South Grand Avenue (route); Downtown Los Angeles (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90017 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Best Whole Foods near me by far. Everything they sell is here. It’s a pretty big store and it’s new. Parking is free. It’s in a structure. There are machines at the entrances and exits but they don’t work. They have been like this for a long time. I wonder if they will ever function. There are elevators you can take to the lower level of the structure where it’s usually empty. The only thing I don’t like is that the store is busy and the cash register area is kind of chaotic.; I have been in many Whole Foods Markets all over California. This location is designed to have a spacious feeling. It's very clean and organized. There is tons of security everywhere. We will definitely return to this location another day. They have parking in the building or public street. Both charge for parking.; A solid grocery store with a very large selection of produce and other items.

A little on the pricey side but it’s because of higher quality brands etc. the big buffet style food offerings is also great.

I’d definitely come back here again and get my general home/grocery items. My

Also Amazon returns is also very easy here for items that could fit in a mailbox style drop off; Clean and spacious Whole Foods Market with an eatery attached. There are so many options for beverages and there is even an alcoholic beverages section. Choices for baked items were quite limited though and the already prepared food section looked a little lackluster. There are options for prepared sandwiches and other foods. It was busy on a Friday evening around 7 pm.; Food: Variety assortment of fresh produce and fresh ready made food.

Parking: large parking complex with validation free parking.
Validation ticket stamp at exit of checkout.

Universal charging station for EV cars
Easy pickup for online grocery orders

Ready made food Buffett
Coffee shop
Smoothies
Bakery
Deli
Plants
And more

Cons:
Long checkout lines during rush hours

Name: Crown Valley Market
Address: 27771 Center Dr, Mission Viejo, CA 92692, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 27771 (street_number); Center Drive (route); Mission Viejo (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92692 (postal_code); 3603 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
We have been loyal customers and supporters of CVM since its original opening. We shop here weekly and know most of the staff. The produce is less expensive than anywhere else, with a good selection of meats and European cold cuts.
A week ago, on a Saturday evening, I purchased salmon steaks and planned to cook them within the next two days. When it came time to cook, we discovered the salmon was putrid and smelled terrible. The stench was so bad that we had to dispose of the bag with the deli label, even though I wanted to keep it to report the issue.
We went to the store to inform the manager about the situation. The manager informed us that the policy is to return an unsatisfactory item within 24 hours with a receipt. Unfortunately, we had neither because I typically don't keep grocery receipts. While the cost of the meat was not the issue, the manager's lack of concern for our 20+ years of loyalty was very upsetting.
We will now shop somewhere that values its customers.; The best place for all types of European food and delicacies. The staff are all so very helpful and everyone seems to speak 27 languages. I got sauerkraut imported from Poland there. They make fresh Sangak Bread daily. The produce is so fresh and well priced. Love this place!🏆; This place is very unsanitary. I went to the bakery, someone ahead of me was being served. The employee used her very sticky hand to get different pieces of pastries without gloves or using tongs or a spatula and put them in a container for him. He left without taking the container. It was my turn now, she never cleaned her hands, she never wore gloves, she used a dirty towel on the counter to wipe the stickiness from her hand and started taking the pastries I wanted with her dirty hand and putting them in a container. I too left without taking the pastries. As I am posting this, I see that someone left a 1-star review a couple of days ago, Nazanin T, said the pastry she bought from this place had a hair in it. She posted a picture of the pastry and the hair. After seeing them in action, I can understand why there was hair in her pastry.  From there I moved to the deli section to get some cold-cut meat. I saw two people behind the counter and assumed they were both employees. It turned out the guy was an employee and the lady was his girlfriend who was allowed back there touching every single meat and cheese and helping herself. I asked a question and he told me to wait a minute. He spent 15 minutes with her as she was helping herself to the slicer, the cutter, and the packaging papers without any gloves. She and he then filled up her shopping cart that she had taken behind the counter and filled it with meat and cheese and she left. After waiting 15 minutes I left because I did not want to buy anything from this deli anymore. I went to the produce department which is 2 feet away from the deli section. After he finished with his girlfriend, he never asked if he could help me. He could see me as I could see him. He had no one to serve as everybody got disgusted and left but he never offered help. I will not go back to this place. Very disappointing and unsanitary.; I had a bad experience recenlty. The produce i bought was bad, and this manager guy got very aggressive trying to tell me there was nothing wrong. It was rotten. He was way over the top and i havent been back since. I have such mixed feelings about this place, as I like the fresh bakes and the overall options.; Parry the manger with the brown hair and glasses supper rude women I bought a teapot and it was missing the top part and she was basically accusing me if my parents should’ve have checked, and I was the only one who bought it and was the only one in the store I feel like because I look young she accused me. Marey the Hispanic women in the front with curly hair super helpful and did a great job . Maybe make her the manger not the other lady who asked me why ur parents didn’t check the item when I was the only one there

Name: Super Irvine
Address: 27771 Center Dr, Mission Viejo, CA 92692, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 27771 (street_number); Center Drive (route); Mission Viejo (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92692 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Love this place. I'm Mexican-American, so it's cool to stop by a place with such a wide variety of products I'm not familiar with. I like trying things that are new to me. Plus, today i got some info about the in store bakery, which I'm definitely going to try next time. A very kind shopper pointed it out. She was purchasing sangak flatbread. Once I asked her about that, she even suggested I try one of her favorite styles of pickle.; This Market has so much of good verity of produce and exotic fruits, they have their fresh bread you can see it baking infront your eyes. Delicious bread.; BBQ is good for the price...ask for well done!  Some products are fresh and great prices yet some are cheap and almost a waste.  Overall, a great fast stop for authentic food yet most importantly, halal 😋; Here is a small Persian grocery store that you can find all you need as an Iranian. They have a good collection of meat at meat department and they always have fruit a head of time. I like the place but I wish it was more clean.
For restaurant we only tried once and we ordered lamb head! It was really good and the price was a lot cheaper than other places.; Great produce, groceries, middle eastern products, Iranian, Persian, Syrian, Lebanese and other products, european chocolates. Very reasonable prices.  It's our favorite shop.

Name: Superior Grocers
Address: 12375 Central Ave, Chino, CA 91710, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 12375 (street_number); Central Avenue (route); Chino (locality); San Bernardino County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91710 (postal_code); 2624 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Always a lot of parking and clean parking lot. Superior is always stocked with groceries, produce and baked goods. I love their bakery. Their cakes and pan dulce is so good and fresh. I went shopping for masa and all my tamale making needs today and left a happy customer. I found my masa, chili's, and more. There is even a taco spot inside the market to fill you up.; I would not recommend this place anymore. I went in to get an Agua  fresca , the cashier was Yoselin H. There were three people in the stall and no one was coming to assist me, they were just standing. I wouldn’t have a problem with this but then the  young lady assisting me gave me had a negative demeanor and gave me the wrong size and flavor and still charged me for a medium when she gave me a small.; Be aware when ordering a cake from superior market.
I was very upset to find out that when I ordered custard filling in my granddaughter‘s birthday cake it was not custard. Superior market uses a vanilla flavored whip cream and tells their customers that it’s custard. That is FALSE ADVERTISING! They are charging you for something that you are not getting.
For those who don’t know what custard is… It’s kind of like a thick vanilla pudding. NOT VANILLA WHIP CREAM.
And then I don’t know who did it but one of them people back there stuck their finger or something in the cake, and didn’t say anything. They just handed me the box.
Not cool.
After standing there for I don’t know how long telling them how they are ripping their customers off by doing false advertising the manager finally gave me back some not all of my money.
So if you want vanilla custard in any cake that you order, go somewhere else.; On the tag shows $0.89/lb but they charged me $0.99/lb. I bought almost 10lb.
They said they cannot refund me because I paid with wic card. So because I said I paid $9.39 so they should gave me the quantities for $9.39. If they cannot refund money they can give more oranges to make it right quantities for what I paid. But they refuse it and they said they cannot do anything.
Be careful on the prices. ALWAYS READ the receipt here!!!! it’s not 1st they charge more.
It’s not about money because it’s not a lot difference, but it’s their attitude and their customer service (I had to run back there to take a picture for them). And I have to pay their mistake!!!
Samething it happen to me long time ago at Walmart, and over there I received great service.
I didn’t had to run there to proof that their prices was wrong like what they let me did here.; I love buying groceries there. They always have everything what I want

Reviews: They live up to their name. I especially like that their liquors are not in a cabinet. You can go pick one out instead of holding up the line while you have to wait for customer service to answer multiple calls for help like every other grocery store does. Good prices and a nice selection too.; They have a nice selection of produce and fresh meats. The shelves were well-stocked and the isles were clean. I found the prices to be better here than in Cabo Rojo.; Edit** Good Very clean and organized... Glad I found this place.. Wow how time's have changed. This has become a horrible place to shop. Rude cashier's and very unorganized eg; went shopping full cart over an hour and a half,wait online get to the register unload most of my food to be told the system has been down all day and the are only accepting cash! Imagine how great it would have been to know that information as I entered the store.. To top it off I was told that i should put everything back where it goes, as if I haven't wasted my time already. Btw this isn't the first time. I've tried to support the local supermarket but I'll just continue on to Walmart or sam's..; Ordered a cake for a guest dinner and it was a disaster. The top layer of frosting was stained with red liquid and the insides of the cake were were falling apart. The layer of frosting was not even leaving gaps in between. Since it was moistened with vainilla, they left some areas of the cake hard as it was not evenly done. When we cut the cake we could see the incompetence and disregard. I never imagined this would happen.; My always grocery shopping stop when I come back home. It can get crowded with long checkout lines but its the biggest supermarket in town. What you see if what you get. (I worked in Mr. Special Lajas in the good old days with best store manager, Quiro, best Head Cashier, Bruni and the best combination of pitchers and catchers... Cashiers and Baggers!)

Name: Rincon Farmer’s Market
Address: 8PQX+WQX, Rincón, 00677, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: Closed; Saturday: Closed; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 PM
Address Components: 8PQX+WQX (plus_code); Rincón (locality); Rincón (administrative_area_level_2); Rincón (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00677 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Lovely people sell their fresh items and some tinctures. Best cup of hot cacao. Delicious juices and homemade food too. I remember years ago it was larger with all kinds of vendors. Now it seems some vendors are not allowed maybe... like no craft items and jewelry. The coconut water was fantastic. I bought coconut oil too. Wonderful Sunday outing with lively music playing. Go and support the local vendors.; Every Sunday! Come here for fresh local produce and foods from local purveyors and vendors. This is great for a good family outing and to support the local community.

If you are visiting please take the family out and visit the locals and support them.; The market was fantastic. They had a wide variety of local fruit and vegetables, a local cacao vender, plenty of juice stands, a couple bakeries, all the art vendors from Thursday, and my favorite, a local family that makes cheese from their cows. My only regret was not buying more cheese!

For fruit, we brought home Mamey Sapote (Three on top), Guayaba (guava), a coconut, dried starfruit, and something else I forgot the name of (maybe Jobo?) but is delicious!

We also brought home pickled local sweet peppers, which are incredible, that epic local cheese, and some tomatoes a guy grew in his backyard.

Most of the local bars and restaurants are open at the same time as the market, and the vibe is comfortable happy community island life.

Note the rig I didn't get at the market, I had to buy that at the smoke shop down the road 🤙🏼 And the sauce from a local medical Dispensary 😉; A bit pricey on some basic things from some people, like avocado for 4$ for one is too much, but two people down, guy had 2/4, but what's really good is the gyro and also things like cacao beans and plants. Love cilantro for 10$ a big planters worth .; Not really a farmer’s market, more of a food and crafts market.  Good variety of hand made stuff, some interesting food to try, too much jewelry, and lots and lots of small paintings, small woodwork, stickers, art, etc.  No bargains, no price gouging; everything seemed to be full retail price or negligibly more.  This is a good stop if you’re in the area, less rewarding if made a destination.  And, as with every other similar market I’ve seen, vendors leave early.

Name: Walmart
Address: 3535 Ave Militar Ste 193, Isabela, 00662, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: Ste 193 (subpremise); 3535 (street_number); Ave Militar (route); Isabela (locality); Arenales Bajos (administrative_area_level_2); Isabela (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00662 (postal_code)
Reviews:
They have almost anything for your needs. This a recommend place to find what you're looking for. There's a few Wal-Mart locations located in and around the Puerto Rico area.

They have a large parking lot area for your vehicle.

Most of the staff is helpful when you ask for it. It's not like some other places where the workers are asking customer if they need help and show a willingness to help out. That's why I'm not giving them 5 stars. This should be part of a training program for employees for future employment at all Wal-Mart. If this is part already, most workers are not applying as customers service.; Has 90% of the basics, it’s definitely a hunt. Best bet, come with someone else, let them stand in one place with a cart, you go run around to grab the items so you’re not fighting through the little aisle and crowds. You can find most of what you’re looking for but just be aware this isn’t the normal states Walmart so everything is a little more expensive.

What’s the best time to go when it’s not super packed and a total madhouse? Never.

The up side to the craze? There’s a Panda Express inside 🥰; Great experience and very good people over there everyone was happy and make you feel like family; This Walmart has been remodeled, and it's way better than before. Finally it has a normal supermarket and more merchandise.; Right on main rt2 , be aware that this road has 25mile per hr section for school zone.

Reviews: On my way to Rincon I stopped in this place to get fishing supplies. It was Sunday and it was closed. I called the phone number on the window and the owner, Omar, told me to wait there and he would come and open up the store for me! What great service on a Sunday. They have everything you need for fishing. Huge selection and great variety of lures, fishing line, weights, rods, reels and more.; Forget about spending your money in Walmart or Kmart...this little store has everything you need for saltwater or freshwater 🎣 fishing. Omar is very attentive and the prices are fair. Great selection of hard and soft lures specially for your bass fishing needs. A must!; This tackle shop really has it all. Very helpful and freindly staff, and fair pricing. They cover all bases, from shore fishing, off shore, to spearfishing. They also have a nice stock of air rifles, airsoft, and camping gear. Its a must stop for any outdoorsman in the area.; Easy access. The store is small and the staff is not very knowledgeable. It's a bit pricey though and the variety is a bit lacking.; The best tackle shop on the island! Super well stocked with all of the latest tackle. Omar is the man on the island for all your fishing needs!

Reviews:
Elle from the bakery department, and I cannot express how impressed I was with her professionalism. She created an amazing cake that exceeded my expectations! Elle was not only kind and soft-spoken, but she also demonstrated genuine care in her work and interactions.
In a world where good customer service can be hard to find, Elle truly stands out. Thank you, Elle, for being so amazing! I will definitely be returning to the bakery because of your outstanding service.; I go to this store almost daily.
It is clean, well-stocked, and has very capable, hard-working staff.
The fruit and vegetable selection is good and well-organized.

I'm generally ok using self-check out for small orders, but when I want to use a register with a staff member often there are only 1 or 2 registers open versus 5-11 self-check registers. Those often glitch (possibly user error some, but not all.).

The flower department is beautifully displayed and has seasonal plants and flowers.

The prices are, on the whole, better than Vons, but more than Target for the same items. Better selection than Target.

Parking is easy.

I like going to this market as it meets many of my grocery store needs.; Good selection of groceries. Usually has good produce. I've always felt this  store is more clean than most other grocery stores. But, also higher prices than most other grocery stores.; Best store in ventura. They do a great job. However, that being said, and it's saying a lot, it's still very cramped, and there's just too much noise in Commiefornia. It's too crowded. Too many people and their attitudes. So the experience isn't as good as it would be in a red state. Sorry, Ralph's. It's not you. It's politics and the location. Reviews:
I was searching for a place to go get bottled water, and I left with a BBQ chicken!  Best $10 spent!; A very nice shopping experience in this supermarket without much fuss. They sell international products most of which are from latin america. Everything including the produce were fresh and the prices are quite satisfactory. The store is well organized and kept clean. Employees are also approachable.; Love the bakery there. Great value plenty of options; Overall excellent grocery store, bakery and eating place. Of the eating place, cannot say enough to let you know how much I love the food here. During non-COVID times they have tables inside. I have come here to have lunch with friends many times. Always pleased with my food. As for the in-store bakery, very good, great selection of items, not the best I've ever had, but in top 5. Grocery store is very good also. They have lots of product, prices are good. Staff working here are nice. Have even met members of the family that own this chain, they are very nice, and even eat lunch here too. Parking is very good, considering in an area where parking is often problematic. Getting here is okay, nowhere near a freeway. Parking, restrooms, entrance, aisles and checkout are all accessible. Restrooms are fine.
On a personal note recommend the tacos, they are outstanding. Have brought friends here, and while they may initially question why we are coming here, they all agree that the food is quite good. Currently on the weekends they sell chicken and tri-tip that they bbq outside, and it is really good.; Great pollo Al carbon on weekends only $10 for a whole chicken
Good house made tortillas and salsa too

Address Components: 3548 (street_number); Q Street (route); South Omaha (neighborhood); Omaha (locality); Douglas County (administrative_area_level_2); Nebraska (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 68107 (postal_code); 2521 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
it is not a bad store. I was there few times. Some products are very specific and you will have a hard time time to find it somewhere else. The major surprise is that everything is MORE expensive that in other grocery stores,  it also can be more clean. Eggs on the shelf  were 2 days after expiration date, it is not good. Some meat products you do not need to thing where to buy, you just go there.; Overall worst Hispanic grocery store I have ever been to. Very dirty. Old produce, limited selection. The only items in produce worth getting are the cactus leaves.
The deli needs to be inspected by the health department! Raw pork in green chilies was in the warmer with the cooked foods for sale. Huge health hazard! The people packing the cooked food were not wearing gloves. The area behind them was dirty.  Section next to the warmer with items that should have been refrigerated - cooler temp display. Was closer to room temp.
Unless you want to risk food poisoning, Don't buy food here!!; I go to the store mostly because South Omaha desperately needs a new grocery store and this is the only one in the area. It has some great qualities, I love their homemade tortillas, they have a lot of produce you can't get anywhere else, a great selection of both Hispanic and American foods and it's written on the aisle signs in both, they sell pinatas and they just opened self-checkout lanes that they desperately needed. My main issue with the store is cleanliness and customer service. For months you could smell dead mice right as you walked in the entrance. And the meat department offers a great selection but oftentimes the plastic they sit on is not clean. It was so gross the last time I went in I took pictures to send to the manager. As far as customer service goes as an example I had a money order I purchased there stolen and cashed. On the western union website they instruct you to let the store know bc the only place that can cash it is the store. The girl at customer service actually told me it was store policy if someone comes to cash it they can't keep their information to give to the police since it would be invading THEIR privacy. Apparently a person who would cash a money order they know they didnt purchase is protected instead of the customer that actually spends their money there. So long review summed up, great tortillas but not worth the risk of getting sick from dead mice in the store, dirty meat dept. , and TERRIBLE customer service. I will never shop here again!!; This store has a little bit of everything for a latin dish. Not to mention, I have searched high and low since moving here from fl for my favorite hot sauce ( Texas Pete) and EUREKA!!! they had it.; If you like fresh Mexican foods go here. Pricing can be a bit high,  but the fresh tortillas both corn and flour are better than any other store bought brand.

Terms of alcohol they should have most of the brands (missing Hite in cans)

Fruit is usually cheap here compared to other markets or even h Mart.

Parking is my plenty and usually very busy here.
There's also other restaurants in the same plaza for food.

Across the street from baekjeong.; white hair tall old man with glasses was so rude, he would speak to himself in front of me complaining that i am asking to create new membership. if he is lazy and dont want to do his job, he should quit; It is clean,organized store. Address Components: 1826 (street_number); Vinton Street (route); Vinton Street (neighborhood); Omaha (locality); Douglas County (administrative_area_level_2); Nebraska (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 68108 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I think this location is far better than the other on Q however the self checkouts make for a stressful visit. It’s as if you forced to deal with a 90 year old blind deaf cashier with Alzheimer’s sometimes. They always repeat to place items in the bagging area when they are and the machines all seem to glitch all the time.

Also I do not want to be referred to HR or customer service as it always leads to no resolve.

Update : ofcourse I was given a generic “reach out to HR message “ and the self check outs still haven’t improved; It's nice to have a bank conveniently in with the store!; I left my car at the parking lot after doing groceries for a couple hours and they got my car towed and they said now I have to deal with the towing company which is a terrible business that is closed on weekends the towing company treated me like garbage hang up on me when I asked if my car was in a covered garage, they said I can’t pick it up until Monday, they towed it on Friday night and it’s going to hail and there is a tornado warning and they said they are not responsible if my car gets damaged I’d have to use my insurance.; Has to sand tons of products but just have to be careful with produce and make sure you pick through it.; The staff consistently appears disgruntled and impolite, and the self-checkout machines are consistently slow and glitchy, making quick trips impossible.

Recently, opting for a traditional cashier line to avoid the sluggish self-checkout experience, I was disappointed when the cashier failed to alert me about the bagged items I left behind. Upon realizing the oversight at home, I called the store hoping to rectify the situation, only to be met with unprofessionalism from the person who answered the phone. It begs the question: what are the hiring standards here? Is there any accountability?

Returning to retrieve the forgotten item, I encountered further frustration as the cashier refused to acknowledge their mistake and insisted I pay again. Blaming me for not noticing their error, they refused to remedy the situation, resulting in the loss of my regular business over a mere $2 discrepancy.

One had almost 12 people waiting, the other one was the express register and the other one had a "closed " sign even though the light at the register was on. I asked if he was closed to make sure and he affirmed that he was with a gesture. So I proceeded to the express register and after I moved to the next register he checked out more people, some that were behind me looking to pay too.  When I got to the express register the attendant told me that I needed to wait because the customer in front of me requested a price match. I agreed and when it was my turn to pay she told me that the person that was behind me on the line needed to go ahead of me because she only had five items and I had more than 10. I got upset because of the way she approached the situation and her demeanor towards me. I left the merchandise at the register and asked for the manager and they refused to call him. They sent the head cashier instead and her attitude was even worst. I had over a Hundred dollars worth of merchandise and I left very upset because it was the first time I shopped at this place because it was highly recommended and I was very dissatisfied with their customer service. Not a way to do business.  I will not recommend this place to anybody.; Good  as usual,  but they sometimes run out of merchandise.

Name: Ralphs Fresh Fare
Address: 42150 Washington St, Bermuda Dunes, CA 92203, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 5:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 5:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 5:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 5:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 5:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 5:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: 42150 (street_number); Washington Street (route); Bermuda Dunes (locality); Riverside County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92203 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I got poor service and unhelpful
Questions in the deli department.  It was a Mondnay about 11:00 AM. I was the only customer at the counter.  There were several people working there but they completely ignored me. Finally
after several minutes, I asked If someone could help me. An older woman came over and I told
her I needed slices of ham and cheese. I was standing right in front of the meats.  Instead of helping  she kept asking me question about brands. She was rude and and not helpful.
I am an 88 year old man, well groomed and soft spoken. I have never been treated in such a condescending manner. Please train your staff to attend to the live customers first.; Went in today, store was not busy so able to go right to checkout. I had items saved on a list that were on digital special and I asked cashier to help me understand how to use the app so items could be charged at sale price. Cashier was very abrupt, was able to get my discounts bit still completely in dark how to use app. Needless to say I have no desire to return and be treated so rudely.; Please be aware that this store is charging you a connivence fee for your cash back. They clearly do not say that on the card pad but it is as clear as day on the big screen by the cashier .
Once I saw the 75 cent charge for my 20.00 I cancelled my transaction .. Cashier said run the card again, which I did and I informed her that I did not want to pay the fee. She looked away rolled her eyes and treated me poorly with a bad attitude, when I stated that they should have it on the pad to inform the customer of the charge.
I came home and goggled is this practice legal ?? and it is NOT in the state of CA and there is a pending law suit against KROGER for doing so. This Ralphs is OVERPRICED and understaffed with rude individuals.

You can go to Staters or Albertsons across the street and there is no fees for cash back. I told a friend my story and her grandson wanted 100.00 back and they charged him 2.00 and he says they do it all the time.

I found this quote on line pertaining to this exact practice that we should not be charged.
****************************************************************
Adding a cash back fee whenever a customer completes a cash back transaction using a debit card would violate these rules. According to one article, by assessing these "convenience" fees, Kroger, the parent company of Ralphs, Food 4 Less, and Foods Co., is able to take an extra $75 million a year from its customers. The fifty cent fees add up.
*****************************************************************
They are making 75 million more a year on just that.. now let that one sink in.
On top of that we also pay for a bag fee , ridiculous and unethical.

Check your receipts or better yet find another store to shop in for better prices, better customer service and no illegal connivance fees.; Cashier named Juan is rude and discriminatory. Refused to help me and mocked me the entire time. Awful experience; Customer service at this store is not good. So when a young gentleman I recognized from the Indio store says hi to me..I was confused then I was so happy to see him.He was the reason I shopped the produce at the other store..I thought he quit.I would like to say that you have a great employee working for you now...the nicest toughest guy I have ever met. I believe his name is Eddie.No matter what he is doing he always went above and beyond to get me what I needed. Keep it up my friend!

Reviews: We frequently visit this place and people there are normally friendly. But you get to know really the business attitude when there is a problem. On Saturday (two days ago), I bought a bottle of Puerto Rican honey. (In general, I try to buy local products to favor local economy.) The honey had a stale, funny flavor, and thus I decided to return it. They wouldn't return the money because the bottle was open. I tried to no avail to explain to the manager (Carlos) that I wouldn't possibly know that the honey was stale without opening it. He even dared to say that he wouldn't taste it because he didn't know what I could possibly add to the honey. Anyhow, I was quite frustrated with the experience.; Microgreens, swiss chard, kale, bok choy, fresh green peas, locally grown tomatoes and cucumbers, this and much more are the delightful fresh veggies you can find at El Viandon. I love this place, the staff is very helpful. Unfortunately they do not carry organic produce, they say there is insufficient demand, but I hope they will change their minds.; Very good; Great quality in all the products ordered. Name: Fry's Marketplace
Address: 2929 E Ocotillo Rd, Chandler, AZ 85249, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 2929 (street_number); East Ocotillo Road (route); Chandler (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85249 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Today, 8/22/24, went to shop at Fry's in the am.   Completed my shopping and headed to self check out.  The store has two sets of self check out lines on the east side of the store.   As I approached the open registers, the side with 4 self check out stations, I noticed two were not working and one was occupied but the last one had items at the register but no customer.   I was told the person ran back to grab an additional item but I could head to a register down the line to check out.  This did resolve my issue but I do not understand why open self check out when 2 of the 4 registers are not working??   Makes no sense to me but then again I do not work there.   This store is convenient although I do get some good deals, it just frustrates me when things like this happen.    Make it easy for your customers.    Why not make sure all registers are working for the convenience of your customer.; Walking into Fry’s Grocery Store is like stepping into a whimsical wonderland of culinary delights! The aisles are a treasure trove of surprises, each turn revealing a new adventure in grocery shopping. Who knew hunting for the perfect jar of peanut butter could feel like a playful scavenger hunt?

The produce section is a vibrant rainbow, bursting with colors and freshness that almost make you want to start a fruit bouquet business on the spot. And those quirky little signs with puns and jokes? They’re like a sprinkle of joy on your shopping trip, making you chuckle as you pick out your veggies.

The staff at Fry’s are like friendly neighborhood superheroes, always ready with a smile and a helpful tip. Need to find that obscure ingredient for your next culinary experiment? They’ve got you covered, and might even share a recipe or two!

And let’s talk about the bakery – it’s a sweet tooth’s paradise! The aroma of freshly baked bread and pastries is enough to make anyone’s day instantly better. Plus, the endless variety of snacks and treats makes it feel like a mini festival every time you visit.

In a nutshell, Fry’s Grocery Store isn’t just a place to shop – it’s an experience. It’s a delightful blend of convenience, quality, and a dash of fun that makes grocery shopping something to look forward to. So grab your cart, embrace the quirky charm, and enjoy the ride!; I shop here occasionally and always find the store clean and well stocked. Most of the employees are helpful and polite. However when I use the self checkout I’ve interacted with Pablo, who is consistently rude and condescending to customers. I avoid this man and I wasn’t surprised when I saw him square up with an elderly woman who was simply having issues using her coupons. She asked him to step back when talking to her and he responded, “Would you like to speak with a manager?” I could see she was becoming upset. I dread asking this man for any assistance.; Advertised BOGO on stevia sweetener… got to register didn’t give me the discount. After review they claim it should have been discounted and asked me 3 times what I wanted to do. I want the deal. They claimed I had to come back. I have 2 kids under 2 years old. Just getting to the store once with them is hard enough. Not happy with the customer service that’s why I rated 1 star.; Would give 0 stars if I could!  Ordered deli trays one week ago and still waiting over 30 minutes and counting to get my food!  DO NOT order from here if you need food on time.  So far one tray of 4 came out and brought one that I didn’t order.  Appalled by lack of customer service at this store!  The one tray that came out looked like a 2 year old put it together!

I’ve been waiting 45 minutes so far with only 1 item of 4 done.  The gentleman next to me has been well over an hour.  Don’t bother complaining to customer service because they don’t care!!

Reviews:
Little over price.   But I'm welling to pay extra for professional help... place extra organized and clean but more importantly the staff is very helpful and easy to find them.   Unlike walmart where you ask for help and they pass you to other worker who doesn't seem to know much... and I especially like the meat 🍖.... the steak and porkchop look picture perfect...; What a beautiful experience!! I paint about my ancestors all the time and what a blessing to have my family and granddaughter experience this place in person.  Is like coming to life.  Ty for the officer who was so kind to help me with my spanish with directions.  Didn't get her name but she was so kind.; Very nice, clean, well kept and well stocked grocery store. We visited three times while staying in the area for a week long trip.

If not familiar, you have to request coffee at the register - it's not in the aisle. The deli counter typically has a long wait, so just place an order here first, then go back to pick up once you're done shopping.

We didn't buy any of the items pictured but wish we had!; I love supermax they got the best deals around. The quantity is outstanding. Reviews: Great little higher end grocery store. We were very happy with their chimichurri steaks, the plantain and yucca stuffed chicken, their chicken salad, and their guava cream cheese dip. Yes, they are a little pricier than SuperMax, but you're in Puerto Rico, so indulge a little. Great beer selection also. Anything from Ocean Lab is a winner.; Great place to buy hard to find beef cuts such as Brisket. They have a great variety in cold cuts, salads, cheese, dips,etc For that great event in your house with family and friends. Amazingly and friendly.; Delicious, high quality meats and tasty salads. I bought hamburgers, marinated chicken and potato salad and the Mexican orzo salad for a family vacation dinner. All I can say is, “wow”! Perfect for the grill!; My favorite meat and specialty food store ever! Pricy, but well worth it for the quality! Try the spicy crab dip!; Very expensive, can buy a lot of the same stuff at supermax for much less. What's good is there pre-made meals, eg macaroni and cheese.

Name: Paseo del Plata Shopping Center
Address: Paseo del Plata Shopping Village, Dorado, 00646, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Vicinity: Paseo del Plata Shopping Village, Dorado
Address Components: Dorado (locality); Higuillar (sublocality_level_1); Higuillar (administrative_area_level_2); Dorado (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00646 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Paseo del Plata Shopping Center truly stands out as a versatile hub for shopping, dining, and entertainment. Every visit here is an enjoyable experience, with something for everyone in the family to love.

Dining at Paseo del Plata is a treat, with a plethora of restaurants offering a diverse array of cuisines. From casual eateries to more upscale dining options, each restaurant provides excellent food and a great atmosphere. Whether you're in the mood for a quick bite or a leisurely meal, the quality across the board is consistently impressive.

The movie theater at Paseo del Plata is another highlight. It features the latest in cinematic technology, offering a premium viewing experience with comfortable seating and excellent sound quality. It’s the perfect way to wind down after a day of shopping and dining.

In conclusion, Paseo del Plata Shopping Center is more than just a shopping destination; it's a place where you can easily spend a full day enjoying diverse shops, delicious food, and great entertainment. It’s a must-visit location for anyone looking to have a fun and fulfilling day out.; It is a real nice place to hang out where you have access to the cinemas, a variety of restaurants, live music on weekends, even a Supermax supermarket.; This is my favorite Super Max grocery  location, so far.  Big parking lot.  Nice,  clean, well-stocked store. And located in a beautiful area.; Many choices for food, bars, ice cream, movies, grocery, etc.  Parking is fairly easy but I have to note that I was not there on a weekend during what I would expect is a much busier time.  The area is clean and fairly well lit at night.  There are several empty spaces.  I don't know if they are vacancies or if they were recently built out for incoming tenants.  Either way, it is a good area to find many things you need, have lunch or dinner, or to hang out for some entertainment.; Beautiful shipping area. Has various stores food shopping Amigos/ small salon/ small food shops / cannabis dispensary movie theater and more. Always super clean , friendly people beautiful area. Parking can be a hassle and a long walk at times but never had an issue . Go here weekly for my nights out movie day or grocery day

Address: FPF9+F9H, Calle A, Dorado, 00646, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: FPF9+F9H (plus_code); Calle A (route); Higuillar (sublocality_level_1); Dorado (locality); Higuillar (administrative_area_level_2); Dorado (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00646 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The beach was packed like sardines in a can but we were able to find a spot. The beach is clean and they added a volleyball net. They also have a banana boat ride that I recommend because you are definitely getting flipped over before coming back to shore lol; The water was warm and awesome. I loved it.  Worth the $4 to park at the parking spot. Beautiful beach.; The water is amazing. There are plenty of bar restaurants along the street. I got street parking. There is no place
to rent beach chair or umbrellas being
that there is no major hotel on the beach to do so, so bring your own. This is mostly a beach around residential community. There is a restaurant/bar by the beach with free outdoor shower. The sunsets are amazing, the beach does close at a certain time. Overall a family beach. Lots of family with children  bring your own grill as none or available. Definitely a very beautiful family friendly beach.; Good place to relax and enjoy the breeze.; As usual street parking can be tricky but not impossible. Really convenient bars and restaurants right on C, facing the beach. There are plenty of picnic tables to sit at and lovely palm trees to sit under. The waves can be choppy so the first waves are a bit heavy with sand and sea plants. There was no life hard on the beach so do take care. On this side of the island the waves are formidable. If you venture past the poles it can be be much deeper and more dangerous. There are no rentals here- there used to be but not anymore. The only negative is the dude walking around ogling young ladies and touching himself. But over all a wonderful sunny yet shady afternoon listening to the crash of the waves on the beach. Oh and beware of the beach roosters... Stay safe

Reviews:
They sell expired meat look at this internal temp was 115 so it was cooked and it’s grey ! I tried on two different steaks warning they sell bad meat !!!!! It smells bad and texture is bad !!! Calling health inspector tomorrow; I was very impressed with this little store. It was clean it didn't have any smell in it. I bought 2 bottles of barbecue sauce and some fresh broccoli. The prices were just as much as the other stores. But I was very impressed with the store. I didn't expect to find what I found in there. When I opened the plastic curtains. I was quite satisfied; It's a pretty cool spot if you need to pick up a few things.; Solid place for a quick stop, especially during the holidays. The parking lot is tough, and small meat prices aren't bad, and they have tbone and ribeye; They have the best deals for the meat department. My mom comes here to get their latest specials. Today they had chicken legs for $0.39 a pound! Yes, you read right. Only $0.39.

This place has so much merchandise and at great prices. It is a very small place, but they are very organized and somehow fit a lot into it.

They have baby supplies, kitchen supplies, beauty supplies, bathroom supplies and school supplies. Then on the other aide they have the food like the fruits and vegetables.

I see a lot of employees working and putting up more merchandise. Most of the time there is only one cashier, but there aren't too much people that come here.

The parking is small and it's a one way entrance. Luckily, people don't take long to shop here so most of the time there is at least one spot. There is a bigger lot next to them that's connected, but it belongs to other stores.

Name: Supermercado Brazil
Address: 10826 Venice Blvd. UNIT 105, Culver City, CA 90232, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: UNIT 105 (subpremise); 10826 (street_number); Venice Boulevard (route); Washington Culver (neighborhood); Culver City (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90232 (postal_code); 3649 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: Wow!! As a Brazilian myself I must say that I was amazed with this market here in Culver City. It had so many authentic, good-tasting yet a little pricy food from Brazil. It’s definitely worth it though! I was blown away with how everything tasted exactly like food from São Paulo. Something that is very rare to find here in the US. Even the Cashier spoke excellent Portuguese and it made for a welcoming exchange while I shopped. I live 30 miles away from here but I definitely intend on coming back again soon. Obrigado, tchau!; I found out this place a couple of years ago and was initially thrilled to find Brazilian products there. However, in recent months, I have become increasingly frustrated with the store as they have been selling expired products! On one occasion, I purchased an expired Knorr broth, and now, an Antarctica guaraná. 😒 I don't know what's going on with this grocery store, but if you're in a hurry, you do have to pay attention to the expiration dates or consider going somewhere else!; Throw away expired stuff! Not ok to sell here in America I will never go Back!; The staff here is very helpful and exceptionally friendly. The prices are good and they have a good selection of products. Obviously, as expected, the store has niche Brazillian and Latin American products that can be hard to find. The only downside I would mention is that they don't accept Calfresh/EBT; Love the coffee they sell. Pilao in traditional or expresso. Drinks smooth and easy.

My family went there this morning for a quick breakfast before we went hiking. The breakfast burrito is unacceptably bad. Prisoners deserve better. Did you put the eggs and whatever else is in that garbage burrito in a food processor? I have no clue what was in it. Seriously the worst breakfast burrito I've ever ever had in my life. It's also tiny, but that's fine because you won't take more than one bite. All four of us had one and all had the same opinion. We went to the home hungry because none of us could eat it. We talked about it off and on all day.

DO BETTER!; Great selection at reasonable prices, considering it is pretty remote. Saves me the time and aggravation from having to go to Montrose or Grand Junction. Clean store and friendly staff. Will go back.; They have takeout and the usual assortment of quick things to go..; Great selection of everything one could need. Always blown away at the options of dietary restrictions such as gluten, dairy, and peanut free options. I don’t even see a selection this diverse in larger super markets in Denver!; Don's Markets meats are the best. The steaks are cut very nice and are so tender. The price is very good too I can have steak for my family three four times a week with their fair prices. Also all of the employees I have encountered are very helpful and friendly. Keep up the good work. Almost forgot the bakery is very tasty as well 🙂

Reviews: Great family fun...not overly crowded and great walk around the scenary.; Clean, spacious mall. Huge area with plenty of parking. All the larger department stores one would need, plus a variety of smaller places. Large, clean food court. Comfortably air conditioned. Well lighted; safety is never an issue.  Just avoid Claro, because they do not treat people as humans. Expect lots of walking (over a mile), so wear comfortable shoes. Two supermarkets as well.; There's a food truck that was great. Hes only there on Thursday Friday and Saturday. He's parked right in front of chick fil a. Shish kabob are amazing burgers were good. Service was great. I will return.; Visiting Plaza del Norte was a trip to go down memory lane. They have a good selection of stores. Lots of artisans home made which was nice. They have a souvenir store for puertoricans and I had a fabulous time shopping to brings gifts back home.; This small, although small, is pretty cool. It has a movie theater, cool stores, and some good fast food restaurants. My favorite store here is the Otaku Shop of course. The gentleman that works there is friendly, patient, and very knowledgeable, There's also a Bubble Tea store inside of the Otaku Shop that is very delicious. I had the Pika Colada! Definitely recommend it.
