Like going here as there’s so many things in one place to get. Anything you need for the house you’ll find there.
With that said I gave 3 stars due to a man stocking with little concern that my mom who was pushing her walker was needing to go by. He ignored her n didn’t realize you was behind her n with her. I stopped n he proceeded to play bongos on boxes while I was walking by slowly due to being behind my mom. He was annoyed.
Second thing that got me was the bathroom. Although happy this time it was opened on my visiting. That was great to see but a sign that said “wash you hands before leaving” but no soap if any kind to use! Could find manager to tell them. You could tell none is supplied as there’s no sign of it being placed before.; I love love this store...it has everything imaginable for the household and plus. This store reminds me of Joey's in waterbury ct., o ly bigger! It's located in a shopping strip with plenty of parking for everyone including handicapped ♿️ parking. Ground level entrance. I Recommend this store if your trying to save money because their prices are low/affordable. Great store for Christmas toys and decorations as well. They backed up enough for my chevy spark to go through, the mustang honked and I honked back, when I got out of the car the blue mustang pulled next to me a guy inside light skin blonde hair wearing a security shirt and hat said with a thick accent "sir there is no speeding I'm security" I said "I wasn't speeding, go away" he said "I can have your car towed" I said "go ahead I'll wait" he pulled into a parking spot and started to call someone not sure who, I waited for a bit but went inside one of the businesses to ask for the property managers number and I explained the issue, they came out and made a call, while the guy approached to say "you can't drive like that" I said " dude I wasn't speeding you're out of your mind" then he lied and said "I didn't say you were speeding" then I said "yes you did" and the person next to me also said "yes you did" so now he's lying, then a 2ns security came and asked what the issue was, I think told him everything above and also said "I'm trying to shop here" and the 2nd security said, it's OK just be careful next time how you drive to which I said "but I wasn't even speeding..." then he said next time just be careful then I said "ok I get it next time I'll be more careful even though I was careful this time and was not speeding" he then said thank you and told the other security something about customer

In general, you will always find good things at this Market. ⭐️; This market has a nice feel to it. Lots of products that are fresh and reasonably priced. This market is like the less Americanized version of Kroger or Albertsons stores. They sell international products, mostly those from the Mediterranean, includes a bakery, liquor and meat department. Shopping in this market is easy, but it can get packed during weekends. Overall I recommend this market if you’re trying to look for ingredients for an unusual recipe.; I enjoyed my grocery shopping here. The produce was fresh and  they have great prices. There cold cuts and cheeses are fresh and tasty. I would say shop here for all of your produce needs. I find that their condiments and other can goods are pricier than El Super or Superior and even Vons. Great customer service support.

Reviews:
Fam Coop. The best supermarket in this area. You are always greeted when entering the store, store is always super clean and the aisles are neatly stocked. From the manager all the way to the employees who clean the floors everyone is kind, helpful and looking to find what you need.

This store has the best quality of meat and the best prices for their fresh cut meat than all the bigger stores. When you are looking for something and they don't have it, ask the manager, they will have as soon as is humanly possible and at a great price too.; Is almost empty. Service good; Someone stopped me while I was shopping and accused me of being from another supermarket because I was checking wine reviews (they thought I was marking prices). This place is dirty too and full of junk food. They profit mostly off of welfare recipients so they sell cheap stuff.; Some items are very expensive compared to other grocery stores. They sell bags of discounted/clearance items (as many grocery stores do) both times we have purchased these items the packaged goods have all been so far beyond the expiration date that the food has been inedible.; Alot of personal to help their customers. Service with a smile. I do t speak Spanish and the people knew English to assist me. Very friendly customer service. Prices are average for their large inventory. The building looks small from the outside but inside is a good size. The condition of the store is in fair condition. I would definitely recommend this Grocery store to everyone. Parking is right in front of the store and to the right of building. They have plenty of parking for the handicap close to the store. They also will take your groceries to your car to assist you. Shopping carts seem to be in fair condition and they have enough for all their customers.

Walmart has parking. Access for the disabled. You have to wear masks and practice social distancing to enter the
Walmart store. The associate receive you and take your temperature. Then they tell you to put your hands under a machine that sprays hand sanitizer.

Name: Frutos Del Guacabo
Address: Tierras Nuevas Saliente, Manatí 00674, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 1:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: Tierras Nuevas Saliente (administrative_area_level_2); Manatí (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00674 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We had the opportunity recently to visit Frutos del Guacabo as a part of a group experience in Puerto Rico. The time here was excellent, informative, and delicious! We received a tour of the grounds where we were shown the herbs, fruits, and vegetables that are raised to support residents and local restaurants.

We were also treated to a three-course meal on-site. The meal was delicious, fresh, and truly excellent.

The last event during our visit was to watch the making of queso fresco (and to taste it!). We were also served a mango gazpacho that was excellent.

If you have an interest in sustainable farming, excellent food, and people who truly have a dedication to their work, then this is a must-visit place in Puerto Rico.

Oh, and there are goats, chickens, turkeys, and other animals around, which made it all very fun!; The farm tour was an amazing and memorable experience. Learned so much about milking goats, sustainability, farming, planting, food and their different ongoing projects. Everyone I met who works here is lovely. I was also able to push my 6 month old around in her stroller throughout the tour. Lastly, all the food I ate/drank (fruits, tastings, sorbet, lemonade, passion fruit juice, and a 3 course lunch) was incredibly DELICIOUS. Everyone who visits Puerto Rico needs to visit this farm. Hope to visit in the future to purchase local honey again.; Absolutely wonderful experience for our family. Carlos is a brilliant guide and you can sense the love that everyone working here has for the farm. We spent nearly four hours and left feeling like we had become part of the place. It's truly special. We also gained new respect for the island and for the work that goes into bringing the wonderful food items to one's table. Highly recommend.; We had an exceptional time at Fritos del Guacabo. Carlos, our tour guide, showed us the many herbs and edible flowers grown. We tasted everything. We visited the greenhouses. We petted and milked the goats. The snack (more like a feast) of locally grown fruits and cheeses was delightful. And the lunch was over the top good. Vegetarian options available. This was definitely a highlight of our trip to Puerto Rico.; Excellent experience!! The true farm to table excursion of Puerto Rico. Book with Warren International Travel to add this experience to your trip.

Name: Enseres y Gabinetes Xpress

Reviews:
I am still waiting since June 2022 for service on a new refrigerator. The refrigerator has a loose handle and I asked them to fix it. Then they called the refrigerator company for service. They never went!! We returned to the store, please check. They called again and gave me. The company number so I could follow up. Nothing happened. I'll be back in August, I tell the girl and she tells us to take it easy. Well, I'm going to take it easy with this review!!! In addition, the guy who assembled the air that I bought from them, agreed to return to put the cover or foul cover on it, he didn't return either. The lack of follow-ups is not good when you offer a guarantee or supposedly excellent service. I bought them a cheap four-burner stove, don't buy it. That doesn't have any insulation!!!! When you turn on the oven the heat is tremendous. The wall was going to catch fire, it felt hot all the way to the other side. Awful!!!! To let them know.; Good inventory, a complaint was collected in the cabinet and when it was moved to the house the sink did not fit into the hole in the stop, a call was made to wait for the store owners to resolve; Excellent service, delivery and the best price I got. I recommend them 100%.; Top notch customer service!!! Very satisfied. I will definitely return.; Very good service and good prices.
Good pretty and cheap!

I went there a few times because it is convenient around where I want to go. The market is very narrow and hard to push the cart around. They try to utilize every square inch for merchandise. The outside perimeter needs a good steam as well as the inside. The staff is very friendly except a few seafood butchers are kind of looking down on customers.; Rude lady in lane 9 saw me as a white girl and immediately closed her lane. Suddenly there's a older vietnamese behind me and this register is now open. Pretty racist if you ask me.; Do not have them cook lobsters for you.  Lesson learned, they offer to cook lobsters for an extra $3, but all they left are mostly bones and very little lobster meat.  I felt so cheated and don't recommended this serve at all.; Super tight aisles, gets very crowded. But good selection. Butchers were nice.; Well stocked in most Asian food supplies.

Name: EL SUPER MERCADO
Address: 370 Winton Ave, Hayward, CA 94544, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 370 (street_number); Winton Avenue (route); Burbank (neighborhood); Hayward (locality); Alameda County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 94544 (postal_code); 1442 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
What a great store!!! I felt like if I were in a Mexican store. The lady who was in cashier is absolutely nice and kind, she helped us very much.

In addition, there are many products available to purchase, not only from Mexico and other Latin America countries.

They accept payments with credit cards.

Certainly, I recommend it.; The only reason I shop here is because my mom sends me here to get meat. She likes it here because there's less people than at other stores and they have a variety of meats. But look at their produce 🤢 Also, while I was at the register, there was another customer who was not social distancing and the employee said nothing to him. I felt very uncomfortable as he kept getting closer, just not happy that employees don't care to keep their customers safe 😷; Great selection of meat, chicken and pork great for BBQN!! There produce isn't all that great and they don't have all the products like a lot of grocery stores do. This is the spot for your BBQ  needs from carne asada , ribs, marinaded chicken  etc; They have many items, the only problem is that some groceries are not so good and expensive. Especially in the fruits and vegetables section. Sometimes bakery French bread is to steale and other times is good. The advertise items sometimes are spoiling they need better supervision in having fresh items on display. Advertising tags are not accurate with system, you have to be letting cashier know otherwise you get a different price. Sometimes with a bad attitude, they will change it but after calling manager to do the change. One of the cashier wasn't so friendly gave me attitude, and discussion before calling the manager who probably wasn't having a good day either because she had a very anxious attitude but finally changed the price of item. Store very equipped with variety of items but does need more organization and supervision of checking groceries freshness. Otherwise it would be a very convenient place to shop for almost everything. Hopefully they can improve so they can move up their stars.; Small Latino groceries store. It is cheaper compared to other places and the service is fast. They have fried tilapia in the carniceria area. You can also send money to your country. Huge parking lot. Most of the cashiers are very young and not friendly. There is no line when it comes to paying, so you kind of just go in and out. I gave it 3 starts because it doesn't feel clean, and it feels crowded with groceries. I recommend it because prices are worth it.

Name: Grocery Outlet
Address: 1120 W 6th St Ste 103, Los Angeles, CA 90017, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: Ste 103 (subpremise); 1120 (street_number); West 6th Street (route); Westlake (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90017 (postal_code)
Reviews:
First time here, passed it many times. Parking structure with free spaces for the store. Smaller store, but clean and organized. Not much produce available, and a lot of the fruit had gone bad. Lots of options and as always good prices. Highly recommend this location and will return, friendly staff as well.; I find Grocery Outlet to be great for buying groceries at a discount price, but I found a few issues here. The front entrance is almost always closed so you have to go through the entrance at the parking lot. I know it’s a small sized store, but somehow they have an insufficient amount of shopping carts and baskets. Also be cautious if you’re buying meat here, as some may have gone past the expiration date and still sitting on the shelves.; I can't say enough about the deals I find at the store. I love my sardines. You guys have some great deals. I almost want to say steals.; Do you know I went in here they have some good prices and I also bought me one of them cups that keep the cold and keep it hot firmer cut or something like that. It was Reebok and it was 799. I like that store cool store tried out.; I recently had the pleasure of shopping at Grocery Outlet, and I have to say, it was a fantastic experience! Not only was the store clean and well-organized, but the selection of items was absolutely amazing. From fresh produce to pantry staples, this store had everything I needed and more.

What really stood out to me, though, was the incredible deals that I found. There were so many cool and unique items at prices that were unbeatable. I was able to stock up on all sorts of goodies without breaking the bank.

Overall, I would highly recommend Grocery Outlet to anyone looking for a great shopping experience. The selection is unbeatable, the prices are fantastic, and there's always something interesting to discover. Whether you're looking for a quick snack or ingredients for a gourmet meal, this store has got you covered. Don't miss out on all the great deals and amazing finds at Grocery Outlet!

Name: A Dong Supermarket
Address: 9221 Bolsa Ave, Westminster, CA 92683, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 9221 (street_number); Bolsa Avenue (route); Westminster (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92683 (postal_code); 5534 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Not the best, but not the worst.

They have all of the usual and basic grocery items. Usually when I come, there are decent deals on certain groceries and a wide variety. They almost always have my mom’s favorite vegetables and greens. It is often crowded, however, and gets tough during peak times.

The meat deli counter was really crowded today and they don’t have a number system so it was pretty hectic. My mom and I waited for 10 minutes before we were helped because people kept cutting in front of us.

Compared to other supermarkets in the area, this one is actually kind of small. There are less than 10 aisles and it’s also kind of dirty. Being dirty is actually pretty normal for Asian supermarkets, but this one seems a lot dirtier than others. The parking might be difficult as well because it’s in the heart of Little Saigon, right across the Asian Garden Mall, and in a popular plaza. My family and I always manage to find a parking spot though so it shouldn’t be too big of a problem.

Overall, a decent choice.; Best way I can put it. It’s basically like a 99 ranch market except a bit more local/Vietnamese oriented. I did find these 3 in 1 instant coffees which are great for when you’re on the go and need a quick pick me up.; Supermarket has everything you need to cook your Vietnamese dishes. From produce, to meats and seafoods, to dry goods. Every area is labeled for your convenience. Store generally doesn't smell like some other markets I've been to. Clean store compared to others. Prices are good. They usually are at where other competitors if not, beat their prices. Overall, great market.; I absolutely love Little Saigon!! They made their meat loaf fresh each and every day! Coming from Utah, we appreciate all the delicious food they have to offer. This is just one of the supermarkets, and they are plenty more!!; It's my To-Go place for Vietnamese ingredients most of the time. The price is usually good and competitive, especially meat. But Fruits and Vegetables are sometimes fresh, sometimes soso. The way they display the sale prices with bright pink papers are easier to locate compared to other supermarkets. The only inconvenience is the annoying parking lot.

Reviews: The gentleman and owner of this store have been in business for many years. It has been my experience of his kind and straightforward professionalism. I needed ingredients traveling from the Dominion area and he was willing to wait after business hours so we could purchase what we needed. Great products and for those who know the supply chain industries I would say that prices are fairly priced considering the specific products he carries and the niche market he serves. I hope to see shops like this continue and would rather support them than big-box stores.🇵🇷; Tiny shop specializing in Puerto Rican food and other fun items for home sick folks from there (flags, tee shirts, etc) Good mix of stuff. Reviews: A South American jewel in San Antonio!I used to drive Austin, Houston to get food from home, until now that I found this place!! Colombian, Venezuelan, Puerto Rican, Peruvian, Dominican, Panamanian, and so much more! They have unique things from home, I have a great time traveling in space to my childhood on the store.The store was organized, the employees were friendly and approachable.; You would think they have one of the most basic and iconic Latin products like TORTILLAS. And they don’t. 😓; It’s Just Great to Find items that are not carried in Big Branch Supermarkets. Very Organized and ingredients that make Latin Cooking top Notch!; They have even ointment for to relax muscle pain great stuff; You have to know what you want. (Specific may have to special order)

Name: Central Market
Address: 4821 Broadway, San Antonio, TX 78209, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 4821 (street_number); Broadway (route); Uptown Central (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78209 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This place is AWESOME!!! My goal is to come take a cooking class here soon and do my best to drive out here and shop for groceries at least once a month, I live pretty far from here in, otherwise I would definitely stop by more frequently.  Love the large amounts of variety for everything! And that it’s the highest quality of food options HEB has to offer.  Definitely felt like a little kid at Christmas 🤩😆💯👏🏼 because I love reading labels and understanding where my food comes from!; San Antonio Central Market often has expired food on its shelves. Not mentioning the moldy smell inside the store and disgusting odor by the fish and meat departments. Cheese shelves are covered in mold and I would never risk of buying any dairy product at this store (many times I’ve witnessed how yogurt, kefir, sour cream were standing on the floor without attention for a very long time before the employees started putting them in the refrigerators).
Food often expired and the cakes often looked unprofessionally decorated. Fruits in the fruit cakes are often molded and heavily covered in gelatin.
Every time I come I have to be extra careful and check the expiration dates and inspect the fresh produce.
I think San Antonio deserves better.; We purchased a Central Market custom vase floral arrangement and an Anthony’s chocolate mousse cake from here. The flowers were absolutely gorgeous and the chocolate mousse cake was excellent. This is our go to place for the best chocolate mousse cake around. This cake is always fresh and tastes very good. The floral arrangements are second to none! Absolutely stunning flowers! The flower arrangements can be pricey depending on what you purchase but you get your money’s worth. You will not be disappointed! We visit here often for fresh pastries, fresh meats, fresh fruits, artisanal meats and cheeses and fresh vegetables. Absolutely love their store selection of groceries. Great customer service. Ample parking.
Will definitely return again and would certainly recommend this place.; We bought our florals for our wedding here and they were so gorgeous, and reasonably priced. I didn't get photos of everything, but I had a cascading bouquet, baby's breath bouquets for my bridesmaids, boutineers, and corsages for our flower girls. It was all so nicely made.; Adorable! Got some tiramisu today. Had a complimentary snack. The ladies must have known that I hadn’t eaten much all day because they were just so sweet.

Name: H-E-B
Address: 5601 Bandera Rd, San Antonio, TX 78238, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 5601 (street_number); Bandera Road (route); Inner West Side (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78238 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This Heb has to be the most disorganized.

Starting from the parking lot, they’re doing a lot of renovations so half of the lots is filled up with shipping containers. Not to mention this HEB gets so much traffic so it makes it worse to even park.

Going inside is another battle and they’re so many people that it’s really hard to walk by isles. Doesn’t matter what time you come it’s always busy.

Lots of the isle are closed and rearranged so it makes it really hard to find items such as bread placed right near all the cleaning supplies.

Lots of the produce is rotting and has low quantities.

This is the closest HEB to me and it really disappoints me that HEB doesn’t pay attention to the low income communities, I get that Alon Heb has higher income & north side communities have more money to have better facilities.

But it makes me sad that Heb doesn’t focus on the real issues in the west, south & east side lower income communities.

All that being said this Heb is wack.; This HEB is huge and has a ton of selections on everything. The staff is very helpful. However they could get some more parking for the curbside orders. Last time I had issues finding a slot to park in cause they were all taken.; Is the bakery manager proud of this? Because it's on display. Love the chips but can't buy them here. Half full bag of chips for full price. I go to any other store and they are full bags. Embarrassing...; Waited in the curbside for about 25)30 minutes for only 2 baby formula an waters . An there's other cars who got there stuff first but haven't been waiting for more then 10 minutes. Horrible service. You can't say there short staffed cause heb never is.; Ordered a birthday cake! I expected a better-looking cake for the price. Especially for a small cake. Writing should have been on top of the cake instead of the side of the cake. The ribbon with writing made it tacky!

Now I think I found my new favorite HEB store in San Antonio. We will be back!!; I love HEB it's a very good store well stocked low prices even because of the economic downturn we're seeing in the economy they still try to help everyday families with meal deals and specials and buying things in large amounts and giving discounts. Use the digital coupons and the in-store coupons and try to get the best grocery prices that you possibly can much better selection than Walmart.; I visited HEB (near De Zavala road) today. The store was amazing. The way the products were displayed were spectacular. The produces were arranged in such a manner that it’s pleasant to the eyes. Great work team. Much appreciated.; There’s a good reason why I only gave it 3 stars. This store is very limited with products. Don’t get me wrong they do have items but not like the store on huebner store And this is also said by their own employees.  They even say,It doesn’t carry a lot products  like the other big stores hair products they can have more.   like the store  on Huebner /Babcock rd.  De Zavala HEB It’s closer to me. However I won’t go there. My son also works for a HEB store on the other side of town.  And even  he noticed the same thing.  I didn’t have to tell him anything.  When we were having a cookout this summer.  You will find out for your self go and look for a product that your going to want they don’t carry what item. Like other HEB stores carry and  they should . It’s a big store there’s no reason.  Also for the longest time all HEB stores do not have Apple Pay. And just last week this store now has Apple Pay so that’s a good thing for all of us that have apple phones.  You got there you’ll love that .  However I was told not all HEB store are on board with Apple Pay.; I love my HEB and this review for delivery guy curly hair! For the LOVE OF GODS, PLEASE, tell your delivery drivers to keep their darn music down, there is a guy right now it's 4PM delivering food at the Stonehouse apartments, and the music is so high that our walls are shaking. Some of us have small kids and they might be sleeping, and that is unacceptable. This is not a open road or something, there are people living here, some of them are small kids and some of them are old and maybe sick. Thank you!!

Name: H-E-B
Address: 10660 FM471, San Antonio, TX 78251, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Vicinity: 10660 Farm to Market Road 471, San Antonio
Address Components: 10660 (street_number); Farm to Market Road 471 (route); Far West Side (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78251 (postal_code)
Reviews: love this location. Let me tell you why, one day I was shopping with my wife and my sugars had dropped a little low and during this time they were doing sampling and got a little piece of a granola bar and the young lady was kind enough to give me a whole granola bar. its nice to know there are kind people working here. i dont know her name but big shout out to her.; Preeti, thank you so much for the amazing cake design. Went above and beyond :,) I know my coworkers will love it! You’re the best! First time using HEB bakery for cakes and def will be my go to!; This is the only HEB that has issues that I've experienced. Had to wait over 5 minutes as the guest in front had a coupon issue and the cashier and manager didn't use walkie talkies to verify that they'll honor the price. My frozen stuff was almost thawed out.; I had a little over 10 items and some girl came over and said I would have to go to a different line. There were at least 6 registers open with no line and was hardly busy in the store. I came down with food poisoning and had not eaten in 48 hours and was just getting some soups and crackers and drinks. I said I was just not feeling well and if I could just checkout quickly to get back home I would appreciate it. She said no and turned the register off right in front of me. Unprofessional, lack of empathy, and just a cold person. I will not be coming back to this location.; I worked for HEB for almost 15 years. I saw a company that cared for its partners community and customers… even neighbors! Now that being said I have taken what I learned in my management positions with in the company where I grew up and kept a lot of my work ethic and heart for others when training and working where I work now. My fiance and I had such a bad experience with this location on culebra and 1604. We had came home after our one of many grocery trips with some not so cheap steaks that had a whole in the wrap covering the steaks. I of course called the store to let them know which around closing time for business center… no problem I could bring it in at a later date. Being a working women raising kids and what not my fiance finally said hunny do you want me to take that meat back- two weeks later. I said yes and that’s where the problem began. He called me so upset saying there was horrible customer service kept saying we were trying to scam heb.  Saying it’s not their fault we kept the meat that they would not replace. When he told me this it got me very heated. I called and spoke to a child that was telling me same thing that we were trying to take from the comapny. Mind you again I had worked almost 15 years with The company 10 being management. Laughing saying same thing over and over. I asked for names and told them I did not  appreciate how either one of us were treated. Laughed some more passed phone to next mic. Now another kid saying we can not give out our names. I asked for upper management to contact me nothing!! A lot of stuff in between back and forth heb policy wise- H‑E‑B  guaranteed products 100% . We did not want our money back we wanted to replace our meat again that was not cheap. We even said we will pay difference. Now fast forward my other half is finishing shopping for diapers meat and other things we needed for our family. Now he is being followed in the store. He is covered in paint from restoring old vintage cars… being targeted and again followed through out the store as if he is going to steal. I called back to store and those two managers  opening  said we were watching to make sure he wasn’t gonna put meat back and steal fresh meat. Oh at this point I was so upset ! How could these bad apples do this to such a good company. How many people did they make feel like the way we do.Again never received a call back. Called and spoke to a lady that did give me her name but told me the same thing. They don’t honor hebs 100% guaranteed for meat even though it was damaged. that for meat that i would have to take the loss that is why I wasn’t contacted back. Oh and then later said It was never communicated about this. ( which I had to call and contact them again today) I called that evening this happened  to another store. I will say this Will the mic from Potranco location… he is what makes HEB the top store!! He is the reason the company has such a well respected name .He apologized multiple times and said that is not the correct representation of the company. To take the meat back to his store and he would replace it for us. My fiance had already trashed the meat on his way home.said not ever has he gone to a store and made feel this way. We are in our thirty’s we work hard for our family. I was not going to go take it out of the trash!!! Now I’m to the point that just because I can’t fix this from the inside like I could of before and keep the heb proud work ethic- or taking this and coaching my partners I can be the voice as a customer. I a proud heb customer and say this is not hebs way to make people feel horrible!! To make people that work hard to be kind hearted people and do the right thing. We did not want our money back… maybe if this was delivered a better way would I not have to handle this on google!

Name: Walmart Neighborhood Market
Address: 9526 Military Dr W, San Antonio, TX 78251, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 9526 (street_number); Military Drive West (route); Far West Side (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78251 (postal_code)
Reviews:
It's great for a quick stop on the way home or when something simple is needed for dinner or bbq. The service is mediocre at best, and the employees are not necessarily the friendliest. Love that they limit the number of high school students who come in during and after school (one out = one in).; July 2022. I went in to grab a few items, then forgot to get some other items too. So the female you see , in the provided picture , basically watched me during the first transaction. But as I came back to the same self checkout lane to purchase additional items, pay for it, & bagged these additional items. Yup! She was standing there the whole time watching me and guess what she asks me? Can I see your receipt 🧾 and check your bags 😆😂 . H-E-B  had never done this to me but Walmart better be careful as to why y'all keep getting sued!!
And here's the kicker I still shop there 😆😆😂😂; If you ever see this sweet lady Maria the store manager running around just stop her and say hi; This was the best Walmart I've ever been to pleasantly upscale. The staff was also very helpful and everyone had a big smile on their face.; My favorite Market store. Every employee welcomes you with a smile and everyone is ready to assist. Produce is always fresh and every aisle is clean and well kept.Management is always interacting with customers and that is the reason I am always delighted to return.
February 17 2021 Winter blast update. I thank each of the employees and Management for putting their own safety at risk to provide much needed food and essentials to thousands of customers. If they had not opened I would have not been able to give my kids milk. Thank you MOD Laura for always helping customers. This store deserves a raise!
This stores has a great team and they care about their community. Thank you Elisa and Erika for organizing and putting together the Trunk O Treat.

Reviews: Best store ever!   Has everything you need!   Great variety and choices!   Great everything!   Great prices!   Everything fresh!; I am a consumer and I personally remember when this very store used to be Handy andy the poultry, seafood,beef,food areas have always been freezer burned products now formally Arlans I pass through the same areas looks the same NO CHANGE.; I love shopping here! The staff is amazing and I always enjoy talking to Veronica. She always has the answers to my questions and takes the time out to listen. This store offers items that are hard to find other places. They also do a great job at keeping the store clean. I’d give them 10 stars if I could!; Some things are overpriced but it's quiet clean and I can use my phone for tap to pay. Something I can't do at Walmart or HEB.; People, I hope you enjoy this review and pictures because I almost got "called on the police and arrested" for taking pictures inside the store 🤣😂

Name: Walmart Neighborhood Market
Address: 9005 FM1560, San Antonio, TX 78254, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Vicinity: 9005 Farm to Market Road 1560, San Antonio
Address Components: 9005 (street_number); Farm to Market Road 1560 (route); Far West Side (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78254 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Update: they replaced the regular check out registers with self check out. No actual cashiers. I was told they could help me check myself out.  I noped and left the groceries I was going to purchase and left the store.

They made the aisles longer and closer together so it's hard to get around. When the aisles were split in 2 you could easily go find what you need and get out. Now I don't know where anything is. They changed the sign colors from green and orange to a bland white and blue. It's hard to park now.
They moved the pickup parking spots to where the gas pumps are.  My usual parking spot.
No longer your friendly neighborhood walmart. It's just down the road but I'd rather go to heb now.

Would not recommend.; Amazing Walmart! Some amazing guy grabbed me wearing a McDonald’s uniform gave me 13 special sauce sandwiches! Made with his sauce! Super tasty. My friend zec joined in on the eating aswell! He was gay! If you see him. Say hi!; Never enough real cashiers. We have now gotten vegetables with tiny bugs in them. Lettuce, kale, cilantro, and more. Multiple times in the past 2 months.; Horrible customer service! I Visited this Walmart this evening and it only has self checkout..while checking out I accidentally scanned something twice and needed it removed so I called over a employee for assistance and she seemed soooo bugged to have to help me remove the item and the other employee was over on the other side laughing.. like seriously I had zero training as a Walmart employee so calm down..
Needless to say I won’t be returning again.; This is the smallest Walmart I have ever been too , it’s has veggie, groceries  , pharmacy , cosmetics, small session of seasonal toys , it’s was neat and clean , you can find the Walmart gas station opposite to it which makes it convenient if you want to fill up the gas . No rush like the big Walmarts , veggies were fresh I loved the snack session it had good varieties.

Address: 999 E Basse Rd Ste 150, San Antonio, TX 78209, USA

Address Components: Ste 150 (subpremise); 999 (street_number); East Basse Road (route); San Antonio International Airport Vicinity (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78209 (postal_code)
Reviews: Had my groceries delivered today.  I wanted steak.  Mind you I won't get a quality restaurant steak. But I received an appetizer.  My Bag Of chips is bigger than my steak.  Stop having teenagers shop our orders. They don't care about quality,  quantity and getting more for my buck.  Ripping us off in this economy; Ongoing renovations make it little challenging to navigate to this store (parking & driving). Store is clean and well stocked. Check out was easy. Staff was friendly.  Overall good experience.; I asked for double brisket and only got two pieces. This is NOT double. This is what I usually get with for a normal order, which is usually by the way, 3-4 pieces! I just paid extra for nothing. On top of that I did not receive the sides like bread and pickles. Thanks for ripping me off; Let me start by saying that my family and I love this location. All of the staff is amazing. This review is based solely on the floral department. I spoke to someone in this department at least 2 monthsb ago. I don't remember the exact date. I asked about getting a replica floral arrangement of my wife's bouquet for our anniversary. 5 bright blue hydrangea as base and 6-7 ivory roses topped with white gardenia. I know gardenias is pricey. They called me 3 weeks ago and told me the price for the arrangement. So I went in to pay for the arrangement because the gardenias are expensive they required payment at least this is what i was told. I then got a call on Sunday before I was supposed to pick them up on Thursday to inform me that they could not get the gardenias, so my opinions were cancel the order, I can go by fake flowers and they will just add the to the arrangement of substitute for a different flower. When I went to pick them up on Thursday, I asked if I was going to get some sort of rebate, but I was told (no, this is what you get). This department is not worth it. Destiny is amazing, and she is the only reason that I would buy flowers from here again, but I would never even recommend ordering specialty flowers from them again. They ruined my anniversary.; Newly renovated just like all the new HEBs being built. They also have Turkey Legs which are hard to find 🦃

Name: Sprouts Farmers Market
Address: 8101 Callaghan Rd, San Antonio, TX 78230, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 8101 (street_number); Callaghan Road (route); Vance Jackson (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78230 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I love Sprouts so much! It's kind of like a healthy Trader Joe's but with a lot more selection. I love that all the options are healthy and convenient but also affordable. I always recommend this place to anyone trying to change the way they eat because they just make it so much easier.

The people here are also really sweet, I tend to chat with some of the stockers every time I'm there. Just a really good, affordable place overall ❤️; The customer service was top-notch, with attentive and friendly staff who went above and beyond to meet my needs. The quality of the product exceeded my expectations, showcasing excellent selection. The entire process, from ordering to delivery, was seamless and efficient. I highly recommend this company to anyone looking for outstanding products and superior service. I will definitely be a returning customer!; This is the sketchiest sprouts I’ve ever been to. None of the employees look like they even want to be there. The cashiers are extremely slow, almost feels intentional. Then they can’t even be bothered to apologize for the wait or to even greet you with a smile. The cashier I had was very snooty.  The self check out lanes were roped off so you have no choice but to wait in line forever. This whole place has a weird vibe and I didn’t even feel safe in the parking lot.  Definitely not coming back to this location.; It was a nice shopping experience. Came to look for castile soap and a face serum. Found it right here. No complaints...; I go here twice maybe three times a week and I buy mainly organic foods. In the last 2 years, I figured they would change their way of handling produce and even storing process. Theres not a single visit that goes by that I find moldy fruit. Bruised fruit. Even some expired produce. Pathetic. And when you try asking a question, it’s as if you’ve bothered them. Meh. Other than that, their vitmain section is good. Meat dept could at least have someone at the from at all times. It sucks to wait........and wait. But their. Biggest downfall, is how they only have two registers open. When they call for back up, managers do not even hurry to assist. They walk and look at you like a deer on headlight. They also recently added two express lanes but they’re non existent. It’s more a Mural than anything.

Name: H-E-B plus!
Address: 20935 U.S. Hwy 281 N, San Antonio, TX 78258, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 20935 (street_number); U.S. Highway 281 North (route); Far North Central (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78258 (postal_code)
Reviews:
What happened to HEB?  It’s like going to Walmart with a red color scheme…nasty meat and rude employees.  Went to the meat department, all the Milanese steaks were turning green, no problem, it happens sometimes…take an uncut “eye round” to the butcher to see if he can just slice this piece up for me since the others are TURNING GREEN.  He says we don’t do that and I can’t help you.  I didn’t mind coming to HEB and paying a little more, I like supporting Texas companies and they used to have better quality products.  It’s a shame how far they’ve fallen…see attached pictures for the “quality” steaks HEB sells.; You can tell this a very affluent side of town.  The HEB plus near me doesn't look nearly this nice.  Very big and fancy looking.  It has a sit in area and a garden center.; Lately when I buy fruits from HEB within couple of days the fruits go bad, I work 12 hours a day. I don’t have time to go return the fruits to them,I’m very disappointed with heb products. I will not buy fruits from heb again.; Great store.  I liked the layout.  Was trying to find something, so I asked a worker in the store.  They looked it up on their phone and pointed me to the right aisle.  Service with a smile.  I love HEB, and it's nice to find one where the people are as nice as the one close to me - traveling and visiting family.; Usually, this HEB location is great. Been going to it the last 3 years. Never have I ever had one complaint about HEB in my entire life.
Today, I was getting checked out by (my receipt says) Kathy L.
Not a smile or a hello or any greeting. She seemed to have an upset/disgust look on her face. I made a little joke about the raw chicken and not once did she acknowledge me speaking. She didn’t even tell me my total I had to ask if she was ready for me to pay. Handed me my receipt and said here you go.
Hope she has a better day.
Other than that, this HEB location is always great.

Name: Whole Foods Market
Address: 255 E Basse Rd Suite 130, San Antonio, TX 78209, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Vicinity: 255 East Basse Road Suite 130, San Antonio
Address Components: Suite 130 (subpremise); 255 (street_number); East Basse Road (route); San Antonio International Airport Vicinity (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78209 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I was so excited to get the Berry Chantilly cake I had tried at a work event. I got it for my brother’s birthday. I even got 2 of them because I wanted everyone to try it since I had loved it so much.. well, I was so disappointed when we cut into the cake, it had a price of parchment paper along the middle section… I can’t believe Whole Foods would let something like get by.; My sister and her special needs class went to have lunch here. Unfortunately she had a bad experience. They were looking forward to having pizza but the workers were not working. They were just talking to each other and they didn’t even greet her or her class mates. So they left and decided to have lunch somewhere else. I’ve worked in fast food places for many years and I know what it’s like to get rude customers and develop an attitude where you just don’t want to talk to anyone, but they’re are still customers who need assistance & I hope that they can work at being better at helping their customers.; What a shame. Ever since Amazon took over they treat their staff badly and have priced themselves out of the market. I used to go all the time. I no longer think it's value or even quality. I prefer central market for luxury or clean food. It's a real shame they used to be excellent. But health should not be at this price. Plus they no longer sell the vast selection of makeup they used to which was great and they don't sell as much foreign import or seasonal food. Overall not recommended.; The store is stocked with a wide variety of high quality healthy and organic items. You can find something for everyone.
The store is clean and well organized.  Yet, the elderly female cashier could use more customer service training. She didn't greet nor acknowledge me when I was paying.  She was too busy yapping with the young bagger.  I rate based on customer service 1st. This place gets 3 stars, particularly because of my experience with that cashier.  Regardless, come check them out for yourself!; They are always decent never disappoint, except I am kind of mad they got rid of the carts for kids. Overall the deli always has really good meats and the soap selection is nice.

Name: Whole Foods Market
Address: 18403 Blanco Rd, San Antonio, TX 78258, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 18403 (street_number); Blanco Road (route); Far North Central (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78258 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Having grown up in Austin when Whole Foods was a local grocery store… still highest quality… great place to grab a salad or real food to eat on the go or hang out … pricey but worth it; I love this place! I love all the products and how clean and well stocked everything always is!  I got some soap bars and got a 33% discount because I have Amazon Prime 😁👏🏼🤩

Restrooms are always clean, and everyone is always helpful and nice.  I love the space outside where I can enjoy a healthy meal I just got from the salad bar, and the overall environment is great!; Good selection of items you can't find at other grocery stores but a bit pricey.

**update** I used to go there because they had a bar that had a good rotation of beers every couple of weeks and i could sit there while my wife shopped; they removed it. I then kept going there because they still had several unique beers to choose from in their alcohol section. They no longer have a diverse enough selection to justify me getting my beer there. They still periodically have great deals on fruits though.; Good WFs, as its clean, large, nicely laid out, has both indoor and outdoor seating, easy parking, etc.
I’d love to see better grab and go food, or hot bar offerings. Myself and my coworkers rely heavily on these amenities since we travel almost every week and need healthy food options that don’t use inflammatory oils and other harmful products. But it seems like WFs is still behind the curve on this one. Otherwise, to the average customer, this is a great stop for necessities.; I enjoy shopping at Whole Foods. Unfortunately, San Antonio only has 2 in the entire huge City of San Antonio! Compared to much smaller cities, like Minneapolis, MN, there you can find 5 WHOLE FOODS MARKET!!! They also have a much better selection!
This Whole Foods on Blanco Road in S.A. is getting worse by the month! The Bakery has a sad selection, and  Rotisserie chickens are not done until way after lunch hours! Compared to other states, this WHOLE FOODS MARKET is an embarrassment. I have to drive 20 miles to get to the nearest Whole food market in San Antonio, which is embarrassing enough for such a large city, just to find out, that I will not get many products in this store!

Name: Walmart Neighborhood Market
Address: 4226 De Zavala Rd, San Antonio, TX 78249, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Reviews: Hi! I called ahead to see if this location carried some cards (since some smaller neighborhood markets sizes will have some at the checkout station) but I was very rudely informed over the phone that they did not carry this item by Christian. I remained very friendly, and I was glad I called ahead since it turned out they didn’t have the item, although the level of rudeness was extremely palpable and unnecessary. I was also hung up on almost immediately. I work in costumer service myself, so while I understand a long day, I’m hoping my next call or visit will be met with more civility and kindness.; I just want to mention that the Walmart Neighborhood Market concept has turned  out to be a fantastic success story seldom acknowledged anywhere.  The food quality is better than I expected by light-years with truly fair pricing all the While.  While the H-E-B  and Walmart Mega-Store  down the street are a sea of chaotic Suburban mayham I grin as I go the back way, down  an empty street nobody knows about, only to arrive at  this brand new store with an honestly small town vibe.  What I noticed was that people actually talk to each other instead of desperately trying not to run into each other.  Sometimes it's the simple things that make a place truly unique.; The supervisor this location she's really rude. I have been shopping from this store for almost 10 years and the last couple times I'm in and she's not nice. I have been working customers service too but never treated people this way. I saw her stand at the customers service and I asked if I can get cigarettes and she said if I can read the sign. Another times she's telling to get out with my puppy,,  I don't know that I can't take dog in there but she should be little nice to tell me.; Y’all need to carry the new @BeatBox flavors and show some patriotism lol. Red white and blue; This is a small market but everything you need is here.  It’s always clean and well stocked and you don’t need to go on a scavenger hunt to find the name brand products like at HEB!  Wish they would build one in the stone oak area.

Name: Walmart Neighborhood Market
Address: 9006 Guilbeau Rd, San Antonio, TX 78250, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 9006 (street_number); Guilbeau Road (route); Far West Side (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78250 (postal_code); 2650 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
In a very compact area in a parking lot full of other business'.
Hard to get in and out parking spots with all the traffic moseying through.
Inside the store was nice, only thing is that all the scan and go registers were "CARD ONLY."
They had only 1 register open for cash payments. The line was very long.
There were 3 employees just standing at the front of registers doing nothing. Walmart be slacking a lot lately at quite a few locations in san antonio.
There is an H.E.B. right down the street from here on New Guilbeau. OPT TO GO THERE INSTEAD.; This neighborhood walmart is the worst one I've ever been in. The customer service is horrible. They depend on the self checkouts and huff and puff if they have to actually do their job of checking out a customer! There is one truly lazy chick in there that looks like she'd rather be anywhere in the world BUT at work at Walmart. There are sometimes elderly people in carts and she doesn't lift a finger to help. If someone needs a price check she acts like they asked her to walk to Russia instead of doing her job to by pressing a few buttons on the computer register. The problem is that  she's not the ONLY lazy one, she's just the laziest one! Lately, I've been driving to the  neighborhood store on Hunt and Military just to avoid the poor service at Tezel.; overall no issues, however there are never enough baskets to shop, and it isn't due to the fact everyone is using one, there's only 6-8 from what I counted. Some need to be put on order. constantly have to ask selfcheckout  for one and doesnt seem they are making an attempt to grab them and put them up front by their feet let alone the front door when shoppers are done with them. small store = more small baskets.

I will note I asked the self check out for one, and rather than looking to see if one is sitting unused under the counters I got "oh they most all be in use" went and got one myself

otherwise lines are quick, store is coldest store which I love, and nearby making it
convenient

please order baskets
Thanks, - your local shopper; Quick and convenient. Easy to get in and get out, but still a great selection. And the same price as big Walmart! The majority of checkout aisles are self-checkout making it even simpler to get what you need quickly.
One complaint: It is cold in this store. 🥶; This is actually a nice little store. They keep it well stocked and clean, and the people are friendly. It’s a lot easier to get in and out of than the larger Walmarts.

Reviews: I just love this HEB...I drove from Alamo heights area...wish they would hurry up and fix their store. Everyone was so nice even a young manager.; My sister-in-law Loves this location!  The Wine and Cheese sections keep her occupied for quite a while! We All shop and find New items to try!! Love It!; The best HEB in the area!!  The store is very clean and well stocked.  There is a large kosher food section.  This HEB has a wonderful wine 'cellar' with many selections available to serve all budgets and a very knowledgeable staff working in the wine area that will be happy to assist with selection suggestions.  Many sumptuous cakes, pies, tarts and other baked goods to tempt the sweet tooth...plus many choices of freshly made breads...from rye to french baguettes.  Lastly just a step away from the bakery you'll find an extensive selection of freshly prepared complete meals.  Just pop in the microwave or the oven and dinner is served!  You can choose from a NY Strip steak with in season vegetable, Mexican, Italian, Mediterranean,  Chinese cuisine anr standard American fare.  For those with dietary concerns there is a selection of vegetarian and gluten free freshly prepared meals available as well.; Too busy and hard to get out of the parking lot. However I love this grocery store; Visited Whataburger and as,always the Burger was very good...

Name: Molina's San Antonio Country Store
Address: 700 N Alamo St, San Antonio, TX 78215, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 700 (street_number); North Alamo Street (route); Downtown (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78215 (postal_code); 1811 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
1st Time Here. Clean store. But it seems they dont want to Fix the Restrooms for the paying Customer?
The Molina's Hamburger Combo was Delicious,  fresh Vegetables, Tasty Good Meat, Nice puffy Buns and what I really liked there was No Grease coming out of the Burger. Just for this Tasty Delicious Burger and the CLEANEST of the Store they get 3 stars🌟
I will come again but I will leave if these Restrooms ARE NOT FIXED.; This store gets 1 star today because I am sincerely grieved by what I have just experienced. What I thought was a little gem, became one of my WORST experiences with customer care to date. RUDE staff. I have an office across the street and walked over with to grab a bite btw clients. Its Good Friday. I chose the fish plate (rice, beans, and I asked for a popper). I was handed a ticket that I took to the clerk. The clerk stated she did not need my ticket. As I do not know their procedures, it had appeared they'd conferred regarding my order. I paid via Apple Pay and leave.

No sooner was I headed to cross the street did I hear commotion behind me, I helpful bystander, "hey!" and gesturing over to the clerks and guard by the door, "You didn't pay for that popper!" Mind you this is a $3-$4 item and I'm getting accused as if I've stolen something, essentially front of my own business with clients on the way, smh. I state that I did offer to hand her my ticket and she just went on, "I don't know what you order by that ticket." As if I am to know what their procedures are... smh.

She said she had it, "you got the plate." At the counter (and with more privacy), I let her know that I did not appreciate her attitude with me either. It became an argument with me, as the customer, that she did not HAVE an attitude, that she would have had to pay for that pepper popper. I did let her know that that information was not necessary, that her attitude was NOT okay! The 2nd clerk, that I thought would intervene with de-escalation tools for customer care, instead escalated with, "WELL IF YOU DON'T LIKE OUR ATTITUDE HERE THEN YOU CAN LEAVE!! AND DON'T COME BACK IN HERE!!" AND proceeded to ask the security to escort me out. Once outside, I was grateful for him as he held space with me, meeting me with professionalism and basic civility. I recommend this security guard, Officer Mata, provide this STAFF with a training on handling community. He was amazing. Had any given juncture of this ordeal been met with "our apologies, we failed to ring up an item, would you mind, xyz.." this would have been a small matter. Instead I was met with JUVENILE BEHAVIOR and a SENIOR staff endorsing it. As a psychotherapist working across the way, ESPECIALLY, this public display and accusation could have threatened my business this day, not to mention my LICENSE for failure comply with law. ETHICAL standards ought to apply everywhere, treating customers with DECENCY from homeless to fellow businesses alike. I honestly felt targeted as I am also a black woman as well. It wreaked of micro-aggression. I will ABSOLUTELY hold my responsibility for ADVOCATING against social injustice until I meet with management or hear back from corporate, SOMEONE, that represents the company, that can respond with civility instead of BANNING me for being severely grieved today. God HELP US.; I stop there almost every morning for various stuff. I don't know her name but her and her son have both helped me. They are so respected by me . Becky is so kind helpful she is asome. also The whole staff there is top notch. Food is always the best. Management go ahead give them all raise. I have stopped there in the afternoon the afternoon Guy's are very respectful and take care me they number 1. Calvin; Friendly staff, security outside, slurpees, Mexican snacks, fresh made food and fresh market. Couldn’t ask for more!!!; Nothing has a price and the cooked food tastes horrible and to top is off they don’t offer cash back! TRASH!!!

Reviews:
I am not sure if all locations are the same but this location of Michoacana Meat Market is unfortunately attended by staff who treat all clientele with some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced.  I have been going here for the prices of some products but am seriously considering to no longer go just due to the horrible customer service. Not sure if the employees are mistreated or what but management should pay attention and train staff to use common courtesy with the customers. I do not recommend. 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻; UPDATED: I lived across the street literally AND this was not my first bad experience with them. This is just the time when I decided was enough. I was trying to give them the benefit of the doubt. They failed me every time, until, the third time was a charm. Also, the previous issues had to do with their hot food section. Now to continue back to the review...... I go here ALL the time and spend daily. I spend over 10+ dollars a day and MORE. I just had a bad experience with them a bit ago. I went to buy some eggs size jumbo and a pound of pinto beans. I only had 5.57 to spend because I'm a lil low on cash due to not getting paid until Wednesday. I was paying attention to prices I mean it was ONLY 2 ITEMS. The eggs and many other dozen cartons were placed under the price of 3.39 and the beans were 1.69 for a total of 5.08. Why was the total 6.08 and they were charging me 4.49 for the eggs. I was a bit embarrassed due to not having enough so I just had her put the beans back and I paid for the eggs and left. I realized when I got home so I called them. The man tried blaming the customers saying they move things around. I explained to him there was several cartons there. He asked me to walk back WITH THE EGGS and receipt so that he could give me the eggs for the price. Then I let the girls know and they DENY me by giving me another excuse saying that's what they cost and they had to make room for them to fit. What does putting them under a price that's UNDER A DOLLAR MORE got to do with yall not having room for your product that you're choosing to sell. Don't over order if you have no room. That was rude and not considerate of a walking, paying customer. Aside from making me walk back just to tell me NO THAT'S WHAT THEY COST. PLEASE PAY ATTENTION TO THE PRICES WHEN BEING RUNG UP AND DON'T FALL INTO THE SMILES AS THAT IS WHAT IS USED TO THROW YOU OFF TO NOT PAYING ATTENTION. Keep the 1.10 I'll find another place to shop. It was good while it lasted.; The lady’s in the kitchen the dark Hispanic lady
And the short  one looks like she’s pregnant and can barely walk there smh well end of this review they give me my tacos all sloppy 1 barbacoa and 2 carnitas for $16:18 and I double ask her why all that for 3 tacos she said the tacos are $4.40  each plus no napkins salt lemon either cilantro or onions nada.. la Michoacana knows better change yall stuffs already…; Ordered chicharrones from the meat market and found them infested with maggots once i got home to cut them up. Report was filed with city’s food safety office.; Very rude cashier(53237) !
I asked for product location and she just pointed to an aisle( wrong one) then at check out grunted but never spoke 1 word. Not a thank you, don’t come back, did you need anything else? Never again!!!

Address: 13310 NW Military Hwy, San Antonio, TX 78231, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:57 AM – 8:36 PM; Tuesday: 8:57 AM – 8:36 PM; Wednesday: 8:57 AM – 8:36 PM; Thursday: 8:57 AM – 8:36 PM; Friday: 8:57 AM – 8:36 PM; Saturday: 8:57 AM – 8:36 PM; Sunday: 8:57 AM – 7:36 PM
Address Components: 13310 (street_number); Northwest Military Highway (route); San Antonio International Airport Vicinity (neighborhood); San Antonio (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78231 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I've been a customer at Natural Grocers for a while now, drawn in by their selection of organic products.  However, my recent experiences have been consistently disappointing.  The most significant issue is their inaccurate pricing. On numerous occasions, I've been overcharged at the register. The shelf price simply doesn't match what I end up paying, and it's always in the store's favor.

What makes this problem even worse is the unhelpful and unfriendly attitude of the staff. When I bring the price discrepancies to their attention, I'm often met with indifference and a lack of any genuine apology.  It feels like they don't value my business or care about correcting their mistakes.

Natural Grocers, you need to address these issues immediately.  Accurate pricing and respectful customer service should be a priority. Until then, I'll be taking my business elsewhere.; Very beautiful grocery store with all organic and natural ingredients. My husband and I really enjoyed looking around at all the phenomenal products. The prices are well out of affordable, but we did purchase some yogurts that were reduced by 50% as they were expiring in two days. I’d love to come again.; Love this store. The prices aren't your typical grocer, but it's similar to Amazon prices and no wait time. Super friendly staff. Rewards card, special sales for N rewards customers. Have all my favorite things and then some. Great selections on all accounts. Always clean, staff is knowledgeable about their products. My food is more delicious than ever.

*update... cashier had to ask me what my turnip was. Eggs aren't 2$ anymore, sales are still excellent. Lip balm is the best. Same store months later, will always go back here.; The place is all right if you like that pricey organic natural stuff.. I have no issues with the place, but it's just not my usual go to grocery store. But overall it's clean, nice & and the service has been friendly.; Disorganized and expensive. Compared to Sprouts, Whole Foods, or Central Market, this place has much higher prices than any of them. Also the staff are very disorganized, there must be issues with the systems they use on the back end of things. The staff are friendly, and they are doing the best they can, so they aren't at fault. However with how inefficient everything here is, it's almost always better to shop elsewhere.
The only redeeming benefit is that the Natural Grocers branded products are high quality and affordable. Stuff like the lip balm and specialty flours are an amazing value. So I do still shop here for those things every 6 months or so, but that's it.

Love rancho; Número Uno rancho market is a good place to buy stuff but the price is to expensive and sometimes the floor are very dirty but I love this place a lot; Good I didn't know this store was here..neighborhood  going through changes; i grew up here when i was a small kid i went there a few months ago to get guatemalan tostaditas bread and wow nostalgia and memories went through my head. me my mom and my sister going to this local market getting food and eating bread n coffee every morning. i have good memories there. i wonder how much it’s changed.; This place looks like a nightmare from the outside, but once you venture in it's actually not a bad little market. There's a great selection of Mexican grocery standards (Clamato, Mexican candy, Bimbo bread, etc.) and a decent produce section.

Name: Great Wall Supermarket

Opening Hours: Monday: 8:30 AM – 9:30 PM; Tuesday: 8:30 AM – 9:30 PM; Wednesday: 8:30 AM – 9:30 PM; Thursday: 8:30 AM – 9:30 PM; Friday: 8:30 AM – 9:30 PM; Saturday: 8:30 AM – 9:30 PM; Sunday: 8:30 AM – 9:30 PM

Reviews:
Great place to shop for all your favorite Asian foods and the prices are very reasonable. We always find the freshest vegetables and fruits. Lines were very short for a weekend. They have a huge parking lot and also some street parking. I am sure when Chinese New Year is here the Great Wall Supermarket will be very busy. This is a great place to shop in the San Gabriel Valley area.; This Asian grocery store have alot of selection of herbs, dried chilies and spice. The kind lady who was ringing me up was very helpful. She went out of her way to help me. The store is clean.; Large variety of foods imported from Asia, particularly South East Asia. You can get laksa paste, rendang paste, sambal chili items here. No gula melaka, you'll have to use gula jawa, or palm sugar from Vietnam. Rather like Hawaii Supermarket but with a better parking situation and less crowded.
On April 28, 2022, I note that inflation is affecting certain items more than others. Some 3-in-1 coffee packs have jumped from under $6 to $9.99, condensed milk squeezable bottles are at $3.99 from pre-covid prices of $2.39, etc.
With their new store opening in Temple City (where the k-mart was), shoppers were drawn away.; GW Supermarket is a huge grocery store that mostly sell Asian products. Parking lot is huge. The aisles are organized and well stocked. Prices are relatively fair. Staff was nice and competent. Overall its one of the best grocery store in the neighborhood.; This place sell expired items. Happened a few times with multiple people we know and happened a few times with us. I know, why don't we just stop coming - well either we forgot or willing to give them another chance, 4 out of 5 visits we get expired products (ugh, it's always the one time I forgot to check!). Including today; bought in 3/2023, Bing fen exp 7/2022, more than half year later...

Reviews:
I ordered fried chicken at its deli. They had a special on their fried chicken on Thursday and I took advantage of it.  I picked up my order on Friday. It took a little longer than I expected to have my order ready. I probably will place the order here again in the future because of the price, quality and convenience.; This store itself is OK.  Can't say the same for some of the patrons that shop here, or shall I say park their cars here.
Some crazy lady who was yelling and screaming, and banging on some other guy's car.  Cops came around and asked us if we heard any noise.  We told them the general direction.  Three cop cars circled around the lot, causing cars to "play musical chairs" by that corner with the charging station.  They didn't catch anyone, and then some creepy guy kept staring at us.  No security in the market, and no security in the lot.  I'm going to avoid shopping here, thank you very much!; Friendly helpful staff, clean store, and fast check out.; Terrible customer service from the employee named, Yvonne.
