Name: GW Supermarket
Address: 5665 Rosemead Blvd Ste 100, Temple City, CA 91780, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:30 PM
Address Components: Ste 100 (subpremise); 5665 (street_number); Rosemead Boulevard (route); Temple City (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91780 (postal_code)
Reviews:
F/k/a Kmart location for those old enough to remember now has been remodeled to this huge Asian market. Produce is plentiful and looks fresh. Lots of seafood and active butcher area for wide variety of meat. Parking is little nutty, people don't respect returning carts so I parked further away to avoid cart traps for my vehicle later; Massive grocery space occupying the former Kmart area. There is so much space that some of the produce is placed in two different locations in the produce area. It's very clean and well-maintained. There is your usual wide variety of products spanning many Asian cultures as well as some western products too. Lots of live seafood too and a wide selection of meats, frozen foods, and snacks. Location is right by a very busy intersection so there is plenty of people in the area but parking is fine in their large plaza.; Nice and clean grand opening supermarket. Many on sales items are in very good price especially some fruits and vegetables. I got navel oranges $0.50 per lb that are super sweet. Also, frozen giant scallops on sales $9.99 per lb that usually $14.99 per lb. Good price 😄
Rice noodles 4 for $4.98 😉I got 8 for my friend.
However, no all items are cheap. Pay attention on the on sales items then you will really save money.; Newly opened in 2024, it took over the former Kmart location. The inside is huge with a huge variety of items. While prices are not as high as h-Mart, it seems to sell at a small premium vs other markets. Items on sale do make it worthwhile. Parking close will be difficult. The Chuze fitness next door also has many customers and both sets of customers are jockeying for the closest spots to their respective entrances.; Another Super Market just opened next to a bunch of others... yey...!

Visually, the market reminds me of Ralphs and Vons, but the the grocery items are almost the same as 168. There are also a few small stores in here. Mix it up together, and you get a small version of San Gabriel Super Store. They have volume thats for sure, I just hope the fruits aren't as bruised up the next time i come here. I wonder how long it will stay clean in here 🤔 Their basket have wheels so that's cool.

There's a small women's clothing store which is cool, but we seriously need ACTUAL RETAIL CLOTHING stores around here; not another super market next to another super market thats next to another super market 🙄 We already have Super A, 168, another asian market at san gabriel and another across The Hat, and Ralphs all within 3-4 miles. This is redundant like Subway. This store should've been a bunch of small stores like H&M, Zara and even Sephora. I really wanted this spot to be trendier.

They're using some brand of card swiper that I have never seen before, so I really need to research where it came from out of security.

Name: Super King Markets | Claremont
Address: 436 Auto Center Dr, Claremont, CA 91711, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 436 (street_number); Auto Center Drive (route); Claremont (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91711 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This massive international supermarket has a variety of unique imported boxes of chocolate that comes with a bag. It looks really nice and it is an excellent gift idea for various occasions. This location also has a great and huge selection for liquor and alcohol. There are also freshly made on site ready to eat sushi and rolls available as well. There are also lots of imported dadu and London dairy ice creams and products that are not commonly found in other supermarkets. There are weekly deals posted on their website. The check out is very quick even when it is crowded. There is also an area with lots of mini crane machines for kiddos to have fun.; I love this place. It is very clean, very well organized, and very well lit. Their produce is always super fresh. Their produce is also the cheapest in town. They have fruits and vegetables that are hard to find. They also have a huge variety of meats. They also have a lot of hard to find meat. Walking up and down the shelves is pretty fun cuz they have items that are not normal to normal grocery stores. Their bakery makes them delicious creations fresh. I love their alcohol section, they have a huge alcohol inventory at great prices; This is SK! It’s for real the king of grocery stores. Great prices and very clean. You can find multicultural groceries no question about it. It’s worth going!; One of my all-time favorite markets anywhere! Great selection of ethnic products. Fresh...fresh...fresh & cheap! Filled with college students in red tops marked Super King roaming the isles...keeping everything spotless!
It's always crowded with people from all parts of the world...mixing recipes and talking with each other. It's like visiting a
Bazaar in Morocco.
Meat and seafood section is always "slammed"...you take a number and you gladly wait. Only Stated Bros. can match the quality.
The fish moves so fast...it's always fresh and good. If you don't start with good ingredients...it's not going to get any better.
It's one of the only markets that carries fresh chicken feet (a great cooking stock).
The vegetables are "prime"!
Real Jordan almonds...(colors and white) fill neatly arranged trays of delicacies.
Pinenuts...walnuts...almonds...cashews...you name it...they have it. Best nut and spice connection I've found in this whole region.
Fresh seasonal fruit greets you at the entry. Once they had a giant Jack Fruit they cut hunks for us to taste. Delisious! I saved the seeds to plant new trees. My first Jack Fruit experience...I fell in love.
It's such a pleasant experience to do that food chore.
On my top 10 Favorite Markets!; Nice store it's not lacking in anything in particular they have some fruits you don't typically find in supermarkets they also have some good quality cuts of meat,only thing is that it can get busy sum days especially Sundays and sometimes their scanners don't work

Reviews: Needs upgrading; small isles; parking lot always full; meat dept. access fire not use ticket for orders; pleasant employees but always talking amount themselves.; Prices are very good but you can't hardly walk around because they are so much people and merchandise still in boxes; This the most uncomfortable, dirty, disorganized place that I have been to. First, the store is so small that you can't even walk from aisle to aisle without running into a person shopping. The aisles are not wide and there is constant piles of unpacked merchandise clogging the aisles. The registers upon check out are out of date, some don't have the belts working to speed up the check out process Their parking is full of holes and there are many security guards there to assist you but they bunch up in one place and their directions are confusing. Needless to say, it is not friendly to handicapped customers because it is impossible for one to exit their car and walk in this place. A positive thing, is that they have good prices but at the cost of the consumer suffering through this disorganized maze! The owner needs to stop penny pinching and invest in some needed remodeling there.; Priceare high. Small parking area.; I love produce sections, nothing better than real food! But this disappointed.  So much produce covered in plastic 🤮 then they even add styrofoam to make it worse!  When I go for produce I now go to Selectos or elsewhere.  If this place changes and offers more food without packaging I'd shop here more.

Reviews: Prices for veggies and fruit are much cheaper than Fry's, Bashas and Albertsons. However if the deal is too good they often run out. Just shopped recently and bought 15 pounds of fruit to make 2 trays and a bowl of cut fruit for a friend's funeral. Exceptional fruit but had to look long and hard to find enough since it wasso late in the evening. I spent $25 and they turned out looking magnificent! No strawberries - all gone so picked-up berries at Bashas.  Value for fruit was exceptional for the price.; This is probably one of the cleanest nicest Hispanic grocery stores that I've been to in the valley. They have relatively fair pricing they make a lot of from scratch items. Their Deli is off the chain. And they have a small restaurant inside in case you want hot delicious Hispanic entrees from across Latin America. For some reason they don't serve burritos but they do serve plates of food that you would find in a delicious burrito. That's probably my main beef with them no pun intended. Their produce is exceptional and it has a little bit more variety than the big box chain stores like Walmart and target. If you looking for Hispanic grocery goods this is your One stop shop; The store has always fresh products, cookies and meat products. It is relatively clean. The prices are relatively low compared to other major stores like Walmart or Target.  Just purchased some chili and onions.; Place is always clean and stocked up on fresh produce. Meat and dairy department are also very clean and stocked up. The only down fall is the self check out service had 3 cash and one credit card so we had to wait a while for the cash register. Maybe add more self check outs or add more cashiers for the other registers that are closed.; It's like a upper-scale rancho market but it's also very much like Kroger. They have a huge selection of sour creams and meets vegetables my favorite is the Auguas Frescas

Reviews: Great place to gets things that you forgot and need quick for the kitchen cooking, etc.; I love the area, high up on a mountain with a view of the sea and Rincón/Aguada/Aguadilla. There is everything you could want and need, just like in any big supermarket. There is fresh produce at the entrance; onions, potatoes, plantains, lettuce cilantro, the usual munchies ( sweets like cupcakes, chips). There are three different fridges, 1st has meats, seafood, smoked p. chops, hamburgers. There are aisles with rice, beans, pastas, veggies, creamer, boxed milk, evaporated, aisles with miscellaneous. At the end of the store is the dairy fridge, next to it liquors; beer, wine, etc. Colmado Miradero has the old school colmado charm, but it has so much more than your typical Colmado. The staff is super friendly and efficient.; This is a great little place, you can pretty much find anything you need here. Very organized and friendly staff.; Good service and good products....; Excellent, good service and a wide variety of products.

Reviews: The mall has so much to offer that I had to go back a second time. I loved the pretzels at the kiosk. Great in every way.; Can't believe it's been 20 years! Still a great place to eat, walk and visit.; The best shopping mall in the Cabo Rojo, Mayagüez area of Puerto Rico. 10 minutes from Cabo Rojo. Right off the main roads, so convenient for all areas to reach it easily. Plenty of stores and food options inside as well as in the surrounding area. Krispy Kreme is even right in the parking lot. Walmart is one to the anchors as is JC Penny and Sears. Parking is usually pretty easy but in prime seasons or holidays it can be a bit nuts.; Outdated and boring, it needs remodeling ages ago. Great service and deAls; It’s just great; I bought a briefcase that had a seam damaged on the main handle 9 days after purchasing it. When I took it to the store they told me that they couldn't exchange it because it was already damaged and that they couldn't refund my money. They sent my briefcase for warranty and they told me that it could take up to a month, in the meantime they gave me a used briefcase that has nothing to do with the one I had purchased. This company's return policy left me terribly disappointed. Now I have to go a month without the briefcase I bought and they won't let me cancel the purchase of a product (which is not cheap) that was damaged after a week of purchasing it.

EDIT: after almost a month without a briefcase, they gave me a new one to replace the one that had been damaged.; Excellent, pleasant place, super attentive staff, good customer service, they do everything possible to please you, a clean, quiet and safe place, the merchandise is made of excellent material (of good quality), recommended for everyone.; Excellent merchandise and service. Reviews: I would highly recommend Omaroti to anyone that desires a better quality of life. No matter how healthy, or unwell you may be, Omaroti can show you what’s going on inside your body and recommend changes in diet or lifestyle for improvements in overall well being. Creating medicinal tinctures or teas in front of you based on your body’s assessment is an experience on its own. I am forever grateful to the friends that recommended Omaroti to me and I feel the need to share this to help anyone else in their  own life. Thank you ❤️; So grateful to find a natural healer in Mayaguez. Was having concerns with my body adjusting to the food and climate in Puerto Rico after moving from the states 2 years ago. Their consultations provided me with supplements my body was lacking due to a change in diet and tinctures made from locally spruces herbs for grounding. It's a process but I feel much better and can tell my health has improved.; Phenomenal healing work done with care and support. I know my words cannot do justice to the work that Omarati continues to do for our community and the world. We are a family of four and she has helped us through some very difficult times offering loving and holistic approaches, healing from a deeper perspective than modern medicine can offer. From Bell’s palsy to adrenal fatigue, eye infections and nutritional deficiency Omarati has guided us towards better solutions that would have been ignored or passed over by others. We are so grateful for her amazing work and know that what she offers is a solution that could help many others. She offers a balanced perspective and a safe environment so please do not hesitate to invest your time and energy to making and appointment today or wandering into her beautiful store in downtown Mayaguez. With gratitude and respect, thank you Omarati for all you have offered our family. I hope many more will return to these practices and find the healing our bodies and land need to thrive.; I have been going to Omarorti since it opened and have been going to Olatokunboh for medicines and support for the last 4 years. She provided prenatal and postnatal herbal support for 2 of my children and she is my go to shop for herbal remedies, incense and herbal supplements in Mayaguez.; I met Ola at a Taino festival and it is a pleasure being in her shop. And an inspiration if you are looking for wellness and quality healing and herbs please visit Omaroti

Reviews:
A Neighborhood Staple
I've been coming to this gas station since I was a kid, and it's still a familiar and comforting place. My dad has been a regular customer for years, buying beer every week. The owners are friendly and always greet us with a smile. The staff is helpful and always willing to assist. The drive-thru feature is incredibly convenient, especially on busy days. The car wash is top-notch, and I appreciate the vacuum feature for keeping my car clean. However, I've noticed that the air pump is frequently broken, which can be frustrating. Additionally, there's a group of men who often hang out in the back, which makes me feel a bit uneasy. Overall, this gas station is a reliable neighborhood spot, but there are a few areas where improvements could be made.; Pioneer Market is easy and convenient the drive-thru is very fast and the employees are very knowledgeable about the items they sell. They have almost everything you'll need for a quick stop. they also have a car wash and a vacuum center which makes it convenient for you. I go there quite often just because it's easier than getting out of my car and walking into a liquor store.; Go here nearly everyday, so convenient. Owner is a bit dour and once berated me for improperly washing my truck. While I won't use the car wash anymore, the store is great, and the people are nice.; STEALING!! HORRIBLE!!! the Spanish girl that works there has stolen from me two times in a row already. I reported it to the owner the first time, she still works there marking up items and pocketing the money. I will never shop there again. I do not recommend you go there. She is also stealing from the owner as well, by not scanning the items. she drives the white car.; This store is honestly amazing, they carry all the snacks and drinks I could possibly need. They also carry a wide variety of smoking related products. The customer service is great, they’re quick to grab your items, and are very attentive (drive through).

I've been trying to get a manager on the phone for the past 30min over a money order transaction. I've dialed almost every extension and nothing. But got to go early in the morning go it's crazy busy..but whom doesn't love to shop. Lol; This particular store is always a bit crowded, especially on weekends. Today, other than my typical list of food items, I was looking to check out different types of vegan meat options. Reviews: It doesn't have fancy merchandise but it has what you need. Strange thing is that they keep the coffee out of the shelves. You have to ask for it at the cash register; Comercio C&C is a suburban, almost rural food market.  The aisles accommodate two cart lanes easily.  The store has a great variety of foods.  It has lots of local foods like fruit and certain root vegetables.  It also has a healthy variety of foods people like me from the states can appreciate.  There is great selection of beer, wine and hard liquor.  I m a strong advocate for supporting local businesses and I appreciate they work hard to satisfy the local and visiting customers.; Great stop to get groceries when you don't have a lot of time. I was able to find everything on my list: a large jar of Chef Piñero's Recao, pre shredded Al Fresco coles slaw mix, avocado, shredded Cheeses, large eggs, bag of Goya rice, frozen dinner options, one half galon of Swiza Whole Milk, Goya powdered beef buillion, Planters lightly salted peanuts, Bounty select a size paper towels, canned dog food, and Dawn dish washing liquid. I even picked up a nice package of pork spare ribs to bake at home. Clean isles and friendly staff. 🤗👍🏻; Shopping there is economical plus we get good quality and variety of products. The only not so good experience is the parking lot. There are holes all over which makes it difficult to park and transit...; They have a lot of deals.  Good prices. Nice selection.  Overall I would recommend.

Reviews:
They could use space between customers and more mature employees.
Has great prices and is clean.; This place used to be a fairly empty center.  But now it's VERY crowded all week long.  Also they need to give a background check on employees.  I went there to buy a shadow the hedgehog action figure.  There was one left on the shelf.  But as soon as I was gonna grab.  An employee swipped it from my hands and ran off.  I chased them down.  But they quickly went into the employee lounge and locked themselves in.  When I told a manager about it.  They refused to help because "It's just a toy, it's not important"  So now we have employees stealing stuff from peoples carts....GREAT!; Today (12/17/2021), around 2:00 -3:00 pm I needed help with a metal type shelf to place in the shopping cart.  Looked for assistance and asked 2 men's sitting in front of the painting supplies area. The one I had asked first for help first ignored me completely then giving me a serious look I apologized if he was a supplier said no but did not bothered to tell if they were on break or so.  So as I was about to turn  back feeling useless and ignored when then the other employee offer to help.  Again I had apologized and thanked to the 2nd  employee.
However I must confess that it did affected me emotionally and worst when I happen to be in disability.  I've tried to do my best with little aid but the shelf box exceeded my lift weight capability.
Really it would do greatly to train employees to be very cautious with disability, seniors even others who are needs from employees.
Sincerely
Sabina Bonilla; My preferred Walmart in Ponce, it seems alot less crowded than the other store, and I find more items from the US I was used to purchasing. I recycle my soft plastics here each time I go shopping. Very convienent. 🤗 Great Produce, Cheese, Dairy and Meat selections.
Ample space between isles.; First of all , always busy and still employees under paid.....ohhh Puerto Rico you...... Good location however...

Reviews:
When I need to buy in bulk, I go to Sams. I usually find more than I expected. They sell a product called Neocell Super Collagen and it works very well for me. The best deal on a  slice of pizza is in Sams Cafe for under $2, it is a big slice with several toppings available. I find great deals here.; Best part, using my phone to scan and pay bypassing completely the cash register.  It's the best.; Fast checkout with the app is amazing. Now you can skip the long lanes paying with Sam's app. During the coronavirus (COVID-19) the distant measures are on. They are controlling the entrance to the store, limiting the customer quantity inside. They will sanitize your hands on entrance. The shopping carts are clean. There's a little wait before entrance for security measures. I find everything I was looking for.
Update:
Normal as usual, no more restrictions at all.; Great customer patient service in the pharmacy and optical!; Most prices were surpringly not that much lower than elsewhere. In some cases, higher. There were some good or great deals, but it was more that some meats approaching their sell-by dates or imported items were discounted or just better priced for buying a heavier or bigger packaged items than grocery stores. Costco has better prices in general.

Reviews: The chicken and tenders the biscuits and wedges.....fire! So good worth my 40$ juicy seasoned cook right delicious the quality of the chicken some good portions I got the 12 pc wedges and biscuits meal; Best Fried Louisiana Fried Chicken in the AV! I’ve tried all the chicken places. Some are good but not great and along comes this little franchise that’s winning over our taste buds. At this market you can get everything from milk, snacks and canned food to your favorite alcoholic beverage.  On the side though is this little 🔥 fried chicken haven. Really clean, nice and the ladies working behind the counter are holding it down with delicious chicken and entrees. Just like the chicken is well cooked the ladies make sure everything is handled correctly and cleanly. Much respect to you 2 young ladies and the food was delicious like the first time. People this chicken is fire. But don’t listen to me there are plenty of other good reviews.; Love it, can find what you need, employees are awesome; Not far from my office, they got all the good stuff. Lots of parking ..; Since moving here, I've discovered a new favorite spot for my daily needs. The friendly staff always greets me with a smile or a joke, and they're an absolute delight to interact with. Not only does the store have everything you could possibly need, but there's also a pizza and chicken joint conveniently located inside. During my most recent visit, as I was receiving my change from the cashier, he performed a magic trick that left my inner child in awe. This place is truly magical and special.

Name: Ralphs
Address: 21431 Devonshire St, Chatsworth, CA 91311, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: 21431 (street_number); Devonshire Street (route); Chatsworth (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91311 (postal_code)
Reviews: I usually don't have issues with this store but I did today. I placed a fried chicken and dessert platter order online, well over 24 hours. They told me they didnt receive my order. They said they could make the chicken in 15 mins but couldn't do anything for the desserts. Horrible experience since it was for a family gathering. DON'T PLACE ONLINE ORDERS!!!; Can’t state how important it is to NOT come to this Ralph’s after dark. This Ralph’s is fine but the problem with the homeless that keeping coming from the near by metro station is getting out of hand. I’ve seen them come in and just stuff things into their backpacks and walk out like nothing. Not to mention the frequent fights and police being called to this area at all hours. No one will stop them, security is sometimes on cite but not enough to stay there the entire day. If you need something at late hours, just drive a few more minutes down the street to the other markets.; For a supermarket in the middle of the homeless community, this Ralph's is ok. Not the cleanest,  not the safest,  but the employees are very nice and friendly.  I had an issue with the digital coupons, (I don't know why they have to make them so hard to get on your phone)[maybe they hope you don't use them] but Jocelyn (I'm sorry,  I think that was her name) was so kind and patient,  she took my phone and helped me get the coupon.  Anyway,  good experience. 👍; This is my favorite Ralph's to shop for my groceries, people are usually nice most of the time here, clerks are very nice and helpful, The meat  counter has a variety of meats, the butcher, bakery, everyone, every area you find in this store are here to make sure you make your shopping experience worth your time.; Somebody else I know and me have been coming to this particular Ralphs for the past twenty years with little complaint up until the last four or five years. For starters, I'd like to add that, last time I checked, most of the current employees have also been there for many years, and we have little complaint with them as well (Bertha in particular was a kind person): our issues isn't with the store or the employees, it's with the loiterers and some of the customers. For instance, we've been challenged to fights at least four times between us, one of the cases was with someone who appeared to be homeless, another case was with someone who appeared to just be released from being incarcerated (we believe he possibly may have had a weapon of some kind). In conclusion, we theorize that the bus/train station directly across the street is one reason for the excessive amount of low quality people.

Name: Huntington Beach Farmers Market
Address: 15851 Gothard St, Huntington Beach, CA 92647, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM

Reviews: I recently visited Huntington Beach Farmers Market, expecting a traditional farmer’s market experience, but it turned out to be more like a supermarket. Despite this, I was pleasantly surprised by the wide selection of fresh produce available. The fruits were very reasonably priced, and I was able to get everything I needed without breaking the bank. The only downside was that it was a bit crowded inside, but it wasn’t too difficult to navigate through the aisles. On the plus side, parking was easy to find, which made the trip much more convenient. Overall, a good place to shop for fresh produce at great prices!; Great vibes and environment for all ages.  Loved the live music by Raized Wrong!  A wonderful array of different offerings.  Clean Huntington Beach setting with that cool ocean breeze.; This is the best place for produce that I’ve found in the area. They usually have a wide variety to choose from, a lot of organic options, and way better prices than Ralph’s or Vons. Some of the produce is 3-4x cheaper here. The only downside is some produce may be a bit ripe and can go bad quickly (but this can happen anywhere). They often have less expensive egg and dairy options as well. I highly recommend!; I love this place. Their produce is the best in town. Prices are very reasonable.; Many fruit vegetables and plants and gardening equipment, the plaza is safe and the store has good prices.

Address Components: 310 (street_number); East Florence Avenue (route); Florence (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90003 (postal_code)
Reviews:
All the stuff you need from a local grocery store at pretty low prices, the only thing you won't find that I was looking for us liquor, but they do have beer and pretty good 3 leches cake.; I changed my rating to 4 stars because when I went in there it was very clean and it was a pleasant experience. I didn't see anything out of place, no mess, the lines were moving freely, and the cashier that was there helping me and my daughter she was professional and pleasant; Dirty and rude! Parking lot is a disaster. No marking...people park anywhere. Guard is rude, and that's who greets you.
Store policy...no pictures. I can see why. It's a mess and has dirty floors.
Not enough cashiers open for rush hour.
So many others in area. Try Superior Market...much better.; I take my dad there for there fruits very affordable.  Can say that for the ladies in Deli section very rude. My experience  I go there once week.; Let me start off with this store is purely without a doubt dedicated to Hispanics and them only.  I myself am  a person of color and in no way,shape or form do I look or dress thuggish. But the security followed me through the whole store  blatantly as if I was stealing or doing something illegal. And I can say hands down that I have never been so uncomfortable and out casted in a grocery store in my 45 years of living!!! And to top it all off when I get to the register for checkout the person that handled me was dry unfriendly and basically rude. No customer service at all, made me feel like I was not supposed to be there!   So I will NEVER go to this branch or any other ever again.  I also will not recommend it anyone that I know....Or their dog neither!1👎🏼👎🏼🤮😶☠️

Name: Super A Market
Address: 2800 Graham Rd, Falls Church, VA 22042, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:30 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:30 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews: This medium-sized supermarket specializes in Latin American food products, offering imported items from Central and South American countries. The store boasts an extensive selection of ethnic foods that set it apart from local groceries. Additionally, it provides fresh produce, meats, vegetables, kitchen goods, fresh cheeses, tortillas, breads, and various canned goods. The store's ambiance is distinct, with products displayed in designated aisles, and it maintains a clean environment. The service from the cashiers is excellent.; The best farmers market in Falls Church and Fairfax County. Most if not all of their produce arrives from Maryland farmers farms. Plus they sell 3 large tables of discounted produce in the back isle of their store. Very generous variety of products you wouldn't imagine with more affordable prices than Safeway, Giant, Whole Foods and Trader Joes.; I was so impressed by this grocery store.  They specialize in Mexican and Latin American produce and brands.  It was so clean, and everything was so neatly organized, it's obvious that everyone working here takes so much pride in the business.  It's not a really large store, but they make up for it in the quality of service.; Super A Market focuses on grocery products from Central and South America. I am really a big fan of their produce, not a wide selection but of superior quality whilst sold at unbeaten low prices. Staff members are friendly.; A medium sized ethnic food market with lots of selection at good prices. Has a very good meat section. The produce section is extensive, but it is kept at room temperature, so it does not last long once it is brought home.

Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Reviews:
If I could give zero stars I would. Why would you even offer same day delivery but the store manager kicks out the uber delivery person because he takes a picture to show a substitution for an item that is out of stock. It is very inconvenient that not only I am paying higher prices to place my order and get it delivered, but to top it off to get it canceled because the manager doesn't care why the uber delivery person is taking pictures. The guy told me why my order was going to be canceled and he also states the manager said he didn't care. That pictures where not allowed in the store. Why would you partner with a third party delivery service and won't let them do their job? Why would you be rude to someone trying to earn money and fulfill an order that is advertised as a same day delivery service at your store? Bad customer service. I will be reporting this to Uber eats as well and will be taking my business somewhere else. DO NOT SHOP HERE!!!!; I was shopin for someone else and they ask me to show what other chips have for a replacement so I took 2 pictures when some one I believe is the store manager started to harassing me telling me I can't took pictures the I showed to him that I need it for someone else he doesn't car and I been kicked out of the store.
This is so stupid management he need to be punished because now EL SUPER  lose  2 + customers.
So ridiculous how manager treat the customer that pay you salary; Good service super clean and love the Wednesday cuz is the vegetales is in special; The prices are higher for more american things I see and use. They have good deals on meats here thats why I come. Overall this store is well maintained and stocked.; Love El super the prices as reasonable and the food it good compared to other groceries stores.

Reviews:
It's not good to do a portrait of some one's Mom praying. Especially a deity stronger than you who has a son name after her . fool. GUADALUPE.GUADALUPANO.; Meat is good and nicely cut.  No excess fat left. Always stocked up. Nice store if you forget your veggie, sauce, rice or bread from the market. Clean and organized. Plus they sell beer only no bottles.; I barbecue twice a week so I get picky when it comes to my meats. I drove out to East LA because I heard about this place through two chefs. They had a good selection of vegetables and all your grocery needs. What I really came for was the meat department. First impression, high quality marbled meats and very clean. The two butchers were outgoing and helped me get the best pieces of the bunches. Everything looked from choice to prime and their prices were below any carniceria with that quality. I had some ranchera, chuck para asada, tomahawk and chicken. I had them season half and I wish I told them to season everything. I cooked it the next day and it was incredible. I'll be a regular.; Good quality meat; The entire area is a #restroom #dessert...

Name: Plaza Agropecuaria de San Sebastián (San Sebastian's Agricultural Market)
Address: PR #111, San Sebastián, 00685, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: Closed; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: San Sebastián (locality); Bahomamey (administrative_area_level_2); San Sebastián (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00685 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Great fleamarket and farmers market.  You can buy new items, used goods, collectable, local vegetables and even livestock.  I've been visiting it for years since I was a kid and keep returning every chance I go.  I visit fleamarkets in United States for a living and this one is my favorite.; Much bigger and better than in the review pictures. Drove all the way from San Juan and didn’t disappoint. Open only one day on Friday. Recommended for those who like markets.; It's only open on Fridays.
I don't go too often because the roads I take to get there can get very narrow in places.
But once there, I enjoy walking and seeing what is there.
Like plants - produce - candy - cakes - coffee - foods to eat and beverages.
Also, cloth and footwear.
Plus crafts - hardware - jewelry and toys.
And more.; I am so delighted of this great place, so many exciting cultural and culinary discovery. Fun, excitement, surprises, on their local produce. As a filipino cultural worker, this local Puerto Rican flea market defines their heritage food , their love of Culture, emphasized with great beat of their music , not to forget it defined who they are.
I hope to visit you again on my next travel.
So very impressed.
Me encanta; Great place to visit. Fresh vegetables, fruits and natural juices available. Beautiful plants, and fruit trees for sale at a great prices.

Reviews:
Good variety and selection.  Delivery option is with an app.
Very friendly and helpful employees.; This supermarket surprised me with the level of fresh fruits and vegetables available. An assorted variety of imported and local products in a clean and comfy area. You can always find a helpful associate to answer your questions and then cut some of the legumes for you.
Unfortunately, I can not say the same for the meat department. The staff is rude and dismissive. The meat while fresh is packed poorly and bloody. Management should keep an eye on this important department.
The rest of the files are well-stocked and clean. Prices are competitive for the location.
And finally, the cashiers are friendly, courteous, and fast.; As with most supermarkets in the island they never have what I’m looking for but for PR (and Caguas) standards it’s a pretty good supermarket anyway. Their wine and beer selection is great tho!; Nice place very clean; Huge selection of quality products and some decent deals like a whole roasted chicken and a loaf of bread (pan de agua) for $11.00 (without taxes)! Clean, well lit and well stocked...first time in a while where all the shelves are full of merchandise. The fifth star is for the cashier who checked me out and packed my bags just because (first time in a long time that the cashier also packs my bags). Also a huge plus to shopping here are all the other stores, restaurants and the bank in its immediate vecinity.

Reviews:
Better stock than other branches. Increased prices recently. Good when on sale. Take in mind you have to wait long hours for pay to the cashier. Lot of people waiting. Lack of employees or inadequate store manager.; Love this Econo store. Has Mexican products that I need, great meats and fruits. Has restaurant inside for coffee and great food.; Very well supplied. Don't let the name fool you though; I was able to find serranos, jalapeños and habanero chiles including corn tortillas and flour tortillas. Also bacalao (cod); This place is fairly new.

The parking could use some work but so can every parking lot on the island.

The store was huge and fairly clean.  Things were laid out nicely and yhere were tons of staff.  Hope you know Sapnish though because most of them don't speak English and one guy was a little rude when I asked for help.  Another guy was very helpful though and went out of his way but still didnt find what I was looking for.

They have a large selection of wine to choose from and a food court with a bakery and sushi bar.

I'd go here again for basic shopping but if you need a bigger selection, hit up walmart or Sam's.

Name: Ralphs
Address: 19340 Soledad Canyon Rd, Canyon Country, CA 91351, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Address Components: 19340 (street_number); Soledad Canyon Road (route); Canyon Country (neighborhood); Santa Clarita (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91351 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This location doesn't have the footprint of the larger stores. However, they have managed to cleverly arrange their items and displays in a logical way to maximize space. They have a deli counter, with prepared food also available in the area. They also have an area which I'll call the Sandwich Station with prepackaged deli meats & cheeses along with other items needed to make a sandwich. There is also a fresh meat counter with a nice display case. The produce department looks very neat and organized. This location has most of what you would expect at a Ralphs, albeit on a smaller scale.

After browsing the aisles I started to notice  that they don't carry everything other Ralphs stores carry, which makes sense. Being a smaller store they don't have the physical space. However, the overall selection of goods is pretty much the same as other locations, and they utilize their space well.

The store seems to be safe, and the parking lot is wide open without places for people to lurk around. I also like the fact that the entrance is free of people lurking about. This could be my new alternative Ralphs.; The issue with at least this location is on the right side of the store as you walk in.  Very cramped and almost claustrophobic.  Laid out very poorly.  The produce section is ok but the meat section is extremely sub par.  Small with few choices.  The two or three aisles on that side are also short, narrow and lacking.  The bread section is terrible.  I mean awful.  As you move to the other side the store opens up as does the selections.  Sushi counter,  The aisles spread out and lengthen and consequently your options grow with them.  I like Ralphs but whoever designed this location did a quite poor job of it.; Visit Ralphs 2 days ago to get some soda, dog food and some snaks for the New Year. It's not so busy during my visit since it's 8pm and everything went well as it is. Will be back for sure. Peace😀😎; Your usual modern supermarket with most everything you need. Good fruits & vegetables. Watch for markdown items just a couple days before their expiration date and remember that the expiration date is often just a guide for freshness. The one thing that's not as good as it used to be as there are fewer checkers and more self-checkout stands. I try to avoid the self-checkout stands because I feel like I'm depriving people of employment. Also why should I be doing the work that the store is supposed to be doing for me and that is ringing up my prices.; One of the attendants on the do it yourself checkout machine is a very honest person. I forgot my cash back but then the attendant called my attention while I exited the store. He handed me my cash back. I was very thankful of her honesty. God bless her.

Name: Spicy Caribbee
Address: 154 Calle del Cristo, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 154 (street_number); Calle del Cristo (route); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Catedral (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews: I happened upon this store during a cruise stop in San Juan last march.  Glad I found it.  Nice store with pleasant staff.  Wide variety of hot sauces.  I was able to sample some products and found the yellow hot sauce to be fantastic!  I recently ran out, and did a re-order online for the big bottle.  Great stuff!; Every new place I visit it’s tradition I buy a bottle of sauce to take home. We wandered into Spicy Caribbee while visiting old San Juan and the staff are absolutely fantastic. They offer travel size bottles of sauce/jam if you didn’t check a bag in. Some of the best sauces I’ve ever bought on a trip! This is a must stop while visiting PR.; Are you interested in tea leaves, spices, sauces, or jams? If you heart said yes to any of those, then you should come to the delightful little Spicy Caribbee! You get a sampling station right when you enter, where you are greeted by a good variety of bottles of sauces and jars of jams, their own recipes. You can help yourself to knifes and sticks to sample them, and they even provided crackers and tortilla chips for a more contextual test. Go straight for their Green Heat and you'll never go back. Their guava jam is also possibly one of my all-time favorite types of jam now. For the spices, you will find a selection of their own blends, including ones that will give you a local Puerto Rican flavor in your own culinary adventures. My personal favorite is the tea section, where you can spend a long time meticulously smelling the different teas they have, including some very interesting blends. Spicy Caribbee is a way of life, and the helpful staff at the store is always ready to assist you on your journey.; Delicious spices, sauces, and teas!  They offer tastings of a number of their sauces so you know what you're getting.  Definitely try the banana ketchup!  It's a bit sweeter than regular ketchup, and I love it.  When you're in Old San Juan, definitely stop in and check this place out!; Gretta was so much help. Appreciated her  fluent English. This is a must stop at. Short walk from our trip and every spice we could have wanted or needed.

Are you kidding me???? So whats the damm point of having small carts then???? Who was the genius of this stupid idea???; I like to buy my groceries at this Econo. Address: #81 C. Jiménez Sicardó, Caguas, 00725, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 6:30 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 6:30 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 6:30 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 6:30 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 6:30 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 6:30 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Address Components: #81 (street_number); Calle Jiménez Sicardó (route); Caguas (locality); El Pueblo (administrative_area_level_3); Caguas (administrative_area_level_2); Caguas (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00725 (postal_code)
Reviews: This great place is a traditional puerto rican mini supermarket. It has been established and owned in Caguas from a long line of family generations. You will always find a gracious "Tito" and/or his wife willing to serve and help you with your groceries list. From fresh meats, eggs, milk (fresh, powdered or shelved) homemade "pasteles", batteries, mops, brooms, candy, paper towels, toilet paper, cigarettes, lighters, matches, any kind of sugar (diet, refined white, organic), dog and cat food. You will find here almost everything you find in a big supermarket with the charm of a nice puerto rican "colmado".; Playing park.; You always get what you're looking for!! Excellent client service. Well located spot and the beers are always delicious!; Have a good time, with good people. There is everything and reasonable prices.; Excellent to share and very good service

Today March 22nd,  I called before heading to the store to make sure the product I wanted was available and with a 75% off. They confirmed the info was accurate and the product was available. After driving there from my hometown, they said they couldn’t sell me the product because it was expired. I asked if they could honored the deal with a same non expired product and they just said no. This is my second bad experience in this particular store. I wish they could contact me  to honor the deal.; Great customer service. Store is nice and clean.; Excellent establishment. Great selection. Friendly staff. Funny American music. Good sales and discounts for military.; I was in the San Patricio Plaza store and I'll never go back as a customer I've been buying for 2 years and today I went to buy a smoothie and an energetic one for the gym, I took the usual smoothie and asked the cashier if she had something on offer in energetically and without much attention, she replied that no, that depends, I ask her if she had something similar to what I requested and she tells me NO.  I saw that there were several in the gondola, I was waiting for an alternative from her and she went to the back and left me alone and after a while another one arrives and asked me (are you going to pay and I tell her nooo if the other daughter is going to check something I forcefully pressured them and the other one told me WELL NO THERE IS NOTHING.... you know I released everything I had that there was almost $80.00 dollars and I released it and left. Now I don't fly and what I was looking for I got it in vitami word. Thanks for nothing. I will make sure that the gym companions that we sponsored that store do not come back

Reviews:
I went to try their supposedly “high quality” Puerto Rican Pork Chops which cost over 100% compared to pork chops on regular supermarkets and this is what I get. A beat up un appetizing pork chop.

The trick was that they hide the Frankenstein pork chop behind one that looks decent, so I wouldn’t notice from scratch.

Arrived to my place and when I went to cook I noticed. I went back to tell the staff in regards and a lady started a rant that everybody loves their meat and its the highest quality instead of acknowledging, as honestly I’ve never been sold a pork chop in that condition.

Never going back and wouldn’t recommend.; In the middle of no where land!! Everyone inside the village was so nice and pleasant!!! Thank God we found a place to snack!!; Great Mini Super Market in Orocovis PR love it; Great service and a variety of products.; Excellent

Reviews: Excellent foodtruck w/ yummy breadfruit fritters filled w/ chicken or salted codfish stew (Bacalao guisado), corned beef hash, and great homemade sauces to accompany the fritters ("Rellenos"). Yummy Carne frita w/ bradfruit tostones (Tostones de pana); Very tasty rellenos de Pana. I had never tasted them and I loved them. They were nice and hot freshly made. The food truck is right beside the ocean and its actually therapeutic to just sit on the shore and enjoy some food from Gustito de Abuela. I recommend this food truck if your in the area and want to grab a quick snack.; Good local food.  Friendly workers.; If you like fried foods made from corduroy, I recommend this place. Located on the beach of Patillas Carretera #3.  You will see the guagüita that sells these fried foods made on the spot. No old or overheated things. "Cheer up"; excellent service and good taste.

Reviews:
It's a place to shop for food, home needs, pharmacies general need, alcohol and bakery. Also a cafe were you can get PUERTORRICAN Food,to eat in on tables setting or carryout. It's right near on Cayey downtown. Soooo convenient.; This is our #1 spot for groceries in Cayey. Great specials and prices. We love the cafeteria style restaurant. The staff and servers, are great. This is one of our favorite "criollo" spots to eat. The menu for the week is always printed out every Monday. Every week is different!; My favorite supermarket in Cayey.  It has all you can need.
Great lunches too.; I usually come more here because I find my routine to get what I need in the same order allways.  Its like a second home and the place I used to go with my mom when she was alive.  Good memories.; I have visited this supermarket only once, but it was a pleasant visit, I found American products that I had not seen in another supermarket, I also liked the extended hours during the week. Clean supermarket with wide aisles, prices are fair.

Name: Amigo

Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Vicinity: Carr Estatal 183, Puerto Rico 183, San Lorenzo
Address Components: Puerto Rico 183 (route); San Lorenzo (locality); Hato (administrative_area_level_2); San Lorenzo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00754 (postal_code)
Reviews:
People are very friendly and helpful.; I love shopping at Amigo because they always have unbeatable prices, and tons of gluten free options. They also have a wide variety of vegan, peanut free, and organic products, so for people with allergies it's a great place to find your food fare. The workers are always friendly. I tend to shop in the later evenings to avoid the afternoon/early evening crowds.; Not the best prices. Econo has better prices. But it is a bit cleaner and better service than Econo; I like shopping at Amigo San Lorenzo. Close to home, no traffic and good prices. Always find what I need. Meats are good. Refrigerators are odorless and clean.; Amigo in San Lorenzo is good enough market.  It has all your necessities at semi-competitive prices.  They are owned by Walmart so if you are familiar with Walmart standards... this market does not reflect the Walmart standards.

It's small in comparison to its neighboring market, Econo.  They have a small produce selection and a very small butcher/deli section.  They offer whole roast chicken for almost half the size of Costco chicken and at almost twice the amount ($8.00)!

They have a very small Asian/International section and the products are overpriced.  In their defense the area is not heavily populated with Asians, so I don't blame them.  Some of the products are even covered in dust because no one really buys them in San Lorenzo.  If you want a larger "Asian" variety, go to the Walmart in Caguas or ask someone to ship you items from the states.

There are several check out counters which seem to usually always have someone working in each one.  The staff are friendly enough but sometimes when the lines get long, there is no sense of urgency it seems.

Parking is a nightmare, then again, parking and drivers in Puerto Rico is just one big nightmare.  I know that's harsh, but it's true.

Some side notes:
- Return line/customer service counter line is usually very long.
- They do sell lottery tickets.
- They have a redbox and a coinstar/coin to cash machine.
- Small butcher window by the roast chicken & Asian items.
- Small bakery to the left of the entrance.
- They still provide plastic bags, but will be going away with them soon.

Overall, if we need to grab a quick item, that is not too unique, we will go to Amigos.

Reviews:
Bottom line: incredible wine selection, best prices per bottle on island (they are 1 of the 2 main distributors) however a lot of high end stuff around which makes overall prices seem high. Boogie ambiance, which I feel affected their initial customer service towards us negatively.

Long line: the entrance is semi hidden as there's a gate to their private parking. Disclaimer: in all honesty, we showed up in hiking attire after having gone to Puente La Hamaca earlier in the day. On arrival we browsed for wines we knew, and noted that there wasn't anyone on the floor. Looking for help, we felt as though we were placed low on the priority list as we saw other customers being attended to. This of course changed when we came wanting to open two bottles on premises and a block of cheese, which is why I'm calling them boogie. Place was filled with 50 somethings in business casual so I guess they thought we weren't buying, but doesn't really excuse them in my eyes. Overall the savings don't warrant a drive here if you're driving from either San Juan or Aguadilla unless you're going to buy a few cases.; Amazing winery. Also beautiful activities center.; Amazing wine selection.  You can either buy they bottle and stay or take home. Great place to set up meeting to talk to other people throughout the day.  Usually they have food for special events, but the rest of the time the kitchen its closed.; It is always a good experience when going to the Bodega de Mendez. They have a very wide array of different wines from many countries in all continents with trained staff to help you pick the wine that suits your taste. It is a great place to spend the time as well. Cold cuts served in house too and have a good selection for whisky fanatics. Good for a early unwinding during the week as they close relatively early.; What a selection of good wines! The Bodega de Mendez is so much more then just a liquor shop - we have not yet found such a large selection of good and some extremely good wines, with emphasis on Spain, but also a comprehensive and high quality selection of France and US. There is a small but top notch selection of food like old Manchego cheese from Spain etc. available. A paradise for wine enthusiasts.

Address Components: 151 (subpremise); 149 (street_number); Calle Villa (route); Segundo, Ponce, Puerto Rico (sublocality_level_1); Ponce (locality); Primero (administrative_area_level_2); Ponce (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00730 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Vegans, keto diets, and people with dietary or gluten restrictions, this is your kingdom 👑

A friend who knows the insides told me that they actively avoid cross-contamination, and make their food separate, to the point that anyone can eat many things here.

So their quality is on point.

We had delivery via Lunchera for lunch. They took a bit of time (45-50 minutes) but this is fine considering the food is made fresh from scratch.

Portions are decent, but on the smaller side.

Everything tastes fresh and nutritional, and they're perfectly willing to make a custom order to fit your health needs.

Also, at one point they called us due to a price difference on their end, so they were honest and offered us something extra to compensate.
Truly extraordinary service and honesty.

Overall this is a wonderful place to visit normally, and a great restaurant for people who need a bit of extra care for their meals.
Truly, their food is the healthiest you'll find nearby.
4.8/5 ✨️; Friendly staff. The espresso was great (local coffee) & the soy free almond flour pancakes were amazing!! I haven’t had pancakes in years & they were cooked to perfection, nice & fluffy!! A wonderful spot with many vegan options, thank you!! Next time I have to try the pumpkin pancakes 😌; Amazing vegan and gluten free options. We had the bread fruit tacos and pumpkin pancakes. I can even find vegan gf on the mainland 😭. I’m so happy. Definitely coming back to try more things.; We went there for lunch. My husband had the spare ribs rice and beans and side of sauted potatoes. I had vegan meatballs, rice, beans, sacred potatoes and a green salad.
Everything was very good. Highly recommend. Great customer service. They cater to vegetarian,  vegan and Keto diets. 😁👍🏻 Health food store items when you go in, the Cafe is in the back of the store. Lunch menu changes daily with one or two each of Keto, vegetarian and vegan diet options. I will certainly  come again. 🤗🇵🇷; It was a great experience. The place is clean and have variety of vegan and traditional menu. Plus there is s vegan and organic food shopette. They also have a natural products store. They have parking.  They serve breakfast and lunch. Recommended full.

Reviews: Good stop but at the same time, very busy spot at times. Main reason is due to the food quality, it's good. If your by, stop inside and I hope you'll see things from my point of view also.; I was visiting Puerto Rico and stayed in Ponce, we went around the island to all directions and tried different bakeries all over. This is hands down the best one of them all. Tried their breakfast, sandwiches, cremas and pastries, everything was on point, fresh and hot! Staff mostly friendly and clean. There was a guy at the door to regulate people coming in and out. They do require vaccination if you are sitting down to eat. The quesitos are the bomb with some coffee. Definitely recommend if you are in the area.; Food was amazing and prices were really affordable. The Pastrami is delicious!; This place has some very good sandwiches. They also have a cheap criollo lunch in which you can choose what you want . They also serve breakfast, It is a bakery so you can get all kinds of sweets, bread and other things while you are there.; Great food at reasonable prices. They have delicious pastries as well as breakfast, lunch, and sandwiches. Because the food is so good expect the place to be crowded early in the morning due to breakfast and for lunch.

Name: Super 1 Foods
Address: 710 S 9th Ave, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 710 (street_number); South 9th Avenue (route); Walla Walla (locality); Walla Walla County (administrative_area_level_2); Washington (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 99362 (postal_code); 3906 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Always fun to shop here! Many interesting items that are hard to find.  Great selection of organic and vegan items. They have the fall/Halloween items out now,  so cute!; I like shopping at super 1. I live close by and shop their daily. The only issue I have is the skinny guy with the obvious comb over who generally works towards the back of the store. That guy literally followed me around the store the entire time. Obvious assuming I was going to steal. Why else would he blatantly follow me around the store? It was a very uncomfortable feeling. I almost stopped and asked if he had a problem. Never had an employee follow me around a store in my life. You will know exactly who I'm talking about once you see his terrible comb over. I'll just ask for a manager next time if it happens again; Clean and well organized store reminds me of Safeway with a larger selection of organic and a bit higher prices though not crazy.   A couple deals on chips and the meat section had some great looking (though pricey) steaks.   The cashier was super friendly.  Walla Walla is a little slower paced than Tru-Cities which is a welcome change and made for a more hometown feel.   Shopping cart was in good repair as it appeared so were the others.   If you are ok with Yokes prices  to enjoy a pleasant shopping experience this is a great choice.   If price is all you care about consider a lower quality grocer.; I really love shopping here. They have decent prices, and their health food options are almost endless. The staff are always so friendly and helpful. We went through Esli's checkout lane this evening, and she made the whole experience so fun and enjoyable for us and our son. I really appreciate the positivity and friendliness we are met with by all of the staff. Thank you, and we will definitely be shopping here more often.; My fiance and I love this store. We go out of our way to come here instead of Safeway however, a little bummed about how the new store manager is running things. We go there mainly for the employees and the employees aren't even allowed to take a sip of water at their checkout stations when customers are present which is just ridiculous. On a hot summer day and they are parched, they should be able to drink from their water bottles. I guarantee you that customers DON'T CARE.

The conversations we have with the employees make our evening and we care for their well being. Make sure to take care of your hard working employees who make your business run smoothly . We don't care about some products costing a little more than other nearby grocery stores when the workers genuinely care about us!! The night manager Shelby works her butt off and even helped my fiance when he locked his keys in his truck. Carlos and Rafael are extremely friendly and are always willing to help when we need it. And Heather thank you for making sure I always have my Reese's big cups in stock!! Your employees are our friends. There are several more employees that we love and just can't remember their names at the moment. Thank you everyone! We wouldn't go there every night if it weren't for you !!

Reviews:
Great new shopping  mall; They are a good company, they put a thousand obstacles in their way to help you, if you need another cell phone you can't buy another one calmly because the sim doesn't work on another cell phone on the same network, their store hours are also wrong, they say they close at 8 and you arrive at 7 and they are already closed, they are disgusting company, it is better to stay far away from them.; Place with a super family atmosphere in its surroundings. Parking is a bit atrocious, however; This Ralph's was a great shopping experience! We were in town for a wedding and needed a few things - and a Cactus Cooler! Name: Starbucks

Reviews:
The lines moved fast they had a system and the employees have a great team; Filipino culture is known for its hospitality and this Starbucks location is no exception.

It's always crowded and the lines are long but the staff make it so much more enjoyable.  Always friendly when I come to visit, you are always greeted with a friendly guard who opens the door for you.  The staff are always smiling and make sure they prepare your order right.  Everyone speaks pretty well English so if you're a foreigner this is a great place to stop in to feel a slice of home away from home.

There are plenty of seats inside and out and the facility stays relatively clean.  I enjoy visiting this Starbucks!; Love thier ❤️ Mango Dragonfruit Lemonade! It's so refreshing! 😋; awesome coffee and service but the drive through is a bit uncomfortable; It took them 35 minutes to make two frappuccinos that I order via uber eats, and I'm just indicating the preparation time. The first time I went the drive thru was closed, and my second experience was the frappuccinos. So far the worst experience I have had in the entire metro area at Starbucks in Puerto Rico.

Address: CR39+Q9X, Carretera, Bayamón, 00959, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
Great selection of food items. Well organized.  Neat and clean location.  Amazing!; End of March so it food shopping for us.  Was able to find everything on my list.  Whoopee Sugar free Klondike ice cream sandwiches.
There have been  sad days for me at times as No NY strip steak, no sugar free caramel ice cream, no enticing steak or beef cuts, and NO SUGAR FREE GUAVA JAM.  Which is a sweet treat with waffles toasted in air fryer.
Today I found local meat cuts and the Sugar free Guava Jam.  AM HOOKED ON H2OH, zero sugar, 10 calories fizzy orange drink.  Great help for water sub.  I sometimes need lemon.  Grew up on coffee, Mom didn't push water.

Hooked so I return to places that always that satisfy me.  Yes, Pueblo was stocked.  I use to find everything including my treats: Sugar free chocolate for my nightly treat and YES ,my sugar free ice cream sandwiches.  Ahhhhh Breyers Salted Caramel Sugar Free.  The meats were varied and  local with some cuts from stateside.
Went shopping for a couple of items and IT WAS UNAVOIDABLE.....I found so much: the cuts of beef, great.
Today was as always.......all on my list plus the fruits that inspired me to make
My kind of light desserts.......Gala Apples for sauce with thin slices over sugar free vanilla bean ice cream, all plus more.
They had Tomahawk steaks!!!
I shop in Pueblo close to 3 times a month......that is proof of a satisfied customer.
Finally supermarkets has expanded their sugar free options but for me Pueblo despite economy is improving each day.

I understand the supply problem but my favorite supermarket is short on steaks,  lacking sugar free ice cream, sugar free yogurt and where is the H2OH!  My nutritionist has a can of H2OH as an example for her patients to see thanks to me.  I will be calling PepsiCo.  However my husband ran it a was able to get our fave coffee and toiletries.; Like this supermarket. It has all you need to cook and drink. Prices are good. Great customer service.; Es un supermercado. Tiene exáctamente lo que el pùblico espera en un supermercado.

Is a grocery store. It does and has what the general public expects out of a grocery store.; Good mix of products a little too pricey though

Reviews:
Under new ownership, all the prices went up. Check the sale tickets hanging from the gondolas, that's your best deals. Do not go to self checkout if you are using more than one method of payment. For some reason the new personnel isn't keen on how to operate the computers. Stock on shelves is good and varied, store appearance is better that the old store (Sept 2021 last days). New shopping carts, and some renovations to the physical plant. Good store, lets hope the recession stops already so we can afford to eat again.; Amigo Supermarkets have been around for many years and as long as I remember, they've always kept lower prices for their customers. When Walmart came into the picture I was already out of the Island, but my Mom kept getting her groceries from them when the fusion brought even lower prices 😃

The Staff were and still are very attentive and knowledgeable, where you can find one anywhere in the store. The store is very well stocked up and clean.

I hope they get to keep their doors open with their original name, Amigo 🇵🇷 I would definitely recommend it to my friends and family 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻 dumbs up 😍; I like this store as it is always very well stocked with the items most used by me. Their meat department has good variety of fresh and frozen products. Lately because of the COVID situation, many products have been in short supply, but I can still shop knowing I'll find most of the items I'm looking for and the prices, although higher than usual, are reasonable; I like shopping once in awhile here at Amigo's. They have good prices on there products. They should improve a little the waiting on the line but other than that everything is peaches and cream.
5/25/23
Amigo was bought by Pueblo so prices have change and they have done several changes to the store.; I have been shopping there for years and I am always amazed at how poorly they keep the shelves stocked. Do they not inventory stock and order so things don't run out? This I believe is a Walmart affiliate, why do they act so poorly in keeping merchandize on the shelves? I would fire whoever is in charge of ordering products for the store. There were no snack size cheese squares, nor the cheese sticks, there was no Good Value thin cut honey ham, there were no 13 gallon size garbage bags! Come on, I never leave this store spending less than $150 and it's usually closer to $200 and that's just getting one pack of chicken thighs. So please do a much better job at keeping the store well stocked!

I returned to Amigo a week later on 8/21st and found the same problem, many items were not available.
This time I asked a store employee what the problem was. I was told that this store will be closing by the end of August and a Pueblo supermarket will replace it! So if you frequent this supermarket til the end of August, be prepared for stock to be even more depleted.

We found a Dunkin' Donut. The counter sign said they closed at 12pm. The counter, servers  said they had only hot drinks. Several people walked away. They told us they were closing.  They reluctantly fixed my husband's and my vanilla chai. Several planes had landed. There were hundreds of people waiting for their flights. Lots of people were looking for food and drinks. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

I had an excellent shopping experience at Supermercado Econo in Humacao! The store is always clean and well-organized, making it easy to find everything I need. The selection of fresh produce is impressive, and the prices are very reasonable. The staff is friendly and always willing to help, which makes a big difference. I also appreciate the wide variety of local and international products. This has become my go-to grocery store. Highly recommended!; Great shop, never been to a store that has slot machines in it; Today was not a good day for me to go shopping at Econo Humacao. I became a Keren for the first time. I couldn't get cellphone service at all, is like someone was blocking my signal 😒. Then I call my sister because I couldn't her to my bank app so that I could transfer money into my card to pay for bags, I always buy 3$ worth of bags. I had to scrap on my change purse 👛  and I didn't even had enough. There was this employee bagging my things he put the water underneath the cart. There is no way I could lift that. He looked annoyed on my request to leave it till the end. I didn't like the way he was bagging my items. So I went to bagged them myself. I was absolutely shocked at the poor quality of the bags. A balloon is stronger than them bags. I can't deal with incompetence.  Thank God that the girls are so polite and patient; Favorite store.  Clean, well stocked,  attentive  employees.  Would give it 5 stars, but their app for online purchases is many times problematic and on sale items almost impossible to find.  Also, many items are overpriced. If prices go higher,, will have to go to other stores.  The roomy aisles makes navigating shopping carts easier.; It moved to a new location and the service is great, lines move quickly and the layout of the store is well thought out. I just wish they had a larger selection of produce similar to the Econo in Fajardo. Their deli counter is outstanding and the liquor section is well stocked.

Reviews: This Mini Market in particular is my favorite store . Found it during Hurricane Maria aftermath . Since this was my first experience with a hurricane I came to find out that I was not as well prepared as I thought .At La Placita I was able to find mostly all the items I needed to survive the nightmare . Due to the power outage nobody ever access to their bank accounts therefore I was very very short money wise . But thanks to this store and their management my money problems were solved . I was able to get cash back through their system . Very grateful to this store and management . I'm a loyal customer .; For year's the best bread in the whole area, here you can find almost everything you need at the best prices, located really visible so you cannot missed if want to visit there, many years visiting and always have the best experience.; They didn't gave me customer satisfaction, wait too long before I can order and the place was not busy at all,and the bread was flat,and there was bugs near the ham... and salami.; Nice corner market has expanded their operation, I wish them well.; The best bread you could it you find it there.

Fine, I didn’t want to take up anyone’s time. All they need is to ring up and bag up. Y’all need to hire cashiers and NOT use them on the floor-something locals do everywhere on this island. Reviews: Decent grocery store. Seems a little higher on prices but very convenient. A lot of merchandise packed into the area they have. I have repeated visits and will continue to.; The place is a bit expensive for a supermarket, not only that but serve food to eat, when I went there the staff was rude and some of the food was not on the menu, when I asked why they had food that they were not serving on display they gave me a dirty look, I was not rude I was just curious of why that was, maybe I should have acted rude but I wasn't going to waste my energy so I just left. Not worth going to or buying only if your desperate or for emergencys; We're visiting PR for a month and wanted to see how Pueblo compared to SuperMax. Both are great and I'd recommend them. Pueblo seems to have more PR-native foods and a well-priced store brand. Easy to navigate store, recognizable items (for my picky eaters, ie. string cheese, hot dogs, crackers). They have an in-store cafeteria and the daily specials have been terrific, and a quick way to get lunch on a weekday. Pueblo is meeting all our needs atm.; Great little supermarket, with good variety of products. Make sure you get your parking taking stamp from the cash register lady.; Clean, organized and so many varieties. Also they have beer, wine/champagne and snacks. All in one LOCATION ONE STOP SHOP😁

Reviews:
Grade A: Very good Basterma. Modestly  stocked Mediterranean groceries & spices also. Owner Maggie is very helpful. The store has it's own parking.; Garo's Basturma has fresh and delicious meats and Soujoukh. The older lady working there is really kind and sweet. The one suggestion I have for this business is PLEASE do not get supplies from Turkish companies. I saw Turkish red pepper paste and tomato paste being sold here. As Armenians we're already very little in the world and we need to support each other as much as we can - and boycott Turkish/Azeri products/businesses. Again, my suggestion to Garo's Basturma: Please purchase from Armenian suppliers and businesses instead! There's so many delicious and high-quality Armenian tomato paste/red pepper paste brands.; Pricey, but yummy! Fresh meats always available and in my opinion, it's the best basterma deli around town! And remember to get the vacuum packed soujouk, it's the best in a George Foreman grill!; Best Cold cuts and the most friendly owner, order already marinated meats for bbq.; The only original basturma 👍
Although recently I’m wasn’t 100% satisfied, I live in another state and whenever members of my family are coming up here I order on the phone and pay over the phone and make someone pick my order up , so recently I felt some change in the flavor and the quality, I hope next time they raise my satisfaction from 60% anywhere up.
