Name: Oak Hill Market
Address: 2150 Heritage Loop Rd, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 2150 (street_number); Heritage Loop Road (route); Paso Robles (locality); San Luis Obispo County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 93446 (postal_code)
Reviews: Oak Hill market is one of my favorite places to stop on my way home. I live deep out in Lockwood, so it's great for me to stop by here and pick up a few things that I need instead of running all the way into town.Their meat market and deli is absolutely phenomenal and I also catch a lot of deals on some of the cuts that they have in the back. The staff here are also super friendly and very polite; I love stopping at this store after a trip to the lake and even before if we've somehow forgot something. They have a great delli with fresh food prepared that day. Their prices aren't too bad and the place is always kept clean and organized.; We are Heritage Ranch locals and feel this is a great grocery store with great service.  The prices are higher but they are having to pay for the extra distance to get deliveries.  From the time you enter and then checkout, the service is great.  While they may not have everything you might find at a grocery store in Paso, my guess is they carry about 95% of what you need.  And, you can always ask (I did) to get an item that they don't normally carry.; I've visited this market a bunch of times in the past year having a house up in oak shores now which those who know the area is really out there.  I feel very fortunate that this market is here it saves me 20-25 minutes of additional driving time to town each way.  The bonus is that it's a really great market.  Good produce that's always fresh great selection of most items and probably one of the best butcher shops around.  They carry a wide array of beef from ranch 1857, Harris ranch, and First Light wagu out of New Zealand and a couple of others.  Their chicken and pork are also really good and fresh.  This place rivals most places I've been even places like whole foods.  If your in the area and are looking for a great steak this is the place not like you have a lot of other options 😉    ha ha. You won't be disappointed.; This store us amazing, especially their meat, deli, and bakery departments.  The drive out is so beautiful this time of year. Prices are very comparable to any of the markets in town...just better and less crowded.

Name: Asian Food Market Marlboro
Address: 79 S Main St, Marlboro, NJ 07746, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 79 (street_number); South Main Street (route); Marlboro (locality); Monmouth County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07746 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We went looking specifically for fresh quail and duck eggs, and we found both and much more!  This is a huge market, with frozen foods, fresh (live) fish, produce, bakery, cooked food (duck), sweets, candy and staples.
Accessible ♿️. People are very kind and helpful.  There are big, clean bathrooms.  Huge parking lot.; Such an amazing store w such a wide variety of items. From baked goods , to every vegetable and fruit imaginable to cooking utensils. They have a wide variety of tea and coffee and many other items  . The store was very clean and the workers were very friendly. ☯️; A local chain Asian food market with a good selection of items to fulfill my needs. Although it may not be as big as the others in the Edison area,  this place has an in-house bakery and ready-made food department. My favorite from the ready-made section is the steamed buns with pork and vegetables,  yum!; Oh yah, this place is nice. I'm not sure why but lately the produce looks bad everywhere else. The produce at the Asian Food Market all looked lovely, as well as the meat counter and fish dept. This place is pretty big and I was able to find everything I needed. Well definitely be going back for more groceries soon.; This is the largest Asian food store within 30 miles of me and I come up there for unique items for wok cooking or doing homemade curry and especially freshwater eel, which is frozen in the sauce and absolutely delicious if you’re into making your own sushi.

Sadly, much of this store carries Americanized versions of their products, I assume to try to get a larger community of people in the store. Finding various Asian country food written in native languages is harder every day as products are not, as varied as a decade to go in the same store.

There’s lots of boxes in the aisles and the Layout of the store is confusing, although it’s quite large and if you’re looking for basic items to make a dinner that you watched on YouTube or somewhere that store will likely have what you need. But there are many better places, and many cleaner places too.

They also have ducks and chickens hanging in a small corner of the store and currently in November 2023 they are going $35 for a duck cut up and packaged. The duck is excellent cooked beautifully, but the section of the store has changed over the years and they’ve made it smaller and smaller , with less products, both cooked in store and throughout the supermarket. The fresh live seafood section is gone although fresh meats and frozen food makes up for it.

It gets a three because the store shouldn’t have the feeling of a smaller big box store, prices are not cheaper and you have an Aldi’s experience.

Name: ShopRite of Marlboro
Address: 280 US-9, Morganville, NJ 07751, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 280 (street_number); U.S. 9 (route); Morganville (neighborhood); Marlboro (locality); Monmouth County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07751 (postal_code); 1572 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Best selection around. I often come here when I can't find the items I am looking for at neighboring stores. A real community asset.; I shopped at this Shoprite for approximately 18 months. It usually was very busy in the middle of the afternoon, not as busy later on in the evening after 9pm. The manager special markdowns in front of the registers sometimes had reasonably priced small lunch options. The freshness wasn't 100% great on a few items I bought for a quick lunch. Reduced priced day old stuffed shells, or chicken & broccoli were passable for a quick lunch but obviously not the freshness of made that same day.; My mom is a very loyal price plus member and so when she has work or is unavailable I always do the grocery shopping. It was about 9-9:05 and I was ready to checkout so I went to self checkout since I didn’t have that much stuff. As I’m scanning a very aggressive and rude Indian employee I’m not sure what his name was is nagging me very rudely about how I have to put all the items in the bagging area now I had heavy waters and things in bulk so I very nicely said I’m not bagging anything and this stuff is heavy I’m a 20 year old woman and not a very strong one at that and he points and said “well this is what the store requires you to do” and did the same thing in the same tone to a very elderly woman with a case of water as well along with her other groceries and she didn’t sound happy either. He is staring me down and practically breathing down my neck so at this point I’m extremely uncomfortable. I finally scan and pay and re load up my entire cart I take my receipt to go home and step over and get lottery tickets before I leave and as I’m walking to leave he approaches me yet again and said I didn’t give him a Chance to put paid stickers on my stuff and he’s standing there sticking almost everything I bought and side eyeing the receipt in my hand. And stares at me as I walk out the store…now I’m sorry but what policies in the ShopRite union allow you to harass your customers and make young and elderly customers life loads and re load groceries back in the cart. He was extremely rude, disrespectful, and doesn’t understand personal space. He had no right and to my knowledge LEGALLY had no right to approach me after I left and paid to look at my receipt and basically prevent me from leaving the store. Absolutely the most unprofessional and rude behavior I have ever seen from an employee at any ShopRite. I should not have to feel uncomfortable and un safe simply paying for groceries….and about $100 by the way…i had a credit card and had every intention obviously to pay for my stuff he is not legally allowed to “detain” me and prevent me from leaving and letting me leave only after he side eyes my purchase receipt and sticks paid stickers on everything I bought. I don’t know his name but he was an older Indian man and was working self checkout line September 30 in the evening like I said around 9pm ish; Bakery is great! My guy Smbat will make any bakers wish come true.
Thank you for excellent service

The guys at the deli will take care of you better than any other grocery store James and Jake are great behind the counter; Although the store itself has everything you need, you simply cannot park there without a highest chance of getting your car hit by an unattended shopping cart. I've actually written to them about this problem, and as of last night the problem has gotten worse. Park next to Home Depot, they actually give a darn about their customers and remove empty carts from their lot continuously.

Reviews:
Great super market with some good buys in the Circular.The employees are always nice and helpful.The bakery’s cakes taste & look amazing! The decorators are so talented, I get all my kiddos birthday cakes here.
* wish they would bring the kids shopping carts back*
Thanks Colleen for all the amazing cakes!! 🧁; I really want to like this place, competition is good. But, the meat is always spoiled, as is the fish. Some foods smell like cigarettes. Especially the aforementioned moist foods. It's just gross. Who is smoking in here? Who owns this place? Gnats flying in and around the sweets? Why is it so hard to not smoke in the back / store and get gnat traps. Why is it so hard to not buy too much stock, if you know the meat and fish won't sell?! I've read some of those comments praising the meat and fish at this location, no way! I'll give credit where it's due, though, the "primo tallo" fresh mozzarella and deli items are amazing. Please, save this place, clean house and start over.; Deli dude asked if I needed help with a mouthful of food. Cashier took all my produce out of plastic bags to scan even though I told her the price and sku number. First and last time I go to this place. 10 minutes to scan 7 items.; Clean, bright, good produce, lots of vegetarian options. The aisles are a little narrow, but not so much as to be a nuisance, like a Kings store is.; I haven't been in years because I got fed up with having to buy 10 of something to get a decent discount. Went today. Great prices, great service. Lot's of things on sale. Great seafood. Got lunchmeat..fruit..seafood
...bread. Very impressed. Will go back now that I don't have to buy 10 items. Good job Acme!

Reviews:
They have a good selection  of junk food. I bought a pack of chicken from them and it was bad. So I go there now for soda or junk food. Will not buy meat from them again; I went there for potatoes and a few other things their fresh produce isn't the best but good in a pinch. Today the potatoes they had were loose and all shriveled up and green. The produce they had in the cooler was all brown and no good.; I'll agree the store is a lot nicer than a couple years ago the new management is doing well.  It's a touch pricey but has everything you need when you need to run out for something quick.  Heck of a lot better than having to drive down to Newburgh!  The employees a friendly I haven't had a problem at all with the new management.; The employee Imran is the best to ever do it! Honestly that kid knows his stuff when it comes to making sandwiches. He is very fast and gentle when comes to putting a sandwich together. And if you want hospitality yell “IMRAN” and he’ll come running.; They hv a good variety of convenient items & a deli which includes some hot foods, but the sandwich I order had the price on the Menu Board. Yet I was charged a higher price. Yet when I pointed it out, the guy simply said OH, THATS THE OLD PRICE. I HAVENT CHANGED IT YET...
I should have left my sandwich on the counter & walked out, but I was hungry & on my way to work, so I paid it. And the cheese tasted so cheap, and it didn't even melt, and it was a hot breakfast sandwich .
I won't order from them again unless it's an emergency.

Name: Netcost Market
Address: 700 Tennent Rd, Manalapan Township, NJ 07726, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 700 (street_number); Tennent Road (route); Manalapan Township (locality); Monmouth County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07726 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I see that I’m not the only one who has had issues with the front checkout and your cashiers.
I’m glad to see that the owner/manager does read and respond to them.  However, I don’t believe that anyone has actually done anything about the issues brought up.
I don’t understand why no one in the store speaks any English at all.  Even the most basic words are not understood by the cashiers.  Also, they have not adopted the friendly attitude of the American sales representatives.
I’m from Hungary so I know how rude and unfriendly the cashiers were back there.
Yours are no different.  A smile and “Have a nice day” would be appreciated.
Last but not least, don’t assume I’m Russian.
This is after all, America.  Address me in English,please, or, at least answer me in English if I speak to you in English, unless you only want Russian customers.
The one star is for your good prices and your extensive and imported products, not found elsewhere. Kudos for that‼️
Thank you
A semi satisfied customer; Good selection of eastern european food (mostly russian, ukrainean), it was a nice surprise to find romanian cheese in there lol (Dobrogea goat&sheep cheese). The freshly prepared mushrooms salad is great (with mayonnaise and garlic); give it a try if you like mushrooms, u'll love it!

As for the prices.. It's a really expensive store, they import most of their products.. so I guess that makes sense. But still.. the price for Persil (laundry detergent) is outrageous, I've added some pictures.

I didn't like the atmosphere... It felt a bit awkward being in there. I forgot to get parsley and for some reason, when standing in line, the cashier kept starring at me (she was waiting for a ukrainian or russian guy to pay for his groceries). Our first cashier was nice and friendly though.. A young girl named Karina if I remember well

I don't think I'm gonna go back to this store during my stay in the US.
I came here searching for lovage which I couldn't find in the american grocery stores and to my big surprise they didn't have it, not even the dried one 😐; One of my favorite supermarket! Clean store with nice selection of western europe food items.Their variety of prepared food is incredible! Management and staff are always friendly and helpful. Especially manager Halyna is super nice! 5 Stars!; One of the biggest collections of food from ex USSR. The best cook in all Net Cost locations! Recently opened meat counter is a delightful addition with ready to cook marinated meats and chicken. Recommend all my Amercan Friends to visit.; Walked in with my mom went to the bathroom found her, some guy in a security vest was following me not speaking any English gesticulating he wanted to see under my shirt so as a joke I lifted my shirt and told him you know how I work out every day.

What I should've done is let him bring the police and expose him for the harassing dog he is. He has a mustache and beard I didn't take his name. My mom talked to him later on and he apparently conveyed some "reason"

We liked to buy bulk borsec bottles from Romania a few hundred dollars worth of groceries every week. We might need to find some new supermarkets.

Reviews: This place is great! Very clean and friendly. The clerk took the time to show me what they were serving. Good prices. I'm going back soon; Great customer service and very clean store. Best mexican food in town.; If you need food from this store - plan AHEAD. We have a boat tour booked for 1:15pm and ordered food from this store for pickup for at least one and a half hour ahead. We were there 12:30 and was told that food will be ready in 15min. We are back in 20min and were told that food will be ready in 5min. Waited again to find out that they never prepared a thing for our whole order and they told us to wait another 5 min and the whole order will be ready. Don’t know why you can’t use any 5min in the one and a half hour ahead to prepare our 5min food. Have to leave hungry on the boat.; I love everything about this place! The management and staff are terrific. The products are quality and reasonably priced. I love the hours open early and close late. So convenient. I also am so pleased they fax and scan documents here as well. Can’t say enough about super savors♥️So glad they are in Belmar!; If you need something in a pinch try this store for convenience… a bit of almost everything. But … their name is misleading; you will pay 3 or 4 times more than other supermarkets and the produce is less than desirable.

Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews: A very big shop at prime location of oak tree road, prices are competitive with local grocery , huge collection of items. Indian utensils are relatively low when compared to the size, parking is moderately available and mostly you will get parking. Produce and other items are fresh and would recommend to my friends; Wonderful store with a wide range of Indian products with nominal price. We have purchased a few snacks which we typically don't get in regular Indian stores. I would recommend visiting.; One of NJ's largest and most spacious Indian grocery spots. The aisles are roomy and well-organized, making product search a breeze. While occasional emptied racks during restocking might momentarily obstruct, it's not a major issue. They boast an impressive variety of goods; I was thrilled to find Indrayani rice here. Their collection of cooking utensils, especially Indian steel ones, is extensive and impressive. The store layout, resembling American retailers, makes shopping enjoyable. Although the vegetable variety could be better, it's a satisfying spot for groceries and utensils. Bonus: ample parking space!; New layout of the store is very impressive. I have been noticing that the management constantly tries to improvise and improve. No other Indian grocery store in the area carries so much inventory of ethnic items as India Grocesers. To position fresh vegetables and frozen items in one side of the store makes a great impact on the shoppers and eliminating crisscross movements amongst not so savvy shoppers; I recently (March 2024) got mangoes here, 16 mangoes box is $20, out of 16 mangoes 1 or 2 are good, remaining all are spoiled inside, they are looking good outside,

The staff is very helpful and courteous.; they sell rotten mint for $1.99 , i bought it yesterday because needed it urgently and had to throw almost mote than half of the mint as it was all rotten. Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 113 (street_number); U.S. 9 (route); Morganville (neighborhood); Manalapan Township (locality); Monmouth County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07726 (postal_code)
Reviews: Their staff went out of their way to be rude and unhelpful when I went to pick up a cake.  The bakery team told me to go to the Amazon counter to pick it up.  I waited in line at the Amazon counter, only to have the the person very rudely tell me she couldn't help me.  I explained how I had been directed to her counter, but she told me she had no idea about why they sent me or where else I could get help.  When I again went to the bakery, they brought me back to the Amazon area, spoke to a different individual, and told me they would bring my order.  I waited another 20 minutes before a different person came to me and asked if I was waiting for something.  After explaining the situation to her, she was finally able to get the cake for me.  I spent over 40 minutes going back and forth for the simple task of picking up a cake, and I was met with rude, unhelpful employees all along the way.; I love Whole Foods. The best choice of fresh fruit and vegetables. Disappointed with this location which is next door with radiology (emergency pediatrician with x-ray) wondering if the food can be potentially exposed to radiation; I love Whole Foods. The staff is always very helpful, willing to answer any questions and offer samples to try. If you have an Amazon prime account, you get discounts on certain purchases. The store is also very clean and there are no problems with finding parking.; Unfortunately, today was my last visit to this store. For several years I came here to buy minced chicken. It was really very good. But the last time it smelled really bad of fat and something not fresh, although the expiration date was OK. I just didn't pay attention to the packaging. Why add vinegar, oil and rosemary to minced meat??? The question is rather rhetorical. For me, this is an indicator of the attitude towards the buyer. It's a pity that for so long I trusted the health of my family to a dishonest manufacturer. Selling something like this and calling it organic... cynical, but in principle I'm not surprised, money doesn’t stink, right?! But I won’t bring mine here anymore.; Nice and clean supermarket with a wide selection of different products you won’t typically find in your ShopRite. The bread selections are fantastic and healthy! My only knock is the organic options in produce are nothing special and most can be found at ShopRite or other lower tier grocery for the same or cheaper price.

Name: Faenza's Gourmet Market
Address: 184 US-9, Englishtown, NJ 07726, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 3:00 PM
Address Components: 184 (street_number); U.S. 9 (route); Morganville (neighborhood); Englishtown (locality); Monmouth County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07726 (postal_code); 8454 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: AMAZING!!! Do yourself a favor and pay this place a visit, delicious food, incredible prices, friendliest staff. This is a throwback of Italian market/deli of years gone by. It’s truly an Italian market/deli with amazing selection of various Italian groceries and specialties at great prices. Beautiful selection of fresh cut meats in their “butcher shop” and all the deli meats you could want! You will thank me once you visit!; Faenza's recently catered my son's birthday party. Sal was so accommodating and easy to work with and helped us arrange for a griller and provided recommendations for waitstaff service. On the day of the party, the griller arrived early and helped set up all of the food. The antipasto & fruit platters were beautiful & our guests raved about all of the food. We will definitely use them again!; My second time coming in was yesterday. Everything i have purchased thus far has been excellent and most importantly fresh. When i asked for grilled chicken Sal, the owner had them make a fresh batch for me. Looking forward to many weekly trips here to stock up as i am a tired mom of 3 :) thank you; Went in today to check them out. Wow, friendly staff. We got there not long before they closed. Bought a chicken Parm stromboli and a cheese steak one. First, they were huge, they were 7.95 each, so worth it. We had them for lunch. OMG, they were delicious. They heated up really and hit nice and crispy. I honestly expected more bread than filling, and I'm thrilled to be wrong! They had so much filling! I still have at least a 1/4 of each left over! We also got a ready to eat chicken Cesar salad, that has fresh made croutons lots of grilled chicken. That was only 9.99 and my ding got it for lunch tomorrow. I'm looking forward to tasting the other things we purchased. The meat looked delicious, and they had homemade Sunday sauce which looked really good as well. The bread is from Abate Bakery in Matawan. We will definitely be back!  Looking forward to trying more delicious food!; My visit was great, and I was pleased with my purchases, especially the skirt steak and mozzarella. Sal is wonderful, and I wish him all the best.

Address: 160 US-9, Englishtown, NJ 07726, USA

Reviews: Been coming here for years but leaving a review for first time.  Their prepared foods and produce are very good.  Cheeses and deserts are also very tasty, but prices have been flying high.  Some items are more expensive than whole foods, and that's saying a lot.  I like to support the local establishments as much as possible, however,  so it is what it is.; Since I moved to Manalapan a few years ago I’ve always bought meat from ShopRite but it always went bad even in one day. So I started buying meat amongst other items from Livoti’s and It is absolutely the freshest meat and it is not expensive at all.If it was a little higher than other places at least it’s fresh plus I’d rather spend a few more dollars and have great meat. Store is so clean and organized. The people are so nice and helpful. I will always shop here. You won’t ever be disappointed shopping here.; Mostly good stuff, but prices have gone sky-high since 2020.  No, it's not "inflation."  That's what we thought about McDonald's, too, before we found out they were making record profits. Went into the store today to get some pesto sauce. Small container was, get this, $14.99.  I'm sorry, is there a pine nuts shortage? Please explain why Italian bread is $4.  Wraps/paninis all a couple of dollars more expensive.   I walked out. I go there far less often now because they have gotten out of control with their prices. They can charge what they like - and I can choose not to pay it.; I love the staff behind the deli counter because they work quickly and efficiently even when the store is very busy. I also love the fact that they have gluten free meal options and tons of gluten free items throughout the store. Vegetables are always super fresh and less expensive than the grocery store. One star off because the last few times I picked up fruit it went moldy very quickly. Im also appalled at how expensive their gluten free bakery options are. It’s $16 for just a few gluten free Italian cookies. Pastosa has much more affordable gluten free bakery options.  All in all I’d absolutely recommend this store save for the fruit mishaps.; ***Store is filthy…Kitchen has flies all over the prepared food! And Cut fruit***Dirty mexican behind the fresh mozzarella section doesnt use gloves when making fresh cheese!*** Do not shop here!***

Reviews:
Highly recommend- and especially for catering! Had a birthday pool party with sandwich/wrap trays, sides, chicken wing and chicken tenders/fries for the kids! Everyone raved! And they deliver!; Have to say “Manny” at  The Food Emporium in Marlboro, provided Excellent Customer Service.  My son came in from Out of town and loves a specific creamer that he can’t get on the West Coast & it’s always available here.  Unfortunately , it was nowhere to be found.  I spoke with Manny at Customer Service, he advised a truck just came in, not unloaded yet, but he will contact,  once the item is located. Low & Behold… a couple of hours later… Manny called, making us very Happy Customers … Food Emporiun is a fabulous store with excellent employees.  My Big Shout-out  to Manny… Your smile is infectious.  Thank You; Just went to see this supermarket.  A friend told me the meats were good here. Looked up and down the aisles they have most of the stuff I would normally buy and more. I wound up just picking up a few things since we just went shopping a day before. Was impressed by most of the stuff. Bought an Italian roll and a jar of their marinara sauce. The Stromboli roll and the sauce were good. Will be returning next time I need to go shopping.; I absolutely love shopping at this local supermarket! Not only is the store conveniently located, but the staff is always friendly and helpful. And it’s family owned and operated. The selection of products is fantastic, and I can always find everything I need for my weekly grocery shopping. The prices are also very competitive, and I appreciate the weekly specials and discounts that help me save money. Overall, I highly recommend this supermarket to anyone looking for a great shopping experience.
FYI. They have  monthly money savings coupons in the Route 9 Shopper; What a wonderful find!!! Great selection of fresh fruit, vegetables,  bakery items. Staff very friendly & helpful.  Heirloom tomatoes very reasonable, fresh basil too. Lots to see. I'll be a regular customer. So glad I found this hidden gem.

Reviews: It is a food truck or food cart that is parked on Highway 916 in San Lorenzo above the business called Colmado Guajanas, it is on a curve, orders are placed by phone and you pick up when they call you or you order there and park in front of the business in a space that is like a mini wax. In my opinion it is much better to order by cell phone and pick up when it is ready (in the same way they will call your number) since there are no other businesses nearby and you will have to wait in front of it inside your car or sitting in a space that they have in the house where they have chairs so they can eat there. Traffic in that area is regular but vehicles go up and down at high speed. The service is spectacular, very friendly, attentive and helpful, good treatment both on the phone and in person. The waiting time is not long compared to all the orders that work. I waited around fifteen to twenty minutes and the food was very hot and super delicious. The rice I ordered was mamposteao style rice and the flavor was delicious. The tostones were fresh and also the salad, they ask you how you want the fish or meat.; I didn't like the service, the food was bad.😝I know first and last.; a small place but with a great flavor...Excellent service; Always friendly and everything super delicious; Excellent service

Reviews:
Always great people and great prices if you know what you're looking for! Everyone is always so nice and friendly. Any time I've asked about something anyone I asked had the answer for me and if they didn't they went and got it!

They even allow well behaved dogs to come in. I've come with my boy Walker a few times and they always love to see him and give him lots of pets!

We'll be shopping here for ages to come, the atmosphere is just so nice when you walk in. Just feels so welcoming to be able to walk in and have employees actually smiling at you!; Unprofessional owner who let employee take photos of me for unknown reasons when I had no contact with this employee. Then she pulled me out of line and singled me out, never had an issue before today. Worst shopping experience, truly embarrassing.; Great place , doesn’t always carry the same items always find something new when I visit, so be sure to grab it cuz it may be gone next time. Descent prices . Would recommend.; Was told, “ if you don't like it your can shop at another store” by the lady in glasses on Saturday around 5:20pm.; Prices are cheaper, but this particular store isn't great. I bought protein bars that were outdated, like 2 days after the expiration date. So I had to return those. Otherwise it is a good grocery store.

Name: ShopRite of West Long Branch
Address: Rt 36 & 71, NJ-71, West Long Branch, NJ 07764, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Vicinity: Rt 36 & 71, New Jersey 71, West Long Branch
Address Components: Rt 36 & 71 (point_of_interest); New Jersey 71 (route); West Long Branch (locality); Monmouth County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07764 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I have seen a lot of bad policies for stores and most of them I understand but you guys truly took the cake on the contest to make your customers miserable. Self-check out only 20 items of less. Cool for one or two stations but all of them it's ridiculous specially since you have an employee standing there wasting their time but only one or two registers open. I will never step foot in this store again. The employees are the worst I've seen in many years!!; This store is large with lots of variety of items. The produce and vegetables are always fresh. Nice selection of prepared hot and cold foods. Prices are fair and a lot of the weekly sale items at excellent prices.; This is not a good store. It's littered with miserable employees who are rude as hell. I go to the hot food bar and basically get ignored, then when finally someone says can I help you? I go to pay and the register is closed. So I go to the front and there's a huge waiting line at self check out everytime. Total joke.; I wouldn't normally write a review, but my experience with ShopRite in Long Branch, NJ's management was so bad that I felt compelled to share. While most employees were helpful and friendly, interactions with upper-level staff and management were incredibly disappointing. My expectations aren't high, but I've never been treated so poorly in a retail setting. It's unfortunate that the actions of a few overshadowed the positive efforts of the rest of the team.; BY FAR the WORST ShopRite I have ever been to

SERVICE - the customer service here is atrocious. They have less lanes open because of the self checkout lanes which would be fine if they didn’t close 8 out of 12 of the registers. They leave 3-4 self checkout lanes open with one slow employee to cover them. All of those things wouldn’t be as bad if you didn’t walk around the store and pass an excessive amount of employees standing around chatting. In addition to all of that they are just rude and not helpful.

STOCK - Items are frequently out of stock on a higher basis then other stores. this store definitely has less options than other locations.

The freshness of produce is also not good many times.

LOCATION - the parking here is not good at all. Not enough parking for all the businesses in the lot. The lanes are extra small so it’s always very tight.

Name: Trader Joe's
Address: 1031 Broad St, Shrewsbury, NJ 07702, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 1031 (street_number); Broad Street (route); Shrewsbury (locality); Monmouth County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07702 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Its a Trader Joe's. Its awesome. Great food. Great service.

My wife loves to get their flowers and home/hygiene products (soaps, sunscreen, candles, etc).

My kids are always looking to find the hidden lobsters which will win them a lollipop, but the secret is that you get one anyway if you ask. But it makes going to the store fun for them.

Just don't expect to find name brand items. They don't have Cheerios or Diet Coke.; It’s a nice market. Clean and orderly.  Easily accessible and, as always, folks who work there are super nice.  Good produce, lots of choices.
We went for the brownies… sea salt brownies bites.   They’re worth the trip.; My good friend who has more than one disability cannot speak highly enough about this Trader Joe's. The last time she had gone there she vowed to never go there again because a female cashier rushed her and didn't seem to care that my friend was having trouble moving fast enough. She went back though and today a very kind, helpful and supersweet young man named Andy assisted her at the register. She even said that she told him what had happened the last time and thanked him for being so patient and kind and for making her feel comfortable to return. Then Andy put a bouquet of flowers on the counter and said, "These are for you." She told me she was so touched she almost started crying right there. What a lovely young man! She said she just had to give him a kiss and thanked him over and over for being such a sweetheart. She said that she then went outside and DID get choked up by his being so thoughtful and kind. What a wonderful young man!; Great food options but no longer buy perishables here.  Produce is hit or miss. Expired products may occasionally be found on shelves as well.; Always good. Lots of gluten free options. Lots of frozen side dishes that we enjoy that aren't made with a ton of additives. Trader Joe's is a staple in our home

Name: Monmouth Beach Supermarket
Address: 73 Riverdale Ave, Monmouth Beach, NJ 07750, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 6:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 6:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 6:30 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 6:30 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews: MY FAVORITE STORE EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!! Porkroll made by Jesus is so good. Friendly cashiers!!!!!!!!!! $4.99 very good deal.; We grew up calling it "the corner store" in the late sixties n early 70s. Expanded majorly n an excellent meat selection.; Not really a supermarket, more like an enhanced convenience store. There's a deli/meat case. Burger meat was the only thing I would dare buy  & I must say it was excellent...prices are high  but it's super conveniet so that's the trade off.....anything forgotten for your vacation should be there or at least get ya thru till you can drive to a real supermarket; It is a good place to go if you don't want to go to a big chain market or store. Quick pick up for one or two items, but don't expect good low prices. It is similar to a 7 Eleven but has more. Has coffee, news/mags, produce, lottery, liquor, deli & meats etc. Their prepared foods are not fresh & honestly some of them taste terrible. They do make breakfast items to order up until a certain time (I think 11AM) & they are good. They open very early for the work crowd.; Prices are reaaaaally high here. I only go here if I absolutely need an ingredient for cooking/baking. It was convenient because it’s local but sometimes the prices are so absurd I’d rather make the drive to shop rite. Deli guy is nice but their quality of produce and perishables is eh.

Address: 446 North Ave, Dunellen, NJ 08812, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 446 (street_number); North Avenue (route); Dunellen (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 08812 (postal_code); 1223 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: Convenient location and well stocked when you need something quick,  prices are a tad high,  but won't stop me from going when in need.; I don’t think they check their stock items good thing I checked before eating them. It isn’t the first time this has happen.  Also I notice they over priced items too  got black pepper for 17.99 and at target they had the same for 13:99 Regular price.; Prices are high for the quality of produce. Signs are also inaccurate, purchased some mangoes and it's supposed to be on sale but instead charged a different price. Buyer beware.; I don’t think they check inventory It is illegal for businesses to sell food at any time after its use by date, or to alter the date without the manufacturers permission The High Court has ruled that offering food for sale after its labelled “use by” date is prima facie a criminal offence. You might want to call your local health dept., because some of the expired products may be spoiled or can cause sickness; Tropical is amazing. I've been going here ever since I moved to the area. I love supporting this small business! They have an amazing variety of meat & vegetables & they always have what I need. I love the fact that I can get certain products & spices only here. I always discover something new to purchase. The staff is extremely kind & helpful, & are always willing to go out of their way to help others & answer any questions. The prices are awesome & affordable. I am always so happy when I shop here & have always had pleasant experiences. I would highly recommend supporting them versus a large commercial super market. They are also working hard & doing an amazing job to stay clean, stay open, & help others out during the pandemic. Thank you to all the awesome employees at Tropical! Your efforts & kindness are much appreciated & they mean so much to my family & I.

Name: ACME Markets
Address: 507 Prospect Ave, Little Silver, NJ 07739, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
Ok so I just bumped up their rating from 5 years ago. They revamped the place. They aren't a huge market, so their prices may be a little more expensive, but not everything. They have great sales. I get frozen pizza on sale all the time and usually snag a buy one get one or two free on their ribs. Great, friendly staff. Quick and easy to park. Their flowers are amazing. Easy to get in and out of.; I really wish Acme (and other grocery stores) would require their cashiers to pack our groceries. I just packed my own and left a pepper on the counter without noticing. The lazy staff just stand there and take no interest in their customer's welfare.
Pissed off!; Two words… Price gouging. Idk how they get away with it but you can get most products acme carries at shoprite for about half the cost. You can’t blame it on inflation while your reporting record profits.. up 50% in the past year; Very wide selection of everyday items. You will not find 'gourmet' items here, whether that is good or bad. The place is clean and the staff is pretty basic. Great place to pop in and grab an item or two. Clean, and you will most likely find what you are looking for.; Thank you to the deli department at Acme in Little Silver for accommodating a big last minute order today. We really appreciated your kindness.

Reviews:
Picanha is top notch, looking forward to picking up a couple of kilos more for Father’s Day.; The meats are fantastic and reasonably priced.  Get the famous Picanha cut and cooked right (check out YouTube) it is fantastic.   Highly recommend; Studies show the Amazon will be gone in under 60 years. Brazilian beef is the #1 culprit. But this place sources from US beef distributors only. So it's not so bad. But still... try to eat less beef. It will drive down the price and demand of Brazilian beef imports.; Stop reading this review and get in your car and go there!!! This place in unlike most other places. Brazilian Meat Boutique is by far the best Brazilian grocery store in long branch. Great prices, amazing staff that is very knowledgeable about Brazilian cuisine and the products they sell and quality food and Brazilian goodies. The meats have that Brazilian touch on them in terms of cuts and available seasonings. I always look at how clean a place is where I shop for food and wow, this place is super clean.

Head there for yourself, you’ll feel and experience a taste of brazil in NJ.; Open now during coronavirus season, shelves are fully stocked with various specialty foods. Staff is very nice they speak English, Spanish  and Portuguese. Store is very clean and product prices are decent. Meat is also top quality.

Name: 7-Eleven
Address: 598 Joline Ave, Long Branch, NJ 07740, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: 598 (street_number); Joline Avenue (route); Long Branch (locality); Monmouth County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07740 (postal_code); 5840 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: Disgustingly Dirty store.; Had a bad experience at this location recently won't be going back. This place was pleasant. Dino in the morning was very nice and helpful, but then this one indian gentlemen along with a younger Indian gentleman gave me a hard time for using their microwave. No other 7 11 or employee for that matter has ever given me a hard time. I always make sure I buy something and am quick so that others may use the microwave. The owner cashier sarcastically joked about charging me a $1 for using the microwave...then they both proceeded to watch me as if I were going to steal something.  It was very demeaning! I got yelled and told not to come back as I left the store. I won't! It's ashame. Some people just like to feel powerful and have nothing better to do with their time. Seriously?!!! You won't let a customer use a microwave that is there for customers? Like I said, no other 7 11 has given me a problem. Sorry for the long post. This just really bothered me.; Very good, we managed store.; Wonderful buttered rolls and crispy chicken wings. Mr. Patel allows customers to use extra napkins with purchase of jumbo slurpees. Restroom is in the rear of store and available for an extra fee.; It's hit or miss. Early a.m. there's usually only one carafe of coffee also the staff are on their phones and not paying attention to the sticky floors or dirty coffee island.  Later in the day the counter guy just stares at you when you say thanks. The guy today tossed my change at me even though I had my hand out. Pam is awesome so they have that going for them. Bobby's ok too..

Name: QuickChek
Address: 347 NJ-35, Eatontown, NJ 07724, USA

Reviews:
This store used to be one of the best quick checks. Now it’s getting worse and worst. I ordered chicken salad when I got the order home. All spinach is so bad. I couldn’t even eat it. Waste of money, waste of time, waste of energy and waste of mood. You can do better than that.; This used to be one of the best Quickchek locations around. Now, it barely even seems like anyone even works here. The coffee station is always empty, the counters are consistently a sticky mess, and God help you if you need approval at the self check because nobody ever seems to actually be there.

Waited around several minutes for staff this morning (who were nowhere to be found and another customer had to go look for other staff to page them) to verify a thermos only for the woman to outright ignore me and proceed to chat with and help customers who walked up after she'd arrived.

What a shame what Quickchek has become.; The tiny wrap ever from all the quick check the I stop by. The cashier nig guy👎; Nice. Clean. Great service. Has is cheap 2.41 today. 2.59 in other places.; Worst QuickChek I’ve ever been to. Every person has a bad attitude and never want to work. You sit by the counter for 6-7 minutes before someone strolls out of the back to give you assistance and then when they’re helping you they’re throwing things around, being rude, don’t want to help and make it like you’ve never been there before. I’ve been going to this quickchek for years and I’ve never been this dissatisfied. Terrible treatment to their customers. This place should be ashamed of themselves. Reevaluate who you hire.

Reviews:
It’s a very nice and modern Kroger! They have beautiful florals!; This is not a very nice Kroger store.  I do not shop here if I can avoid it.  The parking lot is very run down.  The shopping carts are hard to find and in bad condition.  The product selection and layout inside is fine and typical of a regular Kroger.  The checkout experience is usually very bad.  They never have enough people working and there are always long lines.  The employees seem rude.  There is a security guard staring at everyone.  Overall this location reflects the area where it is in.  If you can shop at a nicer Kroger in a better area I would recommend it.; This is a beautiful, well stocked Kroger. Actually, all the Kroger stores we frequent are clean and well stocked.

When hubby and I go to the Texas Medical Center, we try to swing by this Kroger off Kirby. We never leave without their deli-prepared chicken salad. It is superb!  Of course, I add extra grapes for a perfect balance of savory and sweet. It’s is fabulous.
We love this location. Highly recommend.; On 10/12 at 7:50pm ish I gave a ride to a disabled friend to get his groceries. Get to register his EBT card is not swiping. We were told we can't help even with his valid TX ID by the older lady who was in charge due to company policy. I paid for it because he had nothing at home,  it was not in my budget but I cant leave him starving. I understand fraud, but with a valid tx id, this should never have taken place. I frequent kroger in my county and they are pleasant. To this location,  Do better!; good

Reviews: We stopped here to get gas and the gas station attendant would not come out to help us, he completely ignored us. As soon as what I'm assuming was a local resident, the gas station attendant quickly went out to help them while still ignoring us.; The most disgusting bathroom I've ever had the displeasure if using! They claim to have restroom standards but the layer of feces on the toilet makes me question that. I'm repulsed! The food took forever to get abs the attitudes from the staff was appalling.; Always good food and service. They even have tastycake.; I love Wawa. Iv never had a bad experience, in any Wawa ever. That being said. Don't get the chipotle Mac and cheese. I'm only speaking for my stomach and or digestion system, but it was like a shot of pure sadness, right to the guts. My life has been changed for ever. Iv seen and felt things that can only be described as tummy sorrow. I give Wawa a 99 out of a 100.; This is a good Wawa, located at a perfect spot on Rt 66 (It's just where the traffic get tied up, so it provides a nice break). As with most other locations, this one is clean, well-organized, and the staff are always willing to help. We stopping here quite often and are always pleased shopping here.

Name: Wawa
Address: 2000 Shafto Rd, Tinton Falls, NJ 07712, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: 2000 (street_number); Shafto Road (route); Tinton Falls (locality); Monmouth County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07712 (postal_code)
Reviews: We have been here many times.  We drive past another wawa to come to this one, but that is not going to happen again.  The food was atrocious.   The chicken sandwich was rubber.  You couldn't bite into it.  I struggled to break it apart to give to my cat.  We wouldn't eat it, but our cat did.  We'll see if he's alive tomorrow.   We're sad to see that this place has gone so far downhill.; Very disappointed. I understand some discounts end but when you still have the advertisement for 3 Gatorade at $6 still on the door and don't honor the fact you guys made a mistake while your employee take it down in front of me making me look bad in front of other customers is very disappointing and disrespectful. I paid the full price anyway but it's not right to make a customer look like a fool when the were in the right.; I ordered food from the wawa website. My app said it was delivered to the address I requested. It was never delivered and when I called customer service, they said they couldn’t refund my money. That’s ridiculous!!!  As you can see from my screenshot, it clearly states it was delivered. I NEVER GOT MY FOOD!!!; I always like Wawa's coffee best... This Wawa maintains the regular Wawa impression: neat, friendly, and convenient....; This is by far the worst wawa I have ever ordered from. I've been coming here for 7 years. The past year its gone down hill. Every time I've ordered lunch here its been wrong. Missing avocado, that I paid extra for, no chili to my chili mash, a hair in my salad ..and the last straw is no turkey to my turkey panini. I will not be coming back here ever again. I am so disappointed!

Name: BJ's Wholesale Club
Address: 1904 NJ-35, Oakhurst, NJ 07755, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 1904 (street_number); New Jersey 35 (route); Oakhurst (neighborhood); Ocean Township (locality); Monmouth County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07755 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Cashiers are always very pleasant efficient and professional.  This place was going downhill for awhile and they have definitely improved.  I shop here all the time.; Used to be great place, now awful. Strongly advise against joining here. there are other options in the area that are considerably better options now. This is coming from a 20+ year member who was shoved by a staff member for not checking out in the order he deemed fit. Management did nothing. Customer service in corporate has done nothing.

I have shopped here weekly since the 90's, used to bring my kids in their infant carriers. I would venture to say 50% of the meals my family has eaten in the last 25 years are from here and I have not stepped foot back in there in over 2 months. That's how long corporate customer service has been telling me to be patient and wait for a call, resolution, or to even address the problem.

Think twice before spending your money here, especially with multiple other warehouse options and plenty of grocery stores close by.; Store is located on a major North/South road. There is a few handicapped parking spaces and the store itself is handicapped accessible. The store was clean and well maintained. The shelves were well stocked. Most of the aisles are wide. They have a deli, a vision center and an area where you can purchase tires for your vehicle and have them installed. They sell a very large selection of merchandise.; My experience at this location was very poor. I don't think I have ever experienced a place where the employees are just visibly miserable. Everyone I encountered had an attitude and was just plain rude. Not a smile to spare. If I could give a more negative rating I would. Like -5.; I been always  buying from Costco but my mother in law asked me to go to BJs because of prices being better. Let me tell you something that happened on my first visit. I brought my aunt who is just moving to NJ, she is starting a new life here, got an apartment, bought tv on Saturday and cable company came on Monday to install services and when opened tv box, tv was broken. Today, Friday on her day off we went to the store to return it since it was damaged and manager is telling me tv and box have two different serial numbers. How did this happen? No, we didn’t switch tvs. First time we buy a tv this size and brand, this person is just moving here and bought a tv with first paycheck and now we are not able to return it! we are 100% sure that the broken tv with a different serial number was put inside that box by someone else! Not us, how do we prove it? Manager didn’t help at all to look for other ways to find out what exactly happened here, there has to be a tracking number to see who else returned same tv before us and exchange new tv to a broken one. Now we are stuck with a broken tv that we paid for and won’t get an exchange or our money back, what kind of business is this? My recommendation is go to Costco who is a 100% satisfaction guarantee, somewhere else or open anything you buy from this place before heading home so the same thing doesn’t happen to you. Be aware!
Wish I could give 0 stars!

Name: Fabko LLC
Address: 32 Main St, South Bound Brook, NJ 08880, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: Closed; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 32 (street_number); Main Street (route); South Bound Brook (locality); Somerset County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 08880 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Ordered sausages and yellow peppers, mixed salads. The sausages are great, however none of the vegetables have an expiration date on the jar and the yellow peppers are completely rotten, disintegrated. I contacted the customer service 2 weeks ago but didn’t get any reply.; I bought several times from this company and was always very satisfied and happy with their products. But now they are obviously starting to cheat on their customers. I recently (03/17/2023) bought (again) wieners, app. 1 lb for $11.99. I bought two lb. What I received were two 0.6 lb packages. Clearly not what I ordered. I e-mailed customer service, my e-mail was acknowledged as being successfully sent, but no response. Will never buy again from Fabko.; I have to say I am most impressed with Fabko. I placed a large order with perishable items and everything arrived in a timely manner, all items as described, and the perishable items came separately with coolant. Fabko even emailed me, letting me know my perishable items would be shipped on a Monday instead of a Friday to avoid sitting in a warehouse over a weekend. All items were packed very well and despite ordering over 10 different jars of goodies, nothing was broken during transit. I would highly recommend Fabko for all your European item shopping needs. I will definitely be returning!; My order came in fast. The items were packed very carefully and safely without unnecessary packing materials. There was a mistake but they replied to my email quickly and corrected the mistake right away. The items were close to expiration date but not expired. Did not concern me since expiration date on canned goods  does not mean the food is bad. I placed my order a while back,  still have some food in my fridge and it is totally fine.; I take great pleasure in shopping at Fabko. The store offers a good selection of European groceries, and I'm able to find there everything that I need; from delectable groceries to basic household items. The shipping is fast, perishable foods arrive in an insulated box with dry ice, everything is fresh.
The owner is honest and polite, he answers all questions promptly and courteously.
I highly recommend the store.

Name: Wawa

Reviews:
I love Wawa and usually across the board they are very similar in food and service. Which is great! This Wawa on the other hand does a very poor job reflecting the company I have ordered food twice through door dash and twice now it has come out wrong and mixed up with multiple orders. I have driven myself there to have the order made correctly. It’s unfortunate cause the food is great but is seldom made correctly. I’m unsure why this is a reoccurring issue and I’ve checked my receipt to make sure I put the order in right. Beware ordering delivery from here if you want the right food and not have to drive all the way there; Horrible! I was treated as if I was a burden to them. Also I asked for help with a certain product and I was told they were too busy with lunch and lied to me about the product being in stock so she wouldn't have to help. What?! Also a smile would really help with the stores vibe. At least acknowledge your customers when they speak to you. Smh!! Too many Wawas for that kind of treatment.; Wawa is great for a quick snack, coffee or shakes. When you are on a large trip, Wawa is always great for as a pit stop, the rest rooms are pretty clean.

*Decent parking space.
*Unfortunately, they don’t have gasoline here.; Wawa is always consistent. It doesn't matter which one I go to, I know the food will be the same good quality, service good and prices fair.; Place has definitely gone down over the past months. Young White lady with blonde hair at the drink making section was completely rude. I asked if my drink would be ready yet (I waited 30 mins) she spoke to me as if I was STUPID!!  Very condescending. Get better employees who don't burst out in anger over a simple question. Wasn't even busy that day

Reviews: Everything was really nice. Everything was clean and very organized. The only thing you need to be prepared for is to bring your own bags if you will have a lot of groceries. Each bag costs 10 cents, which is not bad, but just be prepared if it is your first time going and you are not aware of this.; Needed an extra duffle to get our stuff home. This Walmart has a bit of everything even a nail salon that I would also recommend. My gel nail polish looks great even after 2 weeks of snorkeling and swimming.; There's barely any groceries we can shop for here... it's good for a quick stop for general groceries, but that's about it. There's a big Econo in the same shopping court though. That one's good.; I love shopping at Walmart, however it would be nice if they would do all their stock after store hours. The isles are not big enough for shoppers and gondolas with people putting stock at the busiest times; This location is ok, I mean this was the location we have been coming back to for things we needed, the stock on Spring Water and coconut water are low which is surprising but all and all it worked out for us. About price and products, they have all and are very competitive.; I should shop there more often for groceries. They always have what I need or want, especially bulk meat and poultry. Called 5 times to order breakfast, but no one answered. Walked in, as we waited in line, the person behind us in line jumped in and ordered in front of us, instead of the workers telling him to please wait for his turn, they just skipped us unapologetically. Waited 35 minutes for 2 egg/ham/toast breakfast. They forgot we had ordered waters too although we were charged for it. They put milk on my coffee even though I specifically asked for black coffee, and last but not least when we were sitting down to eat the paper they used to wrap our food in is not proper for foods. The ink/dye leaked on our food and obviously we couldn’t eat it. See photos — no it’s not sauce! It’s dye :/; This is the second time we came here and both times we were very disappointed in the service and food quality. I was very excited to have a nice dinner place at the Marina open, but unfortunately the quality of service is subpar.
We got seater at 9pm last night and ordered a bottle of wine, the cheese plate and some calamari to start. Everything started well and we were enjoying ourselves. 20 minutes later they brought the calamari which were just rubber. We were hungry so my husband ate them. I couldn’t chew through them. Anyways, at 9.45 they finally bring the cheese plate. The pita is raw, like pale white and the dough is raw. No one to mention this to, since the server brought the bottle of wine no one has approached us, not to pour wine, not to check on the table, not to take our main course order. The $35 cheese plate consists of 3 cheeses, olives, olive tapenade and the pita bread. Since our pita was raw and we weren’t interested in eating raw flour we just ate the hard cheese. A buser came and took the plate away, and we mentioned the pita situation. She said sorry and left. Our server finally came to tell us the kitchen is closing, we ordered the NY strip and the churrasco, both with tostones de pana and a side of truffle fries to share. 15 min later someone came and dropped my husband’s order in front of me. The fries were as a side on his plate. Please note that the cutlery and appetizer plates were just put in front of my husband and I wasn’t given a fork. Another 10 minutes later they brought my steak. Cold. With a blob of butter on it. The steak was cold enough that the butter didn’t melt when spread. Just cold butter on a cold steak.
The server also told us that she mentioned to the “chef” the pita was raw and the “chef” said it was in fact ok. She mentioned she doesn’t want to argue with the “Chef” because he’s her husband. Umm, ok?!
We got our bill, paid $160 including a 15% tip. We usually tip at least 20%, but honestly this was a case where no tip was deserved, if anything, an apology from their management is in order.
We won’t come back and don’t recommend it to anyone.
It’s a shame because it’s so nice to sit outside, the music is nice, location is perfect and their wine list is really nice.
They need some serious training on  service etiquette for their staff.; Place is “ok” for last minute things. A lot of áreas of improvement. Good prices and location is convenient if you’re already at the marina there’s no need to go out to the grocery.; Walked in knowing what I wanted to order. Sat for well over 25 minutes waiting to order anything. Watched every foh staff person take orders from different people who walked up or sat down after us without anyone acknowledging us or asking if we needed help/anything. Finally, one person came up, looked at me, and asked " do you need anything?" I said "do you have" and he walked away to help someone else. Made eye contact w/several staff, motioned for attention got the nod and still was ignored as they served another newer customer. There were at least 5 foh staff & maybe 15 tables. 👎🏼👎🏼
2 stars b/c some of the meat cuts are reasonably priced for being at a marina. When we previously visited during weekdays & were the only 2 ppl in the store we were able to get service.... after personal conversation was finished, not when we came to the counter.; I only had  pizza and it was good and the service waa great.

Name: A.R. Supermarket
Address: 9580 Garden Grove Blvd #300, Garden Grove, CA 92844, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 300 (subpremise); 9580 (street_number); Garden Grove Boulevard (route); Garden Grove (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92844 (postal_code); 1529 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Great Korean supermarket! 🇰🇷

Perfect for buying Korean ingredients that you can’t find at other Asian supermarkets in the area. The meat section is perfect for buying your favorite cut and cooking Korean BBQ at home. They have great produce and fresh vegetables to choose from. Compared to American grocery stores, the prices here are a lot cheaper and they always seem to have new items in season. However, certain sections of the store are lacking and could use a better selection. There are also some items that we were looking for like boba pearls and they didn’t seem to have them which was disappointing.

The place overall is pretty small, but they have a lot of other small shops and a small food court inside as well. You can tell that it’s an authentic Asian supermarket because it’s not super clean. ^_^ It’s located in a large plaza with other shops and a popular coffee shop so there are plenty of parking spots.

Highly recommend!; First time here and impressed with the atmosphere and vibe of the place. The food was all delicious. Got the omelets and chicken wings and ube latte. Everything was really tasty. Prices are a bit high but nothing out of the ordinary for these times. Definitely would recommend if you like brunch places.; My friend lives in Garden Grove and she told me that actually A.R. Supermarket is her favorite for getting Korean food and products.

That’s interesting because I was often shopping Korean food in H Mart nearby but never noticed this A.R. Supermarket so I went to check it out.

It offers a wide variety of products at prices significantly lower than the H Mart’s!!

Vegetables, fruits, and mushrooms are very fresh, with organic brands too. There’s also a wide selection of side dishes, meat, seafood, frozen food, sauces, snacks, instant noodles, shampoos and etc. Those items are often on sale. For example, Harim’s frozen ginseng chicken soup was $7.7 (dated 5/2024) on sale while it was priced at $9.9 on Weee even after a discount.

The store layout is okay, but the lighting isn’t as bright as H Mart’s, so it might seem not so modern, however, I don’t mind as long as it provides good products with great price.

There are a few shops aside in supermarket including shoes shop, Korean cosmetic chain store, women clothing stores and hair accessory shop.  Overall, it’s a great place to shop at one stop and I definitely recommend it.

📍A.R. Supermarket (Korea Plaza)
9580 Garden Grove Blvd #300, Garden Grove, CA 92844

They also have a Fullerton location 📍 1701 Orangethorpe Ave, Fullerton, CA 92833; Great place for getting all the things we need for Korean BBQ; This is an nice foreign shopping experience without leaving town. I had to teturn the mosquito coils I bought here on sale for $4 because they were $2.50 right next door. They only offered me store credit, no refund.  I was ok with that, but used it up right away because the credit was issued on a simple hand written note.

Reviews: I would like to say hello to all who have the opportunity to read this note. All Super Market even if all got grocery, are no the same. It depending on the nationality where the Owners are from. Ctown Super Market has good Latin Food, while Jaint Food Stores, they have American Food and Latin Food. Selector Supermarket has also,  a variety of food to satisfy the community around.; Been coming here for decades. Recently I called asked for help. My daughter is in a wheelchair and I could not take her inside, they took my order, my credit card and met me out front with my groceries.  While this is a service big chains perform they did it with easy and friendliness. Thank you! You don’t know how these acts of kindness make a difference to families like mine. ❤️; While y'all paying those crazy prices at acame an shopenwrigt an stop don't shop grocery stores in here getting fresh meats an fresh vegetables and fruits at a low prices. Best kept secret. Why you think you don't see no Hispanic ppl complaining about groceries because they shop at they stores steak big ones 10-15 dollars big package of children 3-4 dollars go to any of them it's a better buy for your money trust me.; I came here looking for A BIG POT....they had what I was looking for. The cashier was very cordial as well as helpful; I love 💕 to shop at Selecto, there meats are always fresh and excellent vegetables, but there's something that I'm very disappointed and that's there parking lot, it's to small, and sometimes when the parking lot is full, it so difficult to get out, they need to enlarge there parking lot, and there customers would be much happier, Thank you 😊 for listening to my suggestion.

This place is small but has a good variety. Prices are lower than I expected being that it's a smaller chain. The staff was  very friendly. It's recently opened so it wasn't very full. I saw that they had a kitchen so I believe they'll be serving hot food there. I like that option. If you're going you may miss it. So just look out for the tire place Gomera Edwin.; The outside is very comfortable and you can go out easily, the interiors are quite comfortable and you can easily find food. The problem here is the excessive prices, today I bought a 10 Oz Canada dry it cost me 4 with something else and that costs cheaper elsewhere. My girlfriend's mother has been there several times and she only bought two or 3 soda padrinos and an oil and a snack and it cost her about 34 pesos, which if you go to Walmart it will cost you about 20 pesos. And the staff looks at you seriously and the girl who served us today didn't even say good afternoon to us.

If I could give it 0 stars I would give it; Very complete in the variety of products they have.  The lunch area also has very delicious food.  I recommend it 100%.👏👏👍👍; This supermarket is excellent over time because it is close to my house but its prices are very high, it should compete with Walmart's cone and prices and it could be fuller than people visit it in the service the staff helps a lot customer but whatever the price is very high success; My comfortable and very good service.

Reviews: This is the most idyllic local store. There are many fruteras on the island but I have yet to find one that compares to this. The owner is a genuine and kind person. You can tell he loves his job and takes pride in it. Those attributes are hard to come by these days. Everything is fresh. I've had the best tomatoes and avocados I've ever had in my life. Skip Walmart and Econo... just come here you won't regret it. Also yes the sell limbers aka the Puertorican icee. These are fresh and some of the best you'll try.; Best "frutera" there is that i know off and great location for rural people, its great and very friendly owners and family runned also locally supplied, Just a great place to get local groceries from would recommend to a friend.; Super friendly owner, good prices, super delicious limber, homemade.; Excellent service and variety of local products.; Fresh vegetables, greens and different flavors limbers 😋

Reviews:
i love this place! great grocery options for pretty good prices, loads of parking but its always full lol!

they recently introduced housemade agua frescas which vary day to day. Such a great deal for the price! A single serving with a reusable container is around $2. And a whole jug of agua fescas for $6.99. The jug caters for 5-8 people easily! Such a great price for the quantity. My favorite is the Mamey Agua Frescas!! Its so goodddd. And their bakery has a wide selection with prices that fit everyone’s budget!

My favorite sections here are the fresh produce, agua frescas, and the bakery!

They also have coin machine and a wells fargo atm!; The middle freezer that had the foster farms chicken in it was not cold enough to hold all of that chicken. Always putting some broken down things in minority areas. I'm sick of it!! Also, Superior needs to become a diverse store and not just cater to the Hispanic culture. Not prejudice at all I just notice in Superior you can not find some items that African Americans use on a daily/ weekly basis, causing us to have to drive here and there for groceries.; Always when I want to go for some sweet bread I found flies inside.... so nasty ..🤮🤮🤮🤮
And also saw people biting the bread and putting it back inside; Ways find what I like to crate great meals; This place is no longer Numero 1.
Now is Superior market.
The products are a little expensive,
but it looks well organized, and clean, and has good parking space, just try to get a hold of the special offers whenever you can ^_^
