Reviews:
I had so much fun in the store. I can't even start to tell you how much fun loved the little horchata drinks and everything they had in there. It was just so awesome. I even love the bags They had $0.10 a bag but I still loved them. I brought them home with me and plan on keeping them. They're so cute! Oh and I might add they had everything we needed there staff was friendly and the store was clean; Reasonable prices for lots of fresh everything. In-house made tortillas of freshly ground white or yellow corn, (cactus and wheat tortillas, chips too.) In-house made traditional drinks to drink there or bring a quantity home. Fresh made tamales, burritos, sandwiches, salads, dips and desserts. Large bakery selection of traditional breads and sweets. Vegetables, fruits, large assortment of dried peppers, herbs, beans. Beautiful hand painted pottery for serving and for gifts. Fresh butchered meats, seafood, cheeses. Diverse frozen foods department. Large aisles.; To Whom It May Concern,

As a loyal customer of over many years, dating back to when this location was Top Value store, I am writing to express my disappointment and frustration with the service I have received at the Northgate Market meat department. Despite my initial excitement about the store's renovations, my recent experiences have left me feeling fed up.

Specifically, I have encountered three employees in the meat department who seem to lack supervision, appearing tired, stressed, and displaying friction among themselves. I would like to bring the following issues to your attention:

Employees are not wearing name badges, making it difficult to identify them.
- A male employee, wearing a face mask and having multiple tattoos, consistently displays a bad temper, yelling numbers, and ignoring customers' questions. He also throws packaged meat on the counter, showing a lack of customer service skills.

As a manager myself, I would address these issues urgently. I have noticed some improvements, such as meat rotation and presentation during the grand opening, but these efforts seem to wane in the late afternoons, with some meat appearing stale and dry.

As a bulk meat purchaser, I spend significant amounts of money at this store, but I can no longer continue to stress and deal with the same employees without seeing changes after multiple complaints. I hope this feedback helps ownership become aware of these issues and take necessary actions before losing loyal customers like myself.

Im not giving one star as my review since I have had great experience with the cashiers and had a great experience with a gentleman from the deli department. He was very informative and helpful while I was trying to decide what to purchase.

Thank you; My place to go when I need real Mexican and Latino food products.  They have a tortilla factory in the store and you can always find super fresh corn and flour tortillas for sale.  They also have a good butcher counter with reasonable prices.  Their produce department offers run of the mill products as well as some of the more exotic produce that may be hard to find at your local Ralphs.  Their deli also has prepared food.  My favorite is their tamales that come in lots of flavors. There is plenty of parking in a large lot.  They; Northgate Market is the best if you want Mexican food, produce and things you will not get elsewhere. They also have everything else you would get at any good market.

The place is just spotless. They are always cleaning and it shows. The produce is amazing and they have a selection of peppers you simply won't find at a typical market.

They have a large section of hot food. You can get it there and just leave or continue shopping. The selection is really amazing and the prices are low. They have the best tamales and their rice and beans are so great. They have a lot of hot items and sometimes there is a line, but it moves fast. You will be happy with everything.

As to the main market area they have good prices on things you would want to get at a regular market and a vast selection of Spanish and Mexican items, be they canned or fresh.

It is easy to park in their large lot.

The service is great. I have never seen an employee that does not look happy and they are all so kind.

You will love this place. We do.

Reviews:
This place is awesome!! The tamale station (both hot and cold) is phenomenal. The strawberry tamales are on point!

The chicken was delicious  our daughter ate it happily! There's so many things that our city needed that el super and Santa Fe don't do right.

The only recommendation is to split the areas for ordering food. We had a person behind us waiting to order a whole chicken, but splitting the Cocina and tortileria line into two would add way more customer satisfaction! Glad the old Kmart building has some use finally!!; Store is clean, vibrant, fresh and has an open airy feel to it. Meats and produce look clean and fresh. Oh yeah, and they have a in house tortilla factory 👍; Verdict: store has wide variety of Latin and Mexican products at regular prices and hot food options are ok. However, employees, specially security need to be educated on ADA laws.

Full review:
The security employees need to be educated on federal and state ADA laws regarding service and support animals. It is illegal to request for documentation to proof animal service registration. Employees are only allowed to ask whether a dog is service animal and what kind of service it provides. Also, ADA laws does not require dogs to wear a special harness and much less to have the dog on arms at all times. The employees admitted they didn't know the laws, but still demanded to get out.

Regarding to the store products and service only:
The store is well stocked and has pretty much anything you may need to make most mexican dishes. The food court items are varies. The carnitas are specially good. People behind the counters are polite.; Great prices and great variety of produce and meats (competitive pricing and wide range of poultry, beef, pork etc), all types of chorizo too 😏. the kitchen, bakery and tortillería are a great plus. Their tequila selection was pretty good I even got their last bottle of don ramon (havent seen this one in ages) and they even threw in a glass of the goat ochoa 🤣🙏  aint pullin up to overpriced ahh santa fe no more; The store is amazing, clean, organized, lovely. My only issue is the self-checkouts because it weighs the items or it will lock the screen and it locked me several times even though I placed each item as instructed and made sure my child didn’t pick up anything until the cashier just got mad and yelled at me. Lol 😂 im mad too dumb machine. Get rid of that. I ain’t stealing cilantro and tomatoes. Lol

Reviews:
Great place to find organic meats and good prices. Staff is friendly, store is well stocked and always clean. I never have to wait long in line. My only hiccup if you will is that I wish they had more snack options, however I understand this type of store options are going to change so I didn't deduct a star.; Unprofessional employees. I worked there for a while and the owner held my check against me and blocked direct deposit so cashing my check was hard for me too. Whenever customers needed a manager they will take forever to come to the front. One of the managers Brianda gave my sister attitude when I asked her if she can pick up my last check and disrespectfully told her no. One of the workers stole my lunch and the whole store in general is so unprofessional and unorganized.
Would not recommend coming here. They need to do better; One of the things I miss most about CA, besides family and the weather, is Grocery Outlet! Love the variety of organic foods and products, at bargain prices! Between chips, coffee, ice cream, chocolate, and fruit, there are always some great finds here. They also have a robust beer and wine section. When can we get one in South Carolina?!; Lots of deals, good prices. Always fun to see what new products are on sale. Paid $51 for all this stuff (including the lucky bamboo) with a savings of $31. Very pleased.; Do NOT buy cat food here.  If it isn't already expired,  then it will be very soon.  My cats won't eat the same foods, bought from Grocery Outlet, that eat all the time from other stores.

Vendors in your way, and extremely rude if you get in their way! The manager on duty was a snot! Walked around like she owned the place! Not a great experience overall!; Kevin provided me with great customer service at the Bakery dept. He greeted me and help me with the sprinkling cake for my husband. Thank you Kevin; First time at Nob Hill. The store is nice, and the employees were nice to me. That was cool. Everything was pretty high priced. They did have good sushi that was fairly priced. I also found some iced tea from my hometown in Hawaii that was delicious. All in all the store is ok.; Very friendly staff and very helpful. Easy to find and plenty of parking. This store carries 2 of my favorite products Angelo Pietro Salad dressings and Yamasa soy sauce.; I’ve been shopping at Nob Hill Foods for almost 30 years. I’ve found that this store is very reasonably priced compared to Safeway, especially if you become a member and clip the savings! The employees are some of the best people in this town, helpful, kind, and knowledgeable. I know many of them now after shopping there for years. One of the managers named Vince is exceptional!! He’s always working and available to help you at any time. If I have to criticize anything I would say that there are way too many store brand products. I wish they would carry more of the name brands like they used to a few years back. Store brands just aren’t the same quality or taste.

Name: Los Limber de Rey
Address: 35J5+7RH, PR-906, Comunas, Yabucoa 00767, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 35J5+7RH (plus_code); Puerto Rico 906 (route); Comunas (locality); Playa (administrative_area_level_2); Yabucoa (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00767 (postal_code)
Reviews: Grew up enjoying "Limbers", so as soon as we saw this place driving by we knew we had to stop and have a taste before returning home. Tried the "Tamarindo", "Parcha", and "Crema". All of them delicious.; Excellent limbers with many different selections in flavors.  $1.25 each as of Nov 2023.; Ricooo; I was in Puerto Rico on vacation 2 weeks ago, and while in Yabucoa, my beautiful town, I, my wife and my children decided to stop here to buy limbers. What delicious limbers. The man at this place had a great variety of limbers in flavors that I had never thought there were. My wife bought one made of tamarind and I bought one made of grape, because the guava ones had run out, and my children bought fruit punch. Definitely when we return there I will stop by there again to buy more limbers. There are a multitude of flavors and it is impossible to try them all in one visit. These limbers are pure pulp, they are not sweet and ice like some places. From the first bite to the last it is pure flavor. God bless you all.; We were on vacation and found this place, the best limber I've ever tried, my favorite is coconut. The one with tamarind, passion fruit, Nutella for the children... they are all on another level.

Reviews:
Quantity not quality at this Popeyes. Is this a Franchise that you can own? If so,  then I will stay clear of Popeys and stick with Church Chicken. At Popeyes the chicken tasted as of it were fried in old,  very old oil.    Fries were cold and it just isn't worth risking the drive thru and wasting hard earned money.  Even the pie sucked. Ugh; Dirty and smelly.  I like Popeyes but this particular restaurant is a mess; This plaza has a little bit of everything from clothing,shoes,food, and more. This mall also has plenty of handicap parking and wheelchair accessible entrance and ramps,bathrooms, exqulators; The place is mostly known for the movie theatre and the many fast food places around it, during lunch hours.  As for stores, it's mostly just nutrition shops, womens clothing and accesories.  There's a small super market, but there's a walgreens and walmart nearby.  So  you are better going to those.

There's a video game shop next to the theatre.  But the prices on their games and collectibles are very over priced.  Even the common retro games are very overpriced and most of the handheld games they have are fakes.  Especially the pokemon games.; Easy access variety of item stores, and eatery's.

Their meat and seafood area is not as big as other Ralph's store but it works for them. I was interested in seeing what soda they have here because every store carries different flavor. I was able to find the cherry coke which the Ralph's store near my house is always sold out or they don't have it. This store also have some nice flowers selection in the front when you walk in so you can see them first. I also like that this store has a lot of self checkout because it speed the process. The parking here is amazing because it's in a big lot and with a lot of other stores closed down, it's a very quiet plaza. I would come back to this Ralph's location again if I was in the area.; We love this Ralph’s, it’s always clean and well-stocked. Reviews:
This is a fantastic spot with a wide range of healthy options and plenty of local products. The supermarket itself is beautiful. For lunch, I highly recommend ordering a salad. You can either customize your own or choose from their signature options. Everything is made fresh right in front of you, and they chop everything, making it easy to eat. At just $6.99, the portions are generous enough to easily feed two people—a great deal!

The staff is sweet and friendly, making the experience even better. I really like this plac; Very nice little grocery store. The staff is friendly and helpful. That being said, this is not tailored for the average shopper, pricing and some of the products are above normal partially because this is not a big chain store and they're buying volume is smaller and that tends to drive prices up. Also, the clientele are people who live up Old Santa Fe trail which tend to be higher income.; Outstanding local market that has been on location for decades.  For a small store there are plenty of grocery and prepared items.  Several good vegetarian options.  Prices are on the high side, but they offer high end options.  There is an outdoor covered location, with tables and chairs for eating on location.  Good on-site parking.; Fabulous local grocery store! Great wine selection! Terrific butcher! And their salad bar is legendary! So glad that Santa Fe has an independent, local grocery store close to downtown!; We purchased chicken thighs and grilled them.  The chicken had a wild fowl Odor prior to cooking and even worse after! We through it out!  Very expensive, which is understandable for the convenience.  However, quality is poor!

Reviews:
I recently visited the Walmart in Humacao, PR, and had a generally positive experience. The store is well-stocked with a wide variety of products, making it easy to find everything I needed in one place. The layout is convenient, and the aisles are clean and organized.

The staff were friendly and helpful, readily available to answer any questions I had and assist me with locating items. The checkout process was efficient, and I didn't have to wait long in line.

The only reason I’m not giving a full 5 stars is because the parking lot can get quite crowded, especially during peak hours, making it a bit challenging to find a spot. However, overall, it's a great place to shop with a good selection and helpful service. I'll definitely be returning for my future shopping needs!; Very, very busy. Pretty good selection of products.  Enjoyed Panda Express.  Also, contrary to most places in Puerto Rico, the bathrooms were well maintained. The vendors outside had great ice cream and icees.; It’s hard for me to get that upset to write a review of any kind. But I grew up going to Walmart and I always left my shopping cart alone for a very long time. But the day I went recently I was rushing out of respect that the store was closing soon. So since I have a debilitating disability. I was in pain and could not push my heavy cart but I left it no more than 5 minutes. When I come back my shopping cart magically dissapears and they cannot find my shopping cart they took recently. This whole ordeal was disappointing especially when the staff could care less about my children’s food and my hard work to fill that shopping cart ( Disabled people are not welcomed); I love going to this Walmart because they have a variety of items. Plus the isles are not cluttered.; The Humacao Walmart is located in a mall that doesn't have control of the parking and the accessibility of the customer.
After opened the Home Depot across the street we stopped going to Walmart as you never know if you can get out later.
The location isn't convenient... better at Econo..

Name: Trader Joe's
Address: 4675 Admiralty Way, Marina Del Rey, CA 90292, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews:
At Art of Gifting, one of our favorite baskets this season features an incredible selection of Trader Joe’s Thanksgiving products! From their delicious pumpkin treats to gourmet seasonal items, this basket is perfect for spreading holiday cheer. We deliver in Los Angeles and Orange County, and this beautifully curated basket has been a hit with our clients. Trader Joe’s unique offerings truly elevate our Thanksgiving collection, making each gift both thoughtful and flavorful. Highly recommend their products for creating the perfect holiday gift!; I loved the prices, location, accessibility, and wide selection... but was dumbfounded to learn that Trader Joe's does not sell ice!

What? I have to go to ANOTHER food store for ice? Why? If I were an ice company, I'd have my reps hitting up TJ management every single day. Easy money.

There's Burton Chace Park right next door. BBQ grills, hot weather, beautiful views... ice is a necessity!

😀; Staff is very friendly and very helpful. They had lots of new products at this location, that it inspired me to create a sandwich using all Trader Joe’s products and ingredients. If you would like to see the whole video go to /TikTok @lafmob/; I just had a parking lot problem with another customer that stole my parking space. No parking lot since REI took over the Trader Joe's parking lot. There is not enough room for the amount of customers. Trader Joe's needs to figure it out and make more space for customers. Marina del Rey has a million people and Trader Joe's has half of parking blocked for boater's parking only. There are so many of those parking spaces left empty. People are getting too aggressive and aggravated that I have decided to shop elsewhere until this problem is resolved. Trader Joe's this matter requires immediate attention.; The Trader Joe's with the best optics, extremely good real estate. The food here is pretty normal, just like every other Trader Joe's. We did find a unique chili pepper snack, pretty spicy if you eat too many. Good prices on organic apricots currently

Address Components: #7 (subpremise); 6020 (street_number); South Seabluff Drive (route); Playa Vista (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90094 (postal_code)
Reviews: I used to frequent this store at least weekly to buy the 1/2 chicken and fries. Delicious!  Much to my surprise today I received some very overcooked chicken that look like it had been sitting up for at least 4 hours. Aunt some clearly frozen preseason fries unlike the fresh cut fries they used to sell. Why in the heck would you stop selling this with fresh fries and go for preseasoned, super salty, orange french fries. So disappointed. So disappointed. Please bring back the old fresh roasted chicken and fresh french fry combination.  If not, I unfortunately will not be able to continue coming here because it was such a disappointment.; The dude with the long hair and glasses has a very negative attitude. Ruins the whole atmosphere of the shop. He seems extremely supercilious. Lovely area too and it’s a lovely shop such a shame it’s ruined by this guy’s demeanor.; Ordered a bunch of items. All in stock. Store calls. I return the call 4 minutes later and they say too late you order has left and you’re only getting 2 items. Ends up costing $25 for a slice of cheese cake. Mostly fees and a tip. Don’t mind the tip because the driver did their part. Called store back to discuss and they basically don’t give a &$@* if ever order again or not. I guess I’m like everyone else and don’t like getting ripped off.; Yummy used to be in Santa Monica. I was so sad to see them leave. They delivered groceries before it became popular. Fortunately, this location delivers to Santa Monica. They have most household items and a good selection of groceries. The deli has some of the best sandwiches. My favorite is the victory garden. The price is a bit higher than some other grocers, but it's worth it.; Love Yummy. Most reliable groceries during the pandemic. They always call if they are out of stock and ask if you would like to replace it with something else. The workers are so caring and hard-working.

Name: Mitsuwa Marketplace
Address: 3760 S Centinela Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90066, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews:
Japanese shopping and dining marketplace which is structured like a mini complex combo of a foodcourt, bookstore, and grocery/supermarket.

The place is a bit aged but has decent options for dine in and takeaway food.

The grocery and bookstore are spacious enough but too tight for wheelchair access.

Minor inconveniences if you are looking for a bit of authentic Japanese culture within the city.; Stopped in after landing at LAX.  Fun little shopping trip. A mix of gifts, treats, eats,   collectibles, and books. All japanese related.; This is one of my favorite places to get a great ramen and also the market itself its a nice place to get heigh quality fruits, vegetables, meat and fresh fish you can find lots of Japanese goods here; Oh my is this one of the best places to shop at. It has everything revolving around japanese culture. They sell a variety of fresh asian produce for your cooking, an array of snacks and ramen, and a nice selection of meat. The market is quite tidy and could get a little packed. Next to the marketplace is a food stall which sells different japanese food and even has a bookstore!; This is a wonderful grocery store. If you haven't been here yet this is your sign! A lot of time they have really great looking tuna, and do not pass up on the gochujang chicken in the meat section!

It was a great store, definitely I need to plan to go there with my own container. If you don’t have containers 🫙 its kind of expensive which motivates me to bring my own👍🏽 lots of products to choose from, love this store. Got my tofu, loofa sponges, tea strainer and more. 🙂Definitely will change the world if each one of us do our part. 💚💚💚👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽Thank you to Parker very nice especially with my little ones,it was a quick trip but very helpful to introduce to my kids👍🏽Yes we will be back soon⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️; I’m thrilled to have a RE_ on the west side!! Their selection is pretty diverse and the whole experience was just amazing. Their weighing system is easy and so high tech, they have containers if you didn’t bring any and they have a rewards program ✨🫶🏻 the place exceeded my expectation!; Wait i am in loveee. This is a perfect place for me or anyone who desires or maintains a more sustainable way of doing restocking of your dry goods. It’s such a neat and logical concept. Added to my bi-weekly routine.

Def brining my jars next time but the y do have some for purchase + paper pouches in case you forgot yours.; What a cool store! A really fun way to shop for groceries and discover new startup brands. And it’s all sustainable with zero waste. Beautiful store - feels like the Apple Store of grocery. Love their first location in Highland Park, so excited they’re expanding west!; So many fun things! I'm buying a bunch of small portions so next time I'll know exactly what I want.  I found all the staples I was looking for: baking soda, vinegar, dish soap. Brought my own containers. Easy process, helpful staff. Hard to find, but now I know where it is.

Reviews:
From adult beverages to baby diapers, they have it all. They also have regular grocery store prices so don't recover l expect to overpay.; Honestly I come here for the deli! I loveeee their Italian sandwiches/paninis. The owner is so sweet and it’s made fresh on the spot. If you’re looking for alcohol, this is THE spot on the block. Plenty of street parking and close parking to the beach!; I do like this corner store however I don't like that they don't display prices for their items. Most items seem to be reasonably priced (It's a fun game of Russian Roulette each time at the counter.. not really) but sometimes you'll find an item or two waaaay overpriced. I just now picked up a frozen pizza from them thinking "surely it can't be more than $10... WRONG.  When I went to pay for it in the front I found out they are charging $15.99 for a Digornio frozen pizza. HIGHWAY ROBBERY.  I've never seen a Digornio pizza for over $9 in a grocery store... What a rip off!  I'll think twice about what I purchase from here again.

Price labels would be more helpful and transparent for the customer, which would lead to a happier interaction and experience.; This place is a no-go. I've lived in this neighborhood for 3 years and Alan's could be a great neighborhood market but it's trash. $20 for a 4-pack of beer that Bristol Farms sells for $11. I bought freezer burned breakfast sausage a few weeks ago and tonight I bought room temp blue cheese dressing from the produce section that had a broken seal. This place is a joke. The neighborhood needs a good market but this place isn't it. Either care about your neighbors and customers or sell it to someone who will.; Careful. They intentionally hide prices. Good selection but priced with the neighborhood. 6 pack of beer is $22, kinder egg $4. Few customers complained. Shop elsewhere if you’re price conscious. Else carry on.

The fruit tasted like Monsanto got a hold of the fruit. They were basically inedible. Is this a new thing that they started the moment I requested a refund, that they don't return marked down items? They seem to hire a lot of devils that mark people's steps and lie and wait for their life. And what did the devil who refused to give me a refund have to do with Monsanto? Is this a new thing they started at the moment I was trying to return such that they don't accept returns on certain marked down sale items?; Stores smells like fish, the produce is bad, the lines are not open they funnel you to self checkout and then make you do their job for them and then watch you like a hawk especially if you don’t appear to be rich. The produce is always fresh, the store is clean and maintained inside and out, and the prices can't be beat. Not to mention hidden gems that can be found searching the reduced item shelves. I love shopping at Ralph's and won't go anywhere else for my groceries.; A bit run down, but the staff is friendly, efficient, and already ready to serve customers at 6:15 AM on a Sunday. Such a bad experience.
I shop at that branch all the time and she just made me not wanna show up again.
This behaviour is just bad .

Their salsa selections are great.

Their beans are OK

Great customer service; Always a pleasure shopping here. This last visit I picked up some of the best red, seedless grapes I've ever had. Reviews:
This is a clean store with awesome options of quick meals. The quick meals options are prepared to your liking. The produce is always fresh. The selection of meats is awesome. The indoor cafe is tasteful. Amazon members link your account to Bristol Farms app. There are special savings when you link your Amazon account.; Every Bristol Farms on Tuesday gives a 10% senior discount. The everyday 3 varieties of baked fresh cookies (peanut butter, milk chocolate, and original) are huge and worth price. Buy six get one free. No taxes on anything.; Bristol Farms is a great grocery store with great quality, I personally feel like this store in particular excels in providing that type of service. I always see high quality fruits and vegetables, and it is always a clean environment. I shop here regularly so I can stand on that statement. Also the food bar, juice bar, deli section, etc are always of high quality as well. Great for organic and plant-based shoppers!; Way overpriced for exact same items elsewhere. Usually leave annoyed with the store. Their "sale prices" usually bring things to regular prices.

Example: Orgain Simple vegan protein powder vanilla (15 servings) is 23$ and target and amazon, etc.

It is 42$ at this Bristol.

FORTY TWO.

And they won't price match when asked.

Insane price difference and there's plenty of similar scenarios all over the store. With as high of prices at this location, you'd expect some stellar customer service. Sadly, it's usually a sour mood employee, or the security guard making you feel unwelcome.

This place survives off LMU community, they'd by sunk otherwise.; We ordered a grilled turkey sandwich and took it to go. The bread was a bit  crispy on the outside. The turkey, cheese and Avocado was about 1.5 inches thick. Everything was fresh and tasty. We split the sandwich and 1/2 was enough for one person.

We stop by whenever we visit LMU.  Very clean store with tons of buying options. The fresh food pre-made cold and hot section will have you spending time trying to decide what will be the best choice for that day.

About $5-15 per person.

Reviews:
A nice little store where the locals shop. They have everything you need at half the price of the restaurants around. If you want to save some money you must come to this store before getting a snack or going to the different beaches on this side of the island. People are so nice in this neighborhood. We were looking at the mangos on the tree next to the store and a lady came to give us a bag of free mangos. Get your ice, beers, ice cream, chips, etc. it also has a bathroom.; They have what you need for a few days to stay on Vieques with minimum stuff. If you need more supplies, I’d recommend going somewhere else. I understand everything has to be imported but my goodness price inflation was crazy. Everything in my photo was $98; Very good small town supermarket. With all you need for your stay in Vieques.; We were on a boat, stopped here for provisions.

Reviews:
As some other reviewers have noted, there are very few prices on the items!
And there is no way for me to scan them. So I have to go to the register, and the cashier rings the item up, and then I say, “gee, that’s too expensive” and I put it back and I try to find another item. It’s such a waste of time!

And the people at the cash register are downright grumpy. Another review noted that as well. It’s not my fault that they don’t have prices on their items. The people, without exception, were grumpy. Every…time…I went in, which was dozens of times.

Lastly, the produce section is quite limited. Not one single avocado.

I will say they have an excellent wine selection and an excellent “wine cave” in the back. But I will save my dollars for the other stores on the island where the prices are marked and the cashiers are friendlier.; Of the three we have shopped on Vieques so far, they are a solid second. Good selection of canned/shelf-stable foods including Kirkland brand (Costco) dry goods and surprising refrigerated ravioli, a cheese tray, and lots ice cream. They had a good selection of cleaning products, but nothing to wash dishes with-such as a sponge or dish towel. The fresh produce was sparse and what was available did not appear to be very fresh, although they did have good looking shallots and onions, which I bought.; They were open late, had everything we needed, and is located on a great strip of other stores close to sea glass beach.; This store does Not Have Prices on 90% of their food!

They Do Not follow the law and provide a scanner!

I saw two labels on the shelf for mozzarella cheese yesterday. One "Kraft Mozzarella" for $3.99 and the other "Three Cheese" for $7.99.

I decided on the $3.99.

At the register. SHE RANG THE CHEESE LAST for $7.99.  I  said, "The shelf lable says $3.99". Indignantly, she says, "Show me."

We walked back, I pointed to the table, and she said, "it's the wrong sku." OK, so how long has it been since they sold Kraft for $3.99?

Why would they leave it up? Most people would not pay attention, but I am on a fixed budget, and I don't get free food.

She says, "it's $7.99, you want it or not?"

The manager or owner was upfront, so I went to him and went over the same thing.  His attitude was the same, and he actually tried to blame me for being the problem.

I explained that the law says he's to have a scanner, and I have asked him on other occasions for prices of food that's not priced.

I asked before, and they laughed.

They don't care about the person buying food. They have a 'Take It or Leave It' attitude with a rude sense of customer appreciation.

There is no telling how many items are outrageously priced, and we have to pay regardless... because they know they Got You!

There was never an "I am sorry, or We made a mistake,  only, That's the Price, You Want It or Not"?

The girl finally rung it up at $2.99. But after being treated like I was, it was not for me, I  didn't want to buy anything from them again!

Be Aware!
Nearly No Prices!
Wrong Lables!
Piss Poor Customer Care!

I'll go Elsewhere From Now On!; Best selection on the island for meats and fruits/vegetables in-store, but a bit expensive (think Wholefoods) and check-out can be exhausting!

Reviews: I would consider Tienda Verde great in a pinch. They are open later than some. They have a good stock of beverages, including wine, beer, and liquor, which can be taken to the nearby open air restaurants. They have basic dry goods, but very little produce. The employees were the very nicest we have come across on the island. If I could rate the store itself and the employees separately, I would give the store a 3 star review and the employees a 5 star review.; Open until 21:00 but a little pricy.  Be mindful crossing the street after parallel parking; Very limited selection. (No produce or milk). Bought a box of pasta out of desperation, but there were bugs in it. Probably an ok place to buy drinks but Colmado Lydia has a better selection; A large selection of liquor and wines, a few beers, no sangria. Usual array of soft drinks, juices and snacks. But if you're looking for actual "green" products like veggies or fruits, it's not here. Maybe they started out in the green grocery business but pivoted to where the real green is: alcohol. Lydia's at the other end of town has more food selection but less booze.; It hardly has stuff, I went to search for milk and couldnot find it!!!!

experience. Store to buy your groceries. Friendly and quite efficient.

THESE STORES ARE SUBJECT TO THE ARCHIAC "JONES ACT" that the mainland USA CONGRESS MANDATES THAT ALL PRODUCTS COMING TO THIS US ISLAND PAY A TAX ON ALL PRODUCTS COMING HERE MUST GO TO A US MAINLAND PORT FIRST ON THE WAY HERE...
ALSO, EVERY ITEM including a glass of water is TAXED 11.5% - 15+% DEPENDING ON BARRIO PURCHASED.
NONE OF THIS MONEY $0.
None of this tax money gets to the COMMON PEOPLE IN THE FORM OF ROAD WORK, KEEPING THE POWER NOR WATER ON.; Nice people, i just wish they had better meat an produc, but i thank god they are here.; Pretty good selection of bulk products, cheap.; Excellent I got everything I want it; Good place for a variety of groceries

Name: Superdescuentos Morales Market
Address: 4GRX+F44, PR-200, Florida, Vieques 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM; Friday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 PM
Address Components: 4GRX+F44 (plus_code); Puerto Rico 200 (route); Florida (locality); Florida (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Of the two big grocery stores on the island, this is by far the better one. People are friendlier. The selection is better. And the prices are about 10% to 20% lower, depending on the product.

It’s also seems to be the one that the locals frequent, and the other one seems to be the one that the tourists frequent. Which may be why the other one has a bit more grumpy cashiers, having to deal with all the tourists!

This one clearly has staples for the family, but it also has rum, etc. Lots of families shopping here. Much much much better produce selection!

The only issue is that it closes early (sometimes they even close earlier than when they state on their info, so try to be there before closing time).

Oh, there’s a big parking lot along the side.; Get it while you can.
They hand cut there meat hear.
Decent selection of cheese's cut out of rounds.; A larger and easier shopping experience because some items have prices posted either on the shelf or on the products.

Vieques food stores don't see a need to price their food.

It's crazy to try and shop on a budget on Vieques. You may find 4 brands and no prices!

I try not to buy anything that is not priced.  This store does a better job letting the shopping public know how much stuff costs... still, only 40 to 50% of their products are priced.

I think a store could become the main shopping store for more people if they would price all their food and products.

They need to have more than 1 cashier.  Crazy to think 12 people are trying to check out. Wait or leave is the attitude.
Factor in no bags, no prices, can we say, delay!

Maybe Superdescuenttos Morales Market will be the pricing leader and have a working scamner more than one cashier at 3:00 pm?

The "law" says grocery stores are supposed to have a scanner!
Forget the law. Who cares if you get to know the prices?  The public that pays without government assistance doesn't worry about  it, O don't get free food, I like to know prices for choice if nothing else.

Grocery stores here seem to not care if you are on a budget or not. Buy it for whatever they tell you at the register or don't buy it! I was told exactly that at a downtown grocery mentioning Family. I don't shop there anymore !

So bring your bag or maybe? Wherever you shop.

Feeling lucky?
Maybe you can grab a box when you come in because they didn't have bags when I was shopping, but they seldomly have boxes.

The helpful clerks and an above average local selection for variety are mostly fresh.  I just wish everything was priced.

Check the 'sell by' labels and the packaged date.

The coolers/freezers were failing while I  was there or on the blink. Good luck...

All considered?  This is still the largest grocery on the island.; Best place on Vieques for basic groceries and alcohol for selection and price. Not the best for meats and veggies; Their selection of  vegetarian food was pretty good. (I didn’t know this was a vegetarian establishment before I went). I never knew everyone in Puerto Rico was vegetarian.

Reviews: Walking distance, reasonable prices, veggie variety can be improved as well as frozen desserts offer.; Very organized, easy to find items and quick checkout.; It is a supermarket of the Ralph's chain, a little smaller than others I know, but nevertheless, always with sufficient supply. It is a supermarket of the people, that is to say, with very good acceptance by the middle and lower classes. The establishment is maintained with impeccable cleanliness, and the service offered by the staff is of high quality; as for prices, in the average of the rest of the supermarkets in the area.; Everything well packed and very friendly, I did try and use ATM and it was almost 7 to get money out; Areas are clean. Has all supplies needed. But after you leave you have to provide your receipt. All cashiers are in front of the exit door. There is a bagger who helps to put in the bags the groceries you bought.The person in front see you going out from the cashier with the baggage’s and still asking for the receipt. This means there is no trust to the customers. Plus there Are a few undercover peoples watching around the store. Very frustrated with this policy. Unless you think something fishy is going on then you are suppose to check.

Reviews:
Pueblo Store: Excellence Redefined

The Pueblo Store is an exceptional establishment that deserves the highest praise. From its wide selection of products to its outstanding customer service, this store sets the standard for excellence in every aspect. In just 300 words, it is impossible to fully capture the magic that this store embodies, but I will attempt to highlight its most notable qualities.

First and foremost, the product range at the Pueblo Store is simply unparalleled. Whether you're searching for groceries, household items, electronics, or clothing, this store has it all. The shelves are stocked with high-quality products from both local and international brands, ensuring that customers have access to a diverse array of options. The store's meticulous attention to detail in curating its inventory is evident, as they consistently provide the latest and most sought-after items.

What truly sets the Pueblo Store apart, however, is its exceptional customer service. The staff members are incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, and always willing to go the extra mile to assist customers. They possess a genuine passion for helping people and creating a pleasant shopping experience. Whether you need assistance in finding a specific item or have questions about a product, the staff is readily available to provide guidance and ensure your needs are met.

Moreover, the store's commitment to community engagement is truly inspiring. They actively support local initiatives, such as sponsoring events, partnering with charities, and promoting local artisans and entrepreneurs. This demonstrates their dedication to giving back to the community and fostering a sense of unity among customers.

The Pueblo Store's clean and organized layout is another aspect worth commending. Navigating through the store is a breeze, thanks to clear signage and well-structured sections. Additionally, the store's commitment to sustainability is evident, as they prioritize eco-friendly practices such as recycling, using energy-efficient lighting, and reducing packaging waste.

Lastly, the Pueblo Store frequently offers fantastic deals and promotions, ensuring that customers receive the best value for their money. Whether it's through discounts, loyalty programs, or exclusive offers, they continuously strive to reward their patrons.

In conclusion, the Pueblo Store is an exceptional establishment that excels in every aspect. Its vast product range, exceptional customer service, community engagement, commitment to sustainability, and unbeatable deals make it the epitome of a top-tier store. Visiting the Pueblo Store is an experience that leaves customers feeling satisfied, valued, and eager to return.; Chequeen alimentos, muchos tienen fecha expirada!

Perishable merchandise is located at the entrance where there's a passing by of clients from outside and inside of the supermarket reaching for a shopping car.; Good store full with product good variety fair prices and good service.; excellent supermarket, great variety of products, great prices, top notch service, highly recommend this supermarket

On the right hand side. Where there is one or two cashiers. They never even noticed me. I have entered the store two times this week and the same thing happens.
The rest of the store is laid out like a grocery store. They have produce section. But the prices seem a little high. In the meat section the meat was brown. So I went to the deli in the back of the store. They only had one brand of meat. I have never heard of the brand my whole life. The cheeses they sold were two or three kinds but the same brand. Three isles of shelf goods were packed with generic goods. Sold at or near name brand prices. I'm not even kidding you! You could get same goods in others stores in this city. And always see the same products on sale. Also canned vegetables that would be on sale at Price Rite or Save Alot were 1.79 ea.
Both times I went in this store. I walked out without buying anything. The only people that should even wasting thier money here are people that don't have a car. Or take a bus to a real Grocery store. Good luck!

Reviews:
I purchased two packages of the 3lbground turkey, 83 %lean on 9/6/2024
When I arrived at my house I took one out of the package I went to cook it and immediately was overwhelmed with smell of rotting meat. I looked at the expiration date on the package and it has a sell by date of 8/16/2024. I checked the date of the other package of ground turkey and it has a sell by date of 9/3/2024. I'm absolutely appalled and disgusted because this shows me that whoever is running this store is not taking the time to make sure product is properly rotated. One of these meats was almost a month old! My kitchen still smells like rotting meat and this place is going to get someone sick some day.; This is a great store for the Hispanic style cooking we do...it was clean and had a little of everything in there.  👍👍💃 Great prices on the meat selection also! 🥩🍗🍖🥓; It might have been cleaned up a little bit, but this store still isn’t very good. It needs to be much cleaner and taken care of much better. Selection is fine and prices are fine but not great. Meat and produce didn’t look good.; Not a bad supermarket, it's great to have a Save A lot nearby and extend those food stamps or that cash whenever we panic due to the refrigerator being close to empty by the end of the month...this place have very good prices, but unfortunately, whenever I go, They never seem to have what I want or need. Save A lot it's great and it's perfect if you're in a budget or don't want to go overboard and waste your food stamps in one go, but if you're looking for meat (good luck, this place has a very small section and it's variety it's truly limited) if you're Hispanic you might find a few things, but knowing how Hispanic love to cook a lot, they might not find everything they want or need.; It wasn't a bad place cheap prices limited selection. there was a man trying to fight people in the parking lot yeah they did nothing about it

Reviews:
If they are going to lower how many cashiers they have to have self check out, then they need to commit better. Only 4 self check outs and 1 or 2 cashiers? I never come here and don’t see lines snaking the isles because there’s no room and no employees or self check out registers. Get it together stop and shop.; There were products that required clipped coupons, and they were not on the
app. One of the employees was very helpful and said they had to change prices all day. I bought the one sale combo and left. I couldn't deal with having to ask the  cashier to override prices.; They stopped selling under 3/4ths of a pound and the half pound bags of deli meats in the grab & go. Had to dig through bags upon bags of meat and cheese looking for a half pound of turkey and ended up just not getting anything because it was all .75lbs and above. Who gets over .75lbs of deli meat at the grab and go?! That’s just ridiculous. What’s next…. only FULL pounds of meat and cheese in the grab and go?! Have fun with all of that waste.; Genuinely one of the most dirty, poorly managed, and embarrassing locations. If I was corporate I would be pretty livid. One register ever open and self check out lines literally fully down the aisle with only one employee. The store has a distinct mildew scent and it always appears dirty. Genuinely cannot understand how the hell this location is still open, there’s rarely more than four employees upfront and rarely are they helpful. Like genuinely I rarely leave reviews but after years of living near this location I don’t understand how people choose this location over even the lowest tier Big Y store. You should all be embarrassed, waiting nearly half an hour in line is a regular occurrence and then the self checkout machines are nothing but issues even when you use them correctly. Just AWFUL.; Why cant S&S management  do like most other stores and LIMIT  the amount of items for those who want to use Self Checkout as a process to expedite their trip???
Why do they ALLOW people with FULL shopping carts this option when it ties up a spot for over 20+minutes.and truly slows down an otherwise "express function"
Where is the "express checkout" for your store??
The store management has the POWER & POLICY to change this so why don't they??
Simply deplorable....

I wanted to give them zero stars. My food stamps was stolen at this store!!! Don't shop there. I called about my food balance and the representative told me my food stamps was stolen at this store. Police need to investigate them. Something very illegal is going on that store. Don't use your food stamps there!!; Super super over priced there is no way they have 4 stars realistically. Fruits and veggies always look old and now they have a rule where you cannot use your debit card for anything under 5 dollars which is ridiculous especially being that they call themselves a grocery store. They attract shady clientele. There are just so many issues. I saw a women peeing herself in one of the aisles; it is actually appalling.; I hadn't been here in several years, but this is the only place I know of that carries Borden white American cheese.

When I went inside I was pleasantly surprised.

The establishment has really cleaned itself up, literally.

The produce section was very nicely kept (it was getting an automatic spray when I went by) and their selection of all items throughout the store was very impressive.

The next time I go in I will have to take more time to look around, I was just in a hurry because I really needed the Borden cheese.; Employees probably used their gloves for everything else since I witnessed no glove changing…brought it up to the cashier and manger on site yet they looked at me like I had five heads. Looks like not changing gloves is ok and normal for them!! Last time I go there!!; If I could give them zero stars I would. Fruits are rotten,  just kept up from the outside and overpriced. I've given this store chance after chance. Never again. 😡

Name: Hannaford

Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
I used to love this store, but it has really gone downhill lately.  Prices have never been very competitive, but I accepted it based on the location. The main issue recently is chronic understaffing at the registers. They have been pushing self checkout, and it is not working out.; I do not usually leave bad reviews. Several people I know have had terrible experiences in this store since the new layout. The music is blasting and they put things beside other things that do not make sense, and it is meant to create either a joke or frustration and hatred among customers and employees. The last two times I have been in here, I have heard employees making comments about people being on welfare, and the final straw was when someone was talking about people on food stamps who worked there. I, or you, or anyone can be one paycheck away from being on the system. They make people who have state assistance feel uncomfortable in the store. When this place closes because they chose to make members of our community feel bad, just remember that karma is a b!; I hate the new layout of the store. Whoever thought outlining the border of your store with refrigerators doesn’t care about the customer shopping experience. No flow whatsoever and the groceries are disorganized.  Also, they don’t have enough staff to run the store especially in the deli.

Why did you increase the price of your store brand seltzer water by .40 cents and then advertise to customers that they will save $1.77 by purchasing store brand vs. competitor brand?

Instead of raising the prices of your products- Lay off the corporate morons, middle-man management team members and anyone who works remotely if you need to make money to be profitable…

Fix your rewards program so that customers can actually use the points easily to get the discount on their purchases.; Such a big store and the price is great! They have really great parking positions for handicap.; Not one of my favorite grocery stores. It's laid out weird and, no joke, I asked 4 different employees were items were, including asking one employees were pudding was (so nothing strange or unique) and every employee said the same thing "that's not my area, I don't know". The problem is no employee seem to have an area they knew anything about. I feel very sorry for people in Waltham that their chose of grocery stores is this one or Food Basket. Aren't there any decent grocery stores in Waltham???

Name: Market Basket
Address: 110 Market Pl Dr, Waltham, MA 02451, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 110 (street_number); Market Place Drive (route); The Highlands (neighborhood); Waltham (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02451 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We are from the Cotting School and we went to Market Basket on a Wednesday morning around 10:30. It was medium busy, but there were many employees around to help. The employees were friendly and helpful.

In terms of accessibility (our group had wheelchair users), the Market Basket was easy to get into. There were curb cuts to get up onto the sidewalk and there were no stairs. Once in the store it was a bit trickier to get around because the aisles were a little too narrow because it was quite busy with lots of people in them.

In terms of deals, there were quite a few buy 2 for a certain price. The overall prices of items were pretty cheap compared to other stores. In terms of cleanliness, the store felt clean and well kept. There were no spills or trash around.

Our overall experience at Market Basket was a very positive one. We really liked how it was decorated for fall with fall leaves hanging from the ceiling. It felt very festive and fun. There were also a good selection of balloons for events and celebrations.; This Waltham store is about 10 miles from home, but well worth it....
There are 2 other market baskets closer to me, "BUT", no other store compares to this branch. It's immaculate,  there's a GREAT variety of grocery items- the  produce + meat are great.  The beef is mostly Angus..  I haven't  tried the subs, but deli+ fish are fresh.
AMPLE parking.
PRICES ARE MUCH LOWER than other supermarkets  near me.✌️; This Supermarket is  the only supermarket  I've been to since covid and it's full staffed  with humans cashiers and I was so please to see that every corner of the store was fully utilized  by workers , there's never a dull moment  in the place. Keep up the good work  both managers and staffs; Overall a great place to shop and comparatively cheaper than the competition. No gimmicky coupons but overall lower prices and sales running over few items.  Great variety in household, grocery and day to day pharma. Nothing beats Market Basket in item variety and overall pricing. They have also been able to weather inflation far more than others on their own brands as well as others.

If you find walking a chore, the 70 bus marked Market Place Drive drops you directly there from different stops alongside the route.

Amenities:
1- Market Kitchen - their cafeteria makes fresh and cost effective foods. You can order in advance which is good because depending on the time of the day it can be quite busy like lunch time. Most foods on the grill are freshly prepped. The steak bomb, cheese burger and hot dog are great starts.
2- MB Wine & Spirits -  a spirits shop nearby that does tasting every now and then
3- Bottle/Can crushing on site.
4) Reasonable sitting space to enjoy your meals and benches outside the building for people waiting for their bus.

Tips:
a) Market Kitchen - Stay away from dinners as they aren't freshly prepared and sometimes rice and veggies can taste dated because they have been lying around. Additionally avoid evening pickups as the food may not be rotated as regularly. Check the timing of the kitchen before going because on Sunday it closes an hour earlier.

b) Their fruit section is competitive but sometimes other stores launch deals which can be cheaper.

c) Their fresh rotisserie chicken is good but not great and the taste degrades significantly when refrigerated. So if you are thinking of picking the frozen rotisserie for a few cents off, I would suggest do not.; The staff does their best to assist you in any way they can. They get 5 stars. The store is often chaotic and very busy. I love their prices but don’t like the shopping experience. Maybe consider stocking shelves when the business isn’t open. I’d love to see self-check outs installed.

Reviews:
5 Star Supermarket is an excellent Asian grocery with a great selection of fresh produce, imported goods, and delicious prepared foods. Their roast duck and sponge cake are perfect for a special meal. Definitely worth a visit for quality ingredients and authentic flavors!; It was my first time visiting this supermarket (to get snacks), and I saw so many deals that I'll definitely be back!; Selection of products are really good, range from various Asian cultures and cuisines.

The food stall was also really good, with reasonable prices for their roasted pork and other dishes. The only downside is that the products are usually sold out by noon, and they don't restock it.; The store packs herbs badly. I bought a pack of Tia To which looks good on the front, however, it’s all bad after the front is taken out. It’s so bad.; This is one of the most comprehensive Asian grocers I have ever been to. It is absolutely fantastic. I am newish to the area, and I always need to hone in on what will become MY Asian grocer. I was a sashimi chef for many years, and it's a necessity when I move to find my spot. This is it. Go here. Worth any trip unless an H-Mart is somehow closer. 11/10

Bathrooms 🚻 for customers. Just a well run store.; Some of the prices not the right price, bought a gallon of orange juice only to find out the price was 3 dollars more than listed.Also its almost not a bargin anymore because you are reaching prices of other better supermarkets.; Love Aldi's! Chicopee store has the Best Staff ... Which I can't say about the Boston Road store.  Very rude Cashier (M)... VERY rude; The online hours are wrong and the staff is really unprofessional and rude they rush us out of the store just because they were closing. Giving customers bad attitude.aldis on west Springfield; Aldi in West Springfield is my go-to market. The store is organized,  good variety, and excellent prices.  Staff are fantadtic!

Reviews:
This store deserves no stars.every interaction I have had w staff has been disrespectful and gross. The older lady with short hair who does customer service is disgusting. I asked a simple question and she gave me attitude, she doesn’t deserve her job.; My experience with Stop & Shop has been quite excellent. The customer service was on point, and the organization of the store was/is superb. The quality of the food is always up to standard, and they have most brands that I commonly look for. If they do not, they often carry competitive alternatives. It's worth your money to shop here, and it's a company I would like to see remain around for sometime longer.

This review is based solely on my experience as a customer not an employee.; I went to EcoBuilding Bargains a couple of days ago and came across these beautiful cast iron kitchen sinks. I was told that these sinks were from the 80's Era. Wouldn't these look good in your kitchen? I'm doing a partial renovation in my kitchen and the red sink would definitely be a functional conversation piece.; Why is experience here so much better classier higher end than the Stop & Shop on Boston Road.

I've been a customer of the Boston Road Stop & Shop for more than 10 years. Every now and then I come to this Stop and Shop on Cooley. It's just so much nicer, cleaner, there's more staff, their carts aren't complete _ _ _ _. They have three cashier registers open and the booth of auto machines. It is a rare day when we have two cashiers in Springfield Boston Road. Three would be Thanksgiving and Christmas.; Normally a good place to shop.  However, this location at Allen & Cooley Streets is slated to close soon.  Some shelves were emptied.

SEND HEALTH DEPARTMENT ASAP THANK YOU.; I've been coming here for about 5 years and today is the first time someone looked me in the eyes.. smiled and said Hi first. I'm black btw. I come for the food bar. Every other time I walk in here I feel unwelcome. No eye contact or just blaintantly being ignored. I'm convinced only 30% of Hispanics like black people. To the lady who said hi to me today. Thank you. That really made my day; Amazing store, Puerto Rican food, pork, batatas, galletas export sodas, morcillas, Malta India, everything. Wow !!! Incredible and people very nice. Hablan espanol; Great place most don't know about. Hot lunches & meals at reasonable prices. Meat Dept cuts on premises, betters deals than change stores. Spices, dried peppers & excellent produce with variety. Highly recommended!; This place is AMAZING. disguised as an awesome grocery store which it is LOL. But if you ever catch the lunch in the back left corner you will not be disappointed. They have an amazing array of Spanish foods ,hot and ready to go. Each dish is authentic and comes with the best beans you've ever had. I'll give this place a a five out of five for lunch.

Reviews:
Good selection of Turkish and middle eastern foods! Also had healthy options! The staff is very accommodating as well; They have cheap prices and high quality items especially all groceries and dairy , frozen and halal meat . Masallah 🙏; The first thing I noticed is that their entrance is not wheelchair accessible, but inside the stores is full of ramps. I like the variety of desserts, especially chocolates and frozen products. Things that you usually won’t find anywhere else. Things are too expensive. Staff doesn’t feel too welcoming.; Best european market in all of west springfield. Cheapest prices around.; Check the expiration dates of the products before you put them in your cart! I’m sick of finding out some of their products have already expired when I come home. It’s not one or two times but multiple times! I go there not because of the prices but for the variety. I’m aware of the high prices but I was kind of ok with that just because of the variety! However, now I don’t trust this store anymore! With the next item I find out that’s expired I’ll file an official complaint to the health department! I regret that I didn’t file a complaint because they were not following the mask guidelines of the state! I don’t even want to mention that!
Another issue with the place is that same items are priced differently! They don’t have an electronic inventory of their products but individually price them with the price tags. You can find the same item priced differently across the isle. You can be charged differently for the same price since they don’t scan the barcodes but enter the price on the tag.

Name: Mom & Rico's Specialty Market
Address: 899 Main St, Springfield, MA 01103, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews: What a lovely place. Rosamarie and Rico are lovely people with an eclectic and interesting store. You can buy their house-label wine and buy Rico's book on Bocce—he'll even sign it for you. I got the Bocce Bella sandwich and can't regret it for under $10. You have to tour the shop, otherwise come back and check it out.; We had a variety of things and had a variety of differing opinions. I'm sure fresh food would've had a improvement upon this score. The guy who started this really was a pleasure. The ham and cheese sandwich for less than 2 bucks was a steal. Sandwich was actually a good bulkie ham and cheese. The risotto balls were terrible. Dry and rock hard. The last of the pasta we got was microwaved to heat it up and it was still cold. Meatball sub was very good! Just heated unevenly. And WAY TOO MUCH SAUCE. It's unfortunate, because the atmosphere was good too. I'd return for their homemade soda. Bocce soda; I ordered 2 large meat ball grinders with extra cheese extra sauce. She told me i't  be ready in 9 minutes when I went to go. Eat the Sandwich in the car, it was completely cold. The sauce was cold and meatballs were coldThe bread was soggy and.ripped YUCK! 32 BUCKS 😬; This place was recommended on Phantom Gourmet… drove from outside of Boston and the place  was a disappointment… the only thing that was good was a Macaroon  cookie; wholesome spot. lovely atmosphere and the owners are funny and personable. made me feel at home while i enjoyed my grinder!

Name: Patel Brothers
Address: 425 Moody St, Waltham, MA 02453, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM

Reviews:
Stopped in here today for a couple items. I was greeted immediately, asked what I needed & directed to where the items were. Prices were fair. Store seemed run down & not very clean. Seemed to have a wide variety of Indian food products so I will probably be back in the future.
Also worth noting that they accept EBT.; This is the worst place for grocery. The sale item are not for any kind of benefit they are the expired products. And when we tell them about it the staff is extremely rude. They would tell us to do our research before buying. Their grains were expired and they have very less shelf life too. Their mangoes are the worst thing to ever buy and the store owner is very unapologetic for it. None of the staff would ever feel sorry for the expired stuff they sell. We had bought almonds which were on sale but they had insects in it.

I would not recommend this place for grocery to anyone.; Was disappointed with the pricing as most of the products were way too high compared to the other Patel stores I shop at.
It definitely has a typical Indian atmosphere from the maintenance of the building.
It does have a good variety of fresh vegetables and Indian products...
Parking was hard.; Stopped in for a quick soda. Many sodas were months overdue. Had to search for a fresh one. Staff was friendly. The place is well stocked, very cluttered, but seemed clean.; DO NOT BUY MANGOES HERE! $55 a case, and They all look nice on the outside but they are all bad or rotten inside. The store owner will not tell you that this is expected until you contact them after to report the bad mangoes. Also, according to the store owner, apparently these mangoes undergo radiation before being sold. The store owner argued with me that I should have done my research, instead of apologizing and offering to take them back.

Reviews: Wheelers is only a block from my house, and they don't always have an item or it maybe out of stock. But, the last two times I went to Walgreens for some basics (eggs, milk, shredded cheese), I struck out both times at Walgreens, but Wheelers came through in a pinch. They may not carry everything or have what you need in stock, but in those two incidences they came through. They are open to 10pm nightly so in an emergency being a block away I don't have to make a long flip and travel to a major grocery store. The title "Convenience Store" is not a Misnomer. They are close and they are convenient, and we still need them in our lives.; I go there almost everyday and it is a nice little store and it has reasonable prices that you could afford.; Ok service very friendly good customer service; Its your run of the mill neighborhood convenience store. The guy who works there has been there for years he knows most of us in the neighborhood; Very good quality store

Reviews:
Nice place! Mostly Vietnamese and Korean products and I always go there myself. Just have to learn not to go when they're in the middle of re- stocking. Good food. Good prices.; Always love coming here for all my Asian grocery needs. My kids love the variety of goodies to snack on. The vegetables and herbs are the freshest I've seen. I especially love their all ready to eat hot foods for when you need a break from making dinner for the family or just a quick bite for lunch.; This past Saturday, I had the pleasure of being served by two guys at the checkout counter, and I must say, the experience was exceptional. They both exhibited a friendly demeanor and attention to detail that made the entire transaction smooth and enjoyable. Moreover, they were incredibly resourceful, efficiently handling any challenges that arose during the process. They truly go the extra mile to ensure customer satisfaction. If you're looking for top-notch service, these gentlemen are your go-to. Highly recommend!; Lots of ready made food is why I love this place. I love the weekend dimsum to go. Bahnmi can be toasted if you ask. Some other basic Asian pastries. They have lots of great Chinese and Vietnamese specialties if you're an adventurous foodie. They don't advertise it, but they do rice plates, too. I love their kimchi style the most, because it's not too vinegary.

The grocery part of the store is cozy and will have the basics for South East Asian and Chinese cuisines, including a butcher and small seafood selection.; I go to this market every week. The cooked foods are great. Even the place is not too large, there products meet the demand so it will be easier to buy food.
Pros: good food, jackfruit is great.
Cons: small, only has max 3 cashers to check out.

Reviews:
They carry a good selection of Vietnamese and Asian foods, fruits, vegetables, meats, fish (every Wednesday afternoon) drinks, and spices. The owners and employees are extremely kind and helpful. Their new location is large and clean with plenty of room for shopping carts. There is also a dedicated parking lot that makes getting in and out very easy.
Whatever Asian meal you're cooking, this store has what you need to complete it.; Very nice and clean. Nice selection of merchandise. Friendly people. Plants are not for sale😎; An amazing selection, friendly and helpful staff, all at shockingly low prices!; Visiting stores that aren't traditionally American can be scary for us who aren't of the culture. Thus place however makes it very easy to visit as a first time shopper as well as a returning shopper. The prices are much lower than the chain markets because they specialize in the products. Service is very friendly with little to no language barrier at all. I'll be returning soon and often.; This is a small store with only basic Vietnamese and Asian products. It’s like a mom and pop’s shop. As a Vietnamese, I came to support the local business.
After reading the reviews, I expected this place to be friendly. It was not.
A young Vietnamese woman with heavy make up at the register was incredibly rude and unfriendly. She never smiled and when I asked where are certain stuffs, she just stared at me for a very long time and pointed, when she spoke English just fine.
She did not represent the warm Vietnameses’ customer service back home.
If anyone just wants to come there for the products, I would say it is great. As for the register, just avoid the woman.

Reviews: I ordered the Parmesan cheese from Nick over the phone. He sent it to me by FedEx. It is fantastic Parmesan. Maybe the best I’ve ever had Don’t miss this order some now!!!; We got Nick’s Spicy Pollo, made by, I believe, Nick himself. It was delicious! He was patient and accommodating with our questions about the bread sizes and recommended the perfect amount of cuts cause the sandwich was huge! I will be moving to Western Mass from Cleveland, OH, soon, and I've already found my go-to place for authentic fresh sandwiches. It was a huge sandwich that lasted for three meals for me 🤣. The bread was perfect, and the ingredients were super fresh. The shop has so many choices and some fantastic grocery items as well. It surpasses its reputation! I would recommend a water roll if you want to eat it in one sitting (or try to)!; Great food, exceptional attentive staff, old-school Italian market vibe. Ordered food to bring to a friend's family. They called to say it was the best! Order from here and keep this place cooking for Springfield!; Simply cannot say enough good things about this establishment.  Love the vibe, the food options, the friendly staff.  Price point is great for lunch and quality is amazing.; Great food options & delicious!! Love the atmosphere of old school/ new age blend of Italian specialty store. Nice people & reasonable prices. Highly recommend

I’ve been coming here for years! I love EVERYTHING !! Best lentil soup I’ve ever had in my life! I love the chicken shawarma and gyro! Tabouli, hummus and rice hashweh . Highly recommend Cedars :); I was so pleased to discover this amazing place! The food was absolutely delicious, fresh, perfect flavor. The service was great, the workers were extremely kind and friendly. Definitely check it out if you want a positive experience and some tasty food!; I was over charged over and above the receipt amount, explaining that, it's a Massachusetts thing. I needed to do another transaction, after I changed my mind and went to another grocery store and bought rest of my grocery there to check if it's really a Massachusetts thing, which wasn't,
This is not a clean or honest business transaction. I am disappointed.; Went in for lunch. Place was packed and waited for what seemed like forever … TOTALLY WORTH THE WAIT !! Best shawarma I’ve ever had and the chic shish was also AMAZING. The ladies were super sweet and the price was cheap for the monster sized wraps!! I’ll stop in any time I’m close to Springfield!; Our favorite place for middle eastern groceries. Nice family owned place. Tons and tons and tons of imported candies and chocolate. Good variety! We get meat from here too. Highly recommend.
My kids are always really happy coming here.
