Name: Big Y at Fresh Acres
Address: 1941 Wilbraham Rd, Springfield, MA 01129, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 1941 (street_number); Wilbraham Road (route); Sixteen Acres (neighborhood); Springfield (locality); Hampden County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 01129 (postal_code)
Reviews: I’ve been to and worked at multiple big y locations and fresh acres tends to be my least favorite. as someone who works for the company and works with the public i understand that people suck and that management can be poor and stressful, but i also understand the importance of making customers feel seen and cared about. everyone here is miserable, there is the occasional kind words at self checkout, but i feel that the employees here do not care about the appearance of the store/their departments, nor do they care about customer service. i have never NOT seen rotting fruits on the produce floor. i have watched on multiple occasions employees barrel through and nearly hit customers with carts and today an employee in food service nearly hit an older man with his cart and then walk around like he didn’t care and didn’t even say sorry or excuse me. lastly, when i eat the sushi here, i feel no passion. it is sad and feels like they just want to put it out and be done with the job. i know that many people enjoy sushi and appreciate the art of making it and it feels like the people making it don’t really care as much.; Hadn't been there in ages but I won't be going back. Red headed late-teen (?) cashier was miserable. First time ever that I was responded to with a curt, blunt, "no" when I asked to type in my phone number like I always do (never an issue before). Made me repeat my phone number multiple times. I specifically asked to buy 2 bags (25 items???) next thing you know...a single bag is being PACKED to the GILLS, including a half gallon of liquid! About 25 items in all. In one bag. It's sad that some people will never understand the basic concept of common consideration, not to mention, common sense. Expecting someone to carry all that with one hand is rude in itself. When I said (low tone of voice) that there was no way I could lift all that (wrist is compromised right now) her response was rude and snarky ("There's no need..."). There's no need for WHAT? For YOU? Yes, totally agree. If you're THAT precious and entitled, then you don't need to work for the public. I endured much worse in all my customer service jobs and an attitude like yours would have landed me right out the door.; I've been coming to this big y for a few weeks now because my daughters camp is close by so I frequently buy things and go to self checkout. Ive noticed the cashiers watching me each time as if im stealing which im not. I get food stamps so it would be silly of me to steal when im not even paying for them to begin with. Everytime I go there a cashier no matter where there standing comes and stands next to me without fail no matter how many other people are at self checkout. I caught the cashier leaning over and looking inside my bag today. This is ridiculous.  Between here and walmart im constantly followed and checked in on as a Black woman I find this to be frustrating and half the time im with my daughter so what would I be teaching her if im stealing? It hurts all of us. I already knew this company was racist to begin with but im tired of being treated as less than a person. And if you guys think im stealing because im rushing in and out the store I have to catch the bus to go home so thats why im rushing and ive been in retail since I was 18 your store Manager used to be my boss at Stop and Shop so im pretty sure I know the in and outs of a grocery store. If you don't believe me you can check the security footage of your employee looking inside my bag.; Definitely not ADA Compliant! I am the first one to give a great review when deserved. I cannot tell you how disappointed I am in Fresh Acres.  I do not go there often so when I do, I enjoy shopping all their gourmet goodies and looking at the array of unique products. Yesterday being there, brought me to tears. I have had several back surgeries so depending on the day my back pain can be painful or very painful. Yesterday, it was very, very painful so I used one of the motorized carts and I am truly appreciative of stores that offer them.  Maybe it was the social distancing that amplified this but there were certain areas of the store that made it impossible to get through due to the sales displays in the isles. I highly doubt that management of this grocery store or any others take a ride in one of these carts to experience what shopping is like in their store using one. There were at least two areas in the store that made turning impossible.  Between the end cap sales displays and the displays in the middle of the isles I knocked over a total of three displays during my visit.  This is embarrassing and aggravating as I have to get out of the cart and bend over stressing my back to pick everything up.  As it stands now, I will not be going back until they are ADA compliant and I will be calling the general manager today.  In doing my research, here is what I found regarding the guidelines in grocery stores and being ADA compliant.                                                                               "Grocery Aisles. Failing to provide wide enough walkways between shelving units can put a retailer in danger of noncompliance with the ADA. A minimum width of 36 inches is required. If the aisle is more than 200 feet long, a passing space of at least 60 inches by 60 inches must be provided"  I know they were not compliant in a few areas for sure.; Otherwise known as the fancy big y in the area, it's a chock full of specialty items at the deli, not to mention other parts of the door

Reviews: Get some tacos here!!!!! I just stopped by here today to pick up some carne asada tacos for lunch. Let me say, it did not disappoint not only in flavor but value. I ordered 7 tacos for me and my kids to share. They were full size tacos and they were not greedy with anything, they really hooked it up. Pictures do no justice for these tacos. The tacos are well seasoned, not dry, and cooked over mesquite fire. Plus they have a salsa bar with a variety of salsas and toppings. They also sell different Mexican grocery products, fresh meat, fresh tortillas from different vendors, and a variety of produce and beer. Support local and small business here. Plus they take Apple Pay. 10/10!; Hidden gem. Great food, good flavor selection. I'm going back for another burrito as soon as im in the area again. Thank You; I stopped here just to check it out and I glad I did. They sell meat for carne asada and a lot of other meats. I ordered some cooked/grilled carne asada and it was excellent. I mean really excellent. They make chicken stew, menudo, beef stew and various types of salsas. I got a salsa and holy moly it was extremely authentic. They also sell lots of mexican candies, chips, drinks, cheeses and bread/pastries. My wife asked if they ever made Chile Rellenos and the employee made them upon her request & she loved them. Definitely gonna go back regularly; Definitely makes my top 5 list of taco places in Phoenix and I only look for cabeza. A little pricey but it’s worth it with every bite! 💕💕; Amazing selection of our favorite Mexican food supplies.  Ty.

Name: Food 4 Less
Address: 312 Euclid Ave, San Diego, CA 92114, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: 312 (street_number); Euclid Avenue (route); Lincoln Park (neighborhood); San Diego (locality); San Diego County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92114 (postal_code)
Reviews:
FOOD4YES! I'm so impressed with this Food4Less as it's very well-stocked and had great items for plant-based/vegan folks. I'm sensitive when it comes to drinking milk and this store had great oat milk alternatives for an affordable price! The store also had lots of cereal, supplies, bread, and alcohol! I got basic stuff like water, plastic supplies, breakfast items and honey. Everything was easy to find and the store was super roomy. I never felt cramped in the aisles!

The store has a bakery, alcohol section, and most standard commodities of a Food4Less, this store might be slightly bigger than some other stores I've been to. The staff was pretty mellow, so were the customers. I LOVE that there wasn't drama or shady things going on, I had a pleasant experience. Prices are excellent, I'm a boy on a budget and I don't have time for overspending so this store saved me haha.

There's plenty of parking out front and the cart stations are scattered throughout the parking lot for easy access. You can find this location in a busy part of town, however it never felt packed. The staff were working quickly! The only thing that kinda bothered me was the lack of bagging service, I guess not having a bagger cuts costs?; I've been a pretty loyal customer to this food 4 less, but recently their 1 working electric wheel chair was stolen, and because of this I'm unable to shop there, but alas that isn't even the reason for this 1 star review. The reason is, today Friday August 23rd, 2024 at 4:00pm I tried for 30 minutes (until 4:30pm) to call them, I tried all of their departments, no answer, I tried the produce department, and on several occasions someone picked up the phone (because I could hear the background noise) and just promptly hang it up without saying a word. I put it to the test and tried the produce department 5 times and I was hung up on 5 more times.

I was calling to see if your electric wheel chair has been found, but nobody answered me, so now it's off to Walmart instead. Thanks for nothing!; I writing this comment about this guy Cesar, who was working pulling the carts from parking lot on Tuesday October 1st about 3:40 pm. Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 5833 (street_number); South Central Avenue (route); South Mountain Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85040 (postal_code)
Reviews: The food tasted very authentic. I love authentic Mexican food, not like the knockoffs. The tamales was very good. The steak burrito made how you like is amazing. The El Chata was made perfectly.; I don’t know why I’ve not reviewed Los Altos Ranch Market before. I think the fact that you frequent some places commonly, you tend to put it on the back burner! Well, my last visit made me think twice about reviewing what we take for granted many times as this food market, that sometimes can run rings around some of our common go-to places locally for food, groceries and more. Los Altos Ranch Market, the one in South Phoenix on Central Avenue location in particular, is astounding in size and has a mini-mall aspect whereby everything a supermarket has as groceries, produce, meat and fish, delicatessen, dairy, yet also offers take-out from their inhouse kitchen (plus inside seating if you wish), which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner, plus a bakery and tortilleria. You can also find money services, boots and shoes, and some clothing, among quite a few other things. One of the most impressive things for me is the freshness of meats, dairy and produce, organization, cleanliness and personal service. I have yet to have any purchase returned due to lack of quality or freshness as I’ve had to at some area name markets. Although they are Southwestern conglomerate spanning California, Nevada and Arizona, you feel the vibe and service of a local, neighborhood and community market. These reasons and more are the motives for my wife to enjoy shopping here. Check it out, your pantry and tummy will thank you for it.; Market has a lot of latin.products you might be looking for. The kitchen area has pretty good good, I've got a couple of different plates and have all been pretty good. Fresh made tortillas and sweet bread available. Sometimes, they have some good deals. I always find what I  need. However, the check out line is always backed up since the times I've gone, only 1 register is open. They have a couple of self checkout but most of the time is really slow and long line as well. I've also gone a couple times and I have to go back to parking lot to get a shopping cart since there aren't any available in front of store.; Got marinated ground beef from the butcher and the styrofoam was all throughout the meet. So I am assuming they took beef from their shelf in the package and ground it up with the bottom Styrofoam on it and then marinated it. I am not only disappointed but I am alarmed by it. I will not be going back.; Overall, the produce is really good. I like the rewards program & their street tacos.

Reviews:
I went to La Cocina del Rancho Market where Mrs Helena served me the most sweetest Horchata and juiciest roasted pulled pork I've had in a long while.
The bench seats were clean and the line to eat was consistent.
She and her crew are worthy of bringing the flavors of Mexican cooking to Phoenix Arizona..; When you are barely able to keep up with inflation, the current economic situation, and all the increasing costs of food, this is my go to place! I have shopped here before, don’t get me wrong. It has all that you would need for the Mexican food you know you crave! Making it saves you money and shopping here helps you save money! I only bought $99.50 in groceries here. But I have 16 days of meals, buying 6 packages of 2 large packages of pork stew meat, 1 package of beef Eye of the round flat steak and 3 packages of chicken. Keep in mind, I breaking down and separating the individual dinner portions into frozen ziplock bags for dinner. And buying frozen veggies to add to the meal. I can find all that I need to make it stretch. Even a huge jug of spaghetti sauce was just a tad bit more than 2 individual jars somewhere else, but here  $7.49. Now I like to cook and I can make a meal for 2 with leftovers, just by cooking and adding to it, including vegetables, or rice or homemade beans.  A good size bag of Mexican cheese $8.99. Canned green chili sauce 2.49 for larger can. Where you shop is a personal choice. Seriously, I go out of my way to shop here. Saving is the name of the game and Mexican food groceries and food to pick up and eat in store or take home. They have fresh sweet breads and cakes and everything you need for those home made tamales or tacos or your favorite home made salsas. And don’t forget the cold cervezas, cause they have that here too! Enjoy!; I wanted In line to order and they took my order as expected however then the lady who took my order left to the back for like 10 minutes and then when she did come back she starts closing. Like why take my order and have me wait there just for you to start closing unbelievable will not be returning……; Nicole on register 6 today (9/30/24) had an old man bag his groceries as she saw him struggling to even open the bag. All she did was push his groceries closer to the edge as to separate them, to start scanning the next customer instead of helping him... she didn't even have a line I was the only one behind him. As he left I knew she'd do the same to me. I bagged as quick as I could but yet she started scanning the next person (only 1 behind me) our products were mixing and she just looked at us as we decided what was whose. Guess that's all the kind of employees you get these days. What a shame.; We went into this franchise and shopped my husband and I proceeded to check out and had to wait in line for more than 20 minutes on top of that a manager walks by looking at all of us and proceed to walk past us instead of requesting back up cashier. As we finally made our way to the front the cashier was very quiet didn't speak and not once greated us nor thanked us for coming. We really love coming in to this store has great prices on things we need but poor  customer service and management.

Name: Super Mercado El Local
Address: 1209 E Mason St, Green Bay, WI 54301, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 1209 (street_number); East Mason Street (route); Green Bay (locality); Brown County (administrative_area_level_2); Wisconsin (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 54301 (postal_code); 3429 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: Great shop to get your authentic ingredients for any Spanish or Mexican dish. Fresh meat and seafood selection, full fresh and frozen grocery items. We asked the owner (who happened to be ringing us out), his best advise on making enchiladas, as that's what we were buying ingredients for. He told us his family owns not just this store, but a restaurant down the street afew blocks! He suggested I heat an ungreased skillet and individually heat both sides of my tortilla...worked SO well! So for great selections and sound advise, try El Local!! The restaurant is of the same name, El Local. I'll try there next!; Went there for masa, lard, chili guajillo, ancho, and pastries. Cost $85. Need to list prices if you're going to mark up your food by 500%.; Man, the fresh meat in the deli looked so delicious. I should have purchased some.; I love it here! I live so close & bring my kids all the time. They have a TON of variety.; Friendly service. Found exactly what I was looking for at a reasonable price.

Wow! I haven’t visited San Gabriel in a long time since last year! Good place for Asian, Hispanic & American customers to go shopping! Just awesome! However inside the restroom smells bad. Not clean. I don’t dislike the smell. Highly recommend. The price is worth it. The Taiwanese cabbage
has the best price than elsewhere! They sell lotto scratcher ticket machine at the market entrance. I enjoy playing the $5 poker & crossword tickets. The parking lot is huge with so much space. Visit to SG market if you’re able to with your family & friends.; My friend recommended this place and I was not disappointed. Very Chinese/Asian set and have most grocery you can imagine, even some snaps I can’t find in Asia.; Brought a case of coconut of 9 for $13.99 and they all turn bad on Tuesday 6/25/2024.  The juice tasted sour and also was in a funny color.  This was not the 1st time happening.  Very disappointed, wasted my time and money.  Please inspect your food products before putting out for sale.; Great Dim Sum to Go Place.
I went to Monterey Park Location, it was Closed, I did Yelp Search and this San Gabriel Location Popped up, so I decided to give it a try, Glad I Did, I Ordered Siu Mai, most places come, 3-pcs in an order,  you get "4" here, so I ordered 2-orders, and they tasted Great.
I also ordered 3  orders, Beef Rice Noodle Rolls.; I always come here for my grocery needs. Usually cheap compared to other places (except the mochi, that's cheaper elsewhere). So if you notice these guys jack up their prices, you know inflation is bad.

Address Components: 363 (street_number); Calle de San Francisco (route); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); San Francisco (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This must be a staple market... way, WAY too much inventory to be a casual street market...

Deep, AND double-decked, this "supermercado" is stacked to the brim with retail merchandise, fresh and frozen foods, and literally every single beer and hard liquor you can fathom in one space...

Its a short walk from the port if you're coming in from the ship, but im sure even the locals, come from the island's interior to shop here... prices are dirt cheap, especially for it being a US municipality... shop with confidence... and budget some time, the place is huge...

all the top tier retail name brands... all the zero calorie drinks and juice varieties you never knew existed, all the booze... tall one liter bottles of Fiji water for under two dollars... even whole cabinets of cigars and tobaccos...
.; Cool inside and they have quite a selection! Bought souvenirs and drinks. Went back a second time.; My family and I stopped into this store a couple of weeks ago to grab a few drinks. Yes, they had a good selection of items, but the staff is absolutely atrocious.
It was a little cramped where the line was forming and I was trying to be polite and move out of the way. A young woman employee came through and rudely waved her hands to move us all out of the way without saying a word.
Then as the line moved up, the male employee behind the counter rudely announced that we HAD TO BE ON THE WHITE CIRCLE. I never saw the white circle on the floor, but if I had I wouldn't have even known what it was for. Maybe put up better signage if you're so strict about how or where the line forms!
If it hadn't been for us being so parched from the heat, those drinks would have gone right back on their shelves.
We go on many cruises and will be back in San Juan, but I will refuse to go back here so employees can speak to my family so rudely and condescendingly.; Good only if you must. I was happy when  I first found the store within walking distance of my Airbnb. But their selection is limited and the personnel at the register were completely disinterested.  They have more than bare essentials. SomE of the prices are absurd.  For example, the woman at the register spoke very good English so there’s not much chance she misunderstood me told me that a mango cost $3.79.  I repeated the number to her and asked if she meant for one mango and she said yes then I stood there with the items I was actually going to purchase, and she ignored me so much that I just left after replacing the items where they belonged.; One of the two supermarket options I know about in OSJ. I personally like Supermax better, but this is still a very solid store with a decent selection. Clean and solid prices.

Name: Sabanera del Rio
Address: 248 Camino de los Girasole, Gurabo, 00778, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 248 (street_number); Camino de los Girasole (route); Gurabo (locality); Navarro (administrative_area_level_2); Gurabo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00778 (postal_code)
Reviews: The gated community "Sabanera del Río," which is Spanish for "Savanna of the River," has a clubhouse as well as recreational facilities. Each road in the community is named after a flower or a tree. In many areas of the community where the houses are located, these areas are in the form of leaves. The main road of each area resembles the midrib, while the rest of the roads in the area (the secondary ones) resemble the veins. Each area has a huge sign at the beginning of the main road, where it mentions the name of the big road as well as the names of the secondary roads and the numbers of the houses. There is only one road in the community that doesn't resemble a leaf, although this road has its sign with the numbers of the houses. The houses are suitable for high income families.; It’s a cool place to take pictures and view tons of sunflowers, a great place to stop by if you can. They sell some amenities and plants there. But it is just a sunflower field.; Honestly feels like a completely different world. If you like the countryside feel near a larger city, then this is the place for you. The landscapes and the sites are incredibly well kept and include some historic ruins within the community. Lots of security and the house prices are appreciating a lot in value. Great for outdoorsy younger couples that work from home or nearby and mature families looking for a place to retire.; Very beautiful place, lots of green areas and places to look at and walk around. It's a very peaceful place. I love the little lake with the ducks! But if you plan on visiting a resident, prepare to loose more than 10 minutes at the gate waiting for the resident to pick up the phone and let you go in!; SPECTACULAR community, beautiful houses, great location w/ major improvements on highways. Excellent amenities in the community and very safe.

Name: Supermercado Econo

Address Components: Trujillo Alto (locality); Cuevas (administrative_area_level_2); Trujillo Alto (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00976 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Econo Supermercados has undergone significant changes, including a remodeling of the store. While prices have increased, this is a common trend across other supermarkets as well. The renovated store has brought about some challenges in terms of finding certain items at times. Nevertheless, overall, Econo Supermercados remains one of the best supermarkets in the area.

One of the standout features of Econo Supermercados is its wide selection of groceries. They offer a great variety of products, including their own store brand, which covers almost everything, including dog food. This extensive range of options ensures that customers can find what they need conveniently in one place.

The complete remodeling or updating of the building has had a positive impact on the shopping experience. The store now provides more room, creating a spacious and airy atmosphere. With these improvements, customers can navigate the aisles comfortably and enjoy a pleasant shopping environment.

It is worth noting that inflation has affected prices, which is not unique to Econo Supermercados. However, considering the overall quality and variety of products available, the prices at Econo Supermercados remain competitive. The supermarket has managed to strike a balance between maintaining affordability and providing a diverse range of goods.

In response to changing customer needs and preferences, Econo Supermercados has recently installed self-checkout counters. This new feature allows customers to scan and pay for their items independently, enhancing the convenience and efficiency of the shopping experience.

In summary, despite the price increases and occasional challenges in finding items, Econo Supermercados is still regarded as one of the best supermarkets in the area. The wide selection of groceries, including the store brand, the spacious and updated store layout, and the addition of self-checkout options all contribute to its overall appeal. Econo Supermercados remains a reliable choice for customers seeking a comprehensive shopping experience.; Great service,staff,security was on point; The building has been completely remodel or updated, inside there is more room, spacious, more airy,  basically  you will find everything. Inflation  caught up with prices associates excellen. They have recently install self-check out, you scan and go.; Prices have gone up but they have everywhere else. Since the remodeling of the store at times articles are difficult to find. Overall in this area one the best supermarkets.; Management should supervise better the quality and freshness of the in store produce, specially meat, fruits and Milk expiration dates.  Excellent staff and customer service

Upon reading many reviews, I can truly tell you that I disagree on the negative comments ! I can assure you that this store is very well taken care of. You can see the teamwork that is brought out in this store.
You can see the great communication and teamwork upon this store! The store had phenomenal customer service! The store is very clean neat and organize. I was able to find everything that I needed on my grocery list. On my experience, all produce was fresh. The meat department was clean and the customers service was great and fast!
My kids and I also bought food  and it was very tasty! I can tell you that kids are picky eaters, and when they ate their tacos (as well as the carnitas family pack) we were 💯 % satisfied !; Great variety of Mexican foods. It’s almost like Mexico if you go here. Their cooked food is good too. So many things you can’t find anywhere else. Tamales 🫔 to make your head spin from the varieties or the choices you have. Cardenas is truly the bomb 💣 for Mexican food. Definitely it’s not what you get in Mexico because if you been to Mexico you know grocery stores have everything including the coconut bricks. But Cardenas tops every Mexican market in the States. Even the champurrado was good quality and tasted good from the deli, and the small size was huge. I will always go to Cardenas if I see one, I’ll go look around even I don’t need to purchase anything.; Food looks good this time lol... No but really last time I came and wasn't so great.

Reviews:
I visited this store to pick up some supplements and Mad Hippie products. The store was clean and well-organized. They offer a good variety of produce. The cashier was okay, though a bit less cheerful than I would have liked. Despite this, I’ll continue to shop here for my Mad Hippie products.; This is a smaller Whole Foods. It has everything I need. I love the 365 Mashed Potatoes. They were out of them for a while. They have a good variety of organic foods. A nice variety of supplements. They have calrose rice. I can't find that anywhere else. The employees are the best. I talked to quite a few. All super friendly and helpful. They have nice looking clothes too.; This place has such a good bakery! I am currently addicted to the Peach Marionberry Pie.

I always come in here for their bottled water, mango and HydroFlask deals. Lots of ready-made prepared meal options both hot and cold. Organic selection is what you would expect from a Whole Foods.

Plenty of parking and the ease of using your Amazon Prime here is AWESOME.

Respectfully Reviewed; Things are fresh, a lot of advanced food, and I like it very much. I have everything I need here, and there are many parking spaces.; My rating is based on this being a 365 version and not the full scale whole foods. It's a nice sized trendy looking store, great produce in a large walkthrough area along the left wall when you enter the store. The food in the self serve hot and cold bars looked very fresh, they had more vegan options than some of the full stores i've been in, and the areas were clean. The foods were clearly labeled with the ingredients, which was awesome. It is really scaled down from the full version, so don't go in expecting the same variety of snacks,  juices, bulk spices or nuts. But they do a great job of covering the basics. The workers were nice and helpful, and the cashier said they'll be expanding it into a full store, so that will be a huge bonus. Even as a 365 I'd shop there again.

Had to drop review to 4 stars. Went to return items and was advised only the store supervisor had the code to do (and she was currently locked away in her office taking a test for the next hour). They don't have a customer service area to do returns. The store manager said he didn't even have the code to do the return. Good grief.

Name: Walmart
Address: Av. Los Veteranos Km 134.7, Guayama, 00784, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: Km 134.7 (subpremise); Avenida Los Veteranos (route); Caimital (sublocality_level_1); Guayama (locality); Caimital (administrative_area_level_2); Guayama (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00784 (postal_code)
Reviews:
My experience at this Walmart was disappointing. The staff does not seem to understand the importance of treating customers with respect, despite customers choosing to spend their time and money there. It is perplexing why the staff finds it so challenging to provide a pleasant experience during transactions.

The majority of employees, approximately 90%, lack an understanding of good customer service. Many appear consistently upset about their jobs, which is evident in their careless interactions with customers. When customers are lost, have questions, or face lengthy processes, the staff displays little patience or tolerance. It often feels as though they believe they have the right to treat customers poorly due to dissatisfaction with their paychecks and boredom with their roles. As a result, customer service at this location is severely lacking.

The pharmacy staff, in particular, exemplifies this issue. When seeking clarification about a delay in my prescription refill, I was treated as if my request for more information was an inconvenience. After being given a vague and inaccurate explanation, the staff showed little willingness to provide further details. This level of service is unacceptable and underscores the broader issues with customer service at this Walmart.

Furthermore, the woman who took my call became visibly upset and abruptly asked her coworker to speak with me, stating she couldn't handle the situation. I overheard her coworker attempting to calm her down, but she yelled into the phone that she didn't care and then hung up on me after stating her name. This occurred because they claimed I hadn't provided a justification letter for my prescription refill, despite my certainty that I had, just as I had done for the past ten years. She insisted they never lose anything, but I pointed out that I had experienced their mistakes before. I simply wanted to understand why they said my doctor's letter was expired when it was issued the same day as my prescription.

This level of service is unacceptable. If you decide to shop at Walmart, be prepared to encounter poor service and to solve your own problems without expecting assistance. The staff often displays a lack of motivation to help customers, brushing them off or providing vague answers that leave you more confused.

Customer service excellence is clearly not a priority at this location. They seem to take their customers for granted, likely due to the limited shopping options in the area. Their focus appears to be on minimizing interaction with customers to concentrate on other tasks. Smiling, kindness, and patience are notably absent.

To avoid these negative experiences, consider making a list and focusing solely on finding the items yourself. If you need help, avoid asking staff to prevent encountering their attitudes and indifference. Alternatively, switch to online shopping and opt for curbside pickup, which allows you to avoid direct interaction and receive your items without dealing with unmotivated staff. This approach can help you avoid the frustration and poor service that seem prevalent at this Walmart.; Very well stocked.  Excellent staff.  Clean and organized store.; They charge me twice for dog food...rigth there and there!!they told the can't refund me  the other $70.56.....the system will clear it up and correct it itself!!! Really BAD CUSTUMER SVC.GUAYAMA,PUERTO RICO.; Very organized layout of products. Service is professional and helpful. Location from bathroom and althroughout the store is clean. Great experience!; Prices are a little high compared to us and in the front they have hard liquor, which us Walmart does not have.

It's very close to other stores where you can find what you need or want.; Not a big Mall, but has almost everything you need.; Good place to spend some quality time with your loved ones. Name: Los Altos Ranch Market
Address: 3223 W Indian School Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85017, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 3223 (street_number); West Indian School Road (route); Alhambra (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85017 (postal_code)
Reviews: How do all the rude ladies still work there!! Your food court used to be so good, and the Staff seemed happy and cheerful, those ladies are all attitude!! If you're waiting to order food or drinks seems like their bothered. I BANK at this location so I have to come in ,and I like to give places a chance to do right but ,again with the attitude wanted to know what was all included with the chicken meal specials and seemed like she had no clue ,what I was even asking!! We would come here all the time for lunch we work not to far from here so it was a great place to stop and get tacos a fresh drink which they used to have alot of great options ,not no more ..their Bakery used to sell coffee ,so you could get fresh pastries and coffee before heading to the office ,not any more ,Ranch Market do better ..now i find out that Cardenas owns these stores, wow big difference the Cardenas in California are so friendly well priced especially for Cali, get better mangers and clean house!! Good Luck!!; Love the Horchata and the food they make everyday and the pan dulce plus the app they have now get free things now; Stopped by today on my way home after a long day at work. Walked in and decided I wanted some sweet bread. Fantastic variety of bread!!! Then I proceeded to make my way to the hot food area. Got myself some carne asada and some fresh guacamole. Got a few things then made my way to the self check out. Overall very happy about this visit today. Awesome customer service. Keep it up Ranch!!; This store is one way in one way out and that's not very convenient if you're only going to the bakery so you park near the bakery and end up getting out on the other side of the parking lot especially if you're handicap. They also don't have any handicap mobile scooters. They also don't sell pet food or supplies.; When you can hear Don Antonio Aguilar singing when you walk in, you know it's authentic. Carnitas were good, and a great selection of aguas frescas. Add a little more Jose Alfredo, Pedro Infante, Javier Solis and Jorge Negrete to the playlist and this place will be golden. 😄

Name: El Super
Address: 3372 S 6th Ave, Tucson, AZ 85713, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 3372 (street_number); South 6th Avenue (route); Wakefield (neighborhood); Tucson (locality); Pima County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85713 (postal_code)
Reviews: The customer service could be improved, as the lines are quite long and the establishment could be cleaner and better maintained. When I requested a sample of cheese, the staff member placed it directly on the counter without providing a napkin or any protective covering. Additionally, the cheesecakes were left unrefrigerated on a table. It's definitely got authentic Mexican culture.; I actually really like this place. The vibe in the store is very pleasant & bright. LOTS of produce, and multiple real human cashier lanes. 😊🍅🛒; Wide selection of fresh fruits and vegetables, if you are Latine, you will find what you need atthis store. There’s also a decent selection of packaged goods from Central America for those from further south of the border. The focus is on family shopping, so there are many aisles of packaged and processed convenience foods… as a health nut I wish that there were less sugary, cereals, and starches and more whole grains. The butcher shop and “deli“ area have all the cuts of all the meats and many types of cheeses, bases for soup and stews, and side dishes. Again geared toward the Latine customer. Prices are competitive and they have good weekly sales; sign up for their mailing list and benefit from the Wednesday specials.; Best grocery in Tucson. Fresh affordable veggies/fruits/meats/cheeses. Love all the leafy greens for juicing and salads; encourages healthy diet. Store manager William is key to store’s success; always attentive, professional, can do attitude and excellent customer service. Wish we had deli/cafe to spurge on take out please and a greater selection of bulky Items. Adequate security and parking lot lighting for evening shopping. Weekly Wednesday veggie/fruits sales are very popular, get there early or risk sold out. Check out their on site bakery for the best Choco Flan in AZ!; My first and last visit! Place was a mess, Long lines, people from produce were rude and lazy. They raised their voice at me when I asked about products. Meat department was out of control, it looked like a circus. They skipped numbers regularly and didn’t bother to mention that you don’t need a number for seafood. Cross contamination, disgusting. If u want food poisoning or a stomach flu get your meat and seafood from here. Deli didn’t even bother to put samples on a napkin or container, put it right on the dirty counter. Should have left from the first negative interaction with this store. Hope these people improve before the store goes under. Unbelievable!

Reviews: Went to buy meat at ranch and saw a couple of packages of meat with dead flies tightly packed INSIDE of the packages  and flies flying around the meat department .. not to mention that the meat at ranch is poor quality feels extremely rubbery .. won’t be coming here for groceries; I been coming in here since 2012..never had an issue up until today.  Some lady with glasses brown skin that was there without my consent just barges in front of me and says I'll scan them..your items for you.. as she proceeds she's standing next to me the whole time invading my space.. so I asked her if they were almost closing.. she was trying to rush me out out of everyone else that was there and they had more items than me. I gotta talk to whoever is in charge of her.; What a fun grocery shopping experience. HUGE bright, open, clean marketplace LOADED with hard to find specialty foods all under one roof. You could easily spend an hour here. Huge queso wheels up to 12 pounds, an enormous meats, fish, poultry section with HUGE selections. Food is ultra fresh. Friendly staff. Eat-in grill. Wonderful produce department. A must-go.; Great place to shop if you enjoy Mexican food. The Agua frescas are delicious.  The bakery has lots of delicious desserts. Prices are good.; I only bought Cage Free, Free Range 18 count eggs...to see if my stomach tolerates them better. The price was good. I also checked meat prices. What I saw was better than prices I had paid at my closest grocery stores. When I have room in my freezer, I will probably be back.

Name: Mercado Y Carniceria El Pima
Address: 116 N Casa Grande Ave, Casa Grande, AZ 85122, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Vicinity: 116 North Casa Grande Avenue, Casa Grande
Address Components: 116 (street_number); North Casa Grande Avenue (route); Casa Grande (locality); Pinal County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85122 (postal_code); 4523 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: The Ranchera Carne Asada with marinade is the best in town! Perfect for BBQ's and try the Yellow Fajita Chicken!; Went in for some marinated chicken and there was a dead fly on the meat we were going to buy and when we let them know about it all they did was pick it up with gloves that they were already using for other meats and threw the fly on the floor. Never again will we go there. Yuck!; The best carneceria in town. Love their marinated meat. Chicken is the best. Guacamole is my favorite.; Best meat market in Casa Grande.  Several months ago, I tried a Carniceria on Cottonwood that is much closer to my home.  Its service was radically inconsistent.  One person would go out of his way to get me what I wanted, another would say, "I can't help you with that."  I decided to try the Mercado y Carniceria El Pinal on N Casa Grande Ave.  I was VERY pleasantly surprised.  They went out of their way to get me EXACTLY what I wanted which was a thicker cut of beef than what was in the display case.  I returned several times and each time, they make the special cut so I get what I wanted.  The owner gave me her phone number and told me to call her if I was ever at the shop and someone failed to get me what I wanted.  THAT is customer service.  The FACT that the quality of the meat is excellent is over-powered by the customer service I have received every time I visit the store.  DEFINITELY worth the extra five-minute drive.; The man who helped me with the meat department was extremely nice. He took his time with trying to understand me. But the lady who checked us out was EXTREMELY rude. And also charged me whatever price she wanted to I bought about 4 things and it came out to 120$ ! And when I tried asking her about it she claimed she didn't know English. Worst.  Customer service ever.

Super friendly, affordable prices, and super fresh meats. Great experience and would definitely recommend to anyone!; Nice store have lots of things you might need, nice restaurant.; I've eaten here twice and both times it was delicious. Lately I've been stopping to pick up meat when I'm passing through the area, their chicken leg quarters are huge!

It's a busy spot so you can count on it taking 10-20 minutes if you need anything behind the counter; Great Tacos! Ordered 3, best was the Pollo, then Carne Asada, then the Carnitas. They were filling and fresh made. They have an excellent selection of hot sauces and toppings. - 1 star for cleanliness and gas station feel but to be fair it is a market/butcher; I don't know why, but AZ has the best Mexican food I can find anywhere. Sometimes better than what I've had all over Mexico. This place is a shining example of how good it can get. Very very impressed by the flavors here.

Name: Lucky
Address: 1515 Sloat Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94132, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: 1515 (street_number); Sloat Boulevard (route); Lakeshore (neighborhood); San Francisco (locality); San Francisco County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 94132 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Be careful when you purchase something promoted like buy $5 eachwhen you buy 5 or buy 2 get 2 free or almost 50% discount especially meat and yogurt. Those are mostly expired or something.; Low priced market.  Good parking.  I very much appreciate the prices & quality of food.  12/21/19: the remodeled store is beautiful inside!  Wide isles.  Nice flooring.  Neatly stacked vegetables & fruit, new self-serve deli!, nice service deli, very clean!  Still low food prices.  Some neat high end fancy food choices too.  The bakery cakes were professional looking.  It is a pleasure to shop in this store.    I am highly impressed by the great remoleded store & it's new layout too.  I guess this store competes with Trader Joe's nearby & the soon to be built nearby Whole Foods, & perhaps the small Target food store nearby.  This store's prices are quite low, & the food is of high quality.  So far I have not read of food recalls for Lucky, but I keep reading about food recalls at TJ's & some at Whole Foods.  It's not their fault, but still.  It is what they choose to sell that keeps getting recalled.  Not so far at Lucky!  May, 2021.  Their buffet bar is open again.  Tasty.  7/8/21: The hot bar food was good.  June, 2023: The cashier would not tape my buffet box, so it spilled over in my car!  I was so 😡 upset!  I will request a refund for that!  Also, they do not have enough cashiers!  7/1/23: The deli (manager?) lady was wonderful.  I told her how my last buffet box 📦 spilled in my car 🚗.  She told me to fill a buffet box 📦, so I did.  She gave me the box for free!  I felt redeemed.  I was grateful.; Really, really big Lucky.

Huge inventory.

Short staffing cashiers creates long lines. Additionally, few or no carry baskets. More carts in aisles creates more crowding.

I like that there is such a variety of foods - of pretty everything.

Deli section with hot foods.

Flowers and plants and party supplies and greeting cards.

Really large section of toiletries such as you might find in a small CVS or Walgreens.  Plus Pharmacy.

Coin thing - to turn in coins and get cash.

Good place to pick up supplies for a picnic at the beach.

Wide aisles.

Store is very clean.

Parking lot is busy. Not many spots if you need accessibility parking spot.; I don't usually post reviews pertaining to staff who work at a store but anyone who cares about how their lunch is prepared will enjoy this. I had the pleasure of having my sandwich prepared by Gloria at the deli. It's like she read my mind and actually put effort into making it as of it were her own lunch. I just had to take the time to post about this because it means a lot to me to see someone put the effort in. Good job girl💪; Beware buying gift cards at this Lucky.  The 3 gift cards I bought got tampering. The store manager told me to call  their 1800 number, nothing he could do.  So did their customer service said these are my total lost. I reported this to the SF police. I asked them to put warning sign so customers aware there is big risk buying gift cards. Scammers swap cards here and NO REFUND under Lucky policy.

Name: City Market
Address: 72 Beaver Creek Pl, Avon, CO 81620, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 72 (street_number); Beaver Creek Place (route); Avon (locality); Eagle County (administrative_area_level_2); Colorado (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 81620 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Really nice grocery store in downtown Avon. Large selections of fresh produce, seafood, prepared foods, bakery items, and more. Lots of local products. We were able to find everything we needed here and more. Good sale prices too!; City Market has that rarest of rare things in this area: Affordable prices! The selection is very wide, they have a decent selection of organic items, and the fresh baked goods are good as well (we had a lemon cream cake). There are deals all over the store. If you have a Kroger card they take that, or they will give you a city card if you need one (you don't even have to register it to use it).; Been great for a long time but shouldn't offer pick up if they can't do it well. It's fallen apart since Bruce moved. Current kids doing it are even slower AND arent even trying to match brands and flavors. Sure you put in salad dressing and you'll get something from that isle, but not what you ordered. Moving Bruce was a mistake. He wasn't the fastest but he
was friendly And the order was right. Now it's slow AND the order is really really wrong.; Fresh Floral for Valentine’s Day Flowers! Desere was such an awesome help to make a huge vase full of flowers on the spot! A++; I needed assistance to inflate balloons with helium for my daughter’s birthday. I called ahead to make sure someone would be available. When I got there the answer of the employees was “ we are short of people” I awaited around 20 minutes for them to figure who could get things done. None of the department staff had idea on how to handle this. They voiced the manager Kelly on the speaker and she never came. Nobody cares, nobody wants to have ownership for their attitude or attention to customers. Terrible customer service and management. I left empty handed after 20 mins. Went to Walmart and they were able to do the task immediately! Is not what you work on; is how your attitude and mindset works.

Reviews: I've lived in the neighborhood surrounding Nick's market for 4 years now. And they have never let me down. Never been a disappointment with their service. Their supplies or their kind and friendly interactions throughout the store, helping me find things or just chatting about our days and how we are in our lives at checkout. I highly recommend this market so anyone, even if you're just passing by looking for a snack, they're fantastic. They're amazing! And my living experience would be dimmer without them; Love Nick's.  The produce is fresh and fairly priced.  One of the last family-owned markets left in this area.  You won't find nicer owners anywhere.; What a great community amenity - has everything you could need or want with some great Middle Eastern ingredients as well. Produce is top notch and affordably priced. I can’t see myself going to another grocery store!; The kindest owners and have the best selection. Things I can never find at other markets. Name: Lucky
Address: 1750 Fulton St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 1750 (street_number); Fulton Street (route); Western Addition (neighborhood); San Francisco (locality); San Francisco County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 94117 (postal_code); 1204 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
This is not my regular supermarket. I just happened to be nearby (at the DMV), and decided to pick up a few things before I headed back home. I must say, this was the EMPTIEST supermarket (in terms of customers in store) I think I've ever been to! I was here on a Monday, kinda mid-day, and there was just, like, NO ONE there (I always feel like this is a sign of something. Kinda like an empty restaurant). I bought a few small items. And I must confess, I kinda felt like I was being watched while I was in there, like they were concerned I might shoplift or something. I felt this air of suspicion even AFTER I checked-out. Very strange. It's unlikely I'll go again, as this is not in my neighborhood, but I wouldn't want to, either.

The prices I encountered were just sort of OK. Kind of on-par with Safeway.; Lucky's grocery store on Masonic & Fulton is so important to the area. I particularly feel that the fried chicken is better than Popeyes or Safeway. The SF. Fulton Street store is clean and organized. I was surprised to see Krispy Kreme donuts sold in the store.; Nice store with huge variety of stuff. There is also a party section. There is a Poppy Bank. We love this clean store.; This Lucky sucks. Pricing is all sorts of backwards, sometimes doubling or tripling the same exact item at Safeway. Worst of all was during a recent trip there a rude security guard approached my wife, accused her of shoplifting and demanded to search her purse. Upon finding out he was way out of line, and there were no hidden items in her bag....no apology. He  only stated, and I quote, "yah, cuz when you came in here you didn't have nothing", and turned around and walked away? What the hell does that mean? I believe she was owed a polite, and sincere apology. This is absolutely the last time we will ever shop here!; My absolute favorite supermarket.
Reminds me of a suburban supermarket bc it's huge.
Friendly staff, great security, tins of options.
The only thing I have trouble with here is there floral is simple under serviced. Not one decent arrangement ever.

Reviews:
Mega Fresh Supermarket is a treasure trove for any wine enthusiast. The wine selection here is truly outstanding, offering an impressive array of options from all over the world. Whether you’re a seasoned connoisseur or a casual drinker, there’s something to suit every palate and preference.

What sets Mega Fresh apart is not just the variety, but the quality and organization of their wine section. Each variety is clearly labeled and smartly categorized, making it incredibly easy to navigate through regions and varietals. The store frequently updates its collection, bringing in both well-known labels and hidden gems from smaller vineyards, which is a delightful surprise for anyone looking to try something new.

Moreover, the knowledgeable staff at Mega Fresh Supermarket are always on hand to offer advice and recommendations. They are well-versed in wine pairing and eager to help you find the perfect bottle for any occasion, be it a casual dinner or a special celebration.

The competitive pricing and regular promotions also make Mega Fresh an ideal spot for stocking up on your favorites or discovering new ones without breaking the bank.; I went shopping here for pisole ingredients. They had everything I needed. Great store and great staff.; Not a huge supermarket and definitely not for large grocery lists. They have lots of last minute items people usually need and you can find almost anything. Prices are high (hence the no big purchases reason). Location is inside the development but accessible to anyone.; Very convenient. Great bread made with olive oil.very good breaded beef. Good variety. Not crowded. Biweekly specials.; High prices" all the cashiers never say good morning or afternoon only if you salute first.

I am very pleased to recommend it to anyone who loves fish and seafood and inexpensive vegetables.; There was a BUG in one of their side dishes!!! All in one piece, meaning they most likely don't even wash their vegetables!! I noticed it only after it already went in my mouth!!; I personally enjoyed this Galleria location in the heart of DTLA, it was clean with ample deals must be because of the new year but still very reasonably priced Items, got some porridge, banana milk shake, Turtle Chips by Orion both the corn and churro chocolate flavor, fish sausage cake, tteokbokki, premade meal of beef galbi to go. Name: Superior Grocers
Address: 9801 Laurel Canyon Blvd, Pacoima, CA 91331, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 9801 (street_number); Laurel Canyon Boulevard (route); Pacoima (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91331 (postal_code); 4039 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Forever grateful for the memories of bringing my Grammy here. I love her so much. She taught me how to shop. She would have her list and then she'd let me pick something and she'd buy it for me. My boyfriend and I would bring her here on our days off. I love my granny ❤️🫠; One of the best grocery stores for Mexican food shopping in Pacoima with competitive prices. They also have an in-store bakery and eatery. This location usually isn't too packed and is surrounded by a lot of other businesses.; This review is for the employee deisy very friendly awesome helper good vibe the sunshine to the store; The cashier Daisy was terrible at her customer service skills.  She gave the 'last' customer in line the job to tell other customers that she was closed, yet she hadn't turned off her service light. She denies me service, yet she accepts one man after me. She denies two other women and then accepts another man. That's when I spoke up after she denies a fourth woman and I told her it's not fair that she helps others when I was next and she denied me. She rudely said it was because they only had a few things to purchase and I repeated that it still wasn't fair and the least she could do is turn off her light so others aren't trying to get in her line and she gave attitude and she suggested I talk to her supervisor if I wanted to and said that she's been working for the last 8 hours when little did she know I had been working for 10 but I am not advertising it. Was she trying to get me to feel bad for her?  I talked to her supervisor Adriana and the she asked if I wanted to speak to the next person up?  I said yes, please because the cashier Daisy kept eyeing me down with some arrogance in her look which again is very unprofessional.  I told her my purchase is helping pay her salary and even then she didn't apologize for her rudeness toward me.  As I was waiting for Alex, the next person in charge, Daisy, the rude and arrogant cashier walks up to another employee and in Spanish and very childish manner says, "Seriously, she's going to talk to Alex," for which I replied in Spanish, that "Yes, seriously." Perhaps she thought she was going to be more rude about the incident and speak in Spanish in front of me without realizing I understood her.  After that, she walked away and out of the store. I spoke to Alex and let him know that we are all tired here some of us getting off of work trying to get our groceries and I didn't come to be treated like that.  Both Adriana and Alex apologized for Daisy's behavior and it's a shame that Daisy herself didn't have enough self control to begin with, confused and angered more costumers, and didn't have enough sense to apologize herself.; Very well stocked, clean and organized. The cashiers are very welcoming, friendly and helpful.
Great grocery store to go to for your everyday needs.

Name: Superior Grocers
Address: 2000 S Central Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90011, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 2000 (street_number); South Central Avenue (route); South Los Angeles (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90011 (postal_code)
Reviews: So today I went to the grocery store to get me some things to make dinner. I go inside, and grabbed my items, get to the register and it’s a long line. As I stand in one of the lines, I noticed some of the workers at another register (it looked like they were getting it ready to open up). So I asked the representative Kevin, if that register was going to open. He asked the representative David (who was at the register) if he was opening up and David looked up at me and looked at Kevin and said no. So Kevin told me no. No problem. So I stay in my line (which was moving pretty swiftly) and as I approach the representative at the register in my line, I look over and notice David approach a couple (that looks much different then myself) and ask them if they would like to check out at his register. At first, I was a little confused but then I thought, hey, this couple is a little on the elderly side (may have a few items to buy; I couldn’t see their basket). No worries. But then I look up and notice this couple had a lot of groceries. Definitely more than the two ground beef’s, three jars of spaghetti sauce, two pack of noodles and a bottle of juice I was purchasing. Definitely made me feel some type of way because literally seconds had passed since the “No” I received when I asked to the gesture the other shoppers (who again did not look like me) received when they didn’t even inquire whether or not the register was open. Dont want to jump to conclusions or make accusations, but I could not help but feel overlooked and for me, I couldn’t help but feel it had ties to my race. I asked and got a no. They didn’t ask and was OFFERED to check out at the register. I had a few times to buy. They had a LOT MORE than I did to buy. I am Black. They were Latino and living in a predominantly Latino community, sometimes one can feel overlooked or ignored but in that moment in the store, it didn’t feel like a feeling. It felt more like a reality and I didn’t enjoy my experience at all. I spoke with Kevin and thanked him for his help and spoke to Samuel who said he would look into the matter more closely and despite their professionalism and assistance and acknowledgement that yes, something was definitely different from the response I received to the gesture the other couple received, I can not help but feel that nothing would be done. However, I’m hopeful and just wanted to bring some awareness to my experience at this location.; The staff has 0 respect to customers. They complain about customers and yet they need them to maintain their business. Some people don’t deserve work. They should all be replace by AI and technology. Literally, many need to level up and look for a harder job. Hopefully, the employees and those using hard drugs including cigarettes suffer job loss or hours are cut because the management is completely a mess and no one is taking the business serious.; Was told I wasn't allowed in with a bag, I've lived in the neighborhood for 10 years. No signs saying no bags allowed, and then he let people in with bags. Asked me to leave the bag at the entrance but was not responding if someone stole it.; Not enough cashier available line are long waiting time to much. I think next time I go to food 4 less better; I was accused of stealing by Joana and cashier's yet when confronted outside in front of the store I had nothing from their store I had stolen nothing. I even told them I'm not even going to get upset because I know I didn't do anything but I told him you are going to give me the number to the corporate office and you're going to tell me who told you I was stealing because I know that that's my right I also know from having a guard card that you're not supposed to confront anyone about stealing unless you are certain and certain is the word that they have stole something otherwise you have now put yourself in a predicament where you can be sued. If you are African-American shopping at this market it will be presumed that you are stealing I even told them as I left just because I'm African-American doesn't mean I'm stealing from your store. This is a photo of paper I received from the manager with the information I requested.

Reviews:
Awesome grocery store. Awesome selection, nice deli and fresh selections. Love the fresh breads. Prices are also not crazy expensive.
Cashiers super efficient and friendly. Isles were clean and there were plenty of employees to answer questions.
Good location also.
Not far from my hotel. I'm here for a week and I will be back.; Good assortment of foods both fresh and preserved. Great service! They also have a small cafeteria.; Opens early at 6 am and closes at 10 pm. It has everything huge selection range from milk and eggs to meats to processed candy all in this relatively small store. Granted not every employee spoke English, we for everything we needed; Nice little local grocery store with good variety of sundries, fresh vegetables, dairy products, fresh meats, beer and alcohol.. All you may need!  5.99 for lunch.; parking attendant is rude and has no manners. Young black guy think he's bad and has all the power. Instead of asking where I was going to take the barricade off for me to go on the supermarket side he pointed at my face with his finger with a face that said " I want to kill you " what kind of greeting is this as you come in the parking lot???  Then on the way out I was charged 2.75 for parking. I wasn't there for more than 35 minutes and the cashier supposedly punched my ticket ???? I am NEVER going back to this place. I'll keep going to Supermax instead. NO HASSLES there !

Address: 1350 Ave Ashford Condominium, 1350 Ashford Ave, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM

Reviews:
We stopped in here several times during our visit.  It was within blocks from our hotel. We had coffee on both of our visit. The coffee is good but very hot and they have plenty of seating.

The place is very clean. We wanted to try some of the pastry items but most of them came in bulk sizes or maybe we missed the individual items due to the poor service. We were not happy with the service.  On both visits we had a young lady with a bad attitude and NOT friendly so we limited our interactions to coffee.; Organic supermarket in Condado. You can sit and have coffee, as well: about a dozen table with chairs available. Very clean. Lots of merchandise packed on the shelves and in the refrigerated section. Plant based cheese plus an assortment of meats. But so expensive.; Good environment.
Chicken Cesar wrap is good .; Nice seating area, wide variety of food options are available. Very friendly staff, delicious bakery and food options.; Clean and modern market with organic and select produce in the $$-$$$ price range, cafeteria-style hot foods, grab & go, AND a coffee bar!

On their coffee:
Even though it doesn't show up on Google
Maps under "coffee", there's a Cafe Hacienda San Pedro! It does seem they have a smaller selection of beans (no peaberry and only San Pedro in the grinder the day I went) but a great pitstop for a recharge with AC, tables by the window, and proximity to the beach!

Reviews: Got the noodles that I was looking for. For people commenting about the middle aged lady's attitude, she's just a middle age lady- let her do what she wants lol.; Y’all giving one-star reviews have never been to a Chinese supermarket and it shows. Most markets look similar to this one, and most attendants are just stern and blunt. If you look confused or have a question, ask and she will give you an answer. She has always helped me find random ingredients. This store has everything we’ve needed to cook Lao/Thai food as well as my favorite childhood snacks.; Older Lady at the front gets upset whenever someone enters the store. It's as if they don't want to sell you anything. Do they not know they need to sell things in order to stay open? Also, $14 for 6 frozen dumplings is ridiculous. Try yo find another asian shop before giving this one a try.; The store attendant speaks great Spanish and English and she was very helpful. Not a big store, but well-selected items (good choices, good brands). Besides non-perishables, they stock tofu & a variety of fresh mushrooms & vegetables (a-choy, bok choy, bitter melon, daikon etc.). Will definitely shop here regularly.; Great place to find all asian cusine sauce, noodles, candies such as korean,Chinese,  Japanese. Is small, but you can find the basic

Reviews:
The cutest shop with any and everything you can think of! Perfect pit stop before walking around the area for some fun snacks, local drinks, and lovely souvenirs!

The people working there are welcoming locals ready to help and answer any questions :); It’s a nice go to store! THEY TAKE APPLE PAY TOO!!! Was staying in a nearby hotel and it was nice being able to go to the store and get a drink or a snack. The service is fast and the man working there is very nice!  Definitely worth coming back to when I revisit Puerto Rico! They also sell lots of liquor and stuff to smoke.; Ramen, mochi, ramuné! Yummy yummy!! Liquor store, cigarrette as well! They have all convenient store stuff too!! Great store at Ashford avenue; Nice selection on drink and liquor. They also have groceries, chinese food product and souvenirs. I was staying in an apartment around the store. It was my go to store when I needed snack, drinks and deterget; I’ve never been to a convenience store with so much selection! The couple running the store were very helpful and the kids cooking and eating in the store was a nice added touch. Will definitely be back

Reviews:
My husband and I have been here twice and every time they present such a wonderful experience. The ambiance is so delightful, the food comes in just the right amount of portions and the smoothies are so hard to pick because they are All so good! I chose the matcha smoothie, the pesto avocado toast with cherry tomatoes, and my husband got the isla sampler plate. The cute lofi music, the food, everything is reasonably priced, we will be back for sure!; So happy to find this place! It's a refreshing feeling sitting here under the big fans and submerged by local artists' products. All the food, coffee, and smoothies we tried tasted great and fresh!! Do know that they won’t do leftover to-go boxes (at least during the time I visited) so order accordingly :)

Highly recommended!; Wow this place was a great find! Amazingly friendly staff, great menu, so many vegan options! And they had their own homemade cashew milk! Winner! Bit more than I would usually pay for a breakfast, but it's worth it for a treat! The French toast was insanely good! I went for the vegan mixta plate and definitely recommend it!; A must try brunch place. Really nice interior and the food was really good. Keep in mind that they don't serve meat.; Really fresh and tasty food! It has plenty of really good wholesome vegan food which I was able to enjoy. Everything was delicious

Name: The House Wine, Beer & More - Condado
Address: 114 Avenida José de Diego, San Juan, 2do nivel, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Address Components: San Juan (locality); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); Bayola (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00907 (postal_code)
Reviews: We picked this place because it was relatively close to the airport and it looked like it had a wide selection. Both were true. We needed a wide range of booze for a party, and this place has a lot of stuff. I can't speak about the prices since I don't live in PR , so I don't have anything to compare it to. But they have wines from all over the world, arranged by country/region, plus lots of beer and liquor. The place was clean and the employees were helpful. It's a little hard to find in that it sits atop a SuperMax grocery store. You can park on the second level, walk down the hallway and avoid the grocery store altogether, or take an elevator up from the grocery.; Wide international variety of wines and beers, jellies & cold cuts; Great selection of wine & liquor. I was looking for tequila they had a good selection of celebrity tequilas of which I am not a fan of. But one they did have that I would recommend Santo.; Huge Selection for the area. High end bottles are slightly marked up but still a great selection. Friendly Staff. Free Parking; Impressive. People complain about local beers but even if you're going after it - it will probably take you a couple weeks to try all. The rest is unusual too including specials for Jack Daniel or Baccardi. Prices are ok. The location is just above SuperMax grocery across DoubleTree hotel.

Reviews:
Nice place to grab a quick bite. They serve cold sandwiches by the deli and coffee by the resistor. In the back there is a beautiful outdoor patio with plenty of seating. They also sell a variety of chocolates and coffee beans if you're interested in bringing some back to the states.; Wow! Didn't realize there was an amazing outdoor patio for enjoying your meal. It's a high quality grocery store with preseasoned meat and fish. Salads are great. Plenty of parking. Prices are higher than normal. I recommend to buy their pre-made food and eat on the patio.; I love this place! However, on more than one occasion, we haven't received the best customer service at the back counter. (The one with the ready to eat meals and wraps). This minor detail prevents me from giving a 5 star rating. Maybe offer some customer service training?
Despite that, its food and locale are wonderfully delightful!; Wow I miss everything from  this market!
Best quality and lunch! Relax space with tables to seat with your lunch or snacks and a book. Great customer service CLEAN. ALL IN ONE PLACE. 😘; Scamming H-A-R-D on some (if not most!) of their products…

Particular example—
5 oz of Santa Barbara Olive Co. Martini Pimento Olives: $9
10 oz of the SAME kind on Amazon: $9.50

What on the earth is going on here?! Explain…

To locals— find better spots to buy your gourmet products. Unless you have unlimited funds, then I guess keep putting money on these thieves’ pockets!

Name: Walgreens
Address: 1130 Ashford Ave, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours

Reviews:
This Walgreens is open 24 hours but the pharmacy inside is only open for a set time each day.

They have nice and reasonably priced souvenirs here. I bought a hat and a mug to take home.; This is the best Walgreens I've ever been to. So good, in fact, that I shopped there 8 times in my 3 days in Condado. Full grocery store and massive alcohol selection. You've never seen anything like it. Also the nicest staff you'll ever meet, cracking jokes and doing all they can to make sure you have a pleasant experience. The perfect pharmacy.; Went to pick up itch cream for bug bites.  The only thing is the cream did not have a seal. Open 24 hours.; Different from your average Walgreens in the mainland.  Hard liquor at the entrance,  and a whole grocery store in the back; We bought an umbrella to use at the beach and used it for maybe 5 minutes. It kept blowing over and was very poor quality. We kept the umbrella in our hotel for 2 days because we had other plans. When we tried to return it, the store refused to accept it saying “it’s used”. Obviously it was going to be used. The product didn’t work. Any other store I’ve been to has accepted returns like this. Very disappointed. Don’t buy anything from here unless you’re 100% sure the product is good quality and you will not return it. The store should have a “no returns” sign on the door.
