Reviews:
Front door opens at 8am, but you can use the back door.; We must invest in places like this. The streets and sidewalks are full of beauty and dangerous failures of infrastructure. Pedestrian crossings are rife with non-functional signals and broken buttons. Metal utility covers are so corroded that they look like jagged death traps for children to get a leg stuck in. Streets are so thick with patching that manhole covers are 8" deep, creating blowout inducing potholes.

I loved it here, but I despair for those who live there.; Actually I went there to Gustos I think the name of the restaurant was but I changed and went to another restaurant close by which was stuffed avocado shop. Gusto was so full and plus it's was more of a Coffe shop... I went next door where was just perfect for an introvert like me 😉😊; This mt second time staying here.  Its a nice hotel close to the action,  but not in the middle of chaos.   Plenty of store to shop for food, clothes, and souvenirs.; Great for wine tasting and having tapas. Lost of cheeses and breads to choose from. Friendly staff.

Name: Sprouts Farmers Market
Address: 13010 Aurora Ave N, Seattle, WA 98133, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 13010 (street_number); Aurora Avenue North (route); Northgate (neighborhood); Seattle (locality); King County (administrative_area_level_2); Washington (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 98133 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Good selection of produce, but most of the other goods are quite pricey compared to competitors. Some fruits are also quite expensive ($6 for a pint of blueberries, which was a sale price too!) The other challenge is that the checkout lines can be quite long. But the staff is friendly and otherwise food is good!; Love!  Ample parking, great prices, organic food and friendly staff.

Bonus:  where can you get a sandwich for $4.99?  Or splurge and get a meal deal for $5.99, or a deluxe sandwich for $6.99?; Incredible layout and the staff are friendly. If you see looking for a clean, organized, bright, neighborhood market with a massive selection with an INDIVIDUALLY PACKAGED bulk section at great prices, this place is for you!! I know you've been waiting for this opening as much as me so trust me when I say it was worth the wait.; This is a class act supermarket.  Not cheap, but has lots of vegan options that make it worth the drive.  Fake meats and cheeses abound.  There really is something for everybody.  Does well on organics and even has its own line of foodie goodies.  Perhaps, as for me, this isn't your neighbourhood pop in shop, but I highly recommend it when super groceries are your top priority.; Customer Service is lacking with Sherrie and her bagger. No acknowledgment the entire transaction, but I guess for observation sake it would be far too rude to not merely say “Thank you” at the END of the transaction which seemed so cringe for her to perform. Didn’t even ask if I had my own bags or if I found everything ok. No “hello”, no nothing.  I guess her personal conversation she was having with her bagger was much more important than doing her job and acknowledging her customers that make her paycheck possible. I typically love Sprouts, but the utter rudeness and sheer disregard was absolutely disgusting.

Reviews: I’m a little mad I didn’t find this place sooner. I’m going to become a regular. The prices of everything is so much better than Safeways and other typical supermarkets. And they have a good selection of stuff. I got a succulent plant for $4.99. There’s also a large parking space and it’s located right in front of a bus-stop. The person who checked me out was a sweet old man that seemed like such a nice genuine grandfather.; Great store way affordable price s.  Good place. Staff needs to be more trans accepting this is Seattle get with times.    Cashiers job leave personal opinion s to your self refer people how they identity ridiculous this is Seattle; Everything about the store is the bee's knees. Should always shop here first before you go to other like normal grocery stores. It's kind of fun to see how much money you save, and what kinds of cool unusual products you can find.; Outstanding discount grocery store with excellent prices and very good customer service. The store was clean and well lighted on the day I visited. This store also has a decent selection of produce and plants for sale and is located by a bus stop.; This store in Crossroads is smaller and doesn’t have a lot of things as I see at the Kirkland store.  It still has Hope everything is going well values on frozen foods, meats and dry goods.  Just in a small store.

Name: Grocery Outlet
Address: 3445 Alma St, Palo Alto, CA 94306, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 3445 (street_number); Alma Street (route); St. Claire Gardens (neighborhood); Palo Alto (locality); Santa Clara County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 94306 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I was so surprised when this particular chain came into Palo Alto since so many people in PA tend to protest what they consider "discount" stores because they feel it's out of touch with the Palo Alto "brand.  

We have lots of students with Stanford University and elderly people on fixed incomes; a store like this is very helpful to their budgets. The store takes snap EBT cards and I found out that you can buy starter vegetable plants for your garden and Snap will pay for it. I took this picture last weekend.

This location is a very nice store. It's clean and it has a really decent selection of many favorites that you can get at any grocery store, but at Grocery Outlet for a much better price.

Best, the store is small, easy to navigate for somebody with mobility issues to go through and the employees are friendly and helpful.; Love this place! New surprises of products and low prices at every visit. Their ice cream freezer is incredible with lots of options. They also have a fitness section with protein and green drinks.; This place sucks. They messed up all their inventory and even employees don’t know the location of certain items. Besides, ask yourself a question, why are you shopping in this grocery store when everything as expensive as in other stores. Just go somewhere else for better deals and quality.; Its an ok store, but i was a little disappointed. Prices are the same if not more than trader joes, which is my baseline for an excellent grocery. They do have more stuff, medicine, toiletries, pots and pans, but the layout is just a little sad, as is the produce section. They do have a nice big wine section and lots of brand name stuff as well as their own organic brand. So if you’re coming from whole foods the quality will be lower, as will the prices, but i think trader joes ties in price for most things and beats on quality.; Great prices, selection varies somewhat. I could not get a cell signal, Wi-Fi, or any way to communicate with my family to find out if they wanted this or that.

Reviews:
Interesting grocery store with some stuff rarely find !( I thought it was a pizza shop to be honest 😆); Fantastic Deli and great produce selection here. I love the cashiers. Prices are higher than pretty much every where else unfortunately. I personally don’t like the new self checkouts and some of us who are older prefer a conversation with someone. I’ve tried to ask to talk to the store manager before about a couple of things but he/she is apparently never there in the afternoon.; Wow, our new favorite grocery store! Found this place on accident driving by… the produce section alone is the best we’ve seen outside of Berkeley Bowl! Whole Foods should rename to One-Tenths Foods!

Ken thoroughly schooled us and gave us an excellent demo to find the perfect melon. The fresh guacamole was also one of the best I’ve ever had. Love this place!; I find the produce good here. But it's odd they can't serve any usda prime, only choice. I've had many negative encounters with a checkout man. They have a new system for self checkout but don't follow order if you're in line. Wouldn't recommend for it being that expensive; Wow. I can finally find Uji Time ice cream pints here at Piazza. Uji Time used to do soft serve in San Mateo, Japan town and Berkeley, hard to find their product down south.
The lychee is a must try.

Reviews: El Monte Mall is an apartment complex that is both rental and for sale units. It is old but grand and very accessible to facilities.; This is the "mall" you hope you never have to go to...EVER. Shopping for LOCALS is "adequate, convenient and necessary"...emphasis on necessary! This entire mall exists for "convenience" and is open to the public. Lack of security at any and all points of entry (stairs, elevator and parking) adds to all the added danger of going there for ANY reason. No security cameras easily visible (or concealed) and no visible security of any kind at 1PM...imagine late at night!?! Lots of construction, even on the parking floors...lots of people coming and going with NO SECURITY. If you go there by yourself for any reason make sure to be on alert; better to go with someone else and you watch each other's back. This review is not a joke...would give negative stars if I could. Oh wait...forgot to mention that parking is another star that I subtracted; lousy parking objectively. Many lawsuits are in the making at this "mall". Saw many four and five star reviews from young, cocky people who find this place convenient but that don't view "security" the way it should be viewed...for everyone.; I went to Pueblo supermarket and the produce options were pretty limited. But the place was fairly clean. I appreciate that the most about the atmosphere.; The Pueblo Matket here has plenty of covered, secure free parking (in rear) and the place itself has a very helpful staff. store is easy to navigate and selection is pretty good. Has good selection of produce and meats. Bakery, flowers and wines. Accommodating staff.; A place where dope smokers have parking privileges over the regular patrons? Nah, next time I'll go some place else where I feel more respected.

Reviews: Sadly today I had a really bad experience this morning. The staff in the front desk was very rude. I’ve never been treated like this, when I was finally able to make the appointment I decided to cancel and do it somewhere else. Other than that the staff is friendly and good A/C.; Few years ago we went to Planet Fitness in Dallas and had a horrible experience and since then we never went back. Highly recommended!!; Very helpful and well stoked.
Really happy I found this place; Very happy with the service and prices from these guys. Bought a pump (2hp) and compression tank (119g) for our building cistern. Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM

Reviews:
I recently visited Pep Boys for a tire issue, and they went above and beyond to help me. Not only did they fix my tire, but they also addressed another issue my car had. The staff was incredibly patient and respectful, truly understanding my situation. Their exceptional service and genuine care made a stressful situation much easier. If I could give more than five stars, I would! God bless them for their outstanding help.; The service is excellent and professional.  They did what they said they would do at the quoted price.  Making an appointment online was easy.  English and Spanish speakers.  I had an oil change, replace all tire pressure sensors, and 2 tires: $1,370.  Not the cheapest, not the most expensive.  Reliable & predictable service.
The only down side is that they were in the middle of an extensive remodeling.  Did not affect service but I like browsing in the store while waiting and that wasn't possible on this visit.  I'm sure this will be a short term issue.

Recommended.; Great service very nice people. I went because my battery was giving me
Problems and they were quick on checking and giving me options. Overall very good service; It could have been repaired but they gave a false excuse regarding where was located. I ended buying a new tire because they would repair. UNNECESSARY.; I seem to keep these guys in business here in Puerto Rico with flat fires. The team at Pep Boys has me in and out of the shop and back on the road quickly.

Reviews: Its prices versus convenience. I take convenience as it’s a supermarket with a lot of food variety, helpful cashiers and ample parking. Beats the Isla Verde store.; This supermarket is organized, clean, and with few customers.  I was looking for some items, vegetables, pasta, and cookies.  When I started choosing vegetables, a woman talking about social distancing, not hanging out with friends and shopping quickly.  I hang out with my daughter and we found her rude and offensive.  Then we went to the next hall and the same clerk we hurried with. About 5 times the announce and order to be fast. We find the items and pay.  Absurd, rude.  Employees protect themselves with gloves, masks, and sanitizer.  Cleaning at the cash register, on the shopping baskets,on the shopping cars Get shots when it's their turn for added protection.; More like a convenience store. Customer service needs to be improved.; Small grocery store; pan sobao and agua are pretty good if you pick them fresh. The produce section is nice. Have all the basic things you need to survive. They make delicious smoothies here. Checking out is slow and be prepared to pack your bag.; 80% of the employees provide terrible customer service. Management is lazy and useless; they just spend most of their time gossiping and laughing in loud voices. Quality of products is mediocre, at best. I do not recommend this supermarket.

Reviews: Excellent place for buying groceries and stuff for your home.; Very nicely packed with essentials, neat prices and easy access. Reviews: Relocated to PR and was grateful to find a large grocery store with room to push a cart thru the isle and low prices. I would recommend checking this place out if you are in the area.; I like Econo. It doesn't have a massive variety of items when it comes to vegetables and fruits but it's always clean and organized. It does sometimes have exotic fruits that I've never tried before. Once I bought a dragon fruit there which was interesting to see and try. It's a nice store to run in quick and get out as it's never overly crowded or messy. They have a small hardware section as well.; Everything was well organized. Very clean and well kept. The line even though it was pretty long, it flowed at a very quick pace. All of the employees that I had encountered were very nice and helpful. Will be coming here more frequently in the near future.; Good super market rest rooms out side park lot needs work; Ample parking space; plus they are improving the entrance. Brand merchandise variety was so impressive for times of pandemic, I found myself stuffing my cart; but careful with the prices. Some products, such as eggs, juices, and dairy were noticeably pricier than competing supermarkets. Enjoy the variety; but watch the prices.

Reviews:
ZZ Top's "Gimme All Your Lovin'" was filmed here!; Make sure you get your receipt!
The morning attendant took a long time to set the pump and when she did, she only set it for $10 instead of the $20 that I had paid.
I can't tell if she was just slow or wasn't awake yet as her hair was still wet or if she was actually trying to scam me.; Just a Few Tips for This Store:

1. Check Your Receipts!!!! They are the only store in Littlerock who takes those cool 50¢ coupons you get in cigarette packs so I went and gave them my coupon and the price went from 6.33 (higher than the normal price) to 5.83 (their normal price for marlboro 100s) after the coupon. I just paid and went to tell my fiance to let him handle it. He told my fiance that he forgot to add the coupon and gave him 50¢. The guy tried to cheat us out of a measly 50 cents and had the audacity to lie to my fiance like I didn't notice what he tried to do. Very shady dude.

2. Check dates on all products!!!! Especially the sodas that are EXTREMELY UNSAFE TO CONSUME AFTER EXPIRATION.  I received a small bottle of coke that was 4 months over the expiration date. The same guy tried telling me it didn't expire until 2015. I looked around and didn't see any other sodas that had a 2015 expiration date. He refused to exchange for a newer soda or a refund because I took one sip before checking the date on the bottle. Its my understanding from working at a gas station for just a few years that the gas station clerks are supposed to be checking this very crucial detail regularly. They do not check the dates on ANY product EVER. Check all snacks and drinks please!!!

3. Go the extra mile for cheaper, better quality gas. They charge ten or more cents over other stores in Littlerock.

I've tried giving this store too many chances. Every time I go in there I have had to spend extra time doing their job for them. I'm not sure why these people are in business at all.; I'm so thankful this store saved Our Christmas I for to get Marconi pasta for my Mac and cheese, and all the stores are closed. wish I could give the owner a big Hug Thankyou....; Always get a receipt! The older ladies working there don’t know how to be a cashier! They over charge and most of the time they rather be filtering with the guys!

Name: Superior Grocers
Address: 2100 White Ln, Bakersfield, CA 93304, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
I visited Superior Grocers today, 07/07/24, at 3:56 pm, and had an extremely unpleasant experience as a customer. I've never felt so unwelcome, rude, and disrespected. At the self-checkout, I asked the attendant, Stephanie, for a few bags, and she curtly responded, "Yeah, at the end." This left me feeling unattended and rejected.

I had about 8-10 small items, and my husband was checking them out while I asked for the bags. Despite being only five feet from the register and watching us the whole time, Stephanie still refused to provide the bags. I informed my husband that she should be giving us bags now that we are finished, but never did.

We had to put our items back into the shopping cart without bags. When I asked for the attendant's name, she said it was Stephanie and unexpectedly roll her eyes. I replied, "Thank you for the bags as we are all finished now," and Stephanie sarcastically responded, "Yeah, you're welcome," while rolling her eyes again.

This entire interaction left me feeling very unwelcome and disrespected, with Stephanie providing neither a positive nor friendly attitude, let alone proper service.; Yesterday I bought my daughter a chicken soup from here. Let me tell you the chicken soup tasted so nasty and it had a wired smell. Now I have food poisoning and so did my daughter. NEVER AGAIN.; To the owner of this super market, I have been there a couple of times to see how disappointing to see the out side next to this super market dirty looking dried grass every where. Would you think the owne,r of this places could hired a crew to cleaned this up, it really is nasty to see this go to pot. I don't go there any more. This needs to be reported to the health Department.; Store is very clean and cashiers affordable if I couldn't get an affordable item  they would find me something that was; Clean store, good deals (especially Wednesdays), recommend their aguas frescas, don't recommend their cakes. The tres leches cake isn't tres leches, there's no moisture to it when it's expected.

I want to point out the pharmacy here is excellent compared to Airport Plaza that picks and chooses who they will fill a legitimate prescription for. Brentwood Village is definitely my choice!

The cashier lady with dark red hair sucks at her job and has been there for months. She does not know how to use the card machines and refuse service when she gets upset or can't figure it out. Bad service and rude. She has done this multiple times and not with just me.; Great store low prices HUUGGEE selection of chips your in and out in about five minutes and have everything you need so no need to go elsewhere with bigger lines and bigger wait for the same products; Owner is so friendly. Great place.; Since there aren’t any reviews on the accompanying laundromat I thought I’d put one.
The washers are all extremely dirty and some (if not all) are filled with some type of mold where the soap goes. The dryers give off a smell of burnt wires or something that’s just horrendous. A laundromat should smell good but this one doesn’t. Most of the machines are broken or really beat up, and there’s never an attendant in the actual laundromat itself. The bathroom never had any toilet paper either.; I always give him the benefit of the doubt .
Four different times I bought meat from them and all four times it was spoiled.

Name: Oriental asian Food & Market
Address: Montemar Plaza, Calle Calaf, Esq, Federico Costas St, San Juan, 00918, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:30 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:30 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:30 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 10:30 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 10:30 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews: This place is a must if you love Asian cuisine, as you'll find things here that you don't find in your regular neighborhood supermarket. Whenever I need rice paper, vermicelli noodles, hoisin sauce, dark soy sauce, gochujang or doenjang (just to name a few), I come here. Staff is friendly, the owner is around a lot, she remembers me, and is very friendly. The reason why it's not a five star review is because it tends to be a little messy, the pricing of the products is not always clear or just altogether missing, and things can be a little pricey (I can understand that because some of these specialty items can be expensive and and hard to find, even online). Despite that, I still recommend it 100%.; Retail and wholesale keeps them moving product daily, makes their sushi fresher from anywhere else. Homemade kimchi is a must, friendly staff will help you in every step of your shopping.; I love the attention that they give, The store it have a great variety of items, The food was tasty (best sushi I've taste) and the Items I shop were in the store were great prices, original, good quality. I will def go again and again and again.; This store is where we get most of our Asian supplies. It is small but they have everything you need for Japanese and Chinese cooking. The little sushi restaurant attached to the market is adorable, and the food is very affordable and delicious. The spicy tuna roll is one of my favorites! There are tables to sit and enjoy your meals. Take out is also available. The owner is just the sweetest person you could ever meet! She is very helpful and knowledgeable. Great food that is affordable and friendly service. The location and hours of operations is convenient and user friendly. They have great hours Mon- Sat 9:30a-8p and they are closed on Sundays. They are located close to the major highways and other shopping and parking is free and no hassle.; Good store, nice employees and tasty food service. Very small so it is a bit cramped and parking is limited especially during lunch hours.

Reviews:
Placed deli order 3 weeks in advance and it was not started when we arrived on a schedule. They threw it together in a piss poor effort with pinwheel wraps falling apart etc, the guy in charge ended up telling us they would not charge us for it and once he left the rude deaf women at customer service said they talked to someone else and only were taking one of the 7 trays off.

I should've just walked out the food looks like trash; There is a lady that supervises the front end, she marches around in a dictator fashion, barking orders at staff and customers alike. It fills me with an uncomfortable enjoyment, exquisitely embarrassing. Her level of anger at this poor staff is menacing. I'm just waiting for to scream "No soup the for you, get out". Don't go when she is working.; This Kroger pharmacy is amazing. They are always welcoming and know what I need. If you have questions, someone is always available, and I can not praise the staff here enough.

The store itself is a little older, but it is still always easy to find what I am looking for. It's always a great selection of fresh baked goods, fresh meat, and seafood, and organized well.

My biggest co.plaint of this location is the parking lot, and it's set up. It could be better and have a better flow.; Last three times I've shopped here I've been talked to by front end employees like I'm an idiot. Once is a fluke, twice is a problem, three times is 100% on Kroger's end. Try another location.; If I could leave negative stars, I would. Consistently the absolute worst Kroger in the area, by far. In there multiple days a week, every week, and the produce is always almost completely bare. The bakery is a joke, with almost always nothing stocked. Went today and there was not a single loaf of bakery bread available. You would think with the volume this store gets, they would be able to maintain inventory to at least have a single loaf of bread available. Meat selection is consistently within 2-3 days of expiration. This store is consistently out of stock of primary food items and only ever seems to be stocked with random selections that nobody is buying anyways. On top of that, the customer service is absolutely wild. The “veteran” employees are rude as hell and never seem to want to be useful in any type of way, and the kid employees are like deer lost in headlights when it comes to simple assistance. Compared to the new Bargersville location, I have no idea how this place is still in business other than the sheer convenience of location. Will only ever be stopping here for absolute grocery emergencies from now on.

Reviews:
My mom bought a box of esther Price Chocolates. In my opinion, they were not cheap, $17.  When she opened her box of chocolates, I was so excited, There were cobwebs, and the chocolate was molded.  I am still in
shock. Fortunately.
Kroger's did refund our money. Needless.
To say we are no longer in the mood for any esther price Chocolates; I absolutely love the Kroger on the Westside of Hamilton. The staff are always very friendly & courteous. I'm usually able to find everything I need & if not all I have to do is ask & they assist me right away. Plus accruing the fuel points when shopping there is a plus because then I save on gas at the end of the month when I fill up!! Its a win-win situation for me.; Usually this store is ok, not great but ok.  Today, there was no one at the desk even though there were 3 people lined up, and the sign for the service desk said it should be open.  The cashiers ignored us. Finally, we asked for a manager or to call someone.  The 2 employees chatting at the opposite side of the checkout yelled across the store to us we would just have to wait.  The older woman in the red vest was a little rude about it.
The 2 people in front of me just left.
I retreived a replacement for my damaged item. Then, I left the damaged item at the desk for them to figure out later.
If you ignore the customer long enough, they will eventually leave.; ABS💖LUTELY DELICI💖US! I am ALWAYS looking for good tasting gluten free stuff.
Pizza comes with 2 crust and I used one 14oz  jar of pizza sauce for 4 pizzas.
The Mac and cheese was DELICI😋US!; Way more higher than Walmart. Digital coupons yuck. Who has hours to sit down every day and go through digital coupons. I think the add flyer in the paper is enough. I miss out on so many savings because of those stupid digital coupons. This is why I quit shopping at Kroger's after 50 years. Even with the coupon they give me I can still get it cheaper for the same brand at Walmart. And now that Kroger's is trying to buy Albertsons I don't see any prices going down anytime soon. Goodbye Kroger

Reviews: I contacted the central offices of Supermercados Pueblo by telephone to report some discrepancies between prices advertised on the shelves and the price marked at the cash register, as well as the incorrect placement of items on the shelves; all this in relation to the town located in Trujillo Alto Plaza.  In that call I received cordial treatment and very attentive to what I was reporting; I was even informed that they would investigate and take the necessary measures.  If you observe something incorrect in a Pueblo, try to speak with the manager on duty and if he/she is not proactive, call the Pueblo Supermarkets headquarters.; Very bad service at Amigo de Lomas Verdes in Bayamon by Ms. ACOSTA, in charge of the supermarket in the afternoon, too poorly educated, haughty, argumentative, problematic, lack of respect... It's a shame that today's employees are so " specials" with the client... That's the 100-star attitude!; I tried to communicate my displeasure about the "Pueblo quality" over the phone, it was impossible... Reviews: Local business development and even a bingo game!; Find fresh vegetables and plants at good prices.; There are few agricultural and craft markets that bring together different community groups, and this is one of them. In addition to the talented local artisans, farmers and crafts; Youth groups, community boards, community gardens and schools also participate.; Arrive using Google Maps directions, parking is on the street wherever you find it. It disappointed my expectations, all the fruits were overripe or of inferior quality and extremely expensive, I would return but to the one in Carolina in the Roberto Clemente state. They spent 42.00$$$ on cheese, coffee and 10oz of honey; I arrived very early and they were setting up. This place has great potential to become something very good for the century-old community of the beloved neighborhood. Lots of young people. It can be a place to bring inventions and proposals, perhaps the Sagrado U. could sponsor it and increase the offers. Don't get away!

Reviews:
Kumar is the man! If you're in search of anything for your island function whether it be for a wedding, graduation, grand 75th or funeral this is a one stop shop. If he doesn't have what you need, he definitely knows someone who does. He has competitive prices. He's knowledgeable and kind. He has a stock of a lot of interesting items. Come down and check his store out. You'll find something that will peak your interest that's for sure. Come and support a good business in the Bay!; This is a small store with Caribbean, Hawaiian and island items. The owner is helpful and kind.

Although they have a variety of items is hard to see everything due to boxes covering most of the store. If you are looking for something in particular ask the staff.

They have a small selection of frozen items and produce, however most is in cans.; A great assortment of leis and products of many Islands throughout the world. I felt like I was in an island market place.; Very positive first experience here today. The very tiny store is a little overwhelming upon walking in because there is just so much in a tiny space, but great customer service. Fake flower, Kikui nut, and $ leis + Hawaiian shirts & swim trunks + frozen food from various islands among other canned food staples. Not my favorite brand of poi, Taro Brand, but they have it and are willing to help source other delicious items from the Hawaiian islands that aren't currently in stock. Nice find!; Very disappointed today asked the owner for ten pieces of pigs tail gave me eighteen pieces instead.I trusted him so waited till I got home to check it.There was also a lump of salt like two baseballs .!!! In the bag.Don’t trust anyone examine your stuff before you leave his shop.!!!

Name: Boutique Samoa Market
Address: 1217 S Western Ave, Anaheim, CA 92804, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 1217 (street_number); South Western Avenue (route); Southwest Anaheim (neighborhood); Anaheim (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92804 (postal_code); 4733 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Love the customer service and the family, but in all honesty the cooked food here has not tasted good in a long time. Everything pre packaged or any clothes are still good 👍🏼; SAMOA 🇼🇸
Eat the World LA review:
Samoa is the birthplace of the second largest amount of people of Pacific Islander origin in the United States after only Hawai'i, with Los Angeles being the largest community of them on the mainland (Honolulu has more). If that sentence did not have enough fun facts in it for you, it is also worth noting that more Samoans now live in the US than in Samoa. Despite this, they leave a fairly small footprint in our area and it takes some tracking down as some restaurants and steam tables have closed over the years.

One place to find food prepared daily is at the back of a very nondescript strip mall on Western Avenue in Anaheim, once again proving the point that driving too fast is not only dangerous but a good way to miss the good stuff.

The shop sells colorful printed shirts, bags of chips and candy from Australia and New Zealand that must be available in Samoa, some fresh produce, and flags and other memorabilia. The main focus for us of course was the steam table and prepared foods, of which they have three sizes of meals depending on how hungry you are. The already gigantic lunch ($11.99) is technically the smallest but feeds three (non-islander noobs) and consists of taro and banana under a sausage (sosisi) on one half with lamb over a base of sapasui, or Samoan-style chow mein on the other.; Super nice people work here! Food in the hot plate looks good but we just bought some kalo to plant at home.; Come hungry one combo can easy feed 2-3 people; The food was so salty, overcooked, and hard, and taro looked like they were taro from two weeks ago. The most nastiest Polynesian food I’ve ever tasted. Wasted my money and my time here. I wish the one on Garden Grove Blvd has cooked food on week days.

Reviews:
This is a good store for getting Mexican products and meats. It has prepared food. Good fresh fruits and vegetables. I've not waited in any long lines.
It's self bagging but they keep the lines moving.; They have really improved since they became Cardenas. The air conditioning works. It's cleaner. The women's restroom still has the same graffiti inflicted trash cans it had back when it was Rio Ranch. It needs classier new trash cans in the restroom to match the upgraded store.     The wait times now that it has become Cardenas are significantly improved from back when it was Rio Ranch. Much much better. The improvement is absolutely noticeable. It's a beautiful clean store. So happy with the improvements!! The air conditioning problem has been repaired. It not longer insufferable check out wait times like  it used to. Check out times are so much better than what they used to be. The tacos are supremely Good in their prepared food section.; Bakery here is the best!!! I always go to Cardenas bakery for cakes and never have they placed theme toy on cake.. 1st time that this lady placed the theme toy on my cake. Super cute!! Highly recommend; The ladies in the hot food section work too damn slow.. spent like 20 mins there to get 3 tacos and only one person in front of me . Come on managers have your workers be sufficient to provide better service; Went there for crab legs and shrimp and omg, they smelled really bad, pretty much spoiled. I don’t even see how they work there and selling spoiled seafood. I’ll never shop here, I’ll stick to stater brothers market.

Reviews:
Love this place for when I want high quality ingredients.
But because of their reputation everything here is overpriced, I see not every ingredient should be purchased here. Yesterday I bought common spices & herbs, fruits, veggies, greens.
When I went to go look at thoroughly an hour or so later, I realized most of the fruits & greens were going bad. Pick n choose from this place.; Frustrating. La Hacienda has some good quality items but their checkout system is ridiculous, the quality inconsistent, and the prices are super premium compared to other options.

The hot food pickup at lunch time is like someone who has never seen a buffet restaurant or cafeteria designed it, and wants to target people taking food home instead of eating it onsite. Items range from $5.99 to $18.99 per pound so they force you to use many tiny containers instead of one. It’s difficult to know how much you’re getting so you always end up with way more than you can eat and you pay extra for all the little containers (and poor landfill!). The whole thing is chaos, and the routing to get to pay makes it worse. Complete shitshow sometimes but at least everyone maintains good social distancing. Please hire a proper cafeteria designer and charge a single price so we can fill a single lunch box to go!!! Lots and lots of cafeterias do this. You’re not special.

Also, the meat items are usually stale and dry and the brussel sprouts aren’t properly cut (have you tried chewing through the stem???).; The best; Gourmet place in the heart of the financial district. Very popular during lunch time so expect long lines. Great food and gourmet products.; Very nice and high end place with very good food. 100% recommended

Reviews:
Pharmacy or Market , the staff are always helpfull with a smile. Very organized , fresh foods a little of everything. Pharmacy has a well organized staff , customer service oriented that will expediate your Rx as needed. Every shelve is clean & organize , NO dirty floors , well groomed employees , spacious parking , handicap ready 100% location !!!

Another place to pay Water- AAA & Power-AEE, Puerto Rico utilities w/o a hassle, great service as usual ! 👍; Great prices excellent service perfect customer service overall.; PHARMACY AREA BAD SERVICE, BAD PEOPLE, PEOPLE IN CHARGE TO RECEIVE AND DISPATCH PRESCRIPTION..DISRESPECT HANDICAPPED PEOPLE. BAD PHARMACY TO DEAL WITH. DON'T GO THERE.; Love it; I went today on 01/26/24 to manage some color copies. When I arrived at the copying place there was no employee and I was there for a long time (the employees passed by and no one asked me if I needed anything). Then the Manager (Francisco) came to the place and was friendly at first and told me he was going to check if the documents had arrived. Another employee told me that they arrived, but said there was an error and that I should resend them. This is how it was done. Later the Manager shows me one of the documents and asks me if it was that one to which I respond affirmatively and tell him that there are 13. Then, that's when he informs me "you didn't tell me that there are 13" and I tell him "it's just that you "he didn't ask me" and he questions me "you were supposed to tell me it was 13" and he comments to an employee "look it's 13, but he didn't tell me it's 13" to which I come back and reply "it's just that you didn't he asked me" and the employee (to gain the boss's favor?) refers to my person to inform "is that you are supposed to report it." Given this discomfort with other clients watching, I decide to report that communication is not flowing and that I do not care to make copies there. Immediately afterwards, I try to tell the Manager some information and in an elevated tone of voice he decides to greet what appears to be an acquaintance, completely ignoring me. I have been processing copies in different places for a long time. This is why I can give suggestions in this regard:

1. When sending a document, the client can be next to the computer and the employee from the screen asks if that is the document.

2. Second, the employee asks if it is black and white or color.

3. Third, the employee asks if it is regular paper or some different type.

4. Fourth, the employee asks how many copies of each document.

5. Fifth, print one of each to check if you like it and avoid wasting more paper.

###This is how they have done it in other places with excellent service ###

It is a place where I usually shop at both the supermarket and the pharmacy. But I'm so upset that I don't know if I'll go back.

P.S. It is very close to where I live, but I think that instead of leaving my money here I will have to give it to an American multi-company for better treatment than ours.

Reviews: I ordered cupcakes for some friends surprise birthdays...... all I said was make them real pretty!!!! and I had them use the butter cream!!! who ever in Kroger's bakery did these cupcakes should be on cupcake wars on TV!!! these were the prettiest cupcakes I've ever seen (and I've seen a lot of cupcakes )and sprinkled with the edible gold ....they were absolutely gorgeous... I was speechless and they brought tears to my eyes ...... I know that my friends are going to absolutely love them !!! thank you fabulous Kroger Granbury bakery and the sweet person that made these gorgeous cupcakes!!!!!!; I'll start by saying that I love Kroger. Unfortunately I had a problem with a pick up  order last evening. I switched to pick up because of recent medical issues that prevent me from coming into the store. The order last night was to include two 12  packs of diet Dr Pepper that I purchased, plus get an additional two 12 packs free.Arriving home, the two free 12 packs were missing. When I called to arrange to pick up the two missing 12 packs I was told that i would have to come in to the service desk and get them. No exceptions. So I have to find a new grocery store because I cannot afford to pay for groceries that they fail to include with this order and possibly future orders. What a shame to have such a hard nose policy.; Just a quick question.  Why do the checkers refuse to sack the customer's groceries?  Is it expected that the customer sacks their own items?  Yes, of course in the self-check outline, but give me a break... when the checker just stands there and stares at the items until the customer sacks everything. This happens almost every single time I shop at this location. I am pretty well finished with the Kroger in Granbury, I can easily go across the street, get cheaper prices and someone to bag my purchases at HEB!; What is it with the pharmacy? Does it hurt to smile , be pleasant in person or on  the phone? The words thank you go a long way , give it a try!! Horrible customer service. Just got off the phone refilling prescriptions, when I was done giving the information, she said ok, I’ll send it to your Dr. , long pause, and then she just hung up! RUDE. This is NOT the first time with this pharmacy. The entire staff could use a refresh course on customer service. I can see from the reviews this is a repeat occurrence. Do better Kroger.; I have always known Kroger to be an upscale grocery chain, where the wealthy and classy shop. I would expect the restrooms to be clean. However, not at this location. The ladies restroom looks as if it is never cleaned. Toilet paper is strewn all over the floor, food particles are in the sinks, and the odor within the entire restroom is pungent, to say the least. Also, there are NO lights in the stalls. Quite eerie.

Address: 1261 Grand Ave, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 1261 (street_number); Grand Avenue (route); Macalester - Groveland (neighborhood); Saint Paul (locality); Ramsey County (administrative_area_level_2); Minnesota (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 55105 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Kowalski's is a lovely high-end grocery store. The customer service is outstanding, as any employee is eager to help. Ryan, the manager, was very accommodating. The produce is consistently fresh and artfully displayed. The bakery selections rival a French patisserie. The cheeses are fantastic. There's a nice deli with a wide variety of offerings. Shopping at Kowalski's is always a great experience!; I just began shopping at Kowalski's a little over a year ago because I moved closer to Grand. I love the store and its offerings. Overall, it's been a great experience.

Once, I had a bad experience with a cashier, but I talked to a manager about it. I tried to assure him that I wasn't contacting him to make a big deal about it or get the cashier in trouble. I felt that it was a training and racial sensitivity issue. He agreed, and that was that. I felt seen and respected after not feeling seen or respected. and I felt much better afterward.; Very quaint, clean , well stocked pleasant atmosphere.. their Deli rivals those in New York, which made this New York interloper very happy. But the rule that Boars heads New York cheddar, cannot be sold here is to die for..... .. that every Wisconsin and Minnesota cheese lovers would agree with .; Kowalski's market is a wonderful place to shop as far as I'm concerned it's a walkable store unlike Cub and Hy-Vee! They have an absolutel wonderful selection of meats and seafoods fresh produce, delicatessen, they have a comfortable seating area inside so you can enjoy something that you bought at the deli they also have outside seating and you can view beautiful White Bear lake while you eat, I live in Arden Hills and I like to drive there when the weather's nice and shop, it's a destination shopping experience for me I'm a simple man with simple taste but Kowalski's has better taste than I wonderful people wonderful store!; Okay, I like this store, but Thursday night at 7 p.m. someone went into my bag and stole $20. right near the salad bar.  It was careless that I left my pocketbook open in the cart.  The $20. was visible.   I won't do that again.

Name: Kowalski's Markets
Address: 4391 Lake Ave S, White Bear Lake, MN 55110, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Vicinity: 4391 Lake Avenue South, White Bear Lake
Address Components: 4391 (street_number); Lake Avenue South (route); White Bear Lake (locality); Ramsey County (administrative_area_level_2); Minnesota (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 55110 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I go to this Kowalski's all the time! I absolutely love their cheese selection. Compared to other Kowalski's I also think this location has better made-to-order/readily hot food.; Wonderful grocery store, staff are so nice, warm, and welcoming, specially Blake! He is such a wonderful soul, so kind, very very helpful, and so smart. Every time I go there I always hope he’ll be there, just because he radiates joy. :)
Anywho, great grocery store, so clean and well organized. I recommend buying the kowalski’s brand Taco Seasoning and Original Chili Starter, they are sooo good! I stock up so I don’t have to be without it. You can add it to your soups, plain beans, etc. So delicious!; I ordered cupcakes for a U of MN job fair today and they were a huge hit! They were decorated to perfection with cows, pigs and chickens! The bakery manager was a huge help and so was the manager that helped carry them out. Thank you!; Great grocery store! It's always clean and tidy whenever we come in. The aisles are always clear and clean. Items in shelves are always well organized. Wished there were more authentic ethnic food sauces. It is very to navigate through too. Parking is very easy and I like how it's quite close to the store so you won't have to walk far at all. The hot foods are good for what they are. The prices of the food selections are a bit more but you can find cheaper alternatives. Overall, an excellent place to refill your water, grab snack, grab some meats, grab cakes and muffins and more. Employees are always nice as well AND there is a Starbucks in here too!; This  Kowalski's Market location is ALWAYS clean, organized and tidy. I have never gone in here and spotted a dirty area. It's crazy how clean it is. The employees are always nice and helpful. The food aisles are very easy to read and very well organized and always stocked. I've never had an issue finding something as the signs are very easy to read and if you do need something, employees are around to help. Prices are significantly higher than Cubs and other grocery stores. But you will be able find other brands that will fit your budget. Parking is super easy and lots of parking spaces.Cashiers are nice and never had an issue with them. Again, this place is extremely clean and tidy. Overall, a very nice spot to get your groceries.

Name: Walmart Photo Center
Address: 501 West Main Ave, Bayamón, 00961, Puerto Rico

I was there for more than 20 minutes. waiting 🙄 thanks to another client I was able to take the photos

Name: Kowalski's Markets
Address: 16500 W 78th St, Eden Prairie, MN 55346, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 16500 (street_number); West 78th Street (route); Eden Prairie (locality); Hennepin County (administrative_area_level_2); Minnesota (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 55346 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Love this spot! The meat department is my favorite as they have a fantastic selection for all budgets. The 40-day dry aged is my favorite and after purchasing a ton of the beef, chicken, pork, lamb, and various fish, I have never been disappointed! The produce is top notch and my wife swears by their large avocados. I love that Dave’s Killer Bread is not frozen and the cheese counter is impressive. Grateful to live close by to such a gem.; This was my first time in a Kowalski's Market, and I was here for one thing: artisan cheese. I've followed them on Instagram for over a year now and I knew they were supposed to have a good selection; I was delighted to confirm that yes, their cheese selection is fantastic, and yes, their cheesemongers are incredibly nice and helpful. Cheese is a serious hobby for me and I keep an extensive log, and I found more new cheeses here than I have found at any store in quite some time.

The one frustration was at the self check-out. One of my cheeses wasn't in the system and another didn't have a weight that the computer scale liked, so the young man overseeing the registers had to keep coming over to help. He was very nice, but I felt badly about the continued hassle.

I'd happily visit this and other Kowalski's locations for cheese! I should probably look around the rest of the store, too, because I'd probably find more things I liked.; This grocery store selection is a dream. The bakery section is huge and amazing. The healthy selection is top tier. They can make burgers, sushi and more on site. The customer service was alright.; It's one of the few Kowalski's that doesn't have a ramen and pho bar, which is very disappointing. The Kowalski's in excelsior which is about the same amount of distance has a ramen bar, but isn't on the Southwest prime route. Just outside of it, actually.

All the dining room tables were dirty! They seem like they had a good amount of employees, so someone definitely should be wiping off the dining room tables periodically. They had a good selection of sushi, but they didn't have much without tuna, which is very disappointing.; Nice high end grocery store. You will find some things here that you don't find in a regular grocery store. They have fresh seafood. Nice selection of produce. Bakery looks great. I only shop here for things I can't get at my regular grocery store. Prices are a little high.

Name: Kowalski's Markets
Address: 2440 Hennepin Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55405, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 2440 (street_number); Hennepin Avenue (route); East Isles (neighborhood); Minneapolis (locality); Hennepin County (administrative_area_level_2); Minnesota (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 55405 (postal_code)
Reviews: A decent but albeit overpriced grocery store. It's nice for essentials and extras alike. I like the Starbucks inside the store. It's basically like Lunds and Byerly's, in my honest opinion.; Extremely overpriced now. I knew to just get small containers of several deli items, a roll for butter and the cheapest water bottle for $8. For dessert I was interested in a bakery item but settled on a $1.75 donut. The other bakery items are ridiculously high. Have to wonder how many pie and cake slices get tossed out after sitting in the case. Looks like they removed all those expensive gift items. They could do better in choice of guards. After my meal, I looked at the various remaining gift items, passed him, and headed to the restroom. He followed me and was waiting for me when I exited. After getting two small ice cream cups from the freezer, he continued to watch me, even as I went to the register. And for years I shopped in this store. It’s obvious Kowalskis is not performing well.; I believe this is one of the older locations from this brand, but they do an amazing job with keeping it fresh and looking great inside. The location is huge despite what it looks like outside, the building plays with the eye with its placement but inside it's huge. I saw a local musician entertaining the store, that is def a nod to how in-tune the establishment is to the community it's in. The shelves are stocked and you can find unique local items sold here. I think that's what puts Kowalski's in their own lane, they seem to work with local creatives over their peers. Parking lot can be stressful, coming off a busy street into a parking lot that isn't huge can be a lot for someone to handle. Overall experience was great, I will return and see what else I can find and talk about.; Love this place..the workers are so friendly and helpful..the manager, the main guy, is super awesome. I've seen him jump on registers, open up registers so I didn't have ti wait and he even carried my bags out for me once despite other 'inferior ' workers he could have called on. He's just a very well suited man for the job and probably has alot to do with why this kowalskisin particular is so awesome.; Always quality ingredients and friendly, helpful people. Best higher end grocery store in the area.  They now have a build your own pastar (closes at 8:30) which is excellent!  The New space is incredible.

Name: Kowalski's Markets
Address: 440 Water St, Excelsior, MN 55331, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 440 (street_number); Water Street (route); Excelsior (locality); Hennepin County (administrative_area_level_2); Minnesota (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 55331 (postal_code)
Reviews:
What an amazing little market.  Very high quality food selection and a small format store that you can shop in quickly.  The deli, prepared foods and meat counter are top notch.  Also and very good selection of cheeses and nice looking produce that smelled very fresh.; Tidy and well stocked.  Friendly staff including will help with carry out.  Has a coffee shop and seating.   Expensive.  If you are tired of long checkout lines go here.  Good looking vegetable and fruit selections.  Well organized and extensive deli hot and cold and quite an expansive  bakery.; Great little market with a large choice of fresh products.; I have appreciated Kowalski’s for decades. Only recently have I come to realize that their Excelsior location is nearly perfect for 2 retired people. Ultimate in customer service and best stock of any place I shop. They have better freshness (dated packages are significant).  Two people want 18  “Vital Farms” eggs to be great until they are used.

It’s great to have lunch at one of best Asian restaurants from the same parking lot. Just ask and your grocery order will be brought to your vehicle. Parking is free, but limited. We have always found a space without trouble.; Nice store and good selection of items. The baked goods could use some work. I bought a gluten-free cherry pie, and the pastry was raw on the inside.

Name: Kowalski's Markets
Address: 5801 Neal Ave N, Oak Park Heights, MN 55082, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Vicinity: 5801 Neal Avenue North, Oak Park Heights
Address Components: 5801 (street_number); Neal Avenue North (route); Oak Park Heights (locality); Washington County (administrative_area_level_2); Minnesota (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 55082 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This location is convenient for me and I usually like the selection of items they stock. There are some fantastic specialty items, but you will pay dearly for them. Recent published price comparisons rank Kowalski's as among the most expensive grocery stores in the Twin Cities. Prices on things I typically purchase can be $1 to $4 higher than the exact same thing at
Target or Walmart.; Great store - especially like the deli and fresh packaged foods.
Miss the homemade sour dough bread - hope it’s back soon for my avocado toast. Like the regular chicken salad over the “ classic” too hard to made a sandwich with cubed chicken.; Brenda in deli was a great employee! She even offered me a free sample of the deli meat I ordered for a customer. I’m glad to see Kowalski’s hire generous employees such as Brenda.; Service is always great. Staff was friendly and helpful and smiled and said hello. I also love the little stick bun they offer in their bakery. :); My go-to store for groceries. Kowalskis has a beautiful environment, incredible customer service and so many amazing products. Their deli has the most amazing soups, sushi and salads. It costs more than other places like Cub Foods but totally worth it, in my opinion.

Name: Kowalski's Markets
Address: 8505 Valley Creek Rd, Woodbury, MN 55125, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 8505 (street_number); Valley Creek Road (route); Woodbury (locality); Washington County (administrative_area_level_2); Minnesota (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 55125 (postal_code)
Reviews: I’ve never seen a more beautiful Kowalski’s. Love the modern yet cozy aesthetic. The gorgeous displays don’t go unnoticed. They have a fantastic private label that seems to package literally everything. Every department is top notch from the bakery, meat, prep foods, cheese, etc. Always clean and looking lush. This place even has a restaurant and I think a hair salon… and their customer service can’t be beat.; They have, in my opinion,  the best Muenster cheese you can get in our area. The store is clean, the staff are friendly and it's just a great establishment. It's a little pricier than walmart or Cub, but it's well worth the money spent.; This is our favorite local market.  The staff is always super nice and helpful.  I recommend the protein bites as a treat.  They have a Starbucks in the store.  The deli, cheese shop, and olive bar are well maintained and full of delicious goodies.  There's also a Pezzo Pizza restaurant.; Top tier grocery store and shopping experience. High quality items, great merchandising, organization, products & presentation. Could be the best grocery franchise in MN! Love going here. Also a Starbucks inside, an excellent deli area, hibachi bowls, soup, sandwiches & way more!; Do-it-yourself pho is the best part!

Reviews: What a beautiful store, very clean well stocked. I have to say the Muffins are awesome. Tryed the Carmel walnut cranberry. Crunchy Carmel top and moist inside. Top 10; My friend and I went to the Edina grand opening and this store is Beautiful! We enjoyed all the samples. The employees were so friendly. Their Deli area (wing bar!) and Meat counter had so many great items! I will drive the extra miles to shop there again.; Wonderful to have Kowalski's Market Lyndale in my neighborhood. I really appreciate the time and attention they put into their own products and deli, the friendly and helpful staff, and for my money, the most beautiful and creative store and storefront to be found in the Twin Cities. Check it out!; Always a pleasure to shop here when we visit family close by. The store, personal, premium tasting products and atmosphere all make it worth while.; One of my favorites for the footprint it has, great selection for foodies. Organics, rare cheeses, yogurt selection, all forms of bread and pasta. Local offerings from their community.

Name: Kowalski's Markets
Address: 441 Hwy 96 W, Shoreview, MN 55126, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
Definitely my favorite Kowalski's! They have the best bakery items, best meat section, and best produce out of all the locations I've been to!; Kowalski’s is a very clean neighborhood grocery store with produce worth taking a look at, things like blood oranges, housing everything from groceries to Starbucks, to wine and spirits and specialty restaurants under the same roof. We will definitely be returning. See pictures; Biggest store that I've visited from this brand to date. Easy to navigate. Parking lot has plenty of space (Hard to believe there are traffic jams in it) Fashion/retail space takes up a chunk of space. You'll find more unique brands on top of your typical ones in these isles. My interactions with staff were minimal. Fairly nice and willing to help. You can get a lot in one location from this stop. I'll return to see what else I can experience here.; Always clean, great options, friendly helpful staff. Love the food options too and they have Starbucks inside. Plus visited the liquor side too and the gentleman working there was very friendly and helpful. Although I wish they had more options for smaller wine bottles.; I love a good grocery store!
This one is clean, lots of selections for food items and decorations. This is a new cheese I've never tried.  I'll have to get back to you on the flavor.
I love the option to go upstairs to eat your purchases in their upstairs dining area.
Update: the cheese is exactly that (lol) caramel cheese and I enjoyed a thin slice on a slice of apple, many times over!

Name: Kowalski's Markets
Address: 5615 Chicago Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55417, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 5615 (street_number); Chicago Avenue (route); Diamond Lake (neighborhood); Minneapolis (locality); Hennepin County (administrative_area_level_2); Minnesota (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 55417 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The hours on here are incorrect.  Kind of irritating when you check to make sure it will be open at 7:00am and then when you arrive, you find out they don't open for another hour and then you have to scramble and waste even more time to find somewhere else to go because Kowalski's can't be bothered to update the hours on their google maps profile.

The store itself is a nice atmosphere. The products are far too overpriced. The butchers are nice.; Expensive, as all Kowalski’s are but now not even convenient with the change in hours not opening until 8AM.  Making sure I do not use this store again with my spouse working 4 blocks from Whole Foods and other stores in the neighborhood.; Very happy with the cake we pre-ordered online from Kowalskis. It looked beautiful and tasted delicious. I’m glad we opted for the cream cheese frosting and raspberry filling, the whole family enjoyed it!; I love the convenience, and the staff is great, but they very often change product and don't have what I need. They have become too much of a boutique type store with too much space devoted to non-grocery overpriced merchandise. I am sad that I can't support this neighborhood store as much as I would like.; I ordered a sheet cake for my sons 2nd birthday. A Construction site with trucks and rainbow confetti loads, and it was perfect! And it tasted so good too. Thanks for making his birthday cake, was just perfect!

My favorite is Yogurt store Yogen fruts!; It's very good to spend with your family.; I call Trujillo Alto Plaza our backyard shopping Mall. Is an all in one mall where you can find three banks, two pharmacies, an auto parts store, a laundry, a shoe repair store, two restaurants, four mobiles stores, one supermarket, a variety of fast foods to choose from, clothing stores, a jewelry store, a furniture store, three beauty stores, a fitness club, and three low prices household accessories stores.; Very convenient shopping center. Right along main street. Lots of shopping stores, restaurants, pharmacy, banks, grocery store and gas station. Big parking area. Very clean.; Great, nice, clean mall. Well administered. My go to for anything

Name: Turkuaz Mediterranean Market & Carry Out
Address: 10928 Bulloch Dr, Manassas, VA 20109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM

Reviews:
Great food and great service! Lovely atmosphere. The house special spicy sauce is perfect, not too hot but with a kick. The front door doesn't close on its own, so you have to shut it by hand.; Turkish and Mediterranean grocery. Fresh halal Lamb, Chicken, Veal and nicely presented as well, friendly staff. Plenty of parking space. They serve a great verity of prepared Middle Eastern & Mediterranean food and sandwiches for an affordable price. Generally, prices are great, I will defiantly go back again.; Delicious  beef Doner wrap full of flavor and quality. Wonderful kind and friendly customer service. Also stocked with assorted desserts and grocery items. I will be back to try another meal. Thank you Turkuaz for the amazing lunch; Stopped in for our first time to Turkuaz. We had delicious Döner Kebabs with pita bread and different sauces. The portions were pretty huge, and the shop has many delicacies from Turkey, Ethiopia, and the Middle East. The customer service was wonderful! They even served us Turkish çay. We will definitely return, and we highly recommend!; Great store, small but has good collection of Turkish products.
Loved that their meet is Halal and Grass fed. And they sell nice marinated options. Excellent customer service, clean and neat store. Love it and will come back. Thank you

Name: Peruvian Chicken Grocery & Comida Latina
Address: 4802 Dale Blvd, Dale City, VA 22193, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM

Reviews: Craved for Peruvian chicken and Tried it for the first time. I will Never go back at  this store again. Ordered a whole Peruvian Chicken "to go" for my family. It only took me one bite to tell that the food is no good at all to eat. Chicken is hard and no where near fresh that it taste very old (cooked a week ago). All went straight to trash. Felt Very disappointed and robbed.; I go here a lot and since I go here so many times they know who I am and I order a atol de elote once or twice a weeks and sometimes pupusas and it's  really  good; I didn't have any cash on me and their is a $5 limit in order to use your credit card so when I told the lady that I don't have cash and that I can only pay with my debit card she just looked annoyed and just stared at me. I ended up telling her that I won't be buying anything since I don't have cash and she just said ok and voided my item. How ridiculous. So you prefer to turn someone away then to make a sale. As long as someone can pay for the goods then they should be allowed to purchase. I will never shop here again!; Hole in the wall convenience store/great food.  This is not your Americanized South American restaurant.  Everything seems quite authentic.  Great service and delicious food.  The pupusas are on point.; Noooooo... got some tamales with beans.. well... almost no beans.. and they were cold.. have no clue why it took them 15 mins to pull some cold tamales out of the fridge.. won't be back

Reviews: They have a lot here and they even sell alcohol. The prices are better than Florida’s. Bananas are fresh. There’s also a nice view of a small mountain.; Customer service associate was super friendly, helpful & very professional with excellent sense of humor. This was after the first associate that had me to do the return, swapped me to go outside & try to shut-off another's customers car alarm & she specified that she didn't know anything about it to the customer (the customer just asked her if anyone could call the police to assist her with it). And her job was to finish with me instead of returning the merchandise & receipt to me for the next associate to help me.; It's the only place in about a 15-mile radius that I was able to find a large photo frame (16x20), still limited choice but the only place. They were a life saver since already I had visited 6 other places, each time having to drive further and further from where I started. The reason for 4 stars was the disorganized and chaotic situation of the frames section. Other than that and the parking, which is a nightmare, the rest was good.; This particular store is clean and well stocked. Items are easy to find and you're greeted with a smile.; Great cheap goods, pretty clean, not much produce to chose from, but not bad. Customer service was quick and very nice!

I usually go to any store for a couple items but, end up buying a few more. Then I realized a needed a fee more items but didn’t pickup the shopping cart because I thought didn’t need it at the time. Then I started buying a few things and have the necessity of a shopping cart. I went to the first employee closest to the main entrance and asked I she could get a cart for me that I needed. She said shoot cart is right about the door outside, but I had a few items on hand and it didn’t look right to go outside, because then I will look like I was trying to steal the merchandise. Well well, I went closed to the self register and saw a n empty shopping cart. As I was dropping my stuff inside the cart, another employee said, that I is mine and I looked over and ask, could you please get o have someone to bring a shopping cart for me? She goes like, the same expression from the previous employee; you can go outside and get one. Now I ask myself and the company (Walmart), is that how customer service is all about?? Think. Well let me tell you. I wanted to buy a few more things as usually, but just the three items I’ve got was all I paid. Guess what….? Maybe next time I think like 100 times, before I step in that store for sure… employees need retraining, mostly about customer relations…..; Huge shopping area with a movie theater, Home Depot, Office Max, Old Navy & smaller stores sandwiched in between. Reviews:
I recently visited The Bloom Place, and I must say it was a fantastic experience. This store is a haven for anyone looking to improve their overall health with delicious and nutritious options.

One of the standout features is their incredible range of energy teas and smoothies. Each drink is made with high-quality ingredients that are not only tasty, but also full of health benefits. I tried their Ocean Breeze Energy Mega Tea and one of their baked cakes, and both were absolutely refreshing and energizing.

The staff at The Bloom Place is knowledgeable and friendly. They were more than happy to explain the benefits of different ingredients and help me choose the best options based on my health goals.

The atmosphere of the store also deserves mention. It's clean, bright and welcoming, making it a perfect place to relax and enjoy a healthy snack. Whether you're a health enthusiast or just looking for a tasty way to improve your diet, The Bloom Place is definitely worth a visit.

Reviews:
Not enough parking spaces, plus, people r craxy. Improved security. It has been changed. New entrance and exit. More parking spaces has been added; This is the supermarket in my neighborhood.
Service at Plaza Loíza is usually very good but there have been moments when the customers have complained about the  shortage of merchandise packaged for the use of the seniors who make up the majority of the shoppers who live in these neighborhoods. That issue was addressed by the local Consumer Affairs Department and one serving cans of fruits  and vegetables reappeared and are available for us. Some of these senior citizens live alone or take care of their spouse or grandchildren.
The store has fresh and frozen vegetables as well as fresh and frozen meats as well as Fri,em goods that just have to be heated up like lasagna, pasta dishes and pi,was as well as others.
Household goods like laundry supplies, soap, fabric softener and other cleaning supplies like sponges, dish cloths, mops, mop sticks, brooms and broomsticks and buckets are also on sale.
The selection of seafood is usually great and some owners of places that prepare food to sell at their small businesses buy large quantities of seafood and chicken, pork and beef. Plaza Loiza is known for its selection of  of available seafood.
Unless the heat wave has affected the rate at which food cans rust there may be a shortage of food on the island soon.
I know the store in Reparto has generators that they used after María but the recent heat wave and recent blackouts and brownouts may have affected the shelf life of some of the products sold.
I'm very thankful that they have had a good supply of ice to resell during the last month.
The store was able to replace the old refrigerated display cases and frozen foods display cases with new ones over the last couple of years.
The Reparto Plaza Loíza is one if the stores that had added a small area where cooked food can be purchased during the advertised hours. At the moment, this service might not be available due to the brownouts and blackouts
For pictures of what is available in the store this week's shopper should be available on their website since they also offer to deliver what one chooses to buy online.; It is a nice and cozy place that has most of the regular items you'll need for cooking, the staff is super friendly and helpful. There's plenty of parking in front of the store, but remember you'll enter through one entrance then you'll have to drive to the end of the parking lot to exit; Nice small mall. But the have some good brand stores.; Good prices is what youll find and many useful items

The main business there is the Econo supermarket. There is also a Subway restaurant, a Burger King, a barber shop, an optometrist, a health shop, and a couple of other small businesses, but the vast majority of the visitors go just for the supermarket, which is in fact very good, if not very fancy.; It is one of my favorite supermarkets because they sells farm fruits.; All around great supermarket.

Very accessible, plenty of parking and within other important business.

Catering to a wide range of customers... offering a great variety from fancy to economical products.; Always crowded because Econo is always full.

Reviews:
Best eggs in town and delivered to your front door! I can’t get enough of these eggs. They are large organic eggs with the most orange yolk you’ll ever see and so much flavor. Amazing customer service and quick delivery. My family and I will continue ordering.

In the picture you can see a store bought egg on the left and Punto Pio egg on the right!; Great Delivery service and Egg Quality.  The price may be a tad more expensive than competitors but their in-person delivery compensates for it.  I will keep ordering local products over any US-imported egg.   Also, love it when a blue-shell egg comes in the tray.; Very Happy with their Service and Delivery. Very professional and Good use of GPS, seeing where the Delivery person is to Deliver the Goods. Recommend their Services 100%; I order 60 eggs every 3 weeks and the intensely colored orange yolks are green light energy; The best eggs and service straight to your door amazing thank you🙌
