Name: Super King Markets | Northridge
Address: 19500 Plummer St, Northridge, CA 91324, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 19500 (street_number); Plummer Street (route); Northridge (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91324 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I will come again. I love this place.

6/10/2024
If u are vegan or vegetarian or international people, u need to come here to shop. I love this place. Today I got my love:dragon fruit, Chineseeggplant, Thai banana, and lychee. ;); One of the best gricery stores in the entire US. The produce is very fresh and the prices are very very reasonable. Highly recommended.; Definitely cheapest in the valley for fruits, vegetables and certain groceries. They have food from Middle East, East Asia and South America. Because it’s a popular store checkout lines are long and parking is tight. But if you want to save money and wouldn’t mind waiting a bit longer this is definitely the place; You have to see their fresh produce department. Incredible deals, but so many choices! The deli meats are fresh and beautiful, and be sure to get their prepackaged "nazook". Super King reminds me of Gelson's, but with great prices and many choices if you like foods from around the globe. A definite "must try".; Smells bad. Unfortunately. I believe one of the first signs of rot and decay is the smell. The meat department smelled like rotting meat and sewage build up. Rust or wet metals. Like when you take an old wet rag and try to use it to clean. Kinda gross.

Granted they do have a variety of foods from all across the globe I just hope that where it counts they purchased locally. Like produce. From when I first walked in was in awe of the different varieties of produce that you don't usually see in chain markets, but that's what makes it interesting. Not great just interesting.

Reading other reviews it's common to hear this place has questionable decision making. But use common senses when purchasing food. Trust your eyes, noes and gut.

I would've like to make this place my goto market, and will give it a few more tries, but currently I'll travel a little farther for quality.

Name: Vons
Address: 9119 Reseda Blvd, Northridge, CA 91324, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 9119 (street_number); Reseda Boulevard (route); Northridge (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91324 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Very lightly staffed during the weekends. They have also resorted to locking merchandise behind cabinets in many areas creating an inconvenience not just for store staff but also for consumers who have to wait long periods of time in order to get something.

One positive, lots of parking.; There's an African American lady maybe in her 30's also another lady in her 50s has the outer self check out machines always closed. I asked the younger one of the two why she always has them closed, and she says that they are broken but doesn't know what's wrong with them. It's obvious that she's lying. It's very inconvenient for the customers having to wait when there are perfectly fine u scan machines not being utilized.  She also always has a mean demeanor about her. Never smiles, never greets or thanks.  Nightmare of an employee  representing your company. Very bad experience.; Absolutely the worst grocer in the area, by far. If I could give them 0 stars, I would. Never any handcarts available, forcing you to use carts and rack up the bill. Fewer and fewer lanes open every week, forcing the customer to use self checkout, even though the savings from hiring people doesn't seem to make it down to the consumer. Produce is severely lacking in selection and more often than not well past it's expiration point (walked in for some oranges last week and most of them were rotten). Shelves regularly empty. Just absolutely awful. I only come here when I absolutely have to but I'm ust start planning better and going elsewhere going forward.; I only shop here because it's close and walkable. If I'm driving or stocking up on more then a bag or two worth of stuff I'll often go elsewhere.

The store itself is a bit on the smaller side for a Vons. Often missing the item I came specifically for. Sometimes as simple and common as a Dr Pepper or a gallon of milk. Prices aren't great and specials are often a dollar higher per pound then you can find in the advert you can grab from the front of the store. They've stopped carrying products I used to get. Store is often understaffed at busy times creating long lines.

The self checkout... I have never been to another store ever that has the volume on these stupid machines set so high. The self checkout machines are basically screaming at you. Additionally half the payment hubs at the self checkout are trash. Anybody with older magnetic strip only cards, Vons club cards, EBT cards, etc will probably encounter errors.

Now for the shopping center area in general... oh boy. The responsibility of a lot of this is going to fall to the landlord or the area or even the city but you may have to deal with these issues here non the less.

Parking lot is WAY to large. So while you'll always find parking it's also just a giant dirty asphalt soul sucking heat well with lots of wasted space. No trees, no shade. Ground in general looks like the last time it was pressure washed was a decade ago.

The two trash cans out front are always overflowing and gross. The one on the North side entrance was set on fire at some point and there's still melted plastic and multiple dried sodas on the ground from months ago. Probably not a big deal to most but I'll often ride my bike and or bring my dog when I walk. And since there's no longer a bike rack these disgusting trash cans are the only place to lock a bike or leash my dog to while I go inside.

Which leads to the last issue. There are some real screwed up metal homeless drug addicts hanging around this area. I mean surprise surprise it's California and this is getting worse all over. But here's the issues I've had with crazies at this shopping center: Man by the paint store pulled a knife and threatened to kill me in the middle of the afternoon because he said MY DOG LOOKED at him wrong or some literal paranoid insanity like that. The lawn south of the Vons a completely different man was threatening to fight me, then challenged the dog to a fight, and then challenged several shadow people to duels in which he assured these non existent people he would be victorious against. And numerous times I've seen people smoking meth near the gap in the wall along Dearborn and the paint store in broad daylight. I guess this is just something you are allowed to do now in this state.

Security will run off the crazies when they can but they can't be everywhere all the time. If you come here on foot or bike I highly suggest carrying pepper spray or something else that you can defend yourself with.; Antem debit card works here!! Try so many stores to buy groceries. Glad I didn't have to use the app. I saved money shopping in person. Was very nice and clean in the store. Found everything I wanted.

Name: P & K Fruit Market
Address: 170 Newark Ave, Jersey City, NJ 07302, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 170 (street_number); Newark Avenue (route); Downtown Jersey City (neighborhood); Jersey City (locality); Hudson County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 07302 (postal_code); 2823 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Absolutely love this market and their staff. Fresh produce, lots of necessities, and the best selection, quality and price on bouquets in downtown. Any time I want to brighten my house or bring something to a friends house I pop in here to grab flowers. Thanks for being an amazing neighborhood staple!; I've had it on my mind to write a review for this place for a while.  I've been coming here off and on for the 14 years I've lived in JC.  The Kimchi is the best I've ever had; Its a secret homemade flavor you can't get anywhere else and its made in house.
They also forgave me for breaking some eggs all over the floor one day and replaced all the broken ones.  It was just a kind thing to do and shows they are a good family run business that cares about their products and community.; Best spot for produce and groceries in all of downtown Jersey City. I have never been disappointed with their avocado selection (or any of the produce) for taco Tuesday (or any day)! Not to mention this is a family owned and operated business, so the level of service and care is always there. I have been coming here for 9 years and can only say great things about this market! ❤️; I stopped shopping at this grocery store since I read that they complained about the closure of Barrow Street. They pretend the closure of the street is affecting their business. What a non sense. Closing this street was an absolute necessity. Now Newark av pedestrian mall is striving. This is selfish behavior. By requesting the reopening of the street (the store is not even on that street) it means they don't care for their customers. They don't care of public interests and quality of life they only focus on old fashioned car only urban development.  If their business is failing it is not because of the street closure, it is because whole foods opened and mostly because of nearby store Oliva has more choices and way cheaper price.  I recommend everyone to shop at Oliva instead of depressing P&K store.; Hands down the best flower selection in Jersey City along with a really great and curated grocery offering. The family who owns this store is so friendly. I love this neighborhood gem.

Address: 77 Hudson St, Jersey City, NJ 07302, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM

Reviews:
Review is for Deli only. Stopped by to have a quick Coffee with a friend, and they have some decent options for Cold and Hot Beverages. Coffee and Lemonade that we ordered was pretty good. One major drawback is that the Checkout line is same for regular shoppers checking out items from the Market, as well as for those who are just ordering from the Deli. We had to wait in line for along with the other shoppers just to place our orders. I hope they change this.; If you do shop here, make sure you watch the prices when they scan your items. They often post lower prices on the shelves that do not match the scanned prices. I raised the issue to the cashiers and they refused to honor the advertised price. Something about "we have no control over what the stockers do with the price tags". Sounds illegal but ok.; We live in 70 Green St and used to go to this market every day at the beginning. But the truth is they got very poor quality control of fresh goods. We bought watermelon that had super bad smell and a coconut that was too old and didn’t have any coconut water inside. We tried to communicate with the manager and I was told their policy didn’t allow customer to either have an exchange or refund. If you get something of bad quality from their store, it’s just ironically bad luck and they cannot do anything about it. Just go to WholeFoods if you live nearby.; Best place ever for small meals and grocery! Produce quality is always so gooood; "The deli here is really good. There are a lot of options to choose from and the people who make it are cool and friendly;always having a smile on their faces. As for the hot food, it is also tasty and again a lot of options to choose from. It's like getting a home cook meal without having to do the work. Also the sushi here is great. The sushi chef is very creative with the type of sushi he makes. Some are even more healthier making sushi with brown rice instead of white rice.

The store itself is a great store to buy from. There are a lot of products for people who are gluten free, dairy free, etc. most are organic products. I love how they have a lot of international products that are hard to fine in other stores."

Address Components: 1200 (street_number); Greenbriar Drive (route); Addison (locality); Bloomingdale Township (administrative_area_level_3); DuPage County (administrative_area_level_2); Illinois (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 60101 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Disappointing Experience with Misleading Service

I recently had a frustrating experience with a purchase that left me feeling misled and dissatisfied. I bought a fan for $410 and opted for the $279 next-day early delivery service, expecting it to arrive as promised. Unfortunately, the fan didn't arrive until three days later, causing me to miss a scheduled appointment with a technician that I had arranged for the following day.

When I reached out to customer service to request a shipping refund due to this delay, I was met with an unhelpful response. They claimed that since I placed the order on Friday, it was expected to arrive by Monday. However, nothing in the checkout process indicated that there would be a delay, which felt incredibly misleading.

Despite my attempts to explain the situation and convince them of the unfairness, my request for a refund was outright rejected. This entire experience has left me with a sense of dishonesty regarding their delivery promises. I expected better communication and service, especially given the premium price I paid for expedited shipping.

In summary, this experience has been disappointing, and I cannot recommend this service based on my encounter. If you value timely delivery and transparency, you may want to think twice before making a purchase here.; Rude customer service. Had a defective part sent to me and they had to do a warranty claim. No follow up when you try to email to get information. When you call they are rude and no help. Tell me to just order another part while I wait to see what they will do. Meanwhile losing money with equipment down. Horrible company and rip offs. Won’t ever use them for any of our businesses again.; Did someone really complain they used a part and couldn't return it?  Ridiculous.

These guys have been more than helpful every time I have contacted them.  I give them the model tag of some hobart equipment and an obscure picture of a part I need and they get it done.  I am not sure what more you can ask for.; Not a good company to order parts from. Ordered a part it came in I no longer needed that part so I returned it, they sent me photos of it being used which yes I did try it and didn’t end up keeping it. They sent me an email saying I have to send them a return label in order for them to send it back to me I told them I would pay for the return label. They said no we cannot do that. Just before two weeks they gave me 3 days or else my part would be destroyed. Honestly all the part needed was some cleaning inside and it would be like it was new again. Never will I order from them again!!; Received the incorrect part. Called to get a resolution. Was told that I need to contact the company they outsourced the product to. You are the place I made the order with, you fix the issue. Nothing more than a middle man soaking a % off the system. Original equipment if it looks like the picture… 🤣🤣🤣

Reviews: It’s the first time I ever visited. I went with my mother and 3 year old daughter. When we came in there were 3 workers by the register but as we looked around, the workers followed us around the shop to make sure we weren’t stealing anything. It was to the point we felt so uncomfortable that we decided to just leave with the few items we had. It’s a shame, we wanted to buy more but was weirded out by one of the employees standing behind us the whole time. Guys if stealing is a big problem at this store then buy security cameras. We definitely didn’t feel welcomed at this store and won’t shop here again.; This place has the best selection of Brazilian goods I have seen in the area. They even have catupiry!; Every time I have sent money at this place the girl has “forgotten” to send the paperwork. Yesterday I went again to send money. My family members are in Central America and it’s a 3 hour drive for them. Imagine the disappointment and inconvenience to show up and them send you back home because no forms have been sent by them. Attempting to call them is a joke. They answer the phone and purposely don’t hang up so that if you call back they can’t get through. I called the direct number to customer service for the bank and they themselves told me this place is notoriously for this!! So since I’m at work and couldn’t go back to the store my husband went and guess what ZERO customers and just them sitting there chatting away. They knew they didn’t hang up the phone because when we called them out on it they just laughed about!!! Definitely won’t be going back!; As a husband of a Colombian, this place has a whole aisle of colombian things and also colombian sodas and beers. Frozen items and fresh juice pulps. There is another Colombian restaurant/store but this place is better for buying things. Way more things to chose from.The other place is better as a restaurant. The staff has always been so friendly to me. Great people.; I was looking for products to make Tapioca, a brazilian dish and someone from the company saw my post on a Brazilian group on fb and sent me pictures of the produts they had. I left with what I went to buy, plus other Brazilian products such as picanha, queijo coalho, lots of chocolate, polpas de frutas e guarana. I like to support this business instead of great retailers because they do offer more variety and can serve us better. I recommend this place.

Reviews: I saw the worker bringing in the pollo asada and asked the man at the counter if I could get one of those because I planned on eating it right away as I was at Discount Tire they are right next to Garcia's he lied and said that the ones in counter where just as fresh I felt like an idiot when I sat at tire shop and bit into the cold and hard chicken and why does he cut them in four instead of half. I had their food and I liked it because it was hot and tender and juicy. I don't appreciate being lied to would it of been that hard to of given me what I wanted a hot delicious chicken I doubt I will ever go back to bed their employee is a liar and food is inconsistent.; Came in to maybe try something different. Maybe buy a chunk of meat.  Found some pork rinds and fresh salsa.. a little bit pricey but i enjoyed it together.; The hot wings and tacos were great and at a good price. This place is going to be a regular spot for me from now on. They have a good meat selection cooked or raw for home grilling.; LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! So convenient 🤗🤗🤗 get the wings they are scrumptious 😋; I love this place. Go there almost every week and get the fish and shrimp with rice and beans. Or sometimes just the shrimp or the fish alone. Definitely one of the best places in the valley.

Reviews:
I’ve only been to this store twice, and I had a good experience today with the cashier. He was super polite and greeted me with respect. The store is clean and organized, and many staff members were helpful when I asked where certain foods were.

However, I lost my ID here and have been trying to call the store. It’s 6 p.m., and no one is answering. I let it ring for several minutes, but still no response. They seem to lack customer service over the phone. I’m heading to the store now, and I hope they are helpful. If not, I will let you know; I bought ceviche here and it was spoiled already it smelled repulsive. Whoever served it should've catched that. Not to mention you can get food poisoning specially from fish. Do not buy food that's already made for you from this dirty as store .; We bought a chocoflan and the cake was literally sour it was old and expired. Do not risk it and go somewhere else. Won’t even answer my calls to try and let them know; My wife and I have been coming and shop Superior Grocers for many years for the produces,meats and their Bakery and also we like their prices and great deal.; Today I went to the bakery I understand that it was 9:30 pm close to closing time but there are already some occasions that the employee Ana L has a bad attitude towards customers

This store has the biggest selection of talavera and terracotta pottery I've ever seen in person. The prices are reasonable, and you can feel good about shopping here because it's a local small business. The family that runs it is really nice and helpful. I'll definitely be back!; We saw pictures of the pottery online and made the 50 minute ride out to add to my collection.  SO many beautiful pieces.  Can't wait to go back for more!; Beautiful selection of ceramics..dishes, pots and tiles. Also metal work items.
For such a small place they have much to choose from. Good prices.  Will DEFINITELY return to them.; Fantastic pottery store, beautiful pieces, very colorful 💚 Made in Mexico and lead free.  Found a bird bath I loved but decided on this bowl for a friend.  Highly recommended.; Such nice people that own the shop. Had fun shopping with my New England sister. Great place to shop for gifts. Reviews: Get up early, so wet to get some conchas. Wanted a juice. Employee told me to come back at 7:30. When they open at 6.; You can find whatever you need from Mexico or from here, they have a really good prices and for sure delicious food.; Good food good people good prices; The restaurant/deli in here is wonderful and very reasonably priced. The pastor and carne asada are excellent. The tres leches cake isn’t too bad either.  I have an accent, even in English, so I always write my order in Spanish, and have never had any trouble. The groceries are your basic staples, and they have a fresh meat counter.; This restaurant is being hugely overlooked, it is five stars everywhere.  Service was muy bueno, food was fantastic, clean inside & out.  Had an issue (not big) w the ladies room, I let someone know and it was taken care of right away. I think the waiter's name was Alfredo and he was very good.

Reviews: Great prices on eggs,  produce and meat! Everything was very fresh and the store was exceptionally clean during my visit. The staff here were very friendly, the customers on the other hand were not so much. But I wasn't there to mingle with the crowd.; Great Quality food with lots of options. What I love about this places you can get so many great things including things that aren’t even food. I was walking past and I saw that they were selling for backpacks on a place next to the cereal. Also they have tofu which is great for vegan options. One thing I love about this places that are extremely fast with checking out your food that’s good if you’re in a rush! Also they have tons of different kind of sauces which is great because there is a certain kind of cheese I always look for and I am super happy when places have it and here they had the melted nacho cheese that I’m always looking for. What I love about this place is that it is super local and there is multiple around the valley! I would definitely recommend this! Also I love the fact that there is laundry detergent you can also buy her as well as hand soap. You can also buy fresh fish in different kinds of meats. There is even a place where you can buy cake and go there just to have something to eat in the morning because they sell coffee as well as napkins to eat it with also flowers for special occasions.; They have good prices but the Carnicería and Salchichonería staff take for ever they’re just chatting and no helping fast enough. You’ll spend an hour to hour and a half plus another hour waiting at the cashier 🤦🏻; I got carded for looking young I guess. I took my reciet and stormed outta there quick as possible, yucky sucky place haha when they look young as well.; The boy who attends the fishmonger attends the line of hot items and when I went he served a person who wanted fish and when he finished he served me and I wanted roasted chicken and he did not change his gloves with that same glove he put my roasted chicken and I told him I didn't want the chicken like that and he got angry.

Reviews:
They sell food already made and I DO NOT recommend it.
Bought a chile relleno and it was TRASH.
The person who made it use a RED bell pepper instead of green, instead of using queso fresco for the stuffing they used Monterey Jack cheese, and what was suppose to be the tomato sauce was seasoned colored water. Clearly the person who made it isn’t Mexican.; I usually go here because it is clean and cheap too.; Gardena is a clean store, Customer friendly! Fresher produce than most of the other Superior stores that I have visited. Fresh Guacamole is only $6.99, freshly made. By the way -
($6.99 x 4=27.96) not $60!👀; Russell in the Hot food section is the Man. I would highly recommend going in to see him for all your food needs. Very respectful, informative and friendly. I would come back here just to see him and talk. I wish more people were friendly like him.; The first impression when you get in, is everything is meticulously in place and stocked, the floors are shining, you pass through the bakery department and you can’t avoid to stop, and get some bomba filled with strawberries yummy,you follow to the produce department and the employees are excellent customer service, then you go to the meat department, super clean no funny smells, great prices and don’t forget the hot food department, get chiles rellenos or fried plantains, highly recommended handy cap access , please leave comments, and likes to others can see what’s is likely

I don't know what that was all about, so I just left.; They always have everything I need the only reason they miss one star is because I bought some cornbread there one day and it was moldy the next day I must say it was very very good though also the barbecue guy he is learning how to barbecue you can tell the first time he started he would slice the the second time I told him about it he stopped I sing it but he was poking it after I told him not to do that he cooks it all the way that's it get a little bit black but he will not let the hot link casing burst open like it should his cooking style is most excellent just a little rough around the edges let the hot link cases burst open bro bro do not cut them open and do not poke them besides that I am eating some right now and I am very very happy; You want good meat for the grill this is the place... if you don’t like in general the way the meat is cut, just ask the workers how you want it. Reviews:
Huge marketplace for Indian subcontinent and South Asian food items. Spicy vegetarian snacks and whole grains fill up multiple aisles with amazing collection of Indian veggies too.; "The International Market offers an excellent selection of products, catering to a wide range of tastes and preferences. The variety is impressive, with options that span different regions and cultures, making it a one-stop destination for all your shopping needs. Whether you're looking for specialty items or everyday essentials, this market has something for everyone."; Expired Products

They have an abundance of generally outdated goods, so we had to go back and return the items we had bought, and when we did, the woman who was helping us was unapologetic. She was acting as though we were to blame for the problem. How they respond in these circumstances is amusing. Although there are plenty of things there and you can pretty much buy anything an Indian may want, make sure to verify the expiration date before making a purchase.; Very clean staff not very friendly good priced and great spices and drinks options; Great place to get a lot of items from other countries. There are a lot of spices and condiments. Do check the sell by date though. They're really increasing the range of products they sell. The fresh produce looked really good.

Reviews: Rouses is that ONE STOP grocery store, it has everything you need food wise and much more, The variety is top notch and one of a kind. When I'm not in the mood to cook, I stop by rouses to pick up one of many meals to go! I give rouses 4 stars instead of 5 because SEEDED WATERMELONS 🍉 has become a foreign FRUIT and Rouses always have pretty much everything you need I just knew they would have SEEDED watermelon 🍉 😔 But that's my only gripe. Today I tried a Poke bowl 🥣 and it was delicious 😋 something I wasn't expecting (a salad on rice!) ABSOLUTELY delicious 😋 😍; It really doesn’t get any better than this when you’re looking for a grocery store. I love the deli, as well as the fresh produce and seafood. Awesome sushi selection too. Extremely polite, helpful, and professional staff. 100/10.; Wow! What a great store. Wide variety of produce, beef, pork, sausage, chicken, deli, cheeses and more. Very kind, friendly, and eager to help staff. Great products, great prices and they seem to have everything a foodie might want. I'm sure I'll be back.; I love the store everything is very good quality. The only problem I have is with the recent change of the sushi bar. The new bar looks like quantity over quality. It has bad avocado in the rolls. The one I did try tastes like a mass produced sub par roll. The rice is mushy and tasteless which is should have a mild flavor and have some bite to it not straight unflavored mush. I def won't be getting anymore sushi from here they ruined it with this new company they put in. Other than that the store is awesome.; This is a great place to shop. I love stopping here for something I need. There is a great selection of foods, my favorite is the deli which serves boars head brand meats.

Great store lots of options. Fresh seafood. Great meat market. Fruits and vegetables are amazing! Customer service is good. Super friendly and willing to help! They are offering $10 seafood platters daily shrimp, potatoes, corn, snow crab legs. Or for $14.99 all that but with dungeons crab legs. Definitely worth the price.; We used an electric cart today because my husband has a progressive lung disease. Why can't the carts be put in a shady spot vinyl seats hurt to sit on. My husband is considering bring a towel next time but why should he. The manager should try sitting on those chairs to get a feel for what there customers go through.; Shop here often and always satisfied until this morning...we have out of town company leaving today, 4 days ago I called Rouses on Pass Road and ordered 6 Live Lobsters to pick up this morning by 10 am...I was told no problem and they even offered to Boil and Steam them for me I wanted to cook them at home, part of the fun...I offered to pay in advance or give a deposit and they said nor required pay when you pick them up Monday morning... we just called and no Lobsters they said they sold a lot this weekend and didn't pay attention to the orders on the book...really disappointed at the response or lack of response from the Seafood manager...Clayborne is our new favorite market they can take an order; Went in for a surprise protein for myself for dinner.  Found shrimp, Alaskan King Crab, corn on the cob and sauce in which to dip everything! It was warm and perfect for $11.00!!!; I was so stressed out over my daughters 13th birthday party Saturday before I ever got to rouses to pick up the cake and when I did of course something was wrong as is with every cake I get anywhere not just here but the way they fixed it so quick and the cake still came out top tier is what I’m so appreciative of! They did their thing and quickly with me stressed out! A 15 minute fix and the cake came out better than it was before hand! I don’t know the girls name who did it but she did her thing and I appreciate her so much!

We had so many compliments on this cake and how good it looked. Some was even speaking on how they never seen a softball card birthday cake lol wasn’t what we was trying to do but hey if that’s how you look at then awesome lol. Thank you guys for being so caring and professional Saturday evening!

Reviews: Service matters.  I recently went here looking for a small item I expected to be available in a grocery store.  I asked an employee who was stocking meat. I was in and out in minutes.There's nothing better than good customer service.  Employees at this grocery are always friendly and helpful in my experience.; jennifer in the bakery makes theeee cutest cakes; My entire family loves Kaye's. They always have exceptional sales and very courteous sales people. My mother would rather shop there than any other grocery store in Senatobia. Keep up the great job Kaye's!; Nice country store, I live up around Chicago but love Mississippi, I plan to relocate to this region, when I do I'll come here often😎; Always happy with the service I get here! Reviews:
We bought a jug of 2% milk(the last one of this kind on the shelf) and the cashier didn’t give it to us at checkout. When we got home, we realize we don’t have the milk so we went back to the store not even 10 minutes later. However, when I got there the cashier said she put it back in the fridge. She told me to go get it from the fridge which means she put it back on the shelf(for resale??). Didn’t even bother to go and get it.. Obviously, we couldn’t find the 2% milk because it was the last one we bought. Someone bought my milk. I can’t believe that Walmart doesn’t have a policy to wait for the customers until they come back to pick it up. At least for 24 hours to retrieve their bought items, forgotten or not handed to you.
They just simply resell them. At least this is what happened to my milk. They returned my money but when I asked the manager Brandy she didn’t clarify why the milk was sold. She said they write it down in the book but I wanted to know why they put it back on the shelf for resell…she apologized and that’s all.. can someone explain please?; Love this place. Great to be able to run in get exactly what I need and leave. Only down side is the employees with massive carts filling orders for those that want to drive up get their order and leave. They block the isles so it's hard for regular shoppers to get through the isles. This is the reason for only 4 stars. Still, it's a great place to shop.; 5 stars for the store itself and the employees that work registers and on the floor. They're always well stocked and the employees are so helpful and sweet. 3 stars for the pickup people/dispensers. While the other employees are amazing the pickup/dispenser employees are two faced and will lie and talk trash about you no matter how friendly, helpful and respectful you are. There is maybe one or two that are great people.; Walmart teams are quite rude to Hispanics, when Americans steal money, even other things are notified and they turn a blind eye, they do not help the worker in matters such as changing telephone numbers, laws and aid are for everyone, not for some. alone be emphatic and ethical How they steal money from phone to phone, be very careful and respect; This is a great place for a quick stop. Super fast to get through the checkout line, too, which was great. Great place to buy lotto tickets too.

Reviews: I just stopped by there and got two Dungeness crabs, even though they’re  in a clear enclosure when the guy took the crabs he didn’t hold them up or anything to show before he  just put them in a bag. I got home and one’s dead I called to inform them the lady stated she’ll have the manager call. However she returned my call and stated the guy said they were alive … And that I can still steam 🤔 I don’t know how long that thing has been dead y’all should be able to give more solutions than going off what y’all employee said I would feel better if you had said you ran the cameras and it was alive !!; The largest Asian food market in the area, this grocery store has a wide variety of fresh/frozen and packaged items for sale.  Although nowhere as large or extensive as an H Mart, they do have a decent selection.  I've been here several times but as it is out of the way I tend to only come occasionally when I know I need several items, specifically varietal fresh mushrooms.  I wish I had the time and money to really explore.  They do seem to cater more towards the Vietnamese and Thai population (which duh) so you may not find that Japanese, Chinese or Indian item(s) you're looking for.  If you're looking for something specific, it can be a little difficult getting help.  They do get busy on the weekends like every other store.; Lee is a good Asian supermarket in south Mississippi. On Thursday through the weekend they have fresh produce all assorted vegetables. Friendly people there to help guide you to get stuff you need. The even give you a $5 off over a hundred for your groceries. I love it 😻, thank you,Lee supermarket. Till next time!!!😍🥰😘everything ingredients came from Lee ‘s grocery.   Happy Chinese- Vietnamese new year 😍🥰🎉; I wish there was an international market closer to Gulfport, but Lees is pretty unbeatable even if that came to reality. Their staff are friendly, their selection is immaculate. The amount of fresh and hard to find ingredients is delightfully shocking. I shop there as often as i can. It's always clean and the setup makes sense.; Lee's has everything for Asian food preparation - full meat preparation available - extensive frozen food selection  - lots of spices, sauces, teas, pastas, bulk rice and drinks. Only complaint is limited number of green vegetables and root vegetables available.

Reviews:
Oh my goodness I was so impressed with this little gem. My nephew recommended after eating here and he was spot on. Take it from a true steak snob and carnivore that was the best steak I’ve ever eaten. Beautiful cut, seasoned to perfection and delicious to the last bite. Fried portobello mushrooms to start us off were also a home run! If you’re in the area it’s definitely worth a visit. Quaint and homey place with amazing staff and food! Definitely coming back to test some other menu items!; Very friendly and great service we had a Hamburger 🍔 and a Cheese burger 🍔 w/ season fries very good.also finding out that they have Pineapple & Brown sugar sausage..and Sausage Frank's.. They are highly recommended..
Soon I shall find out..
10/16/2023 stopped in for another cheese burger 🍔
And picking up some mid and jalapeno and cheese homemade sausage 🌭.
Steak fingers were on the buffet today..

.; Very good pork chop plate lunch.  Haven't tried the store made sausage I bought yet.; The ribs here may be the best I have ever tasted. Holy moly.; This place has been around for years. This grocery needs a 10 star rating.  I love the customer service.  The young lady (cashier) was wonderful.  We were greeted with a smile.  Every question that we'd asked had been answered quickly and with accuracy.  The sausage is soooooooooo good.    We LOVE it.  Can't get enough. If you really knew me....you would know that I do not eat just any thing.   EVERYONE should try it.  It is seasoned to perfection.  Not too salty.  Not too hot.  Tastes Just right.

Reviews: I visited the store on my way to work on this wonderful Wednesday and I was warmly welcomed by the most positive, kindhearted people. Everyone was in a marvelous magnificent mood. The store had an awesome amazing atmosphere. The managers were magnificent. The employees were spectacular. The customer service was wonderfully wonderful. Everyone deserves a trophy because they are a terrific team. Happy, blessed, joyful New Year’s to this store.; This store is so awesome they have great foods sold their and the people that work there are extremely nice and knowledgeable about what they have; Prices are always thrifty, clerks friendly, well organized and very clean. Definitely recommend!; I love that this store is in front of my complex it is so easy to call them when I'm hungry to order some food and yes the food is good.  I go up there and get my cigarettes and drinks and if I missing anything that I forgot to buy the grocery store it's they have it. I just have to walk to the front of the complex to get what I'm missing they are a little pricey but it is worth every penny.; Overall I will admit it's a bit on the pricey side, but a small nuisance considering the overall prices of ANYTHING and EVERYTHING nowadays no matter where you shop. I at least get the comfort and feeling of the way it used to be shopping at the local grocer in a small town. The staff are always friendly, and just as helpful when needed. Another comfort, which can never be overrated, is the fact that it never seems overly crowded so the visits are pleasant, and the staff never feel overwhelmed. The only thing that does worry me about that is I really don't want to see them go under from lack of sales the way other such small/independent businesses have. It's a shame supporting local doesn't seem to be of much concern for most anymore. Everything has either gone the way of big chain store shopping or online delivered right to you laziness. I still enjoy good customer service and smiling faces during my transactions... I guess I'm more "old school than I thought" 🤷🏼

Name: ALDI

Reviews:
I state below, some of the aspects of ALDI Supermarket store in Canton, MI:

1. Store Format: No-frills, cost-effective.
2. Product Selection: Limited, focuses on essentials.
3. Pricing: Competitive, emphasis on quality and low prices.
4. Shopping Experience: Pretty Streamlined and efficient.
5. Customer Service: Lean staffing model, self-bagging

My wife and I feel that some of the items sold at this location are comparatively cheaper and better than in other places. Overall, this store provides good customer experience.; This store is becoming extremely dirty over time. The produce section is filled with fruit flies/gnats and 75% of it all is moldy. The eggs and milk section are always full of cracked eggs or spilled milk because the caps aren’t ever sealed properly. I’ve been coming here for years, I used to love it so much that I drive past two other Aldi stores (that are gross too) just to shop here, but now I will be needing to go to another one or finding another store all together to purchase my groceries.; I love this place.  Under same business umbrella as Trader Joe's but different business model.  You bring your own bags, do your own bagging, return your own cart to corrale, and now mostly do self checkout.  Smaller store with more focused product selection.  All to keep prices low.; This Aldi location is within a very busy strip mall area.  I find it best to visit outside of rush hour, or any work day and confine my visits to Saturday morning and Sunday.  The parking lot is usually very busy but there are adequate parking spaces.  The traffic on the entry road is a difficulty.  It is relatively easy to enter if you are travelling east on Ford Road but going west can be a hassle.

I like the selections they have, especially their health oriented materials.  The prices are right for the food I would term ‘health’ food.  Like whole grains.  The inside of the store is very plain.  It is easy to navigate to the several sections.  Like a traditional supermarket it is not a gargantuan warehouse.  They are very busy so the staff is actively moving materials from the storage area to the sales area at a regular pace.

The last time I was there I was concerned because electric forklifts were being used to move produce and items out to the floor rather than transferring them to carts.  The location also lacked sufficient boxes to place the food and other goods we purchased in (which is the custom at the place).  We ended up buying reusable bags, so, that worked out.; Girl workin on floor was racist..i asked her where honey was n stuff, u can tell she didn't wana help at all, she just shook her head nat a word then i was behind her, she stepped on my foot, said excuse me she turns luks at my face n regrets saying excuse me u can tell n thats it she didn't ask me if was ok iam sry nothing, iwas hurt though...n i see her laughin saying i am sry to other ppl of her own race for no reason but since iwas asian iwas treated totally differently i was regular shopper at aldi but nat anymore hate racism

Reviews:
The primary grocery store in Hudson, Michigan. Market House is a full service grocery store with several other businesses (a hardware store. Bank, pizza, coffee and pharmacy) located inside.
Clean and well stocked one star deduction for high prices (yes I know it is a small town); I’ve lived in this town for about six years and I would say 99% out of 100 times that I’ve went into the market House I had to deal with a disrespectful rude uncourteous cashier even though most of them are young ladies, and maybe it’s their parents fault for not teaching them respect and morals. Something needs to be done because if you can’t be nice and courteous to people as a cashier, you should get another job instead of spreading misery because your life sucks.; For being a small grocery store they have a lot of good choices though they're prices and items that are not on sale are much higher than Myers or other grocery stores in Adrian. why is that. This is a small town that can't afford higher prices than the supermarkets around them including me; Not as good as other trips. I went in for the donut holes, but there weren't any. Other bakery items were dated or very close.
Like the way the store is set up though, I enjoy the trip from Temperance.
Return: yes; Pros: I’d like to start off by saying the employees are very nice, polite and helpful.

Cons: Most of the items they have expire within a month or two if not days/weeks ( unlike Meijer, Kroger and Walmart). They have had issues with their freezer for almost a year and whenever I shop there, there are icicles hanging from the products. Pretty sure that’s a health department violation.

It’s overpriced for the generic brands they sell and the cost in some cases is 50% higher then that of the previous stores I mentioned. I’ve spoken with this “Brett” person who is on the receipt to call if you have issues or concerns but he just  blows you off and does nothing. The ancestors who handed the store down to him would be disappointed because he doesn’t give the quality of customer service they did when they built the business. Very sad indeed

Reviews:
Home Depot is a go-to destination for many people, and it's easy to see why. With its large and well-organized stores, Home Depot offers a wide range of products for all your home improvement needs. From tools and hardware to appliances and furniture, you can find everything you need under one roof.

However, while the store itself is impressive, the assistance to customers at Home Depot often leaves a lot to be desired. It's not uncommon to encounter difficulties in finding knowledgeable staff members who can provide the necessary guidance and support. This can be frustrating, especially when you need help with specific products or projects.

On the bright side, Home Depot has made strides in improving its online ordering and curbside pickup services. Many customers have had positive experiences with these options, allowing them to conveniently shop from the comfort of their homes and pick up their purchases without having to navigate the busy store aisles. This is particularly helpful in areas where parking and high traffic around the store can be challenging.

Speaking of the surrounding area, Home Depot locations are often strategically situated near restaurants and other stores, making it a convenient destination for budget-minded individuals. You can combine your home improvement trip with a meal or visit other stores to fulfill your various shopping needs.

One thing you can always count on at Home Depot is finding good deals. The store regularly offers discounts, promotions, and clearance sales, allowing you to save money on your purchases. Additionally, many Home Depot locations have fast-food options nearby, providing a quick and convenient dining solution during your shopping trip.

It's worth noting that peak hours at Home Depot can get busy, with increased foot traffic and longer wait times at checkout. If possible, planning your visit during off-peak hours may help you navigate the store more efficiently and avoid crowds.

In summary, Home Depot is a popular choice for home improvement needs due to its large and organized stores. While customer assistance can be lacking, the convenience of online ordering and curbside pickup options has been a positive experience for many. The surrounding area offers additional shopping and dining options, catering to budget-conscious shoppers. With regular deals and various fast-food choices nearby, Home Depot provides a comprehensive shopping experience. Just be aware of peak hours, as they tend to be busier.; Mostly love going to the Marshalls at this plaza.  It's always stocked with so much to choose from.  Good deals. The line always goes by quick too so don't be alarmed.; Mostly visit Home Depot there.  They have large organized store.  Assistance to customers leaves a lot to be desired. Had good exp.  With ordering online and pick up at curbside.  Area around restaurants and other stores are high traffic and difficult parking.; Very glad to see this mall renewed!; It's a small nice area to shop, but it currently has some stores that are not leasing space. It has a good variety of stores. It's parking lot needs some maintenance work done though. Nothing stunning in particular.

$1 coffee station!   This might be one of the cheapest coffee offerings in the area.  Paid a Cappuccino with my phone 📱to this station! That’s remarkable.  The app that connects the stations with the phone seems reliable, uses Bluetooth connectivity and did not present any hesitation or lag in the process of paying.  The station also uses cash 💵 but in the event of no cash, it’s ready to keep operating through the app.

Like the concept and that uses local sourced coffee.

Only available while supermarket is open (from morning - 10pm); Great meats here and with the covid problems they have a good amount off food products and nicely cleaned store , the only thing would be there prices.; Love the selection in fruits and veggies. I can make transactions for my US accounts and more. They need a website or an application at least.; Merchandise available, good prices, but the cashier's are very, very disappointing.; Good variety  and fair prices in spite of the higher prices.

Reviews:
I love this place. They have everything you need. Even for vegans. Excellent fruits & vegetables section. If you're in a hurry & don't want to cook, they have this ready made food section with deli choices. The employees are super friendly and go the extra mile to get what you need.; Overall good quality of produce. They could have better avocados..., and Spring Mix greens (they look awful.) They lowered some prizes; still Manchego cheese at $11 is ridiculous!; Found what I was looking for fast. Bought the kit of Manchego Cheese it's from Spain and it's delicious.; Excellent supermarket, wide variety of quality products. There are brands from other countries, but above all the treatment of the employees is excellent.
It complies not only with the rules for cleaning and distancing for the public, but also with the protections for the workers. I will definitely come back!; We were very excited when we found our pie crust. However, we made a fatal mistake when we bought the sushi. It was absolutely horrendously  disgusting. The sushi tasted old, the rice was undercooked, and they used smoked salmon. Not only that, they only gave us five small pieces of ginger.

Upon eating our first piece of what we thought would be a nice snack, we very quickly realized it was anything but that.  We bravely gave it a second try and my daughter ended up spitting it out, because  she just couldn't stomach another piece.  I however, decided to tough it out and immediately regretted it for the next 15 minutes as my mouth tingled and I desperately searched for a water bottle in my car to wash away the aftermath left behind from this putrid specimen of sushi. Whatever you do just skip the sushi at Pueblo in Guaynabo. It was not worth the $6.79!

Name: Supermercado Taranda
Address: 1618 S 8th St, Rogers, AR 72756, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:30 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM

Reviews:
The real highlight of this store is the tiny restaurant tucked away in the back corner. They serve delicious,  truly authentic  Mexican food at very reasonable prices. The tacos and asada quesadilla were delicious.  If you are looking for fancy, or perfectly spic and span, this place is not for you. Suggestions: brush up on your Spanish so you can order, because most of the employees don't speak much English.  This place gets crowded at times.

All the sights, smells and sounds (mariachi
music playing on the speakers) of any authentic supermercado (think downtown Los Angeles). Small grocery store that has everything necessary  to cook various Mexican foods.
Can't wait to return to do some shopping and have another delicious meal.; The restaurant in the back is great! The staff is very friendly and attentive. The food is very fresh and the portion sizes are large. If you are searching for authentic Mexican food- this is your place. This place is a hidden gem of Rogers!; Be careful eating at this location my husband and his co-worker had asada and now have food poisoning!!!!!; Really good tacos and the menudo so delicious 😋; There's a restaurant in the back of the store. It's hidden gem. Food is as authentic as it gets. The tacos, burritos, or anything here is over stuff with meat and cooked to perfection. All at a affordable price. 5/5

Name: Kroger
Address: 150 W 161st St, Westfield, IN 46074, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 150 (street_number); West 161st Street (route); Westfield (locality); Westfield Washington Township (administrative_area_level_3); Hamilton County (administrative_area_level_2); Indiana (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 46074 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I had the pleasure of shopping at Kroger recently, and I must say, it was a truly exceptional experience. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by friendly and helpful staff who were eager to assist me with any questions or concerns I had. Their commitment to providing outstanding customer service was evident throughout my visit.

One aspect that particularly impressed me was the cleanliness of the store. The aisles were well-organized, and the shelves were fully stocked, making it easy to find everything I needed. It's evident that Kroger takes great pride in maintaining a clean and inviting store environment, which makes the shopping experience all the more pleasant.

What truly sets Kroger apart, though, is its dedication to sourcing locally grown and produced food. It's clear that Kroger values supporting local farmers and suppliers, as evidenced by the wide variety of locally sourced products available. This not only benefits the community by promoting local businesses but also ensures that the food is fresh and of high quality.

Overall, my experience at Kroger was fantastic. The exceptional customer service, clean store environment, and commitment to locally sourced food make it a standout grocery store in my book. I look forward to continuing to shop at Kroger and highly recommend it to others seeking a top-notch shopping experience.; Placed an online order to be picked up between 4-5. Get notification at 3pm order is ready so I go to pick up. It won’t let me tell them I am there around 3:40pm. So, I decided to wait until 4pm. Employee comes to my window and says oh I can check you in inside then I’ll bring out your order. He goes and comes back says actually your order isn’t finished it won’t be finished until between 4:30-5pm as we are an hour behind. He says we will have someone call when it’s ready. I say ok. I drive all the way home. Wait until after 5pm. I call 3 times and get no one to answer in the grocery pick up. So, I drive in because I have things to get done and need things in this order. I pull in complete check in only for another employee to come out and tell me it will be another 1-2 hours. I tried to call to speak to a manager. The phone got transferred and just rang and rang. This is the worst customer service. Like communication of delays and the inaccuracy of how far behind they are. Stop taking so many orders if you can’t complete them. I wouldn’t have been as upset if someone just answered/called before I made multiple drives and wasted time and gas.; I love shopping at Westfield Kroger, I find myself shopping here more often than other grocery chains because of the personalized service. I always go to self check, and I can count on there being a familiar face. My favorite cashier is Parool. I see how personable she is with everyone. I see her taking time to talk to the moms and make the kids feel noticed. She’s so helpful, and I see her as the beacon of friendliness and light. I don’t often see others taking so much pride in making the customers feel welcome in today’s world. If she’s not there, I always go and get in line on the other side so I can say hi to Ina, she recognizes a lot of customers and interacts with them with her amazing warm smile. Kroger thank you for employing, warm genuine souls.; I was so upset today.  My groceries were bagged so ridiculously.  I had brought in 3 reusable bags.    One of the bags was packed so heavy I could barely lift it into my car.  In that bag it had a bag of cubed ham, bag of long grain rice, bag of brown sugar,  lb of bacon,  lunch meat, butter, 2 pkg of cheese, 2 bags of instant mashed potatoes, cake mix, 6 cans of vegetable’s and 2 large jars of spagetti sauce.  The other bag had a loaf of bread , large container of cottage cheese, and a bottle of creamer.  The other bag wasn’t used.   I would like to know if they ever trainer the baggers how to bag.; I just really want to shout out to the Kroger pick-up/pickers/ loaders on 161st St Kroger in Westfield for always making it a really great experience. I have used this service for a really long time. They are very hardworking people and super kind/genuine about out of stock options and they really do try their best. I am disabled and use this service to assist me and my family multiple times a month. It helps me provide to my family when at times I am not able. These workers are very much needed and should be appreciated in our community.

Name: Colmado Martinez
Address: 2-18 Calle 2, Trujillo Alto, 00976, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 2-18 (street_number); Calle 2 (route); Trujillo Alto (locality); St. Just (administrative_area_level_2); Trujillo Alto (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00976 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Colmado Martinez is undoubtedly the best place to get groceries, support WIC and EBT benefits, and so much more. With its exceptional services and commitment to customer satisfaction, this establishment has gained a stellar reputation in the community.

When it comes to accessing essential groceries, Colmado Martinez offers an extensive range of high-quality products. From fresh produce and dairy items to pantry staples and household necessities, they have everything one needs to maintain a well-stocked kitchen. The store takes great pride in sourcing their products from local suppliers, ensuring freshness and supporting the local economy.

One of the standout features of Colmado Martinez is its support for WIC and EBT benefits. The store understands the importance of providing affordable and nutritious food options to individuals and families who rely on these programs. Their staff is well-trained and knowledgeable about the intricacies of these benefits, making the shopping experience seamless and hassle-free. They actively assist customers in navigating the process, ensuring that they can make the most of their benefits.

Moreover, the exceptional customer service at Colmado Martinez sets it apart from other grocery stores. The staff is friendly, attentive, and always ready to assist shoppers with any inquiries or requests. Whether it's helping customers find specific items, suggesting alternatives, or providing guidance on healthy choices, the team goes above and beyond to ensure a positive and personalized experience for everyone.

Colmado Martinez also goes beyond being just a grocery store. It serves as a community hub, fostering a sense of belonging and unity. The store regularly hosts events and workshops focused on nutrition education, cooking demonstrations, and other valuable resources for its customers. This demonstrates their dedication to promoting wellness and empowering the community to make informed choices about their health and nutrition.

In conclusion, Colmado Martinez is a true gem in the realm of grocery stores. With its extensive product selection, unwavering support for WIC and EBT benefits, and exceptional customer service, it stands head and shoulders above the rest. The store's commitment to community involvement further solidifies its position as the best place to get groceries, and so much more. Paying a visit to Colmado Martinez is not just a shopping trip; it's an opportunity to be part of a caring and inclusive community.; Very warm people and nice groceries.; Excelent; Whenever I can I go shopping there, they are 2 minutes from my house and the lady is always very friendly.   Econo every time you go to pick up a purchase, even if it is bread, you have to pay $3 dollars and I prefer to leave them here because they are small businesses and generate less than a supermarket and they are flexible with people; Great Variety of Products!!!

Reviews:
The best cupcakes and cakes. But their attitude is HORRIBLE. They open from 9am-2pm (5hrs) and they close down to take a “break”, don’t answer the phone, I asked if I could get notified when they are not on break, and the lady smirked at me… horrible service. I wish they would be better because their product is great !; We bought a cake for over 80$ yet they don’t provide a disposable cake knife or server. It was a mess when you’re not at home.  The cake is amazing and delicious, but little things can ruin the day.; Best Vanilla Cake!!!! Flamed Merengue Frosting; Had trouble picking up a prepaid office order. Even though I showed them my ID to pick up the cake, a rude lady behind the counter wouldn’t give me the cake until I verified a phone number in their system. And here I thought that an official ID was the best evidence to verify a person’s identity! I can understand store policies, but her attitude was inappropriate for customer service. She could’ve called the number she had on file to verify instead of refusing to deliver the cake. We used to order here often. Never again.
FYI the cupcakes are TINY. Single-bite cupcakes for $3 a pop plus the box. ; Yummy variety of cupcakes and the best frosting ✨️ the cakes are delicious and my favorite.

Name: Alan's Market
Address: Amelia Industrial Park, #36 C. Diana, Guaynabo, 00968, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Vicinity: Amelia Industrial Park, #36 Calle Diana, Guaynabo
Address Components: #36 (street_number); Calle Diana (route); Pueblo Viejo, Guaynabo, Puerto Rico (sublocality_level_1); Guaynabo (locality); Pueblo Viejo (administrative_area_level_2); Guaynabo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00968 (postal_code)
Reviews:
So I went to Alan's Market today for some fresh seafood, and it was awesome. Alans Market is the retail store of SeaWorld distributors who import a large assortment of seafood to the island. At Alan's Market, they have a large variety  of seafood, including wild caught and farmed products. They also have a wide assortment of delicatessens from Europe and Asia as well as some imported wines and spirits. Today, I bought wild caught langostines and  fresh scallops at very reasonable prices. I highly recommend this store to anyone looking for fresh seafood in the  metropolitan  area or adjacent communities. The staff is phenomenal and uber efficient.; Extraordinary customer service. Tuna was outstanding. The 2 ladies in the store are amazing. I love the service provided by both. Thanks; 20/10 Alan's Market is an absolute gem!

Their seafood selection is unparalleled, boasting the freshest and finest products I've ever come across here on the island.

I was thrilled to find items I've been searching for months, all under one roof.

The experience was nothing short of amazing.

I can confidently say I won't be purchasing seafood from anywhere else ever again.

Highly recommend!; Nice small fish shop.

They almost always have fresh tuna and salmon, often time have other type of fishes, whole or filés. Sometimes they have clams and oysters.

They also have so many other things for sale than fish. They have a small Asian side, with sushi rice, seaweeds and seasonings, plum sauce, sriracha etc.

They are one of the rare shop where I could find most of the time a French style cream ( crème fraîche) which is significantly better as a base for the homemade sauces.

They have some frozen selection of spring rolls, endamame, ravioli, shrimps, mussels etc.

Especially during Christmas or other occasions, they sale caviar, and caviar gift packs.

You can order online, or go to the shop. They have a parking lot. There is often time a wait that can be long as the shop is small with not much staff.

I would say sometimes it could be more fresh especially for the price; but overall it’s probably one of the best option here in PR if you don’t buy directly to a fisherman.
I would recommend!; Fully stocked with imported goods and the best fresh fish and seafood, also at good prices!

Name: D'Angelo Italian Market
Address: 35 Spring St, Princeton, NJ 08542, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM
Address Components: 35 (street_number); Spring Street (route); Princeton (locality); Mercer County (administrative_area_level_2); New Jersey (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 08542 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Their sandwiches are outstanding! I haven't tried their pizza, deserts, or shopped for groceries yet, but I had the D'Angelo Signature and it hit every box. It was made fresh and prepared quickly. They offer so many groceries and have a great ambiance. If you need any Italian food for lunch, this is the place to be.; Phenomenal environment!! The staff came around and asked my team and I how the food was, and were very pleased to hear how much we enjoyed it. All the pastas, sandwiches, drinks, pastries, etc. were all delicious. Highly recommend this spot for anyone in the Princeton area!!; Staff is extremely rude and quite frankly bizarre. Tried to order a large pizza pie and was told " I can't do that" by counter person. When I asked why her even more rude counterpart begins to excoriate me because they are working on an order of 20 pies for someone and how dare I expect them to drop what they are doing to make me a pie (as if I am supposed to know this somehow). It gets better! As I begin to walk out she says you can wait if you want but it will be thirty minutes, but then advises they actually can't because they ran out of pizza dough. I will never ever shop at this place again as long as I live. Awful customer service.; Service was good, large selection of salads and Italian food. Prices are reasonable. The only reason I'm not give them 5 starts is because of my sandwich... I ask for sausage parmigiana Hero and the sausage taste good, but the bread was testing awful, old bread... also it was very messy, my wife ask for tortellini pesto salad and that one taste great! Seems the bread thy are using is for days before... I will give them another try and will see if they take in consideration this review!; I always liked their pizza, sandwiches, pasta, and deli dishes. Wish they had working wifi. Prices are high. Has student discount.

Their vodka pasta is excellent. I think they have a lot more flavor than Olives.

Their pizza is superior to Proof but inferior to Pizza Den if you want crispy NY style.

Their sandwiches are far superior to Proof’s soggy mess, and higher quality than Hoagie, but sometimes you need a Hoagie calorie bomb.

Today I had a custom sandwich with grilled chicken, mozzarella, balsamic, and roasted red peppers on a roll for $13. It was excellent, and I was delighted that the gentleman toasted the sandwich for me to melt the cheese. Normally, their sandwiches are cold and can be either hoagies, on a roll, or wrap. No paninis here.

Look at the size of my Gnocchi for $13!

These guys all speak Italian and are clearly from Italy. Not so at Olive’s.

Address: 3636 Springdale Rd, Cincinnati, OH 45251, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 3636 (street_number); Springdale Road (route); Cincinnati (locality); Colerain Township (administrative_area_level_3); Hamilton County (administrative_area_level_2); Ohio (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 45251 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This is the Springdale at Colerain location.  Great selection of almost any fresh food items you could possibly want.  This place is huge.  But the size also presents a problem navigating the parking lot. both incoming and leaving.  This location is so popular that trying to find a parking space is a job, itself; and just trying to enter or leave the parking lot is a chore.  Otherwise, decent shopping experience.the store is generally clean, well staffed, and employees are helpful and courteous.; This is an above-average Kroger location. The “Marketplace” designation seems to signal more choice and more upscale options.

There are still plenty of items on sale, and all of the regular stuff offerings that you would expect.

Has fresh sushi, with deals every Wednesday. Also has a Starbucks, fresh flowers and a great wine selection.

Parking is easy and plentiful. There is a fuel center on site.

I only wish this store was closer to my goiter.; This place has a very good selection of grocery items, which is the second place I would go to after jungle jims. Beware of the sashimi sushi available. It was new so I got some for $10. I got home to eat it and was hugely disappointed. I got a mouth full of strong fish taste and the slices were so thick that the fibers on the filled gave it an unpleasant tough feel with each bite. Waste of $10.; I was picking up a fridge from Best Buy at 9845 Colerain Ave, Cincinnati, OH 45251, to help my son move into his dorm ( UC) . Afterward, I went to Kroger to do some grocery shopping and spent $190. I paid the cashier,  I accidentally pushed my cart with a bad wheel through a door that wasn’t marked as an exit. A white man and woman told me, ‘“ it is not an exit.” I was already outside, so I asked if they wanted me to go back. The man responded, “Just don’t do it again.” I told them I didn’t live here, but I understood.
As I was unpacking my groceries, a police officer, along with the same two people, showed up and said there was “suspicious activity”. I was asked to provide my receipt. This experience reminded me of how, despite the assumptions some people make, not every Black person is a thief, just like not every cop is a killer. It was a frustrating reminder of how differently things could have played out if I were white. Just incredibly sad!; Been going over 5 years nearly every week. Easy parking and entrance. Some foods are high and others are cheap. It's a treasure hunt. The signs that tell what's in the aisles need to be closer to eye level rather than wait up high or better yet a 2nd sign that is at the end of the aisles right above the refrigerators. Has a pharmacy and 5th/3rd bank. Very clean.

Reviews:
Some good fried chicken if you get it fresh.. Shrimp Chevice is good here.... Came in on 10/08 the morning shift yo get some shredded chicken for tamales all they had was seasoned but they advertised unseasoned as well but the had no unseasoned out. All the butchers said its no more we don't have any.. So Darius came to the counter an said how many pounds I told him he then went to clean out the machine that shreds the meat an made what I ask for he went above an beyond to make sure I was a satisfied customer I then had to let the manager Danny Know that Darius An Renee were his star employees....; Decent prices always have something on special and the food is fresh and delicious at the restaurant area; Clean and well organized.  Produce and meats are fresh and inexpensive, especially when there's a sale.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Butchers are helpful.  Bakery is made fresh.  Hot deli section has good selection of dishes and prices are affordable.  I wish the deli section had their own cashier so you don't have to stand in line with all other customers when it gets so busy.  Bakery section does have their own cashier.  Plenty of parking space but they need to fix the asphalt.  Watch out for potholes.; Location is nice and clean. Parking is plentiful. They have a nice stock of fruits and vegetables, and I like that they have a deli with hot food. My favorite thing to get from there are the Superior branded tortilla chips.; Clean and friendly, aisles are wide and uncluttered.
Prices are high though and choices are limited.
Meat department looks good and the fish and shrimp look good as well.
They also carry hot food.

Address Components: 340 (street_number); East McDowell Road (route); Midtown (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85004 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Adam the self check out cashier is SUPER AWESOME!! He always helps me when I come in the store with a positive friendly respectful demeanor. I am so glad they hired this guy.; TL;DR - Do not go to this Safeway, or go and expect the checkout process to be dreadful. Also, be careful of being overcharged.

I never saw myself writing a review for a local grocery store, because normally all of my visits are quick ins and outs. However, my visit to this Safeway was by far the most unusual and memorable (in a bad way) grocery experience I have ever had in my 20 years in the U.S. After shopping (about 10 items), I went to the self checkout area (about a 2 minute wait) and started checking out. After I scanned all of the items, I entered my phone number to the keypad and waited for the discounts to be removed from the total before the final total shows up on the screen. However, none of my clipped deals came through and somehow the total was $20 higher (doubled) than expected. I called over the on-duty self checkout staff for assistance. After reviewing my coupons and my membership on my phone, instead of manually adjusting the total, he said the entire transaction had to be voided, and I had to start scanning everything all over again. I was told that this time I MUST scan my QR code membership instead of my phone number and I must scan it before I scan all of my items. Well, guess what? The second time didn't work either. The staff member apologized and said I now have go to an actual cashier to check out.

So 15 minutes were wasted, I was once again in line for a live cashier to check me out... for the third time. Did I hear third time is the charm? I thought so too, but no! Even the cashier had problems and had to go get the manager to override the prices. 10 more minutes later, I FINALLY left the store with my groceries paying the correct price.

Moral of the story: look at the screen carefully as you are being checked out; make sure all of your clipped deals are applied to the transaction, or else you'll be charged double without you even noticing.; If you do not have the proper packaging for a customer to take home a tall baby cake from the bakery, then you should stop making them or order some appropriate packaging. By the time I got home from my five minute drive my cake was completely destroyed, sliding around in the stupid box that the lid won’t even close on top of it. How ridiculous. What a waste of my time and money.; A well cared for store. Good selection. Decent savings if you have a member card. Today was odd though. The smell of Starbucks coffee and fresh hot wings attacked my nose at the same time. My brain stopped braining for a second. Warn a guy first, dude.; Good store but removed couple stars because of wings from deli. Extremely dry and tasted weird, more like paper than wings (maybe frozen for long time before fried and dried?). Not worth any money.
