Best Deli service in the area. Anytime you want fried chicken or chicken tenders they have no problem dropping a basket. Thank you for your services. And right now they have kretchmar  hams and cheese for $5.99 lb. So you must stop in to get their Deli slices. I can't believe all the money we save using the app. And Starbucks is nothing but a trap from the first moment you walk through the doors the aroma from the coffee just pulls you right over to get a cup of coffee while you're shopping.  😁😁😁; Would be five but security isn’t tight and all the carts are far from the handicap spots on the west side of the store so the elderly that use them to walk and or lean on have to make it pretty far till they can get a kart. Yes my mother needed to report this because she is part of the elderly. But the store is nice inside and clean so 3 stars only to the handicap and cart situation. ( please fix it Safeway ); The lack of communication with management at this store is incredibly disappointing.
I was given a job offer but had zero communication on when to come in for orientation I called multiple times to check in. After 3 weeks of waiting I’m now being told the person I was replacing didn’t quit and they don’t have hours due to it being summer. To make things worse I would not have known a thing unless I repeatedly called the store asking about progress. Thanks for letting me know and keeping me in the loop. What a great look for a company…. Not; I can’t complain.  Very clean and stock up. Meat dept always nice and stock up. I like  a gentle man know there different type of meat . Thanks to Richard in the meat dept he’s very helpful   . Flowers dept. big selection a lot of flowers.  Blanca always super nice.  Monica cashier she always takes her time to help me out.  Never gets in a hurry or rushes.  Very patient.  Chris ,  works for customer service . When I have a problem. With my grocery list. He catches on fast. I get back a few dollars saving . Only one red flag I can say . Two elderly men work for cashier’s. Are not friendly.  I just avoid going to there register.  I rather do self check out. Thank you Safeway keeping your store so clean lit  up with  bright lights  in your store. .; The staff is very helpful and kind. It was difficult for them to do their job today as Safeway did not provide grocery bags for them to use. I can see the store running out of a product but not grocery bags. We were given a box that meat came in instead. Very disappointing.

It’s a larger Hmong store and Carrie’s a different variety of goods. They have a hot food section which was a bonus if youre not in the mood to cook or on the road.
We were on
Our way home from north sac to sf and decided to stop by here for some groceries and hot food. Would definitely come back.; Nice grocery market. They have many things to buy from canned foods to fresh veggies and ice cream. Mostly Asian themed food but also the common food such as milk, soda, ice cream, and Thai tea.

The staff are friendly and helpful so ask if you need help finding something.; Great place to buy Asian goods. Condiments, spices, lumpia, wrap, etc. Unfortunately, when I went, the vegetable area was wiped out and what was left was going bad; Excellent I love their prices it’s so cheap I go there a lot and I love my experience; Always have good food to go. Love this place

Name: WinCo Foods
Address: 4200 Coffee Rd, Bakersfield, CA 93308, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: 4200 (street_number); Coffee Road (route); Fruitvale (neighborhood); Bakersfield (locality); Kern County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 93308 (postal_code); 5064 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
“lowest prices guaranteed” yeah well you get one and a half days to get through your groceries before they mold. actually no, one day because they’re supposed to still be good today. went grocery shopping wednesday afternoon for a dogsitting job i’m doing because they gave me cash for food. i am a broke college student, i went to the cheapest place possible. still spent $80 on just food for three meals, four days. i was excited for this meal because it’s my favorite: pulled pork sliders. i have my meat all cooked up and im getting ready to warm up the rolls to see this. this is RIDICULOUS. and you wonder why people are starving even with a roof over their head. this should’ve gotten me at least two meals and now i have nothing. now i am out of food AND my money. was it actually good until today? or was it retagged. not okay.; WinCo Foods has just about anything/everything you will need in a supermarket.  They sell a lot of items in bulk for additional saving.
Prices are very reasonable. Need deli meat, they have great choices here. Plenty of choices of fish, shrimp and lobster can be found in the back area.
The only downside is the store is huge.  You have to bag your own items and no credit cards are allowed,  ATM-debit card or cash.; I had another disappointing experience at this location. The cashier, Tamera B, displayed troubling racist behavior. This was my first encounter with such issues in Bakersfield, and it has made me reluctant to return. I would highly recommend shopping at the Winco on Panama Lane instead.; First visit as I just moved to Bakersfield.  Great store found everything I needed plus more. Cashier was very courteous and happy she made me laugh. I will definitely be shopping there again; Very convenient, employees are not very helpful, customer service isn't a priority there at all. I did ONE time have an older associate answer my question, stopped what she was doing and walk me to what I was looking for, she knew her store and provided me with excellent customer  service bless heat I think I over thanked her and u did totally compliment her. Customer service is being erased from everywhere. Smh

Reviews: If I could give this place ZERO STARS I would!!!! I went this weekend to buy some meat and I spent $45 the first time and I went back and tried to buy another 4 pounds for $27 and they kept saying my card declined!!!! MY CARD DID NOT DECLINE THEY STOLE MY MONEY AND WOULD NOT GIVE ME THE MEAT OR MY MONEY BACK ! THEY SAID "I dont go off of your transactions on your phone I go off my transactions" WHICH AGAIN I CALLED THE CARD AND MY TRANSACTION DID GO THROUGH BUT THE OWNER YELLED AT ME AND WOULD NOT GIVE ME WHAT I PAID FOR AND TOLD ME TO TAKE IT UP WITH MY CARD HOLDER !! DO NOT GO HERE !!!!; Their fresh house salsas and beans are so delicious and the local El Angel Tortillas that they sell are the best! They have such a good local chip and tortilla selection. I love their house made frozen fruit popsicle bags too! :); Cool customer service Gustavo; Has amazing burritos; This is the best carne in town!  Such friendly and professional customer service.  Also very attentive and fast  They have Everything in this place !

Not a full on grocery store. But has a butcher and several necessity items; I Belive that this grocery store has good butchers, and the owner is very kind. I am very disappointed because I just witnessed two cashiers being increasingly rude with one costumer.

Why do the cashiers work if they are not going to give good service and be rude. The owner is so nice and I am very disappointed of the cashiers that he has.; Catering food great, also in store service phenomenally good. Thanks for the good services.; Great local place to Shop at. Everything is always fresh daily.  Always greeted with a smile From cashiers Norma and Lupita to the butchers Robert, Ramon y El Guero. This is my go to spot.💕😊👍; I remember when Trejo was White hen pantry back in the 90's then converted to 7-11 in the early 2000's. Now Trejo. Good transition.

Address: 3540 Norwood Ave, Sacramento, CA 95838, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 8:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 8:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 8:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 8:30 AM – 6:00 PM

Reviews: My family and I love coming to this little market for fresh produce available early in the mornings. Local farmers supply these produce and it’s all fresh and well priced. The prices have gone up since the past year, but it’s still worth it. They also have other Asian groceries available which is fun to look at. The owner is really friendly too!; I must express my dissatisfaction with the service I received at your establishment. Specifically, the attitude displayed by the young boy cashier towards me was unprofessional. Despite the fact that I have always had positive experiences at your market and have praised the friendly there, this particular incident left much to be desired.; Great service. Good prices. Limited variety of items maybe because of the size of a store required to carry Filipino products and other nation’s products. For example, I was not able to find brown, mascobado, or powdered sugar. I really did not see any dairy products but I wasn’t shopping for any.; Good products, good prices. Under construction for 2 years will likely finish in 6 more with that pace 😭; I've been shopping here for few years now for their fresh produce. Staff are very friendly. Produce are super fresh. Although, avoid shopping late in the afternoon or most of the good ones are gone by then. Most of the veggies, Im not familiar with, but having fun trying some of them. Still hoping they'll have fresh jicama again (smaller, juicier, and crunchier).  Some of their veggies and hebs come with roots intact so I cut the basil about 6 to 8 inches from the roots and replanted the bottom half. See photo of replanted basil, 2 big pots in the back. I think they are looking good after few months of replanting. Hopefully, they survive the winter and rainy season in Sac. Can't find the other photos taken from the store but will try to add next time I visit the market.

This was on 6/26/19 at 1 pm; This small unique shopping plaza it's great. Lots of varity of restaurants to choose from, it has a healthy market (Freshmart), has a bank & a pharmacy. Very convinient. The only down fall is the parking spaces. They are very narrow. Be prepared for traffic. It flows but slowly. 👍; I hate this small shopping mall. It’s always very full and you have to fight for a parking spot. There’s few stores but I guess it’s a good spot foe the people who live close buy and can just walk to the shopping mall. There’s very few stores tho it does have a few restaurants.

Name: Freshmart Plazoleta 169
Address: Plazoleta 169 Carr #169 km 4.5 Barrio, Frailes, Guaynabo 00969, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: Frailes (sublocality_level_1); Guaynabo (locality); Guaynabo (administrative_area_level_2); Guaynabo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00969 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The best variety of natural products!!!!!!
Their employees have a very good attention for the customer; very knowledgeable also.; I tried to return a yogurt that was spoiled and wasn’t allowed… the staff was rude and stated that because I opened it, it couldn’t be returned…

Also this place is overpriced for no reason; Only rating food from food court. Pizzas are pretty good. Tried the Pico de Gallo pizza and Rustica pizza. Rustica was well seasoned and my favorite. Pico pizza had a strong cumin flavor, something I don’t expect from a pizza. My wife had the chicken with yuca and salad. The rotisserie chicken was dry and yuca a bit bland.

Very convenient drive thru!; Tons of gluten free options! From bread all the way to noodles, dates and snacks.; I come weekly to this Freshmart. Every once in awhile I’ve opened a package and either found mold or bugs.  It’s happened a few times (mold in the oatmeal, a bug in the salad, mold on the gluten free bread) but I’ve always let it slide and didn’t take the time to return the item and continued to go. Today I bought a few yogurts, as soon as I got home I opened one. it tasted  sour and it was hard, not like yogurt  (the expiration date was in a week)  it was obviously bad so I opened a new one.  The second one had green mold layered over the top. Then I opened the third and noticed it wasn’t completely sealed. The 4th was sour and hard as well. Finally the 5th one was good so I ate that one and kept the 6th as well.  I drove back to Freshmart and tried to return the yogurts. They gave me money back for two but not for the other two because I tasted them.
It is not really about the money, I’m a continued costumer and spend a lot of money at this place. The cashier (could’ve been the manager)  was very condescending.  I have her name but won’t post it because maybe she was just having a bad day or maybe that is just her demeanor. But the customer service was definitely not there on her part. I’ll continue to go but only for certain items that I can’t find anywhere else. Will never do a full grocery shopping at this location again.

Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 424 (street_number); Cambridge Street (route); Allston (neighborhood); Boston (locality); Suffolk County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02134 (postal_code); 2014 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
It's great for Ukrainian, and Russian food, which I love. Great variety in cakes, all of which are delicious and I highly recommend. The Deli is packed full of smoked treats and pickled fish. I highly recommend the syrnyka and the birch juice. Don't expect anything from the service though, they don't seem particularly enthused to interact.; Beware that this store doesn’t inspect their produce regularly. Twice, I have purchased blueberries that ended up with mold in the middle.

Update: Since posting this review, I have found mold on grapes and bread purchased from this store. I am very concerned about their food handling practices.; Great Russian/Eastern European grocery store with an incredible bakery. I try a new flavor of cake every time I go and am never disappointed.
The store has a large selection, including a bunch of different priyaniki flavors, Georgian wines, various teas and Balkan cheeses. There's also a deli and some prepared foods like salads.; A lot of goods on the shelves are past expiration date and no ones seems to take them off so that people don’t buy it. Most of the ice cream in the tall freezers expired in January 2022. The prices are a bit too high. Spent almost $160 on barely two full bags…. Will not be returning to this store and will not recommend it to anyone.; Whenever we are in Boston and want some Russian food - this is a go to.  This store has a big selection of products.  Friendly staff.   A decent size parking lot on the back (decent size for Boston).  Produce is fresh and there is a good variety.  Staff generally speaks both English and Russian.
Edit: they recently changed the store layout which made it easier to navigate the store.

Name: Kroger
Address: 5400 Cornerstone N Blvd, Centerville, OH 45440, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 5400 (street_number); Cornerstone North Boulevard (route); Centerville (locality); Sugarcreek Township (administrative_area_level_3); Greene County (administrative_area_level_2); Ohio (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 45440 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I LOVE this Kroger! This is my favorite Kroger! The Store itself is beautiful and well-decorated. I haven’t had to have many interactions with the Staff, but one deli employee I had, ( I’m pretty sure his name was Tom) Was very kind and cut the meat very well. I love going here on Friday Nights. There is a live band playing at the bar and It’s so fun and pleasant to hear while shopping. They have a ton of products and great Seasonal decorations. I love this store and will go here for all of my grocery shopping. GodBless and have an amazing day!; Just made a quick stop to get a single red rose. The two they had out didn't look good so I asked the young lady if she could look a d see if she had one good single red rose. She was so sweet and polite. She had one,made my day. Just here stopping what she was doing and she was making an arrangement just for a single rose really warmed my heart. Again her mannerism was so nice. Having a really rough time and she brightened my day. Thank you So much Kroger florist on Feedwire Drive!!; Lazy employees. When I use the UScan with the conveyer belt, the employees just stand there and do absolutely nothing. I guess they aren’t paid to provide customer service and help with bagging.

When I do Clicklist here, I always receive products that are past expiration or expiring the next day.; I've gone shopping in several different Krogers on company business .. I wasn't able to use my company card in Kroger or Starbucks that is inside the Kroger  it demanded a PIN .. which the company card does not give us a pin . So I wasn't able to get water,  fruit, tea, chicken salad or even frozen dinners and frozen breakfast.. how disappointing being im a diabetic,  heart patient, and kidney failure .. 😔 I've been out working now going on week 3 .. im to overwhelmed with restaurant food and wanted  something else light or snack..; Came to do pick up 15 minutes early. No one there. No one answers the phone. Talk to a manager. Her best option is come back tomorrow. Even though quote, employees still should have been there after waiting 15-20 minutes.

Store open 24/7 pickup available. Touristy, lots of booze, beer and chips.; Great general selection in the front (non prescription), fairly secure and clean.

Long check out lines, some clerks, like in the beauty section are really nice and helpful, others in the counter, like the short dude with glasses and a beard, are unfriendly, moody and impolite.

Prescription (RX) area is slow and convoluted even though the pharmacists and techs are nice.; I spent 2 hours waiting in the drive through pharmacy. This is usually my experience here. Not sure if they are understaffed or just bad at their jobs. Absolutely mediocre service!!

Reviews: Good selection of items at reasonable prices. In the aftermath of Hurricane Maria they were able to re-open more or less quickly and although the selection of items available was extremely limited, I feel prices only increased minimally,. Will continue to return here as before the hurricane.; Affordable prices. Lack of variety in slmost al categories. Same brands over and over. The produce area almost empty as well as most dairy products off shelves.; This store is owned by WalMart. I saw a few familiar items that I see at WalMart back in the states. Not a very big store but we stopped in a few times looking for things including beer, wine, and liquor.  Surprised at some of the prices for locally grown food being sold there.  Albeit the island is still hard at work trying to recover from hurricane Maria so the infrastructure still has a lot to repair.  Amigos is not the only game in the area so you do have choices available.  It's a nice store and they he people are very nice and courteous.; The place is clean, organized, covid19 conscious and prepared. The article prices are from 5 cents  to 30cents  lower (average), than surrounding markets.; The costumer service open at 6 am if you need to change a check they are available, the supermarket is very stocked and the employees are very helpful plus the cakes are delicious!

Some staff work without masks on (also on the counter), and general hygiene of the place could be improved. I would like this place to be better taken care of.
Also, the proportion of fresh vs ready food like pizza and other not really healthy meals is sad, but it is almost in any small and middle size shop in Finland. Otherwise, a regular middle size Alepa with the same range of prise and brands as any other shop of that chain.; One of the workers was coughing constantly... I hope they were not forced to work due to financial reasons while so clearly sick.; Cheap, quick. These two words tell you enough. It is a good place to go and buy what you need. Good location.; Pretty nice; Not so many choices but all the basics are here! What can you ask more for a free parking lot?

Name: Supermercado Sin Fronteras
Address: 4918 Baseline Rd, Little Rock, AR 72209, USA

Reviews:
This place has it all... 3 kinds of shrimp, 2 sizes of avocados, complete meat market, complete bakery with fresh bread and custom cakes.  Primarily Hispanic stuff, but dry goods include middle eastern and Mexican.   I honestly haven't seen a larger selection and variety of meats in little rock.  Also had diverse produce I haven't seen anywhere else; It's a great local market. Meat is always fresh with a variety of cuts.  Service is excellent.; This is an awesome grocery store everything you need is there.. their meat department is huge.  youll find great meat at great prices,  not to mention their bakery is to die for!
Customer service is amazing!! Love my people ❤
Worth the drive from Maumelle on an ice/snow or summer day!!; I love the variety and selection of product they have. Sometimes the workers can be a bit rude to none Hispanic customers sadly I hate to even say that but it's the truth in my opinion. And they have an amazing bakery and I love the fresh meat. I will continue to shop here I just wish the establishment would care more about being more welcoming to all is it's customers; The variety and selection of foods, spices, and interesting ingredients here is one of the best in the area.

I'm really quite impressed with this place. It's now on our regular list of shopping hotspots.

Convenient supermarket behind the big park. Mostly Spanish food, good selection of fruits and vegetables, very limited American packaged food and flavors. English spoken is limited. Heavy on pork products and cuts. No fresh fish section or items. No pharmaceutical or over the counter items.; Good place.. have a lot of latin products... but meat & fruits &veggies needs some more attention... could be better; Love had variations of peruvian  foods and other also fresh produce; One of my favourite super markets in my neighbor-hood. It supplies my need with everything. It is very organized and clean. It shelves are always stacked. Highly ewcommended.; I'm new in the neighborhood and I love this place.
The staff seems to be very happy with all the 'smiles' and the 'good mornings' I get.
It's very very clean.
The prices are excellent.
One of the workers actually took me to the shelf where I was looking for something and they showed me where it was.
I can't say it enough, I just love it there.

Name: Bob's Supermarket
Address: 310 S Pine St, Townsend, MT 59644, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 310 (street_number); South Pine Street (route); Townsend (locality); Broadwater County (administrative_area_level_2); Montana (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 59644 (postal_code); 2804 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
When I went there some freak was talking about the world ending and a bunker in the basement. Nice place though; The best breakfast sausage  in Montana. I'm not sure how they make it... but its darn good. My family won't even eat sausage from anyplace else. Thank you Bob's for providing  quality foods. I want to add that most of their meat and produce are from local sources. This is what I expect  when I'm buying food for my family. I don't mind paying a few extra dollars knowing my food was grown or raised down the road. We appreciate  you!!!!; Can't always get what you want , but the cashiers are the best. Always so nice and helpful. The two young ladies , Rikki and Brittany in the deli are amazing! Great customer service and really hard workers. Bob and Mike got lucky when they picked up those two !; Ridiculously nice people. Maybe I've been in the city too long (that's a given, actually. Any time in the city is too much...) but these people were friendly and helpful. The selection wasn't bad, unless you are a beer snob. The only "import" I found was Corona! They sell a whole lot of Budweiser.
If I lived close by, this is where I would spend my money.; My family came out to the Townsend fall fest. We come here every year and enjoy it very much. Part of what makes it fun is we stop at Bob's supermarket for all the fresh, yummy taquitos and chicken. We stopped about 9:45. am which we've done in the past. Today, the clerk in the deli was rude and short with us. She said they weren’t even open until 10am when I asked when the fresh fried chicken would be done. She said about 10:30. She gave us Bean burritos when we asked for beef and bean buritos. When my mom went back in to tell her,  she chucked them in the trash. Her attitude was terrible and her customer service skills need a complete change. I wouldn't have her representing my business. It's funny how one rude employee can ruin what has always been a good experience.

Name: Bangluck Market Corporation
Address: 12980 Sherman Way, North Hollywood, CA 91605, USA

Reviews:
Currently,  they are remodeling this place. I live cooking and here I am buying my ingredients.; I used it to love this place but not anymore they don't have tree Ladies Rice. It's Sucks; I love coming here, the prices of the herbs for Thai dishes~ are great & cheap.. small market, but reasonable.; The store is half empty and has a strong mold smell. It's in desperate need of a remodel, the whole lil mall is. I still went ahead and purchase some items. On our way home we open a bag of hot spicy sea fries and when we were almost finished my daughter found a live ant, in the bag! When I got home I double checked my other items and one of the items had the seal broken. I will never return and well the prices weren't low as other people have posted here.; They everything you need to make delicious thai food at home. Lots of variety. Good produce. They have fresh galangal, lime leaves, thai peppers, basil, lemon grass, ect.
Huge sacks of Jasmine Rice. They also have Red Cargo, Brown Jasmine Rice and Thai Berry Rice. I even found a boxof crab sticks without sorbitol. They take cash and card ($10 min). Market has a Third World feel.

Name: Supermercado La Villita
Address: 300 S 8th St, Rogers, AR 72756, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews: I'm so happy I found this place.  I moved to New Hampshire from Oregon, and there's no authentic Mexican Grocers or restaurants there.  I love the butcher shop here.  So many delicious cuts of meat and reasonably priced as well.  The staff are always friendly and accommodating.  One of the best parts of this place is the small but exceptional restaurant.  Phenomenal food here!!!  The patrons and staff are super friendly.   The Menudo is the best ever!!; This place is the bomb! Head to the restaurant in the back, it’s authentic. We get their red chile (salsa) to go, it’s amazingly addictive. Fantastic burritos, nice people-what more can you ask for. Let me just say, if your in NWA as a transplant and looking for California level Mexican food, all the good stuff is in the back of the Mercados. Don’t bother with the stand alone restaurants, it’s gonna be Tex mex.; Was never acknowledged by any wait staff for the restaurant in the establishment apparently it’s get in where you fit in and grab tables or skip the line for people waiting, because that is exactly what happened. I really try to give these “mom and pops” places a chance but this was a bit insulting.; Butchers in back of store know thier game!! Very helpful and friendly.; My wife & I have been a few times during the week. We love it, variety, quantity & quality. We always eat in the little restaurant, delicious!!!!

Reviews: You can feel the joy when you walk in, peaceful, loving, and caring! They exceedingly go above and beyond to make sure you have a great day and enjoy shopping with them! They have all the amenities and more! You wouldn't want to go anywhere else!; Love Super 1.  I wish they had a store in Tennessee; I love Super1 foods but the Winnsboro store is the worst ive ever shopped at. 2 of the cashiers are rude and the blonde who works at self checkout is terrible to deal with. I will be shopping at the Monroe location going forward. They have great employees and a much better meat department.; I came by here over the weekend in hopes to talk to my aunt that I haven't seen in years. I told a cashier who I was looking for. She was very nice. She knew who I was talking about. She proceeded to ask what looked like a manager if she (my aunt) was working today. She gave me an extremely dirty look and snapped back by saying she didn't know who that was or anybody by that name. And if I wanted to go see if she was working in the back, I could go look for her my own self. I was honestly taken aback by how rude this lady was. It was a white lady with long dark hair. I honestly am shocked how she got in a management position. I would hate to work under her because I have a feeling she talks to everyone that way. She stood in the same exact spot the whole time I was there doing nothing, but she didn't have time to help me. Also, I know for a fact my aunt has been working there for at least seven years. She's been working there since before it was Super One. So, this manager doesn't even know her own employees? Or maybe she doesn't care to know them. I was going to get a few things while there, but this lady was absolutely repulsive I left. I hope Super One addresses this issue and this lady has an attitude adjustment.; Friendly & helpful staff. Get the tamales!

Name: Grocery Clearance Center
Address: 3107 S Cockrell Hill Rd, Dallas, TX 75236, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:30 AM – 7:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:30 AM – 7:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:30 AM – 7:00 PM; Thursday: 8:30 AM – 7:00 PM; Friday: 8:30 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 8:30 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Address Components: 3107 (street_number); South Cockrell Hill Road (route); Oak Cliff (neighborhood); Dallas (locality); Dallas County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 75236 (postal_code)
Reviews:
There is something for everyone featured in this store. But if you are VEGETARIAN, VEGAN, or PESCATARIAN and on a tight budget, SHOP HERE FIRST!!!

Seniors get a $1 discount on every $10 spent (the maximum is $5 per total purchase) every Tuesday.

The store is always neat and clean but the organization of the items is somewhat baffling. For example, typically in stores "like items" are grouped on one aisle (not counting special displays and end caps). But if you stroll the aisles of the Grocery Clearance Center you will see groups of items repeated somewhat randomly throughout the store.

That said the pricing is variable in comparison to most stores. Some items are deeply discounted, some are slightly discounted, some show no discount, and some are priced to sell at a higher price than other stores. However, all the items I examined were in good shape and could be placed in your pantry for a long-term storage (unlike many you find at Walmart and pay full price for).

I was able to purchase large bags of fresh Mustard greens (pre-washed and sliced)for $1 each; Annie's vegetarian pizzas for $3.99; and a large variety of Manuka honey and spices. There were lots of fresh veggies in the cooler at an excellent price! And there is always a wide variety of cheese.

But I would be remiss if I didn't bring up "use  and "best by" dates. You have to be mindful to check them before you put the items in your basket. The worst date I found was an item in the freezer section dated June 2022. That date was just a little bit too long ago for me to consider purchasing.

Finally, be very careful on the parking lot because it's full of moon craters. It needs resurfacing in a very bad way. This limits not only where and how you drive but also poses limits on where you park.; I'm hesitant to write a review because I don't want this awesome secret to get out! I love this place, you can always find something that suits you here. They almost always have some kind or cheese, yogurt or other fancy dairy that is a steal of a deal! Sometimes it's a flat of raspberries that I buy and freeze other times it's chips 12/$1. They have lots of stuff that's healthy as well. The staff is always nice and helpful. If you come bring a cooler, and make sure you have plenty of time for the treasure hunt!; Grocery Clearance Center on on 01/02/2023

Hidden Gem alert 🚨 hidden 💎 alert 🚨

Today I visited this small grocery store today. This is not your typical chain grocery store. The items are discounted and their placed on the shelves in the best order possible but the deals are there🕵️‍♂️⚖️🧮🧾. I saw some deals on some items that I definitely will not be going to Kroger's and buying anymore 😆 If you are in the neighborhood or you even close by you have to make this your priority just to walk into this store and walk around and look and see if you see what you really want to get. Today I went in there for some herbs🌿 and spices 🌶️ that I did not think they would have and they had them. This is going to be my new favorite spot to shop for groceries. 👍👍; First visit and the reviews hold true. Definitely a first stop shop.; My “go to” grocery store! I LOVE coming here and so does my family. The amount of money saved here each week blows my mind! My only regret is that I didn’t find you sooner!

Reviews:
Pretty exhausted with this place..
Things are always out of stock
The only dips they have are hummus and spinach artichoke dip, guac and salsa..
Like is that our only options in America?
Over priced for food that isn’t even good for you.
Tom Thumb is essentially just like a more expensive Walmart as a grocery store that has “the appearance of options” meaning it’s a bunch of the same stuff in different packaging 😂
The produce section is a mess and always low quality..
Just spend your dollar somewhere else y’all!

This tiny bag of Brussel Sprouts was over 6 dollars like come on dude 🙄
I’m over it..; Beautiful Father's day cake. I had it costum made. I made sure to ask for something simple and easy I knew they could do. Nothing over the top. They did it so beautifully. Exactly what I wanted. Thank you.; Do not make the mistake of ordering home delivery from this store. An order a week ago was missing half the items that were paid for. I did get a few items that were for someone else's order so they were shorted as well. A call to the store's phone number somehow directed me to the wrong store in Duncanville. Once we figured that out, which took about 45 minutes I was transferred to the correct store where the phone went unanswered for a long period of time. I had to call the meat department who paged the manager, "Austin." Austin was very apologetic and the missing items were promptly delivered. Austin gave me a credit for the missing items as a gesture of good will. That whole episode took an hour and a half from time of delivery until re-delivery was agreed to. Today, a week later, I decided to give them another try and this time only one item was missing. Once again the store phone went unanswered for a long period so I called Customer Support at 877-505-4040 where I was told that re-delivery, due to it being a single item, was unavailable and that a refund would be offered. That was unacceptable so I asked to have the matter escalated and was told that it wouldn't make any difference. I demanded to speak with a manager and the call center agent agreed to transfer me. The phone again went unanswered so the agent contacted the home delivery department where they agreed to bring out the one item. This took about 40 minutes to resolve. This is a recurring problem and not the only issue. (1) "Do not substitute" items get substituted for product I won't eat because its GMO and soy or just not what I ordered. (2) Virtually all of the produce from this store I've had to throw away. Broccoli was rotten and smelled bad out of the bag  as it was delivered. Mushrooms were bad. It's like the shoppers have never cooked a meal or learned how to pick produce. The bananas are tasteless. I don't have this problem with Whole Foods. If you want to be shortchanged, receive bad produce and have,  in the last week, over two hours to waste on the phone trying to resolve their problems this is the store for you. If I could give 0 stars I would.

Update 10/1/24: Received the patronizing AI-generated reply below which shows total insincerity, and based on similar replies going back months, and my previous heart-to-heart with the management demonstrates they have no intention of correcting this dismal store's problems. Went to the Desoto Texas store today and it was like being in a different grocery chain. Desoto store was well-stocked, clean, employees were friendly and the produce was fresh. Will be pursuing getting deliveries from this store as they seem to actually care about their customers.; Tom Thumb on Hampton Avenue on Friday 13, 2023 at 7:26pm

First giving respect to the person in the Delhi area. Who originally helped me with the Tom Thumb app, trying to get the deal on the chicken.

I am mostly impressed with the person who was at the front self checkout area going back and forth between multiple areas. "Ms. Kayla" 🙏😇🇺🇸 kudos to this individual. They went far beyond customer service and making sure the fairness of the deal was there. This person help me navigate the app and made sure what I entered was correct. These things can be tricky for older customers and it's good to have competent individuals there to help navigate us through these trying times. Please Tom Thumb corporate office this should be a future manager 👍👍🇺🇸

El Rio Grande....get you some!!  ,

This boy never mess with people outside keeping it clean and bring almost all stuff. And the way he comunicate is fantastic. He referred me to another food store down the road which I had previously visited and I recommend as well. If you like peachy 'os candy you should try the strawberry ones they carry!!! I die for them!! They also have the BEST Redbull selection in the area!! They have ALL the best flavors!

Name: Town Talk Foods
Address: 121 N Beach St, Fort Worth, TX 76111, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 121 (street_number); North Beach Street (route); Fort Worth (locality); Tarrant County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 76111 (postal_code); 7054 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Amazing gem tucked away in an unassuming portion of Beach St. Super friendly employees & always some great finds. Might take the uninitiated a little bit of openmindedness--you may not find everything on your list or the exact brands to which you are accustomed--but I've been going for 12 years & have discovered numerous brands I now love & have saved much $$$ thanks to shopping there.; Editing my review. I was just told that I have to snake through a line that runs the length of half the store to get in line to checkout on Saturdays, the only day I shop. They even have a security guard to police the process. I waited for about 15 minutes thinking the line was only for the other aisles so I got out to check out and was talked to. I estimated a 45+ minute wait. By the time I got to the register, I would have made up the money I was saving with my time. Let me know when this process changes and I will consider being your customer again. For now, I won't be back. Think of a better system. I will begin discouraging friends and family from visiting town talk.; I no longer live in Texas, but they've always had the bargains if you have a catering business or restaurant can definitely get some good deals there if you have a deep freezer that's even better because you can buy practically the whole animal there I've shot there for the last 20 years they have three stores Weatherford Texas Arlington Texas and North Beach in fort Worth I miss shopping there on a regular basis and I love this store; I like strolling through there every once in a while sometimes I get in there they just had a fresh truck
, the only problem I have is that hamburger meat is still like $5 a pound that should not be; Great Deals!! Tons of uncommon things found here but all your favorites are probably there too. One of the only ways to afford groceries anymore. And the staff is super friendly and helpful. Plus, $2 for a whole bottle of Arby’s sauce!?!? Heck yeah!

Name: Trader Joe's
Address: 2701 S Hulen St, Fort Worth, TX 76109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews:
The wine selection and prices are excellent.  My wife says the flowers are pretty good too.  The staff are super nice and helpful.  They will literally stop what they are doing and walk you to the products you're looking for. Not everything in here is good, but the frozen foods are good.  They do have hard to find and delicious ethnic foods, so that's a plus.  This place does seem to attract the more unique people in society.

Parking is horrendous and the people are not very friendly when trying to find a spot or leave.  Strange because they all seem very polite inside the store.; Carson, was extremely helpful, I drove all the way from S. Arlington for one main item and he got me the item from the back storage. He really saved the day for me.
This store has some genuinely good people working here. The lady at the checkout was also very pleasant. The excellent customer service is one of the reasons I like to shop at this store.; Always enjoy shopping at this store. The parking is not ideal but the helpful staff and store cleanliness make up for it. They sell out of viral items fairly quickly, but most places do. The staff is always willing to help locate items and try to see when more are arriving if able. Good variety and quality items.; I was looking for truly healthy protein bars with no added sugar. Trader Joe's carried a couple I could choose from. One of the clerks was very kind and helpful in guiding me to just what I needed. This store is a little smaller than most I have been in but neatly maintained. The parking is very difficult as there is not an abundance of parking and there is a great deal of traffic.; My first visit!  What an interesting place!  Found  lots of good organic items like coconut oil, flaxseed, chia, and a nice tea selection.   Employees were all very helpful and you could tell they enjoyed working there!

Not a good neighborhood, but the merchandise is way cheaper than QT!; Trash watch your receipt the little girl with glasses will overcharge you and not hand u a receipt checked mine one night online I was overcharged 25$ Gave this store another chance today 6-9-2024 went through the drive handed my navy fed debit card to Indian guy inside and told him to be careful because my card was broke he said he ran it twice and declined amd asked for my pin number im the drive thru so i came in and he gave me a brand new card with a women's name on it. I told him it wasn't my card cause mine was cracked down the middle he immediately bent the card and cut in half with scissors I called the police and they even said this not the first time this happened at this store missed the whole second half of NBA finals and lost my debit card please do not shop here they scam on slot machines overcharge you and steal your property I'm more mad I have to add a new card to ally stuff; Open all night and good service foods okay no complaints; Let's just say this place is the place to go to have some fun and possibly win some money. Reviews: This used to be my go to for quality foods. Over the years I've noticed that they're slowly and subtly replacing real food with hybrids and genetically modified foodstuffs. Now that they've replaced yet another item on my list with a hybrid, I'm down to the last FOUR items of my usual purchases. It's gravely disappointing! :-(; OMG please check out the Iconic cafe!!!!! The soul food plate is amazing and the jerk tacos too 🤤🤤🤤 I would probably eat there much more if closer to home or able to get delivered but I typically make the drive at least once a week. The staff are so sweet!; This is an excellent family owned business. It's a wholesome health shop. Their pharmacy is well stocked with a wide range of vitamins. There's also a small efficient diner where you can get healthy delicious smoothies, while you can also do your groceries shopping. Customer Service is absolutely adorable.; At Ann's I have NEVER met an uneducated, unkind, unconcerned or impassioned individual. They are my go to for all things natural. When I found Hyaluronic acid that cost $40 instead of the $300 that I had been purchasing, I was blown away. Every individual they hire is amazing. Neiman Marcus should adopt their hiring standards of exceedingly customer satisfaction. 5-Star 4- Diamond service is what they offer as well as their products.; What a blessing to be able to have a store/restaurant like this near me! Customer service, selection, and environment has to be one of the best I’ve seen yet🤎 going to have to make more money to shop and eat here regularly

Name: E-Z Mart
Address: 102 US-77, Marietta, OK 73448, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours

Reviews:
Place is straight sketchy!!  Went inside to pay for gas and a drink,  go to the gas pump and tried to fill up but nothing was happening went back inside to ask for help but the guy just printed a receipt showing i didnt pay for gas!! But my card was charged for the gas anyway i asked for refund,  no help given! He asked me to pay again and i refused because i was already charged for the gas and he said there was nothing else he could do so now im haveing to dispute the charge with the bank for this fraudulent charge!!  As the other reviews say this place is just scamming people and should be avoided altogether!!  theres a shell around the corner that’s honest go there instead; Story time!
I left Dallas a little over an hour ago and decided to drive as far north as possible before stopping for gas.
I ended up stopping in Marrietta. The first gas station right off the highway was out of gas. I looked up the next available station and went down the road a little and made a right.
Pulling up I was thinking "Wow, what a hell hole!" I saw 2 double sided pumps. No covering. One pump was for diesel and the other for regular unleaded. The pumps didn't even have card readers!!!
I needed a red bull anyway so going inside wasn't a huge inconvenience. As I walked in the man greeted me cheerfully and asked how I was doing. I responded as I grabbed my red bull and went to the counter to pay.
He made such nice easy going conversation, it was relieving and a definite change of pace. Then as I walked back to the pump I thought to myself...Wow. If I didn't need a red bull from anywhere I was getting gas I wouldn't go in. I wouldn't come in contact with a single person, especially such a delightful person.
You really do need to stop and smell the roses sometimes. Technology rules our lives, especially mine. But setting all of the technology aside there are really amazing people left in the world. They just tend to be overlooked for our convenience.; The store in Marietta Oklahoma has the poorest customer service. I have been shopping in that store for over 10 years. The manager now and the clerks are not only keeping the store nasty and not cleaning it their faces when you walk in, looks like they can't stand customers, there is never even a hi any more or welcome, you just get this sour look like why are you in here. I have spent a lot of money in this store over the years, but not anymore not as long as these people are running it, it is aweful.; LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE...Awesome Sweet Tea always ready....EZ Mart girls are out of this world as far as customer service is concerned...always smiling and talking to every customer...Tiffany is the best tho...NEVER know what she might say or do...LOVE HER!! If you haven't stopped by then get off your butt and GO GO GO!! Tell em I sent ya lol; It's been going downhill for a long time and yesterday my card was charged over 200 in fraudulent charges just to find out they had a scammer at the register. So everyone who has used them needs to cancel their card if you used it at THE REGISTER. Inside job or not you guys need real help all around. How does that even happen

I prefer Meijer as they excel in both. I only shop here as a last minute convenience.; This Kroger branch has best Sushi! Amazing collection of flowers and home plants. Their cheese collection is good.; It's a great store with a fantastic array of choices. The big draw back is checking out. Just reopened after the tornado and the store looks amazing. Big clean restrooms and fresh food . Would definitely stop again!; Still closed down. Don't know when they'll reopen.; the girls that run this place are there to please. they don't get much to work with but you always get a smile and break if u need one.

soda pops are $1.35 44 oz and down. some fried food. breakfast stuff. pizza stuff.

I am happy we have people like this running this place.; For what it is, I can’t complain. Restroom was functional and supplied with the necessities. I imagine it’s been a long time since it had a thorough cleaning though. The store was small, but well stocked. The lady at the register was quite friendly. Prices reasonable. Fuel price very reasonable. Parking for 40 or so trucks.; Nice truck stop, lots of parking for 18 wheelers. Bathrooms are less than spectacular. Sinks always dirty and bathroom always smells like urine. Using the toilet the cracks are so big between the door you can see people taking a dump. Food is always hot and fresh and the help is always nice and friendly. Would give 5 stars if bathrooms were in better shape.

Reviews:
Fiesta Mart #71 at 3434 W Illinois Ave, Dallas, TX 75211

Neighborhood grocery store that can totally cater to the neighborhood that I live in. Interesting this morning my coworker comes in with some chicken wings that look fabulous. Their hot bar is basically a restaurant you have a seating area inside. Plenty of produce 🥒🥑🌶️🫚, their meat 🥩🍗🍖 section is humongous. They have alcohol and beer on the far side and you could even buy shoes inside this place. It is definitely set up for the community to achieve more at this grocery store than most others. One of my favorite things to get out of here is the fresh cut fruit 🍉🍍🥭 up front. They also have fresh bakery 🥐🥖🫓 breads and treats 😋 Always seems to have hot tamales.; OMG! The sign clearly says express 15 items or less and this lady continues to ring this lady’s groceries up like she can’t tell she has well over 200 items!!! 🙄🙄🙄; Do you like waiting an hour to check out with a gallon of milk? Then this is the place for you!  On God, they'll have lines to the back of the store and like 3 cashiers.

Prices? Just bad. The cheapest thing there are vegetables and meat. But $5 for a dozen maximum cruelty eggs? $2.50 for a pound of off brand spaghetti? So on and so on.

At least they have stock and mostly keep the drug addicts out; Pupusas on the weekend were a great addition, giving it 3 starts there should be a limit on how many pupusas you can order, instead of waiting on large order of 20 and 30, some just want 2 or 3 but end up leaving because of large orders; The lady frontend manager was very rude. I'm disabled and was having trouble starting the handicap cart they have for customer in-store use so I had to find someone for assistance and the cashier's would not even help but just point fingers in directions like wow great help. Finally I found I'm assuming the manager lady and she rudely said "Well it's not gonna work without key"
How was I supposed to know
Then I asked for a key and her reply was "Do you have Id". OMG I felt like she was being mean not even smiling as she continued doing whatever she was ..I gave her my id and she gave me a key and didn't offer if I need help knowing where to insert it....I feel as she could been more polite and more of assistance. I certainly think I won't be going back to this store unless absolutely need to

Name: Central Market
Address: 4651 West Fwy, Fort Worth, TX 76107, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 4651 (street_number); West Freeway (route); Sunset Heights (neighborhood); Fort Worth (locality); Tarrant County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 76107 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Oh my soul! This is something everyone must witness to believe. If this is your local grocery store you don’t know how fortunate you are. Been, and lived, in many locals now and nothing comes close to this experience. Clearly the best grocery store bar none. Brain and belly overload, clean throughout even while busy, friendly and knowledgeable staff in every department, and leaves you in a sort of euphoria rarely achieved. Central Market definitely set the proverbial bar extremely high. Keep up the great work!; I came here for lunch at the Cafe and made my own salad. The salad ingredients were so fresh and there were so many options to choose from. There's also a sandwich line and tons of ready-to-eat choices for pastas, meats, salads, BBQ, rice, and more. There's a nice sushi section and different types of coffee. It was actually a bit overwhelming for my first visit to see how much food there was. Plenty of seating inside, outside, and upstairs by their cooking school.; Central Market is just the best supermarket, this location in the heart of Texas! Is a foodie paradise that never disappoints. With its vast selection of fresh produce, artisanal products, and gourmet treats, Central Market elevates grocery shopping to a whole new level. Whether you're searching for exotic ingredients for a culinary adventure or simply stocking up on everyday essentials, this supermarket has you covered. The vibrant atmosphere and knowledgeable staff add to the shopping experience, making each visit a pleasure. From the bustling bakery to the expansive cheese section, Central Market is a must-visit destination for anyone passionate about food.; We went to this market first thing in the morning and bought every piece of king crab legs for my daughters birthday. Two days later we cooked the crab legs and they were completely bad. Very strong ammonia smell. The cost was $288. I called the seafood department and because I tossed the receipt (yes... very bad mistake on my part) they would not refund my money which is totally understandable. I did speak with Mark on the seafood dept and appreciated that he would give me crab to replace, but living an hour away this was not feasible.
I drove to this store for a premium product. I received great service, but a terrible product. Beware when buying seafood from this store.; I love the incredible selection and variety provided by Central Market.  You can't find a  fresher selection of meat and seafood. I really enjoy visiting this location.

Address: 505 W Santa Rosa Ave, Edcouch, TX 78538, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 2:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 2:00 PM

Reviews:
Authentic rustic Tex - Mex busy breakfast and early lunch place. Fast service, booming drive through. Great bacon & egg tacos (smoked bacon😋).; Usually a great place but today in the morning I went by and bought breakfast tacos potatoe and egg with beans and cheese and in one of my tacos there was something black it was big not sure what it was I almost choked! I was so disappointed ☹️; Awesome breakfast tacos. The staff is on the ball here! Lunch is well served! Highly recommend to anyone passing through here. Tables to sit and eat.; I had been told about Rios meat market.
Finally decided to stop.
Now I wish I had stopped here sooner.
Their food is awesome.
The food is old school home cooking.
It really has mom's cooking; Update: they no longer sell meat. The tacos are ok but the overall prices are expensive. The large bag of Takis are 3.99+tax! Insane, when I can get it at Fast Track for less and at Walmart for 2.33. They recently increased the price of flour tortillas so they're now $0.50 each. Really. I love Mexican sodas but they lean towards the $4 mark, with Joya being the most expensive. Rios is successful manily due to lack of competition. If Stripes were closer, they would stand no chance. They have a lot of clientele especially in the mornings because who wants to drive to the La Villa Stripes? Even though Rios is literally like 30 seconds from my house I'd rather drive all the way to HEB or Walmart to buy chips, sodas or tortillas for a lot cheaper. I only come here when I'm desperate lol

Reviews: Excellent international market with a huge variety of products from all over Asia, as well as Mexico and Africa. The produce is excellent and varied and the meat and seafood selection is amazing. Make sure to grab some of the hot and prepared foods before they run out!; Great place for this kind of food.. Tons of ramen... Special fruits.. And a great assortment of fresh whole fish.. We had them cut some salmon filets.. Literally the best I have ever eaten..; I stopped in to acquire some specialty items for my shop. Great selection and prices! There's an array of everything you could hope for: produce, sauces, noodles, canned goods, cookware, home decor, etc. Some things, I hadn't seen since my childhood in Malaysia. I will definitely be back.; This place has everything to knock out a 5 star meal any day of the week. Great spice selection married with an untouched meat department that has all the meaty bits and parts you could ever ask for. 5 stars.; This is my go to destination for Asian related groceries and snacks. They have quite the variety from: Asian fruits, ice cream, candy, snacks, ready to go meals, chips, crackers, spices, seasoning, sauces, coffee, vegetables, pho ingredients, ramen noodles, beverages, cooking utensils, fish, crabs, shrimp, crawfish, quail eggs, large bags of rice, and so much more.  You will just have to stop in and see what all they offer!

Reviews: Come here primarily to buy ripe and sweet plantains. They have well seasoned carnitas and asada too. Their bakery section is great as well. Love their delicious corn bread.; I love the butcher shop in this supermarket, all the gentlemen are very good-looking and polite. Very nice people, and very respectful. To make it even more perfect, I would like them to serve me a coffee every time I go. Lol.; If I could I would give them zero stars. I came in for some pills saw four employees at the registers and no one  greets you. If they were busy I would understand but not even that. I walk over to the medicine counter and nothing. Reviews: A star for each mouse I saw. One was crawling along the back of the snack shelves. I love a questionably clean chinese grocery store as much as the next person, but nah - you don’t want to SEE mice.; I have been shopping here for many years. Same convenience, good collection of Chinese groceries, vegetables, fresh fish, seafood, meat,  etc. , the same mess and crowds and the same hardworking people. They also make extra parking lot available during weekends right next to the main parking lot and it is always convenient to park and shop there.; Still the best Chinese grocery store in Boston, always has great produce, and a huge selection of teas. I do not lie the whole range of snacks is always my weakness. Checkout and service has always been great. Not to mention having your own customer park lot in the city always makes going a breeze.; Well let’s not judging the cleanness or the attitudes of the cashiers. It’s Chinese market, we came here for the groceries that we don’t get from Whole Foods or Costco. They carry enough options for seafood, which is a huge plus. Vegetables are fresh. Meats are ok. Need more Asian snacks though.; This place was busy when I went there (on a Saturday). It was relatively less expensive than its neighboring store (New York Marts). I recommend going to this shop first before the other one nearby. You'll get a wider variety of vegetables at a fraction of the cost. Will be coming here more often.

Name: Babylon Fruit Market
Address: 36886 Ryan Rd, Sterling Heights, MI 48310, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Address Components: 36886 (street_number); Ryan Road (route); Sterling Heights (locality); Macomb County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 48310 (postal_code); 4455 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
ordered a mixed tray yesterday one of the items was completely spoiled and smelled very bad. I was so impressed in front of my guests. I called the store to let them know. Her response (OH I WILL TALK TO HIM AND SEE. Didn’t even apologize or tried to make it up to me.
Note: I ordered the tray on Sunday to be ready Monday at 3:00 pm therefore I want to change one of the items so I called around 10:00 am Monday asking them if I can cancel one item on the tray and add another one. She said I can’t do that because they already started it so I was like WHAT my order not until 3:00 pm why would they start now she was like oh no just the round koba must be boiled now. So I was like yeah please don’t let start my order now that’s way too early and won’t even look fresh. Therefore now I believe that the whole tray was made earlier that’s why the koba halab smelled and tasted sour . Other items were okay but at this point I don’t trust it at all. I just don’t understand why people treat others just like the way they want to be treated be honest and work extra harder to make your customers happy. Don’t start customers order 6 hours before promising time just because you want to save money making your employees work part time only. Anyway never ever again that place is no no to me .; Staff and owner are very friendly and helpful. They don't act pretentious or have their noses in the air. This is the only place I purchase my homemade yogurt (liban) from. The thick layer of cream skin is so delicious and such a treat. But the best part about the yogurt here is that when they make it they slightly burn the pot of milk so it adds this incredible smokey flavor that just makes it absolutely perfect. You can't find this anywhere else. If you've never tried Iraqi yogurt before get it from here, you won't be disappointed.; Thank you, Babylon Markets. The bread in Babylon Markets is very excellent and I give it 100%
SAM from Alliston Ontario; The staff here is great.  Big helpful smiles.  The breads, fresh and amazing.  Sometimes the fruit has fruit flies, so ALWAYS wash your fruit no matter where you get it from.  Watch an episode of ‘MONSTERS INSIDE ME’.  You’ll be washing your store bought fruit every time.

But the customers in here leave a lot to be desired.  Some are just pigs.  I’ve had men take cuts in front of me. It’s like you’re not even there.  The meat counter; well for one thing the butcher can’t speak English.  The second thing, everything there is covered with blood.  The handles on the freezer doors, smeared with blood.  The butchers apron loaded with blood.   I just wonder if the health inspector has been by recently?

Lastly, never, NEVER buy the mixed olives, pickles, beets, baby corn etc., from the open salad bar thing in front of where the Iraqi bread is baked.  On more then one occasion I have witnessed bare hands & fingers help themselves to the pickles, olives, and beets.  I saw a man with a cigar in one hand (between fingers) shift the cigar over to the other hand and then his smoking bare hand goes in for a beet which he immediately gulps down (I saw him help himself over & over again while waiting to fill his bread bag)!  Just yesterday I witnessed an older lady go in the olives for her free sample.  I said rather loudly”that’s gross!”  Then I asked her “Would you buy those olives if my bare hand took those olives?” She then waves her hand at me and says “I no speak English.”   Well she understood something cause.she
then put a few olives into a plastic container and walked around the ,store munching away.

So here’s my review in a nutshell:  their baked bread is excellent,  Their employees are always smiling and seem happy, they’re AWESOME!  Their produce is win some, lose some with the freshness and fruit flies,  Their relish/salad bar, STAY AWAY!  Their butcher counter STAY AWAY.  And their customers/clients, well you can’t make a silk purse with a sows hide.

Have a good day!; Just be careful they will try to steal from you or giving you a bad product or expired. The staff is not professional at all and the way they dealing with customer is very bad they lied to me and the manager and the owner do not want to admit it. End of the day just do not deal with them and keep your business with somewhere else that appreciate and respect you as a customer. They are the worst ever.

Name: Tu Nutricentro La Casita Rosa
Address: Carolina, 00985, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews: Excellent customer service; Hello! I visited the pink house nutricentre by mistake, thinking that I would find food like in other nutricentres on the island, Mr. asks me what I'm looking for, I answer food and he tells me that there is no food there, and I continue to tell him to go into the center of nutrition thinking that there was, He tells me that this is not a nutrition center and that it is WIC (until that moment not knowing what WIC is) he tells me that he has been working there for more than 20 years and that it is only for children but no for adults, but then he also tells me that it is for pregnant women (are pregnant women adults or not?) The gentleman got upset, I proceed to give him information about what a nutricenter would be and he tells me no and that I disrespected him because he has been there for years. there... here I wonder, the WIC is supposed to offer nutritional education to ADULTS, breastfeeding support that is for ADULTS, NUTRITIOUS FOODS for ADULTS... is it fair that this gentleman is so uninformed and that a government institution is not suitable for future mothers on the island? Annoyed he kicked me out of his premises, but it makes me think of other people who come in to ask for information and this man does not know, it is urgent that he be given adequate training or that he be changed areas, it is not possible for him to receive funds from the government federal and that store has nothing! Who regulates these places?;

Reviews: Great food; Love; The lady who helped me was very kind and cordial every time I visited her. The food was very good. This place was my family's daily staple while we were visiting the area for several weeks and didn't have a kitchen.; They treated us very friendly, we ordered takeout. Because of the rain we couldn't leave the Pontezuela area so they saved the day for us. We ordered sancocho and the dish of the day, chops with congris rice and everything tasted very good and the portions were generous (two servings each).; Good place for grocery store

Reviews: The food was SO fresh and delicious- the nachos hit the spot! The store was very clean and well stocked. We loved this place!; The store is great!  Clean, lots of stock and the produce selection is tremendous!; Every other store needs to take lessons on stocking and fronting up merchandise from this business.  I have years of experience doing this type of work and I've never been so Impressed, especially on my first visit.  Pictures included; Driving back home and we saw La Unica and that they had a taqueria. We immediately pulled over and got these delicious al pastor tacos. Let me tell you there were the BEST street style tacos I have ever had. There was so much meat inside, the food was incredibly fresh, and it was delicious. Loved the salsa that went with them too. If I’m ever back in the area, I’m going back and getting more! Highly recommend; I love them. They had wonderful Coffee ☕☕☕ Saturday after Hurricane Helene! They were so kind.

Luckily I tasted it before giving it to my toddler.; Try their hoagies it's way better than The Meat Stop.; Nice clean store well stocked with friendly owner and staff. It's great to have a locally owned small business.; Love shopping here. Great customer service.; Everything that I needed from NY is now right around the corner. The owners are just like the ones I know n luv in Brooklyn..I luv it. West Indian, Caribbean and American products/groceries/meats,  they also make GREAT hero sandwiches.
Being from Brooklyn, I am happy this place exist!!!

Name: Sayar Market
Address: 3 Everett St #3e, Revere, MA 02151, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
The company is well-known Algerian, and the sticker that appears on the cover says “Made in Algeria,” and when you remove the sticker, it says “Made in Morocco,” and the bar is an Emirati code, and the quality of the product is not the same as that in its country of origin, Algeria.  What is this ?  Please respect customers. Please investigate; Arabic market Everything is new And diverse The shop is clean and tidyOutside of Boston But the prices are clearly high, and I have not tried buying meat and  And I don't know prices
You will notice that prices have become high everywhere and are not the same as before, unfortunately; The worst service in the meat department. No sense of urgency, expect to wait 35-45 min + even if you’re second or third in line. On different occasions Iv come here everytime worse then the next. They trim meat for trays instead of helping you and even see that you wait long yet don’t care. I waited 45 min behind one other customer  to be told they don’t even have chicken breast. Seriously you don’t have chicken breast as a butcher? Never again this place; Very good Arab market that has all you need. Fresh meat. Nice staff. I was served by Bachar. He was the best and it was a very satisfying experience during a very busy time of Al Aid; These sweets are expired, they refused to exchange them or give me my money back...this is the third time they have done this, it was highly unprofessional.

Name: Super G Mart Charlotte
Address: 7323 E Independence Blvd, Charlotte, NC 28227, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 7323 (street_number); East Independence Boulevard (route); Idlewild South (neighborhood); Charlotte (locality); Mecklenburg County (administrative_area_level_2); North Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 28227 (postal_code)
Reviews:
An excellent Asian grocery store. If you're looking for any asian ingredients, snacks, drinks, etc, this is the store to visit. You will find a wide range of kitchenware products.

The restaurants inside seem to be great. We only tried one, as we came here 1 hour before the store closed. The aisles are clean, and products are well organized and easy to read the products and prices.

Parking is shared with other businesses, and it is easy to find a parking space. There is an entrance only and exit only for this store.; ASIAN dishes! Come find your ingredients fast. This place is a wonderful sight to stay and just look around. Take your Asian cookbooks with you! So amazingly organized to see everything. There are ingredients from other countries too. Pick yourself up off the couch and go! Also, the pastry shop? 😲 OMG!; First time visiting Super G and was thoroughly impressed. My wife works in consumer food goods and loads of items that are growing in demand. Including a picture of the incredible selection of ramen from multiple countries with flavors you won't find anywhere else at very reasonable prices; Best store ever ! The store is a combo for those that are looking for Eur-Asian , Indian and Mex-Latino products. i was able to find so many Turkish items which was totally unexpected. They also have a great produce section with lots of fresh herbs and other items i did not know i needed 😊; For cleanliness of the store two stars. For cost of the store— it’s a rip off on many many items. We went to the store looking for 5lb packages of yakisoba noodles. And there weren’t any! There was small 16 oz packages for $4.49! Definitely not worth the price. You can get those at chef’s store for way better deal! The store has a lot of stuff but it’s waaaay overpriced!

It's a good little gas station. Not really much to say except my utter disappointment because they have a sign that says "dont say dang at the price" when like none of the prices are on the product shelves. But I am absolutely not behind it.; Very nice workers and clean store; Wow no restrooms for shopping customers
Don’t shop here
