Name: Super 88 Market
Address: 188 Commercial St, Malden, MA 02148, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 188 (street_number); Commercial Street (route); Malden (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02148 (postal_code); 7306 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
They have most things here. Lots of produce, meats, kitchen items.

Big parking lot. Easy to find parking usually.

If you’re cooking Asian dishes. This place will probably have it. Chinese, Vietnamese, Indian, Korean, Japanese food.

There were only two check out lanes open. You might have to wait depending on their staffing.

Compared to hmart this place has more variety options. But surprisingly the pots and butane were cheaper at hmart.

I like to get sauces condiments, dry goods here but vegetables and meats from hmart or other stores.

Nice Asian grocery store near  Malden; Uhmmm, I go there for certain ingredients you just can't find at your local stores. They have a good variety of unique greens and food. Fair warning the store requires you to pinch your nose a bit. It just has its own aroma in there. But if you're on a mission to get your ingredients, you will do what you gotta do and not notice it too much. I'm convinced the odor is either from the meat dept or the fish dept. Anyways, a nice selection of foods, decent prices, not bad, the seafood is a hit or miss. But overall, it's an OK place; Check out closely your receipts when shopping here. They might charge you the full original price for those items on which they put discount tags! I purchased sachima showing “2 for $6.99” and they charged me undiscounted price, $9.98. And their excuse went just “someone forgot to take down the discount tag”.; Great supermarket, but the quality of produce is not always immaculate. You'll get a rotted onion every now and then.

A most delicious chilli crisp selection.; Friggin adore this store. Just a vast selection to get lost in. The Candy aisle didn't disappoint either. Nor the drink aisle ❤️. Can't wait to go back. Takes Cash/Card/EBT. Definitely worth exploring and trying new things. Spoiler the winter melon tastes like a water filled cucumber :p

Name: Hong Kong Supermarket
Address: 1 Brighton Ave, Boston, MA 02134, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 1 (street_number); Brighton Avenue (route); Packard's Corner (neighborhood); Boston (locality); Suffolk County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02134 (postal_code)
Reviews:
A decent little store with Asian products. Many of the things I got while living in China. A few Asian restaurants in the same building.; Opened the frozen buns I JUST bought and it's completely full of mold. The expiration date even says it's good through end of the year.; It's a decent Asian market. You also have competition such as H Mart as well as super 88. Super 88 generally has the best selection and normally is the largest of the stores.; This is such a great place to buy meats for hotpot or kbqq at home! There's also parking available and has a nice foodcourt with lots of options. It is an affordable and accessible place for college students to buy Asian veggies, fruits, snacks, seasonings, etc.; The shop is located near Boston University, where there is quite high demand for Chinese grocery. The owner of the shop takes advantage of this and the price of most of their groceries is higher than average, compared to other Chinese grocery stores in Boston area. While
they do have a large variety of Chinese groceries, some of their groceries, such as vegetables, gingers, fish, etc. are not fresh. The workers there are not friendly, either.

Name: Grocerind & Inis Kitchen
Address: 624 Lakestone Commons Ave, Fuquay-Varina, NC 27526, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 8:30 PM
Address Components: 624 (street_number); Lakestone Commons Avenue (route); Lakestone Village (neighborhood); Fuquay-Varina (locality); Wake County (administrative_area_level_2); North Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 27526 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Ever since this restaurant opened my husband and I have been wanting to try this place. Everytime we try to go in its always pack and we end up leaving. Today we finally got to try this restaurant and the food was amazing. The food was so flavorful every dish had it's own unique taste. So glad we stopped by today and had the chance to try it out. My favorite was the butter chicken. They are super friendly here. We will be back to try something new.; I being a pure vegetarian and was tempted to eat paneer biryani. So, I ordered Paneer biryani today from this place. When I opened the box it was topped with very good looking paneer. Then I took one spoon from the box what I saw was traumatizing. It had big chunks of chicken peices inside. I was in a shock for few minutes and then I had to trash the entire thing. This is the last thing being an India you expect from an Indian restaurant. Highly disappointed and never going to order anything from this place. Stay away from this restaurant guys!!!!; Let’s start with, I love Indian food. I spend many parts of summers in the UK, and I’m always looking for a good curry over there. So when I heard of this place, that is more authentic and smaller, I rushed over. I ordered the chicken korma before my recent visit to the UK (June 2024) and tho I liked it, I wasn’t excited about how sweet it was (almost like extra sugar was added). But I had it again after my trip, just now, and it was perfect. So whatever you’re doing now (July 2024) unless if it’s just happenstance one or both times, keep doing it. I’ve also had their $10 fill your plate deal, and it does not disappoint, actually the opposite! The food is flavorful, and delicious. I was raised eating various southeast Asian foods with friends and neighbors. This tastes like home to me. Thank you!  Also get yourself a PAPAD or naan from the freezer section to have some for later too with any leftovers…. They also have some class UK snacks, so that’s a plus. I love that it’s grocery and a cafe!; Great little find. This cafeteria style eatery serves a chefs special combo meal for $13. It comprises of a variety of small dishes presented on a tray with dividers. The person helping us was awesome explaining and showing us the different dishes.  The spice level was about 6 out of 10. They also have an A La Carte menu if you are not in a rush.
Today I didn't have time to check out the attached grocery store, next time!; The food is absolutely fantastic.  Very delicious! Love that  Fuquay is growing and it’s great to get a larger variety of food types.  I love spicy food. This food definitely has a little kick for those who enjoy that. If you don’t they have options for you as well.  Also the grocery has a great variety of hard to find vegetables and spices.  They carry Halal Butchered meat as well.  The owners are wonderful and kind people.  Meeting them would also be a lovely part of your experience as well.

Name: Hong Kong Supermarket

Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews: Certain things you have to get at the Asian market #sushi #homemadesushi; Wonderful source of ingredients, snacks, and kitchen tools that you can't find anywhere else. Cheap bags of fresh chicken bones help me keep the freezer stocked with soup base through the winter.; Wife finds fresh grown food here. The fish is amazing and shrimp is cheap and fresh!! You can have fish cut while you watch!! We come here often for Asian vegetables you don't see at major markets. Noodles and Raman you only get at Asian markets. We love this place..; I use to love to go this place for grocery shopping when they have a section for bakery and bbq area. You able to get roasted duck, bbq pig, and bbq sea food. That area is long gone.; make sure to check the expiry dates on perishable items, I didn't find expiry dates on minced garlic and ginger, other than that veggies and fruits are great plus at reasonable price. check the section where they keep different sauces if you like me make a lot of stir fry and Chinese dishes it's really a game changer.

Name: 99 Asian Supermarket
Address: 60 Broadway, Malden, MA 02148, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Address Components: 60 (street_number); Broadway (route); Malden (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02148 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The fresh fish variety is incredible. By far my favorite place to buy fresh fish. The fresh vegetable selection is also really great.

The food court is also fantastic. Great variety of choices with 3 different restaurants to choose from. And the sushi and donburi place is *the only* sushi place I've found in the Boston area that serves Egg Don. It's sublime, the ultimate in comfort food. Give it a try!; Love this place.  Go here for quality produce and Banh Mi Ba Le!  Finally, I don't have to go to Dorchester for a great authentic Viet option.; Prices are the prices these days but I think they are off by 25 to 75 cents a pound on a lot of things.  10 to 20 cents higher on cilantro for instance.  It's nickel and diming but it adds up.  Still they have a great seafood counter and all the things you need.  I haven't tried the food court yet but it looks good!  I might next week check it out; This place is huge I didnt smell anything not sure what other people were talking about the bahn mi place was closed I was bumed out but yea 1st time here they have  large huge variety of things very excited to have found this place noodles rice pots teas spices  drinks seafood dumpling frozen hot pot meat and fish balls you name it live fish and crabs fruits you don't usually see snacks like shredded squid yum anime and pokemon logo drinks  bring your own bag or you pay 20 cents per bag cashier was polite you go in one entrance and go out a separate exit ill definitely  go again great quality of instant noodle and regular noodles this place isn't hmart  but it's still good; Beware of 7-day return/ exchange policy on house-hold item.

I purchased a $53 rounded-bottom wok on 03/03/2024. On 03/17/2024 after a 45 minute drive, I came to the store for grocery shopping and to exchange for a flatted-bottom wok.
I was taken by surprise when the customer service person refused to do an exchange. She circled to the 7-day return/ exchange policy at the bottom of the receipt. She also called a “manager”.

However, a few minutes later, a lady showed up, grabbed the receipt and pointed to the print of the 7-day return/ exchange policy on the receipt and said, “see here, and I can’t do anything”, and left.

Attached are the photos of the wok and the original receipt.

Again, please beware of the 7-day return/ exchange policy.

Name: Truong Thinh Supermarket
Address: 1305 Dorchester Ave, Boston, MA 02122, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 1305 (street_number); Dorchester Avenue (route); Dorchester (neighborhood); Boston (locality); Suffolk County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02122 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Delve into Vietnamese culture and let your taste buds explore what this World has to offer. All with a quick trip to this market and helped by the amazing, friendly staff. Also, several Vietnamese shops and restaurants in the immediate area.; When I go here to shop... The employees are reserved. Not altogether pleasant.  But the seafood is decent in a pinch.  I think if I was treated better as Customer.  My rating would be totally higher.; I could find many Vietnamese dried foods and ingredients here with good price. I hope next time shopping carts and baskets would be cleaner.; Caution: This supermarket's practices are incredibly deceptive. Numerous instances of overcharging have been reported by both acquaintances and family members. Despite our initial skepticism, we too fell victim to their tactics.

1) Inattentiveness can result in overcharges for a few items.

2) Instances of items being double-charged have also been noted.

3) Customers using EBT cards should be particularly vigilant, as they may be charged for more than their actual purchase.

I strongly advise anyone considering shopping here to remain vigilant during checkout, meticulously review their receipts before leaving, as the market tends to exploit inattentiveness, leading to additional charges. This predicament has affected almost all of our acquaintances, neighbors, and even ourselves.; Cashier name Thuy is rude , she didn't even say hello or thank you to customers . I only had 1 bag of green lettuce but she over charged 2 . She kept talking to her coworker while scanning items . That's impolite and unprofessional when doing customers service

Name: Surepinoy Oriental Food Mart
Address: 145 Water St, Quincy, MA 02169, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 7:30 PM; Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 7:30 PM; Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 7:30 PM; Thursday: 9:30 AM – 7:30 PM; Friday: 9:30 AM – 7:30 PM; Saturday: 10:30 AM – 7:30 PM; Sunday: 9:30 AM – 7:30 PM

Reviews: SO MANY CHOICES! I love it! There's a huge selection of pan de sal, hopia, mamon, polvoron, Goldilocks rolls, breakfast items, snacks. Brought me back to memory lane when I saw a can of Broas, Milo, Boy Bawang, etc. It was so funny that I got so excited like a little kid that my husband would always tell me how my eyes lit up with joy whenever we go in a Filipino grocery store. So far THE BEST Pinoy variety store I've been to in this area of MA.; Very helpful for delivery of Balikbayan box (via LBC Express). The lady in charge was extremely helpful to me. Although not my reason to visit, I noticed a wide selection of Philippino food favorites. They accept a standard "large" Uhaul box; sea shipping was $85 via LBC with a 10-12 week estimate.; Extensive selection of Filipino food products,  including frozen items. Not the most welcoming staff. They're just there to ring up your items and make sure you don't steal anything.; There is a good variety of Filipino food, including fresh-baked, canned & pre-packaged, refrigerated (balut!) and frozen (Magnolia ice cream!). You can purchase spices, spice packages and some personal care/beauty products. The personnel are very friendly & helpful.; I checked this place on 3.3.2018. The people working here are friendly. Salamat po mga ate. Sa uulitin po.

Name: Ebisuya Japanese Market
Address: 65 Riverside Ave, Medford, MA 02155, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 11:30 AM – 6:30 PM
Address Components: 65 (street_number); Riverside Avenue (route); Medford (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02155 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This store was kind of a disappointment! The tiny Japanese grocery store near where we lived in Greenwich CT was one fourth the size and had much better selections. This store was also pricy and while it seemed they have authentic Japanese goods, they're missing key staples like shoku pan milk bread.; Great local Japanese market with a good selection of fresh produce, frozen items and prepared foods as well as random stationary and utensils.

I stopped by for the 'summer festival' event on 8/13/23 and picked up the freshly made okonomiyaki and takoyaki ($6 each) - tastes just like what you'd get at a stall in Osaka, though I did have to spend 40 minutes in line for that.; Lovely store that me and my husband will be frequenting! We’ve eaten at the restaurant portion of the shop twice and it was delicious, and we’re having fun trying the various snacks and candies they have in stock. The staff is very helpful and friendly!; My wife and I recently participated in a sushi-making class at Ebisuya. We both had a wonderful time and learned a great deal from our instructor, Chef Tucker. We felt the class was a great value and a fantastic way to spend and evening. I appreciated the small size (limited to 5 participants) and thoughtful instruction. Everything we made was absolutely delicious, but we particularly liked the torched salmon belly. We hope Ebisuya will continue to offer classes in the future (hopefully at different skill levels). Many thanks to Chef Tucker and the entire Ebisuya staff.; I have been literally looking everywhere for a legit Japanese market like the ones I used to frequent to for years in Japan as a little one. I'm not talking H Mart or other Asian grocers with "all-things Asian". Not that I have anything against them, and I definitely frequent them for most of my Asian needs! But I was looking for a place with anything and all Japanese, and I happened to find it right next to our hotel in Medford of all places. They have full stock on just about anything you would find in a supermarket in Japan, from frozen goods and fresh seafoods to kitchenwares and school supplies. They even have a small restaurant with freshly made bento and made-to-order sushi, AND a fully functioning automatic Toto toilet/bidet in their restroom!

For a while now I've been craving arabiki (Japanese sausage) and ever since I left Japan I've only had it once more at Japadog in NYC before they closed. I was nearly brought to tears of joy when I saw that they carried the sausages here, and instantly bought several packs to take home. Among other unique offerings they also had soy sauce dispensers with all different kinds of soy sauce to self service from, and entire sections of Japanese pastries and snacks.

We also ordered some fresh made bento and sushi, and were extremely pleased. The oyakodon was to die for, and it was made with haenuki rice, which brought back some fond memories as a child. The tamago nigiri was amazing as well, not to mention the hamachi, tuna, and octopus nigiri we ordered. The only downside, if being picky, is that they don't have any alcoholic beverages. They do have non-alcoholic beer, but nothing that would make you tipsy. No worries there for us, however. We can find them widely available elsewhere.

Parking is on the street, so don't forget to pay the meter, it's only 25 cents for 15mins, or if you're like us, walk from the hotel.

We could easy spend a whole day here if we wanted to! I know for a fact that we will be making routine stops here if we are in the Boston area again, it's definitely worth the trip!

We were able to get out of the car and ran into Neptune Convenience store as we were in shock/panicking. The two men working locked the doors behind us and made us feel safe and comfortable in order to call the police. I couldn’t have asked for a better ending to a scary situation. Even though they did not totally understand what was going on or what had happened they acted quickly and that’s all I could have asked for. I don’t know much more about the convenience store but I am so thankful for the two men working last night!!; They are over charging for food, they claim food stamps won't cover foods milk n bread n charge me cash, the owner's son wouldn't let me husband leave the store by holding onto the food stamp card so he held him against his will and then the comments about not liking your kind which is Italian he don't like. Regardless nobody should get treated that way. If you want to see the video hit me up on Facebook and I'll show you were it is on my husband's Facebook a live video of the whole interaction. I couldn't give no stars or I would've. I want to tell department of transitional assistance about price gouging, charging my food stamps twice they day, the isle of expired snacks that have been removed, and refusing to take snap for certain foods they decide. Just record in the store n it's a public store n they recording you then you can record them so protect yourself. God bless XoJaynaoX; Charged me 18.99 twice and refused to give me my refund after I showed them the charges on my card I'm never shopping here again and no one who works here knows the bosses number smh.

Since my first review wasn't truthful let me see it in the order that it happened I come in on Christmas Eve and I purchased items that equal up to 18.99 now I purposely only put $20 on my card because I wasn't expecting to spend over that and the first time he charged me it charged my card I told him he charged my card he still told me it was declined so I transferred another 20 to pay for it a second time to see that both times will post to my account the next day but they were closed on Christmas Day so I go in the day after Christmas to get my refund in they make me wait until they verify that it went to their account when I show them that it posted on my account so if the money is debited from my account that should mean it's in your account shouldn't make me wait 3 days after the incident to get my money back and make me go back and forth. You wanted a better review buddy you got it I was just giving you a shorter review but you want to get cocky like you guys didn't refuse my first refund you giving me a refund now but it's how many days later that's ridiculous that's the ridiculous part that's the one star that you guys are getting.; I prefer local business to chains like Kappy's but this one has a long way to go in terms of prices and convenience.

Have time to fool around but not to post prices? There are no price tags outside of the special sale items (which are very few). And the prices seemed rather high.; I dont think they are rude at all in the convenience store. Always friendly w a smile!  And Im shocked at how much variety- I needed bread- there were 8 kinds! Cheese- 6 different brands! I can't complain.  Very convenient. But doesnt speak english.

Reviews:
Maruichi is a great place to shop for japanese food and ingredients.  They have the standard selection of japanese snacks, drinks, sauces, etc with some additional less commonly seen choices.

The onigiri here are good too.  Prices are reasonable, obviously many things are more expensive because they are imported.; Hands down has the best Japanese grocery food selection in Boston. Their weekend special tuna sashimi bowls ($35) rival the ones I’ve had in Osaka. They also have a decent Japanese knife selection and some Japanese kitchen accessories.; Came back to visit Boston and came across this amazing place, finally there’s an authentic Japanese grocery store in BOS!! Ughhhhh I wish this place opened earlier before I left the city 2 years ago😭😭😭😭😭; We visited this place to get kakigori for dessert. We got the yuzu and the strawberry kakigori. Both were way too sweet for me. I was looking for parts of ice that didn't have any syrup/topping for respite from the syrupy sweetness.

I wouldn't get the kakigori again. When Tsurumen in Davis has kakigori, they make it with a much better balance of flavors. And Oasit's Sweet in Brookline also has great shaved ice. It looks like they have a lot of other good food though, so I'd be down to try that in the future!; Wow! A MUST SEE place! Experience for yourself. What a nice place to have great Japanese food and drinks. Can get busy at certain times of the day, but the vibe is a good mix of lounge and restaurant. Definitely a win.

Reviews:
This message is for all the non Hispanic.
Please come here, if you like Hispanic food give this place a try, it can be intimidating over the weekend because it's so pack and it looks chaotic, but I promise you that you will find friendly people inside.  Get anything from the restaurant inside, the food is delicious, or get a grilled whole chicken and some fresh made tortillas. I promise you this till be amazing and it's super authentic.; While I haven't eaten at the taqueria inside the grocery store, it's always busy at lunchtime and the food looks great.
This is the best place in North Fulton if you need authentic Mexican ingredients. Their produce is half of what I pay at Publix or Kroger, and they have a far better selection of peppers, tomatillos, etc. And always friendly, helpful service!; I was trying to find Mojo sauce in my area of town and none of the common grocery stores, Publix, Kroger, sprouts...had anything. My girlfriend suggested trying a Mexican grocery store.

I went to this one and man was I so pleased inside!  Not only did I find my Mojo sauce but great fresh vegetables, assorted spices, hot sauces and fruits, it was just like being in Mexico.

Tons of fresh Mexican herbs and spices and peppers, multiple tortillas styles and types corn flour other. In the back a full meat butcher with all types of beef, chicken, pork etc. along with some prepared items to take and eat there or home.

The have an actual taco stand/restaurant in the store.  People were lined out the door so you know it’s good.

What a Cool place!  I’ve been back twice now to do my small grocery shopping and herbs and spices at great prices!; Had way more Mexican items than most places. However their dried peppers don't always come with what their supposed to in the package.; This is by far one of THE best Mexican Butcher shops in town!
The ceviche is amazing!

Reviews:
Clean store. Unique items & good variety. Prices are on the higher side. I wish my $8 pear didn't have a large bruise under the price tag, where it was impossible to see. Seems intentional? Wouldn't mind if it was discounted. Parking is a challenge if you're driving. Overall worth checking out.; Great location and diverse selections. Have been shopping here for the past 2 years, despite higher cost than average.

However, was quite dissatisfied with this occasion, where the buckwheat noodle is basically non-boillable and full of repulsive chemical smell. Will have to avoid any non-transparent packaging buckwheat noodle in future.; The Japanese cake I bought on 05/16/2024 was moldy but the customer service refused to refund me. I went to the shelve to take a picture of the price and surprisingly found all the same cakes are moldy and they are still selling them. Disgusting!; This is my absolute favorite Asian supermarket I’ve been to. Everything about it is nice. Everything is so fresh, bright, and clean. Amazing selection of fresh seafood. Lots of fun new food flavors to try. I always stock up here on snacks before making the long trek home to Maine. There is also a cute pastry shop at the very front that I haven’t tried, but looks delicious, and some other shops like a sushi and a noodle place.; Very full-service store; has fresh fruit and veg, including hard-to-find items, as well as surprisingly well-stocked fish case (note the pic of the monkfish—with head!!); amazing array of red meat, including items like kobe beef short ribs, wagyu, etc., & even some choice grade cuts. Absolutely amazing selection of shelf-stable/non-perishable foods & ingredients from all over Asia, not just Korea, including things like roasted soybean powder that you cannot find in other groceries. You could probably stock your kitchen with all basic staples as well as your longed-for items from Asia and never set foot in any other grocery store again. (A slight exaggeration, but only slight!)

Name: Star Market
Address: 275 Beacon St, Somerville, MA 02143, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 275 (street_number); Beacon Street (route); Ward Two (neighborhood); Somerville (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02143 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I patronize different Star Market locations and have done so for many years. I find their produce particularly appealing; however, after a very unpleasant exchange with a downright rude, unprofessional, and outright hostile employee at the Service Desk this past Monday, September 30, 2024 at 7:56 am, I will never shop at the Somerville location off McGrath Highway again.

I had used a self-service machine to ring up exactly three items: a bag of grapes, a pork loin, and a package of ground turkey. According to the Star Market app, the turkey was supposed to be $3.97, but it rang up as $6.99. I then went to the Service Desk to rectify the matter, and that’s when my “buying experience” went awry.

There was a person at the counter, who presented as a female of color with a ring through her nose, to whom I said, “Hi, this turkey didn’t ring up at the right price;” she looked at me and said, “We don’t open until 8:00.” I then looked at my phone, which read  7:56, and holding up the package of turkey replied, “So, how do I get this addressed?” Her retort was, “You have to wait four minutes.” I was incredulous, but okay.

I stood at the counter and waited the four minutes, while she repeatedly shuffled papers located on a desk behind her. At 8:00, she looked up at me and said, “How can I help you?” I explained about the turkey, and as it turned out, and as she very nastily pointed out, in her tone of voice, the package I picked up wasn’t “the one on sale; that’s the 99% fat free one, and the app says we’re out of it.” I was stunned at this exchange. Shocked at the unnecessary vehemence she displayed, I told her I wanted to return it and did so. That encounter has bothered me for a few days now.

The purpose of this review is to inform Star Market management that this particular employee, on that morning, was an extremely poor representation of its company.

I believe in following “rules.” If the company policy is that a matter such as mine can’t be remedied until the cash machine turns on at 8:00 at the Service Desk, then that employee could have and should have communicated such clearly and without contempt. That was not the case. There was absolutely no need for the manner in which she addressed me and my concern.

I realize that some do not understand that there’s an art to customer service, and that employee was a perfect example of untrained and uncaring. We all should take pride in whatever work we do, and that woman lacked it that morning. That’s unfortunate for her, but she cannot and will not take it out on me. I will never shop at this location again.; Just bought two of these home and noticed both are opened and one was half the volume of the other. Obviously someone opened and drank and put them back. That’s so gross!
The store is big but seriously understaffed. I will never buy any food from this store again.; Molded veggie Bubba burgers on sale at this Star market.

Recently they only keep the self check out open. Very un helpful and understaffed.

This used to be one of the best grocery stores in the area, yet they have had high turn over,  obvious stocking and inventory control issues and very poor customer service, even phone calls to this store are greeted with un professional staff responses.

This location needs a visit from the Sommervile Health department.

Thier Dairy coolers also smell and need attention for sanitation the past few visits I have made.

I will no longer be a patron of this location.

Edit: I got the message from Star market Managment here on Google that the issues is being looked into internally, just to note, I have also contacted Bubba Burger about this issue and are in email contact with them also and will be contacting city officials to make a report to have the board of health also investigate this issue.

Edit- 5/9/24 The Sommerville Heath department responded to my email requesting investigation of the mold issue. The company for Bubba Burger also responded in kind.; The vibes are off here in inexplicable ways! The prepared foods case appears to have a chronic leak in the bottom so there are crumpled paper towels there to stanch the flow. The flooring itself is stained and cracked and needs to be replaced throughout the store, but those things don't account for the uncanny feeling throughout the store; Maybe you should hire employees for the cash register rather than expecting customers to do that. Prices aren’t very good, the service is not very good,, and the produce is often bad. I see the empty parking lot all the time when I drive past it to go to Market Basket, which is much further, but infinitely better. There’s a reason why the parking lot is empty.

Front end staff are rude and inconsiderate . Make up rules just  to inconvenient customers. I've spent thousands of my hard earned money there. No more.; This is my go to for Groceries in Gardner. Fair prices and nice staff. No sitting in long lines to checkout like Price Chopper. Hannaford branded products are great. White bread is always fresh. Deli and meat departments are on point. Hannaford Rewards are a nice bonus as well.; Thanks for the awesome pug cake! We loved it.; Rude managers, store is filthy, bathrooms are disgusting, parking is awful (your car will get hit or scratched), terrible location, extremely limited selection. I give it one star for the rank and file employees... they are always nice/helpful. Go to price chopper or Aldis when it opens.

Name: Super One Foods
Address: 440 US-41 East, Negaunee, MI 49866, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: East (subpremise); 440 (street_number); U.S. 41 (route); Negaunee (locality); Marquette County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 49866 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Everything was fine. Shopping was fun and shiny.....then the checkout.

Nightmarish. Just wanted to pay for my food, use the coupon you clogged my mailbox with and leave.

That wasn't happening. By any stretch of any imagination.

Luckily for them I guess it doesn't matter because of a serious lack of choices. Sad really. It really showed.; Great for a quick trip for extra groceries in Negaunee.  I don't know that I would shop here for all my groceries, because their prices could be better.  But, in a pinch it's a good store.  Very clean, well-maintained, and overall friendly staff.  Conveniently located on Hwy 41 right as you're making your way through downtown Negaunee.  Definitely recommend for anyone who needs a quick grab.; Always Has The Food I need And Good Meat there; Love our local store! I always am welcomed by staff and wonderful selection for a small town grocer.; I have been shopping in the super one in Negaunee for 10 years and got to know quite a few of the cashiers. Today I forgot my credit card on my office desk and was refused service when I offered to enter the number manually by memory. The manager, Kevin gruffly told me that, there was no way for him to know it was me entering the number. I asked her how do you know it’s me when I swipe my credit card. He said with the chip. As I said, anybody could slight use my card without any sort of ID. No one’s ever checked my ID when I swipe my credit card.
It’s too bad. I won’t be going back and I’ll be steering others away. Good luck with your remodeling job.
The ladies behind the counter are great. That’s where the two stars comes from.  they can have the rest.

Name: Market Basket
Address: 400 Somerville Ave, Somerville, MA 02143, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 400 (street_number); Somerville Avenue (route); Ward Two (neighborhood); Somerville (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02143 (postal_code); 3215 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Very busy grocery store, but they do move people quickly in and out of the checkout lines simply because they have all of them open! Which is a rarity these days and a delight! I would recommend this location, seemingly fair prices and super convenient to the community around it. Parking can be a bit of a mess so would recommend walking if you can.; Market Basket is a standout grocery store chain known for its impressive selection and customer-centric approach. The store consistently delivers high-quality products at competitive prices, which is a major draw for budget-conscious shoppers. The produce section is particularly noteworthy, featuring fresh, locally-sourced fruits and vegetables that are both vibrant and flavorful.

One of Market Basket’s strengths lies in its extensive range of products, from everyday staples to specialty items, catering to diverse culinary needs. The store's layout is intuitive and easy to navigate, making the shopping experience efficient and pleasant. The bakery and deli sections also deserve praise for their wide array of fresh, delicious options.

Customer service at Market Basket is often highlighted as a positive aspect. Staff members are generally friendly, helpful, and responsive, contributing to a welcoming shopping atmosphere. Additionally, the store's commitment to maintaining clean and well-organized aisles enhances the overall shopping experience.

In summary, Market Basket excels in providing a high-quality shopping experience with its great product selection, competitive pricing, and excellent customer service. For anyone looking for a reliable grocery store, Market Basket is a top choice.; This Market Basket has been a staple since 1990, and it's ready for a vibrant refresh. The options are ripe for expansion and a modern makeover to match its peers. If it's family-owned, perhaps it's time to unlock its full potential.; I would like to make a great thank you for a 2 employees  of the store who helped me with trouble parking of my SEMI commercial truck. They helped me to get out of from packed parking and giving me directions how to make it safe for everyone. They spent their time and add  their efforts to help me to get my truck safely from busy parking lot. Thank you for being so helpful, patient and so professional in this situation. Good people, real professionals is always a matter and the best value for any business. Thank you so much!; The slim young man called Morgan is my go-to cashier any day! He's always pleasant and approachable. I also met Leidy tonight and she was amazing! Thank you both for your service!!! 🤝

Name: Trader Joe's
Address: 748 Memorial Dr, Cambridge, MA 02139, USA

Reviews:
Not very accessible by public transportation, but there’s a large parking lot, so great if you are driving. I came for blueberries, but they were already sold out by noon, unfortunately. I also noticed that the freezers felt pretty warm, so the frozen items might be suffering from freezer burn. No issues with service.; Quiet store with great location and parking lot! I got the mini tote here! And I really like the tester of hand cream!; Tell your ignorant white employee to not laugh at my appearance. I'm way cuter, my personality and everything. I don't laugh at anyone usually. I am from Orange, MA. Tea owners. Me. I'm Real. I'm kind. There is no such thing as COVID. It was gimmick. I am Eurasian, not even half. Point, I am making is don't fake laugh at someone. Just go to work. Don't pay too much attention to me. Or pay me cash. Thank you.; My produce/meats/perishable seem to perish faster from this location than elsewhere. I've often observed the thermometer above the deli meats around 50/60 degrees (today the top of the cooler was dripping condensation) so I wonder if that has something to do with it?

Update: 3 weeks later I noticed they removed the deli meat thermometer. But the thermometer/fridge near the cheese seems to be suffering the same issue...; Handy supermarket, large variety of items

Name: Super One Foods
Address: 3070 US-41, Marquette, MI 49855, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 3070 (street_number); U.S. 41 (route); Trowbridge Park (neighborhood); Marquette (locality); Marquette Township (administrative_area_level_3); Marquette County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 49855 (postal_code)
Reviews:
They are the only ones that carry my favorite spaghetti sauce, just an fyi. But the bakery here is what I love the most. Even last minute orders were honored and done very well for me every time I've ordered from them. The cakes taste amazing but they look even better than they taste. They are the only place I will order cakes from at all in my area.; Hi five to Jodie! Fantabulous employee (Ely (Eli) is an awesome bagger, too 👍) No other store in the UP compares!; Finally I have found a place that can slice jerky.  They seem to have very nice staff and good prices on groceries.  Taco Tuesday is great, and their meat department is very helpful.; The BEST grocery store! If you want top notch service from the friendliest employees around this is your place. The store is always clean, well stocked, organized and staffed by people who care and seem happy to be there! Thanks for consistently  being such a great store!; I’ve been a regular patron of Super One since I was learning how to walk. Easily the best grocery store in Marquette. Love interacting with the friendly staff, getting a bangin deal on wares, and always having joyful conversations with the cashiers / baggers!

Also, special shout out to the bakery department!!! I ordered my daughter’s birthday cake from them and Kristie went above and beyond meeting our design request. So much talent in one grocery store!

Name: Saveway Market Inc
Address: 8031 Dix St, Detroit, MI 48209, USA

Reviews:
Best place friendly never any problem check cashing services they are the best!

I recently visited this check cashing party store and was blown away by the friendly and welcoming atmosphere. The staff were incredibly kind and went out of their way to make sure I had a great experience. Not only did they cash my check quickly and efficiently, but they also had a wide variety of party supplies that I ended up purchasing for my upcoming event.

The store was clean and organized, and the prices were very reasonable. Overall, I was extremely impressed with this check cashing party store and would highly recommend it to anyone in the area. Whether you need to cash a check or are looking for some fun party supplies, this store has it all! Thank you for such a great experience."; i myself work there.. they are a great bunch of dudes.... Tony Mantana treats me with respect no matter if i am wrong sorry Tony and to  george i am sorry I know you dont forgive me but i admit my wrong; Courteous and attentivve .great little corner store and.with gas station food on occasion. The Taco truck in the summer was a bonus.
Update march 2024.
They now have Tony Wings in the am , absolutely worth a stop, Delicious
Tony wings !
Update sept 2024
Still serving those excellent Tony wings , the Clausauges and Georgiepies are good too; Only issue I have is they need to open at 8am during the week but friendly staff; Everything in the store is so expensive and all the pops are expired

Name: Daily Table Grocery - Central Square
Address: 684 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge, MA 02139, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Address Components: 684 (street_number); Massachusetts Avenue (route); Riverside (neighborhood); Cambridge (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02139 (postal_code); 3308 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
A friendly neighborhood grocery store, with several sister locations around the greater Boston area. The merchandise is not fancy or exotic of any kind, but covers the daily essentials of a normal household. Fruits, veggies, meat and dairy products, plus a good variety of canned food is what this convenient place offers. The location is convenient, accessible through the Red line and multiple bus routes. The staff members are always very friendly. It provides the daily nutrition of good quality you would want to bring to your family's dining table.; My favorite grocery store! Legitimately one of the things I miss most about living in Central Square. It's got such kind staff, low prices, and manages to stock pretty much all my essentials in a relatively small store.; I am so endlessly happy for having found this amazing shop! If you are looking for high quality fresh produce at affordable prices, this is your happy place! 🍌🍉🍇🍓🫐🍈🍒🍑🥭🍍🥬🥒🌟

✅ The shop is super clean
✅ The produce is arranged neatly
✅ Availability, variety and quality are great
✅ Prices are affordable
✅ The staff is super nice

Thank you Daily Table for providing us with this amazing shop 🙏♥️; Really appreciate the concept, ethics, and community embodied in this place. Though the breath of selection and freshness could be improved, but I will lend my unwavering support whenever possible. Living in a neighborhood of (Bezo's) WholeCheck and H-Mart, it is refreshing to have a place that cares for the neighborhood and its employees.; Daily Table is an oasis of unique treasures in the bustling sea of grocery options. While it may occasionally lack the predictable staples, it more than compensates with an eclectic array of extraordinary finds that elevate your culinary adventures. Navigating its aisles is akin to embarking on a culinary treasure hunt, where each discovery promises to tantalize the taste buds and inspire creativity in the kitchen. And fear not if your shopping list remains incomplete, for neighboring giants like Whole Foods, Hmart, and Target stand ready to complement Daily Table's offerings, ensuring that every craving is met and every mealtime delightfully fulfilled.

Name: Pemberton Farms Marketplace
Address: 2225 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge, MA 02140, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 2225 (street_number); Massachusetts Avenue (route); North Cambridge (neighborhood); Cambridge (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02140 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Yes, this place is expensive but they do offer different products and brands that I don't usually see at your typical grocery store. They also sell bakery items from local bakeries as well as their own products.; They bake the best sourdough I've ever had!
Please also try their home made: almond soft cookies, pear tart, and cakes.
Cakes are packed in slices and it's in a cool island in front of the deli. You can also find Tiramisu (the best I've ever had: chocolate, coffee and mascarpone just in the correct proportion so you have all the flavour in a delicate way).
Sandwiches are delicious, some of them made with their own focaccia and ciabata.; I’m so elated I came across this market while we were driving around one evening. Although I grew up in Cambridge (now residing in NY), I rarely venture to this side of the city. The market reminds me of businesses I’ve experienced in the Berkshires. The vibe is laid back with friendly customer service and quality merchandise. There was so much to see in all departments and the nursery is divine. There is a parking lot; however we parked on the street. There are also benches and little tables interspersed outdoors. I look forward to my next visit to Cambridge and will make this one of my first stops.; This is a very nice, local joint with high quality products. Nice little deli inside making decent sandwiches, but they're a few dollars too expensive. Awesome collection of very nice plants. Also sporting a solid beer cooler. I wouldn't do my regular shipping here, but it's great for a quick stop or specific items; Best grocery store in Cambridge! It can be pricey, but I can always find everything I need, even my odd vegan stuff that no one else has. They have beer, wine, and liquor too!

Name: Carnival Market
Address: 1101 Walton Blvd., Pontiac, MI 48340, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 1101 (street_number); Walton Boulevard (route); Pontiac (locality); Oakland County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 48340 (postal_code)
Reviews: A great place to grab simple authentic Mexican food.  I tried the Ultimae Combo with 3 tacos, beans and rice.  I enjoyed the Barbacoa very much, the other 2 not as much.  I also tried a tamale, which was good.; I drive 40 minutes to get here and it's worth it! SO MUCH to choose from. I got specifically for their corn shells. They now make homemade corn and flour shells fresh right there in the store. They serve hot food. I love their taco's and homemade sauces as well. Stop, shop, and eat lunch !; The market is great to shop at but the prepared foods are amazing. The barbacoa beef is excellent and so are all the freshly prepared salsas. When I want a hot, fresh, and quick dinner but don’t want to spend hours preparing and cleaning up after I always stop here. The people who work here are also very friendly - the first few times I went in I was that annoying white lady asking a bunch of questions about the food but they didn’t make me feel bad about it.; If you are looking for the best Mexican market  in southeast Michigan, this is the place to go. Grab a quick bite from their deli style restaurant. The menu very impressive. The store has everything from spices to freezer section. Take home something fresh or refrigerated.  Great service, friending people.  Full fruit & vegetable area, meat counter, and oh my…awesome desserts.  If you need anything Mexican, they have it.  Had some fresh fish tacos for lunch today. Picked up some fresh corn Tamales for dinner tonight.; First time in this place, and I will tell you what it has everything you need from fresh and marinated meats to spices and more. My favorite part is the restaurant, which I  probably place in my top 5, maybe #2, for overall best in food and layout. I really like this place  and wish I found it sooner. I will definitely be back to patronize.

Name: Trader Joe's
Address: 3044 Walton Blvd., Rochester Hills, MI 48309, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 3044 (street_number); Walton Boulevard (route); University Square (neighborhood); Rochester Hills (locality); Oakland County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 48309 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Trader Joe's, the neighborhood grocery store and so much more! We have been shopping there for over 15 years.

On the outside of the store before entering, they always have items, flowers or watermelon 🍉 or seasonal products.

As you enter the store they have a nice size display of assorted flowers and herbs.

Once inside you will see end caps between each aisle with unique items. Many items are Trader Joe's label like chips, cheeses, coffee, cookies as well as everyday basics like dairy, fresh produce and artisan breads. And they have an outstanding wine selection.

Trader Joe's does have an issue.  There are seasonal items that sell out fast, and we enjoyed many products that we would love to have all season, but we also know that the product can and in many cases be discontinued at any time.  But with that said, we still love to shop there and sometimes we even stock up on the product, knowing it may not be there on our next shopping trip.

Many products are priced to meet or beat the competition!

The crews that work both the floor and registers are always willing to provide their assistance.; The absolute BEST Customer Service I've ever encountered, the Staff goes above & beyond for the Customers. Even the Customers that shop here are SO nice! The selection & prices are better than grocery stores & you know your getting high quality products! This is my FAVORITE Store, I could spend hours in here just looking at all they have to offer because they have so many seasonal items on top of their regular selections! I honestly can't say enough good things about Trader Joe's, its not shopping, its an experience!!; Overall, reasonable one like the other Trader Joe's. Not sure this is for this store only and a seasonal theme going on... there are certainly more rose and other pink liquid in the store. Testing new product is always fun.; This place is great! Every time I go in, I find something new that is absolutely the best quality. There are so many dinner and lunch ideas, pre-cooked, prepackaged meals. The beauty products as well, all natural lotions and face products that I absolutely love. They have a nice selection of natural dog treats too. Check them out!; Walked in here at 850, knew I was close to closing time... I just wanted to grab their $5 dark chocolate ice cream QUART (not pint) and ended up getting $30 in desserts. I didn't like this store growing up. Now that I'm older, I LOVE IT! Very cool products, traders Joe brand and other brands. They also have a very cheap but Gorgeous flower area. I will be back soon! Thanks foe great service as well!

Name: Bozek Markets
Address: 3317 Caniff St, Hamtramck, MI 48212, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 3317 (street_number); Caniff Street (route); Hamtramck (locality); Wayne County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 48212 (postal_code); 3148 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
This is such a nice little grocery with lots of Polish foods.  The cake selection is extensive, the hot bar is nicely stocked with tasty foods, the selection of frozen perogies is huge, the deli has lots of quality meats and cheeses, there are so many wonderful imported delicious butters to choose from, lots of jarred pickled items, beautiful fresh produce and breads, and their meat locker has the most wonderful cuts of meat at great prices and it's freezing cold which is a treat on a hot summer day! The staff is friendly and helpful.  I highly recommend this wonderful store.
I just miss their old homemade pickles and sauerkraut that you could buy by the pound.  I would love to see that brought back!; This is one of my favorite places in Hamtramck and I need to go back more regularly. It's a Polish market with a lot of Polish and other ethnic foods. They have hot Polish food in the back that is outstanding. But the most special thing here is the shelves of individually wrapped chocolates that you can just pick and choose from and throw in a bag. It is dangerously delicious.. some of the chocolates have liquor in there, others are more traditional truffles or have cherries, but there are a lot to choose from. Highly recommend this place; This is a Polish supermarket that is amazing.

You must go see their meat market it truly a neighborhood gem!

Smoked fish outstanding!

Imports from Poland 🇵🇱 ♥️

Take a trip. I absolutely love it.

My favorite is the string cheese, best braided cheese, anywhere.

Come see for yourself!; I like the products of this market. I lived in the former Soviet Union in the 80's and I can find many of the products related to Eastern Europe cuisine here. I'm also a cook so I come here.
My only grivance is the not so good, the majority of the time customer service. I don't  want to pay the race card, I'm  not of European appaerience and I don't  want o say that that is the reason but, the stafff strugles to be friendly to me even though I'm very friendly to them. I almost feel like I'm pulling teeth..
It's important to look at your customer's face when you are taking to them so they feel recognized and appreciated,, not jumping on your cellphone  before you have give your customer the receipt.  That's is an experience  from real life on Saturday, August 31, 2024 with cashier Orysya.
So take note management.  Train your staff well.  You are in Hamtramk, there is a lot of diversity here. We all want to feel welcomed  at your store regardless of our differences.  You have a good business,  don't blow it.
Thanks.; No fresh produce, mostly looks old or gone bad. Cramped store but nice meat department just a little bit pricey for me. Some items in freezer have freezer burn and looks bad. They sell prepared food but I haven't ate it. Nice people and if you're looking for polish cookies or candy this is the place 👍

Name: Busch's Fresh Food Market
Address: 3188 Walton Blvd., Rochester Hills, MI 48309, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 3188 (street_number); Walton Boulevard (route); University Square (neighborhood); Rochester Hills (locality); Oakland County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 48309 (postal_code); 1265 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Alot of things I love about this store, the produce and veggies seem higher quality than other stores, excellent beer selection, can get in and out quickly.
However, yesterday I handed the cashier a $100 bill, my order was around $60, which I thought isn't too bad, not taking too much change.
The cashier, out loud sarcastically said 'great', angrily counted my change and never said another thing to me.
I'll be back, but I'll definitely be using self checkout!; Clean, nicely arranged. They had sparkling water, which was the only thing I came to pick up. Staff were friendly, and the parking lot had plenty of available parking spaces.

In a strip mall, so there were other shops and restaurants to check out.; Local products

I like the local theme, lots of Michigan brands. It is more of a specialty market with higher prices. It is not the type of market where you would do your every day type shopping but to stop in for one or two items is nice.
Very bright and friendly staff.; Very well maintained shop.  Vegetables are fresh, slightly expensive but good quality

Very friendly staff; I will never buy anything fresh from this store again. Went here on Monday 4/22. Bought a loaf of bread, the next morning the bread had mold. Also bought organic asparagus, stored it in my fridge in a cup of water as I always do. Went to cook it on 4/24 and it was completely bad, had to be thrown out. Not the first time I’ve had issues with produce here.

Name: Cardullo's Gourmet Shoppe
Address: 6 Brattle St, Cambridge, MA 02138, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Address Components: 6 (street_number); Brattle Street (route); Harvard Square (neighborhood); Cambridge (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02138 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Loved this store and sandwich counter! A large variety of items - great place to grab food for a picnic or outdoor outing. Excellent selection of gourmet desserts and candies. Specialty teas and wines there as well. A handful of vegetarian  options for sandwiches. Staff were very friendly and completed our order pretty quickly. A few tables are outside for seating.; frozen chicken tender and canned tomato sauce!! The worst chicken parm Sandwich Iv ever had!! And for 17$ never again! Everything in that store is insanely overpriced!! And is was half cold and half Luke warm!; Gourmet Italian family shop with sandwich table, wines, European snacks, and many other peculiar goods.

Located at the heart of Harvard Square, very convenient and easy to locate. The store has many variety of wines, beers, and snacks. Most of snack brands are exotic and not easily found in supermarkets. Cool experience.

We bought a chicken Parmesan sandwich and a roast beef reuben sandwich, very well made, the chicken and beef meat were extremely tender.

Definitely recommended!; Great sandwiches and service was very nice. Sandwiches were delicious and easily could be two meals for a reasonable price. They had a special deal for the holiday when I went and I was unaware. They realized they were about to overcharge me as I was checking out and gave me the reduced price which was kind and they could've easily let me miss it.; On our visit to Massachusetts, we visited this place and had the worst experience of our lives. We ordered two chicken wraps with black olives and vegetables, I don't remember what drink we ordered. The young man who served us was Latino like us, white skinned and short hair and some tattoos. He pretended to be nice to us very well. We placed the order and sat outside and waited for a few minutes.

They brought us the order and the wraps had been taken out of the fridge, they were almost frozen, they didn't even heat them up. When I told the young lady who brought us the wraps that they were cold from the fridge, she told us that they served them like that. Of course we didn't believe her, but we ate them anyway.

We felt ripped off and it was a complete mockery. No one should go through that. They treated us like idiots.

The lady with glasses is so friendly and funny, the other girl is not. The guys are weird and stare at women that come in making the place feel very uncomfortable. Some items are way too over priced, but they are the only store that carries the spicy cheese puffs that I crave! So it's a good place for me may not be for others.; I went in last Friday and was highly disappointed in the service. The food was so expensive and for what? None of the employees ever seem happy. I tried so hard to give this place a chance but the service is not great. I’m not rude i go in i say hi and try to keep that small town feeling but that seems to have just went away!; Went to buy cigarettes an my bank card was denied but yet it took the money out of my account. 2, got ice cream an it was all melted; They are thiefs do not order no pizza because they will make it wrong and they will throw ur replacement pizza away when they make it if u dont get there when they want u too

They make fresh coffee every morning, at the deli in the back they have several different fresh grinders made-daily available to grab and go or made to order, along with sides like macaroni salad and the like. Also have slushies for kids and a good selection of basic alcohol.; The fabric of the local community..great spot, great people, great service.  I read a review from last week that said the store was dirty…100% disagree as every time I visit someone is cleaning something, floors are spotless and deli is pristine. You want shiny and new? Go to Cumby’s and pay through the nose..you want someone to know what you’re going to buy before you walk in, this is for you. Oh and PS..a no frills, made fresh sandwich for $4..are you kidding me??; Been going here since I was a kid best convenient store around. Everyone is always friendly and helpful.

Name: Happy Trails Natural Foods
Address: 43 Parker St, Gardner, MA 01440, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 5:30 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 5:30 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 5:30 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 5:30 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 5:30 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 43 (street_number); Parker Street (route); Gardner (locality); Worcester County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 01440 (postal_code); 3806 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Great selection of spices, healthy foods and gifts.
Nicest people that take the time to explain products and help customers make the right selection.

Found a couple beautiful wall hangings one was made from  upcycled saris, some wind chimes and got some awesome ginger candy!

Well worth the drive and already planning another visit for a unique gift for mom.

Easy walk to other great stores and resturants.  Interesting architectural details too.; Have been shopping here since they first opened.  The store is looker better than ever these days!  I always find just what I need and help is always nearby if I don't see it. We need Happy Trails in this community; I hope they are here for another 45  years!; I was delighted to discover that this store has a wide selection of homeopathic remedies as well as herbal remedies and supplements.  It also carries toiletries, candles, crystals, incense, books,  bulk loose herbs and boxed teas. (This is only a  partial list).  They also carry what I think are some of the best tasting brands of all natural, raw, unrefined honey that I've ever had.   When you walk into this shop the first thing you notice is the scent of incense gently wafting through the air.  It feels as if you are stepping back in time to a gentler, kinder age.  I found it to be a comforting,  magickal place to be, so let yourself relax while you visit.  As you slowly peruse the wonderful things you'll discover there,  let yourself soak up the ambiance as well and allow it to renew your spirit.; Part natural foods store, part gift shop with local handmade items and some crystals. Good selection of CBD items, looseleaf teas and herbs, locally made jewelry, and a large homeopathic section. Also some secondhand furniture etc in the back of the store (looks like they clearing out some antiques?). Very friendly staff. Premises clean and well organized. Street parking.; Love this store!  It's always clean and stocked.  A great variety of natural products.  I love going into the store.

Name: New Deal Fish Market
Address: 622 Cambridge St, Cambridge, MA 02141, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 622 (street_number); Cambridge Street (route); East Cambridge (neighborhood); Cambridge (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Massachusetts (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 02141 (postal_code); 1123 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
They have amazingly fresh seafoods! I got mussels from them last week, and I appreciate how the staff made sure that all the mussels were alive when being sold. The mussels from New Deal are also way fresher than those you’d get at Whole Foods. I made white wine garlic mussels dishes twice in a week and the quality of mussels from New Deal is distinctly better. I will never buy mussels at Whole Foods again (half of the bag I bought were dead mussels, and they did not taste fresh at all).

I’ve also been buying sashimi-grade fish from them for 2 years now :) really fresh salmon, tuna, and scallops!!; Wonderful and lovely fish market. People are super friendly and willing to explain the differences. I got the king salmon and swordfish. Super fresh and delicious when I cooked! Prices are slightly higher than other fish markets (seafood prices are high in general).

Parking can be tricky. Street parking so you may or may not need to walk a bit. The store is local favorite and it was crowded when I went. So expect to wait a few minutes to order. Great fish market overall.; Amazingly fresh!! I have visited New Deal Fish Market for more than 15 years for their sushi grade salmon, tuna and hamachi. The fish were as fresh as they could be EVERY single time. We raved about them every time at dinner table. Staffs behind the counter are friendly and love to give suggestion how to prepare certain seafood when asked ! They took care of cutting the fish, clean and skin. Recommend this shop any chance I could to my friends 😁; I’ve been going to New Deal for years to get the best fish and seafood in the Boston metro area. I live in Roslindale but make the roughly hour round trip to Cambridge as often as I can. The variety and quality of different fish plus a consistent supply of whole fish is unmatched. Staff is helpful, knowledgeable and good people. Love these guys!; Absolutely stellar quality fish - I've shopped often on my way from work and only wish we lived closer to New Deal Fish Market!

New Deal is near a bus stop that runs through Harvard, and a short walk from Kendall. There are a few spots to lock up bikes on the same block, but traffic and the condition of the road surface doesn't make it that pleasant of a ride!

Address: 92 Kirkland St, Cambridge, MA 02138, USA

Reviews: The Charles street location was my go to market and I was sad to see it close. But the Cambridge location is great. Carrying the same meat products as well as some of Wulf's fish, which is sushi grade. And the woman with short hair who works on Saturdays will also melt your heart while selling you the best veal cutlets.; I've only shopped hear a few times but every time it's been a real treat. Most recently I went in to purchase a St. Louis rack for a birthday celebration. They must treat those pigs up in Vermont reeeeaaaall well because these babies knocked it out of the park. Huge, succulent, moist, flavorful ribs, maybe the best rack I've ever smoked. Will definitely be back again for my next special occasion, and I highly recommend them.; I am so sad I didn't start coming here sooner! This place is adorable and all the staff have been outstandingly kind to me. They are very helpful in explaining their offerings and they also let me know they have different made to order foods (like this burger) for different days of the week. In addition to things you'd expect at a butcher's, they also carry ice cream, other snacks, and even mini laundry detergent. Would absolutely recommend, anything I've had from here has been delicious.; I was recommended by a neighbor to come here for raw marrow bones for my dog, and was blown away the first time I went in. Beautiful grocery items as well as knowledgeable and super friendly staff. They even asked my dog’s size to make sure the bones were cut to a safe size. Its become a weekly staple for me and the cuts of meat are leaps and bounds better quality than even Whole Foods.; Wonderful local butcher. Wide selection of high quality beef, pork, lamb and more. Helpful staff. A pleasure to shop here.

Name: Super G Mart Pineville
Address: 10500 Centrum Pkwy, Pineville, NC 28134, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 8:45 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 8:45 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 8:45 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 8:45 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 8:45 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 8:45 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 8:45 PM
Address Components: 10500 (street_number); Centrum Parkway (route); Pineville (locality); Mecklenburg County (administrative_area_level_2); North Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 28134 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Shout out to Andrew, one of their amazing employees who helped me find my phone. Excellent customer service!

The store itself is bigger than the other Super G and had a great selection of not just Asian food, but other international food and non-consummable items as well. They had aisles for African, European, Indian and other miscellaneous categories. It was fun to just walk around and explore.

The attached food court, Alley 51, had great food hubs. Manila Grill had great Filipino food at reasonable prices, but there were also Thai, Japanese Ramen, Vietnamese, Chinese Pancake and other types of cuisine.; This Super G is way bigger than the independence road location in Charlotte. Has every ethicnic food that you can think of that shows you they are very inclusive. Multiple employees working at every department. There's even a French Bakery that's serves cakes and coffee. Even though the store was packed self check out was a breeze.; If you're seeking an international grocery experience in Pineville, NC, Super G Mart is a must-visit! This immense store boasts a spectacular array of fresh seafood that is simply unrivaled. The highlight for me is the live crab table—a unique feature where you can choose your own live crabs, ensuring the freshest seafood meal possible. Alongside this, the vegetable selection is tremendous, offering diverse options that are perfect for pairing with any seafood dish. Whether you're a seafood aficionado or just exploring new culinary delights, Super G Mart will not disappoint with its fresh offerings and vibrant atmosphere!; This was my first time going to this place as we have a super G closer in Matthews. The supermarket actually was a bit smaller but the food court was very large. There were so many different things to try. Korean, Chinese ,Phillipino, Japanese, Vietnamese and also dessert places. Fully stocked bars too! The only thing I would advise is to get there early or go on an off time because it has long lines on the weekends. Prices were about the same as going to a restaurant. Pay in cash. They appreciate it. Don't look as you pass the first or second restaurant. There's some roasted ducks hanging there with their heads still on.; While I love having access to the range of ingredients Super G Mart offers, you have to be careful that you aren't getting taken advantage of.  For example, I purchased 1.66 lbs (26.6 oz) of squid.  Turns out that half of it's weight was ice, netting 14.0 oz of squid.  I'll be careful to avoid their in-store packaged frozen seafood in the future.

Name: Hatoya Mart Japanese Food Grocery Since 1992
Address: 605A N Polk St, Pineville, NC 28134, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 605A (street_number); North Polk Street (route); Pineville (locality); Mecklenburg County (administrative_area_level_2); North Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 28134 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This place is awesome!! Friendly service and a great selection of Asian products. Although this is a Japanese grocery, this place carries the best kimchi I’ve ever purchased in Charlotte. I bought this yesterday and I’m already almost halfway through the jar….it’s addicting. I will be coming back for more when I run out.; We adore this shop! We stop by here usually once a month and love their sweets selection. Japanese desserts and snacks are lighter and not super sugary compared to our own. The staff is always friendly and helpful and it's always a fun experience.; OMG, the best experience ever in the Charlotte area since I've been here. So I called this particular store after calling 4 different asian markets around town to get ONE very sought out ingredient.... THAI basil. When I tell you not only we're they very friendly and respectful over the phone, they sold me all the thai basil they had left for a really good price. Oh, and yes, it was VERY very fresh. I'm just so thankful for the little things. The customer service is beyond amazing. The store is very well organized, and the overall experience is top tier. Y'all run to support this small business. They're worth the drive and the coins. Thank you so very much.; I wasnt expecting this store to be so good! Huge selection of everything you could need , i frequently shop on amazon JP and the prices in here are far better , so affordable! They have an amazing range of groceries ofcourse but what amazed me most was all of the japanese skincare, hair products and toiletries etc , all at affordable prices too. Also a great store if you are a lover of hello kitty.
Im from the UK and i wish our japanese convenience stores were this amazing.
10/10 great products and nice staff; Hatoya Mart Japanese Food is the place you want to do your healthy shopping located at 605 N Polk St
Pineville NC 28134
United States
The employees are very kind and are ready to assist you to finding everything you need. They have Knowledge on their products.
I bought four boxes of different teas and some bok choy and stir fried a nice combination of veggies for dinner. I love shopping here so I’ll be back every week.🩷

We loved visiting this shop. They have a decent selection, and they have some freshly baked goods (we weren't able to buy d/t allergies, but they looked amazing). Given the fact they're an ethnic shop, the prices are reasonable. It's also neat and organized which makes a trip to a store nice. Employee was friendly as well.; The only place where I find everything I'm looking for; Very large selection of international foods, including Amish stuff.; A wonderful small business run by very nice people. Great selection and prices.

Update: the new location is huge and spotless with a great selection.; A delightful store, very well stocked with excellent quality and unusual food items from the middle east, eastern Europe and Asia.. Prices are surprisingly good for a small, independent store. The tea selections are awesome!  And the candies -- wow! The lady who runs it is welcoming and upbeat. This is a regular stop for me.
