Name: Super G Mart
Address: 4927 W Market St, Greensboro, NC 27407, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 4927 (street_number); West Market Street (route); Greensboro (locality); Guilford County (administrative_area_level_2); North Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 27407 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Good size market. Had most of the things i needed! Also a couple shops inside it too; Went on a Saturday. The produce section was abysmal. So many fruits were molded and rotten. Pretty disgusting I didn't feel comfortable getting any produce. Great selection of other goods that you can't get at your usual grocery store though!; Warning! RAT!!! OMG!!! I mean.. OMG... i had been buying vegetables for at least 5 years in this place until today. My cart was already half way until my daughter stops me in the hallway and tells me there is a Rat ahead of us... yes.. A RAT!!! I only imagined this thing running around on top of the food.. sleeping and peeing on it.. omg I couldnt get out of there fast enough.. like.. can you imagine this thing running around the vegetables and the meet!! 🤮🤮🤢; I usually go there for fresh seafood but it would be unjustified if I don’t mention everything else they have to offer.
This store is very diversified and that is why you will see people from almost every culture and race shopping.  The biggest reason people shop there is that everything is reasonably priced and they have big verities of fresh produce, you will also find spices and ingredients from Central Asia, Africa, Korea, China, India, Pakistan, Caribbean countries and many other countries.
They have huge numbers of workers always working and stocking up the shelves and that’s why you won’t see an empty shelve there unlike other big stores.
If you’re looking for that missing ingredient that you can’t find anywhere, give them a try you won’t be disappointed.; **WARNING** Be mindful of pricing and employees who have no regard for honesty. I picked out two fish and realized that the person weighed them at the wrong price.  The  worker pointed to a  sign and refused to honor the $$ amount they listed the lower price.  I asked that they remove one of the fish.  I brought it to the attention of the store manager and he had them to honor it. I wanted to add the original amount of fish back and the department manager refused to honor the original amount. I just left it. This seems like a small issue until you think of the reason there are laws in place about this very issue. Principle is everything!!! He lost business over $1. I can recommend anyone to shop at a place I can’t trust to do the right thing. Shop at your own risk.

Reviews:
They went all out upon opening, now it's a self checkout nightmare.  I'd pay a few bucks more to not be strong-armed into becoming an employee.
Then there's the online options, both pick up and Boost deliver have had milk out of stock. Ahh, the great milk shortage of 2024...
Believe  I'm letting them go, rather find a smaller store with actual cashiers. Would drive a little extra to make that happen.; Love my Kroger store but very unhappy on the carts handicap people use, have the time they say there charged and they are not! My husband can hardly walk so finding a cart that runs is not easy and if it stops in middle of store no associates help; Tonight is seriously the last time I use the quick click pick up! They not only called me to tell me that it would be 2 hrs late… But, once I showed up for my order they said it wouldn’t be ready until sometime tomorrow!! They’ve been late the last few times but, this is ridiculous! I cancelled my order and went to Walmart who never does this!; Shout out to the floral department!  Had an emergency & needed flowers for a wedding. They were great, looked at the photo I had & recreated it so there were enough bouquets for all the bridesmaids! Thanks so much, great service!!; Brought back an item that was damaged and they let me trade for a new one...so helpful! And the checkout had ample self checkouts along with a cashier @ checkouts. Easy in and out!  Kroger Marketplace in Troy, OH

Name: Kroger
Address: 633 Armour Rd, Bourbonnais, IL 60914, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 633 (street_number); Armour Road (route); Bourbonnais (locality); Bourbonnais Township (administrative_area_level_3); Kankakee County (administrative_area_level_2); Illinois (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 60914 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I am relatively new to Kroger. Had an issue with a pickup order. Tried a simple phone call to the store. No one at the store will pickup a phone. Issue was my groceries were tossed into my car. OK nothing breakable other than cookies. Got home and the bags had water in them. Apparently they were left open and sitting in the rain before delivered to my car.
Only option was online refund request. Did that and it called the items "missing" no option for damaged. The impression Kroger leaves is they would like to solve all issues with refunds.
Non existent customer service! Jewel is much better in this regard.
Note the soggy accumulation of wet crumbs in the corner of the box as it was positioned upside down in the water contaminated bag.; Used to love kroger when we first moved nearby a few years ago but in the last year something has changed.  Pick up orders are rarely ever ready on time, or they're missing items.  Prices seem to be much higher here compared to other retailers in the area. They have expanded self check out, my assumption is they can't keep help and this was the solution, and maybe explains the issues with pick up orders now? It's disappointing that the changes have been negative vs positive, hopefully whatever changes have happened have at least been positive for their employees.  🤷‍♀️; Good place to buy groceries even at 9:30 at night.; I'm disgusted that what was my favorite grocery store has changed. They now are more like an employer, since we now basically have to check ourselves out. Why, why, why?! It's not saving us any money! Why are they expecting their customers to do this, and why are we doing it?! It's frustrating, time consuming and we're not getting ANYTHING out of it, except higher prices and more work.; Line is 10 plus people long and only one section of the new self check outs is being used. 6 unused self check outs with the line being out of control. The new self check outs with conveyer belts appear to slow down the process, but the fact that this store has spent capital on additional self check outs only to neglect the needed self check outs when the lines are out of control speaks to some issues. Only one employee manning self check outs is not enough. Sorry to give a negative review, but it appears this store needs more dedicated workers manning the needed self checkouts. Please fix.

Reviews:
Certainly! Here's a bad review for an Asian oriental market:

"Unfortunately, my experience at wausau oriented market was disappointing. The cleanliness of the store left much to be desired; there were several instances of expired products on the shelves. The staff seemed disinterested and unhelpful when approached for assistance. The selection of fresh produce was limited and not well-maintained. Overall, I left feeling unsatisfied and unlikely to return.; I love it! The prices are surprisingly cheap and everyone there is so nice. The only issue I have with it is some of the items don't have a price tag so you have to go to the front to ask the price and the store looks a little shady with crooked steps and peeling paint. Also the doors are hard to open. The fruits and vegetables are fresh and the general vibe is very nice; I can't even give 1 star horrible customer service , I was asking them for a  couple products if they sold at the I s business online said they did Balutis what I wanted...lady was rude rude rude ....; Normally I always post really positive reviews but I just want to make people aware.  When you buy rice there really look at the bags.  I bought a 10lb bag of rice for a craft. (Warm heating bags) About 1/10 that way through I found a dead flying bug.  Didn't think much of it.  As I got further and further down I found more and more and then they were alive.  Then I found larvea. That you may not notice and would then cook and eat.  The bag even has cobwebs in it.  I'm a little worried what I'll find further down.  I'm halfway down the bag now.  The tiny perfect circle holes in the bag are what indicate bugs but I wasn't looking for that when I bought it. I bought this bag yesterday. 10/3/2020.; Nice place. A lot more run down than most stores but it has a nice homely atmosphere. Got a decent selection, including catfish, which I find very hard to find. Reasonable prices aswell.

Great place to grab all sorts of Asian food including veitnease, Korean, and Thai food items, as well as all sorts of snacks and some cooking assories, they also carry some produce if you're looking for fruits and veggies  or even frozen meats. There definitely one of the better stores out there for selection of Asian foods as since they carry a variety if you're looking for something special they would be a great place to start at. I know I'll definitely hit them up again in the future!!; There are a lot of products from Asia.
I found fresh mangosteen, Bok coy, water spinach and some vegetables here.
There are a lot of Asian drinks, seasoning and snacks from different countries with cheaper price.; Great selection and very friendly staff!!! My go to Asian grocery store!!!; Very clean store, very organized, good selection of pantry items and produce items. Friendly staff. Would recommend.; We were really excited to discover this store, just off from south 17th Ave. They stock a lot of ingredients that cannot be easily found. The vegetables alone like their fresh lemon grass, was such a great find. The Pho restaurant next door is definitely worth the visit too.

The kimchi stew is pretty sour, you can’t drink it alone, you need to pair it with rice. The tteokboki isn’t spicy at all, very mild.; Ordered Gul Rung Tang - flavorless
Dduk Bok Gi - good amount of spice
O Sam Bul Go Gi - yummy maybe you can share with two. Did not see any squid. But it comes with a very small portion of rice. They give you kimchi and 3 other sides. Small but they are fresh. Service is quick. Appetizer- 10 piece Yaki Mandoo - it was ok not much flavor maybe if i had some sauce.; This place has a vast variety of Asian food and snacks with a restaurant inside as well. If you are looking for an Asian snack odds are they have what you're looking for. Also the service is A1. I've been twice and each time I've been greated with a smile and checkout was always friendly. Check it out!; This was by far some of the best Korean food I have eaten in Charlotte. If you weren't looking for this place, it would be easy to miss! Additionally, you will want to enter from the side of the building where you park, not the front! As you walk in, there's a cute little seating area that is tucked into the grocery store. To kick the meal off, we ordered the steamed mandoo. It was super soft and pillowy while the filling inside was delicious. They are kind of big so make sure not to fill up on these at the start.

As for my main course, I ordered the Bibimbap. This bowl of food was made with love, and I enjoyed every bite. The base consisted of rice, and it was accompanied by a bunch of different veggies, meat, and a perfectly cooked egg! There is also a bibimbap sauce that came with the dish that added the right amount of spice and tang. The fish cakes were also our favorite side dish! Our waitress was great, and I would definitely make this place a priority on your list if you are on the search for Korean food in the area.; Best Korean food in Charlotte.

Kimchi pancake 10/10. Cold noodles I didn’t like but my friend did. Spicy squid over rice soooo good. But then short ribs omg 100000/10

Reviews: I can count on them to have the items the big box stores don’t. The bulk spices and teas are great quality and a huge variety. Gotta be strong when I pass up the cakes in the refrigerator section though!; Great place to find all sorts of bulk goods, rare organic items and foods and local foods, if you're in the area there definitely worth a stop as you would be surprised at some of the items they carry. There even a good place to check out for growing your own sprouts and they have cheese and yogurt making supplies.; I love this store. They have a ton of gluten free options and if you can't find what you need, they'll happily order it in for you. And the best coffee you'll find in the area (Ruby!).; Pretty clean.  Nice salad/soup bar.  Good coffee. Bakery items were rather bland.  Enjoyed the turkey goat cheese wrap and the broccoli salad.  A few tables on the main floor; more seating on the upper level.  The staff are knowledgeable and friendly.  The women at checkout were cold. I would definitely recommend for a healthy lunch and elite groceries.; One of my favorite spots to grab a quick bite in Wausau. It’s hip and cozy. The live acoustic music that often plays over lunch is soulful and just puts me in a good mood. One of the few places I don’t mind eating alone with my laptop. Besides that the food is fresh, healthy options and delicious!

I recommend Then to all my friends.
The best place to go for meat package or lunches.; Great little market. The meat is the attraction here. Good guys working here, nice lady at the checkout. Quality meat products.; Had reasonably priced chix salad sandwich on white untoasted bread. Big chunks of tender and juicy white meat in it. Very tasty and filling. Right on!; Meet in the deli is fantastic but the other parts of the store need restocking with fresh items I want to date items need to be removed from the shelves 😕.
